public class UserMainCode
{
	public int allDigitsCount(int input1)
	{
        String str = input1.ToString();;
        return str.Length;
	}

    • Yammer
      • you posted on yammer
        • someone noticed and offered you job
    • Outlook
      • you notified your HR, Manager, WMG head etc
        • they forwarded your request to concerned authority
        • they offered you a project
    • LinkedIn
      • you connected with various allotted trainees from Wipro
        • they told you whom they should contact
          • you contacted them and they offered you job

Arrays - Dotnet.md

Array Types

Single dimensional Array

int[] num = new int[] { 34, 345, 23, 5, 23 };
num[0] = 23;
num[1] = 56;
num[2] = 67;
num[3] = 22; I
num[4] = 78;
//num[5] = 67; // this will throw System.IndexOutOfRangeException 

// Accessing the values
int i = num[4];

Double Dimensional Array

int[,] twodimarray = new int[2, 3] { { 12, 34, 45 }, { 45, 12, 67 } };
twodimarray[0, 0] = 10;
twodimarray[0, 1] = 20;
twodimarray[0, 2] = 30;
twodimarray[1, 0] = 40;
twodimarray[1, 1] = 50;
twodimarray[1, 2] = 60;

// Accessing the values
int j = twodimarray[1, 0];

Array of Arrays

int[][] jaggedarray = new int[3][];
jaggedArray[0] = new int[4] { 23, 576, 12, 67 };
jaggedArray[1] = new int[2] { 76,12 };
jaggedArray[2] = new int[5] { 79,34,12,56,8 }5

// Accessing the values
int k = jaggedarray[0][3];

Complex Arrays - Manual

// To be defined outside the main class
class Employee
{
public Int  EmpId { get; set; }
public string Name { get; set; }
}

Console.WriteLine("This is Array's Project");
// one dimensional array, 2 dim array & Jagged arrays
Employee[] emp = new Employee[4];
emp[0] = new Employee() { EmpId = 101, Name = "John" };
emp[1] = new Employee() { EmpId = 102, Name = "Scott" };
emp[2] = new Employee() { EmpId = 103, Name = "Rita" };
emp[3] = new Employee() { EmpId = 104, Name = "Sandra" }; 

Employee E = emp[2];
Console.WriteLine(e.Name) ;
Console.WriteLine(e.EmpId);

Complex Arrays - Automatic

// To be defined outside the main class
class Employee
{
public int  EmpId { get; set; }
public string Name { get; set; }
}


Console.WriteLine("How many employees data would you like to store?");
int size = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());

Employee[] emp = new Employee[size];

for(int i=0;i<size;i++)
{
Console.writeLine("Enter Employee {0} details", i+1);
Console.write("Id : ");
int id = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());
Console.write("Name : ");
string name = Console.ReadLine(); I
emp[i] = new Employee() { EmpId = id, name = name };|
}

Console.WriteLine("-----Employee Details-----");
Console.WriteLine(); // for gap
console.writeLine("Id\tname") ;

foreach(Employee em in emp)
{
Console.writeLine("{0}\t{1}",em.EmpId,em.Name);
}
Console.Read();

Output

# Ashfaq 8-Sep-2022.md

Wilearn Trainings

  • Introduction - B29076 – 4 minutes
  • Work Etiquette - B28857 – 15 minutes
  • Teaming To Win - B29078 – 9 minutes
  • Establishing Customer Affinity - B29079 – 21 minutes

Wilearn Notes

Things taught

Onsite incidents

  • Wash hands
  • Wearing puma shorts in Niche office
  • Taking Visa to Mastercard
  • Pushing in Buses
  • Banging the printers
  • Grabbing lots of chocolates
  • Exploiting phone bills
  • Taking naps at work
  • Keeping long nails
  • Disturbing someone without appointment

Parameters Impacting Customer Service

  • Handling schedule slippages
  • Flexible/Ease of doing business
  • Meeting milestones
  • Response to action items
  • Relationship and engagement
  • Domain and functional knowledge
  • Number of revisions to the schedule
  • Quality of impact analysis
  • Clarifying query
  • Application Support during Service Delivery
  • Technical competency
  • Thought leadership (innovation and patents)
  • Resource fulfillment
  • Cross cultural
  • Promptness to respond to operational issues
  • Being proactive
  • Proactive risk management
  • Communication skills
  • Quality of intermediate work products (such as
  • design documents, test plans, POCS),
  • Avoiding regression issues

Scenarios

Scenario 1
Client has some urgent requirements and had arranged a call with onsite and offshore team, during the call the onsite team assumed that offshore team is taking care of preparing requirement documents and the offshore is assuming that onsite team would do that. After the call has ended it comes to notice that requirements have not been captured and the client raises an escalation.

Solution
Follow the LEAD strategy. First listen and empathize till the client cools down and then come up with a solution.

It is a case sensitive language.

Types of Cases

  1. Pascal - eg. EmployeeName
    • Used in Solution, Projects, Class, Properties, delegates, Methods
  2. Camel - eg. employeeName
    • Used in Private variables, keywords

carve-out's on MSFT stack.md

Run a campaign targeting Private Equity firms to target carve-out's on MSFT stack

  • Private Equity Firms

The Microsoft Technology Stack

The Microsoft stack is a set of applications and tools that are designed to work together—from the back-end data base to coding languages (e.g., C#) and development environments (e.g., Visual Studio), all the way up to platforms and applications, like cloud apps, Microsoft (Office) 365, and business applications like Dynamics 365 Business Central.

  • Figure out what use cases we can pitch to the Private Equity client# Certifications.md

Change Word - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/1u21m0816o


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public string returnTheModifiedSentence(string input1) {
    string[] words = input1.Split(' ');
    int str_len;
    string final = "";
    char ch;

    foreach(string word in words) {
      str_len = word.Length;

      for (int i = 0; i < str_len; i++) {
        ch = (char)((int) word[i] + str_len);

        if (word[i] <= 90 && ((word[i] + str_len) > 90)) {
          ch = 'Z';
        } else if (word[i] <= 122 && ((word[i] + str_len > 122))) {
          ch = 'z';
        }

        final = final + ch;
        Console.WriteLine(final);

      }
      final = final + " ";
    }

    final = final.Substring(0, final.Length - 1);

    return final;
  }
}

Create numbers in range

# Create PIN using alpha, beta, gamma - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/be582d9f

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int createPIN(int input1, int input2, int input3) {
    int[] arr = {
      input1,
      input2,
      input3
    };
    int max = 0, min;
    double sum = 0.0;
    double place = 1.0;
    int num;
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
      num = arr[i];
      while (num != 0) {
        int r = num % 10;
        if (r > max)
          max = r;
        num = num / 10;
      }
    }
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
      min = 99;
      for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
        int rem = arr[j] % 10;
        if (rem < min)
          min = rem;
        arr[j] /= 10;
      }
      sum = (min + (sum / place));
      sum *= place;
      place *= 10;
    }
    return (int)(max * 1000 + sum);
  }
}

# Decreasing sequence - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/8e68e9a4


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  //Assume following return types while writing the code for this question.
  public class Result {
    public int output1;
    public int output2;
  }
  public Result decreasingSeq(int[] input1, int input2) {

    int c1 = 0, c2 = 0, max = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < input2 - 1; i++) {
      if (input1[i] > input1[i + 1]) {
        c1++;
      }
      if ((input1[i] < input1[i + 1] && c1 != 0) || ((i == input2 - 2) && c1 != 0)) {
        if (max < c1) {
          max = c1;
        }
        c2++;
        c1 = 0;
      }
    }
    max = max + 1;
    if (c2 == 0) {
      max = 0;
    }
    if (input2 == 0) {
      max = 0;
      c2 = 0;
    }
    Result r1 = new Result();

    r1.output1 = c2;
    r1.output2 = max;
    return r1;
  }
}

Dialogs.md

  • Dialogs
    • used when a user wants to follow a wizard to perform any action. It define pages to allow capturing responses.
      • For example: Asking for relevant information to create a record (call center). Based on the response we can perform an action,

    • Scenario : Create a booking by capturing response from the customer on call

            # digitSum even sum of even digits in N - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/b55d1714

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int EvenDigitsSum(int input1) {
    int sum = 0;
    while (input1 != 0) {
      int n = input1 % 10;
      if (n % 2 == 0)
        sum += n;
      input1 /= 10;
    }
    return sum;
  }
}

digitSum odd sum of odd digits in N - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/738fdee0

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int OddDigitsSum(int input1) {
    int sum = 0;
    while (input1 != 0) {
      int n = input1 % 10;
      if (n % 2 != 0)
        sum += n;
      input1 /= 10;
    }
    return sum;
  }
}

digitSum opt sum of even or odd digits - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/a05abbcf

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int EvenOddDigitsSum(int input1, string input2) {
    int sum = 0;
    if (input2 == "even") {
      while (input1 != 0) {
        int n = input1 % 10;
        if (n % 2 == 0)
          sum += n;
        input1 /= 10;
      }
    } else {
      while (input1 != 0) {
        int n = input1 % 10;
        if (n % 2 != 0)
          sum += n;
        input1 /= 10;
      }
    }
    return sum;
  }
}

digitSum sum of all digits in N - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/ab1d60cc

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int digitSum(int input1) {
    int neg = input1;
    if (input1 < 0) {
      input1 *= -1;
    }
    int len = input1.ToString().Length;
    if (len == 1) {
      if (neg < 0)
        return input1 * -1;
      else
        return input1;
    } else {
      int sum = 0;
      while (input1 != 0) {
        int rem = input1 % 10;
        sum += rem;
        input1 /= 10;
      }
      if (neg < 0)
        return digitSum(sum * -1);
      else
        return digitSum(sum);
    }
  }
}

This analysis conducted for the PL 400 shows that exam topics has a maximum match rate and all other matches (except 2) from other websites overlap with it.

Also out of 42 questions 10 questions were found which approximates for 24% of the questions.

10 questions were also found connected to MeasureUp again contributing to 24%.

Conclusion

  • MeasureUp + Exam topics (verify answers with discussions/search) shall be necessary for all the Associate level exams

Encoding Three Strings - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/f05028d5


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public class Result {
    public string output1;
    public string output2;
    public string output3;
  }
  public Result encode ThreeStrings(string input1, string input2, string input3) {
    string frnt1 = "", mid1 = "", end1 = "";
    string frnt2 = "", mid2 = "", end2 = "";
    string frnt3 = "", mid3 = "", end3 = "";
    string output1 = "", output2 = "", output3 = "";
    int len1 = input1.Length;
    int len2 = input2.Length;
    int len3 = input3.Length;
    if (len1 == input1.Length) {
      if (len1 % 3 == 0) {
        frnt1 = input1.Substring(0, (len1 / 3));
        mid1 = input1.Substring((len1 / 3), ((2 * (len1 / 3))) - (len1 / 3));
        end1 = input1.Substring(2 * (len1 / 3));
      } else if ((len1 - 1) % 3 == 0) {
        frnt1 = input1.Substring(0, (len1 / 3));
        mid1 = input1.Substring((len1 / 3), (((2 * (len1 / 3)) + 1)) - (len1 / 3));
        end1 = input1.Substring(((2 * (len1 / 3)) + 1));
      } else if ((len1 - 2) % 3 == 0) {
        frnt1 = input1.Substring(0, ((len1 / 3) + 1));
        mid1 = input1.Substring(((len1 / 3) + 1), (((2 * (len1 / 3)) + 1)) - ((len1 / 3) + 1));
        end1 = input1.Substring(((2 * (len1 / 3)) + 1));
      }
    }
    if (len2 == input2.Length) {
      if (len2 % 3 == 0) {
        frnt2 = input2.Substring(0, (len2 / 3));
        mid2 = input2.Substring((len2 / 3), ((2 * (len2 / 3))) - (len2 / 3));
        end2 = input2.Substring(2 * (len2 / 3));
      } else if ((len2 - 1) % 3 == 0) {
        frnt2 = input2.Substring(0, (len2 / 3));
        mid2 = input2.Substring((len2 / 3), (((2 * (len2 / 3)) + 1)) - (len2 / 3));
        end2 = input2.Substring(((2 * (len2 / 3)) + 1));
      } else if ((len2 - 2) % 3 == 0) {
        frnt2 = input2.Substring(0, ((len2 / 3) + 1));
        mid2 = input2.Substring(((len2 / 3) + 1), (((2 * (len2 / 3)) + 1)) - ((len2 / 3) + 1));
        end2 = input2.Substring(((2 * (len2 / 3)) + 1));
      }
    }
    if (len3 == input3.Length) {
      if (len3 % 3 == 0) {
        frnt3 = input3.Substring(0, (len3 / 3));
        mid3 = input3.Substring((len3 / 3), ((2 * (len3 / 3))) - (len3 / 3));
        end3 = input3.Substring(2 * (len3 / 3));
      } else if ((len3 - 1) % 3 == 0) {
        frnt3 = input3.Substring(0, (len3 / 3));
        mid3 = input3.Substring((len3 / 3), (((2 * (len3 / 3)) + 1)) - (len3 / 3));
        end3 = input3.Substring(((2 * (len3 / 3)) + 1));
      } else if ((len3 - 2) % 3 == 0) {
        frnt3 = input3.Substring(0, ((len3 / 3) + 1));
        mid3 = input3.Substring(((len3 / 3) + 1), (((2 * (len3 / 3)) + 1)) - ((len3 / 3) + 1));
        end3 = input3.Substring(((2 * (len3 / 3)) + 1));
      }
    }
    output1 = frnt1 + frnt2 + frnt3;
    output2 = mid1 + mid2 + mid3;
    string output3_temp = end1 + end2 + end3;

    output3 = string.Empty;
    char[] inputArray = output3_temp.ToCharArray();

    foreach(char c in inputArray) {
      if (char.IsLower(c))
        output3 += c.ToString().ToUpper();
      else if (char.IsUpper(c))
        output3 += c.ToString().ToLower();
      else
        output3 += c.ToString();
    }

    Result rs = new Result();
    rs.output1 = output1;
    rs.output2 = output2;
    rs.output3 = output3;
    return rs;
  }
}

# Entity Framework - Dotnet.md

# Factorial of a number - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/8c1f2ae

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
//Read only region start
public class UserMainCode
{
public int nFactorial(int input1)
	{
	if (input1 == 0)
		return 1;

	return input1 * nFactorial(input1 - 1);
	}
}

Find the order - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/1u21tzecxs


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public string findTheOrder(string input1, string input2) {
    int str_len = input1.Length;

    int flag = 1;
    int count = 0;

    // check increasing
    for (int i = 0; i < str_len - 1; i++) {
      if ((int) input1[i] > (int) input1[i + 1]) {
        flag = 0;
        break;
      }
    }

    // check decreasing
    if (flag == 0) {
      flag = 2;
      for (int i = 0; i < str_len - 1; i++) {
        if ((int) input1[i] < (int) input1[i + 1]) {
          flag = 0;
          break;
        }
      }
    }

    if (flag == 0)
      return "Invalid";

    // counting misplaced
    for (int i = 0; i < str_len; i++) {
      if (input1[i] != input2[i]) {
        count++;
      }
    }

    if (flag == 1) {
      return ("Increasing:" + count);
    } else {
      return ("Decreasing:" + count);
    }

  }
}

FindStringCode - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/e4df74e5


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int findStringCode(string input1) {
    string str = input1.ToUpper();
    string[] word = str.Split(' ');
    string value2 = "";

    for (int i = 0; i < word.Length; i++) {
      int sum = 0;

      for (int j = 0; j < word[i].Length / 2; j++) {
        int first = word[i][j];
        int last = word[i][word[i].Length - 1 - j];
        sum += Math.Abs(first - last);
      }
      if (word[i].Length % 2 != 0)
        sum += (word[i][word[i].Length / 2] - 64);
      string value = sum.ToString();
      value2 += value;
    }

    return Int32.Parse(value2);

  }
}

Freelance Topgear.md

  • Topgear# Get Code Through Strings - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/75c9faf0

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int getCode ThroughStrings(string input1) {
    string[] word = input1.Split(' ');
    int sum = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < word.Length; i++) {
      sum += word[i].Length;
    }
    return (1 + (sum - 1) % 9);
  }
}
```# Getting Started - Dotnet.md

![](./raw/Getting-Started-Dotnet.mp4)

### Difference between dotnet frame and Dotnet core

Google.md

# Identify possible words - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/13486c16


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public string identifyPossiblewords(string input1, string input2) {
    string[] st = input2.Split(':');
    string str = "";
    for (int i = 0; i < st.Length; i++) {
      if (st[i].Length != input1.Length)
        continue;
      string test = input1;
      int x = test.IndexOf("_");
      char ch = st[i][x];
      test = test.Replace('_', ch);
      test = test.ToUpper();
      st[i] = st[i].ToUpper();
      if (st[i] == test) {
        if (str == "") {
          str = str + test;
        } else {
          str = str + ":" + test;
        }
      }
    }
    if (str == "")
      str = "ERROR-009";

    return str;
  }
}

Indexers - Dotnet.md

# Inheritance - Dotnet.md

# Inheritance, Polymorphism, Exception handling and file handling.md

Project


Inheritance

1. Create a class called Person. 
Populate the class with below private fields
	1. FirstName as string
	2. LastName as string
	3. EmailAddres s as string
	4. DateofBirth as DateTime
Add a con structor that accept FinstName, LastName, Email, DateofBirth as parameters
Add read- only properties that return the following computed information:
	1. 1SAdult as bool whether or not the person 1s over 18
	2. SunSign as string - the traditional western sun sign of the person.
	3. IsBirthDay as bool - whether or not today is the persons birthday
	4. ScreenName as string a default screen name that you might see being offered to a tirst time user of Gmail or Yahoo (e.g. Hari Joe born on May 25th, 1980 might be hdoe525 or haridoe052580)

Create a class classed Employee which should be derived from Person class. Employee class should add the following properties:
	1. Salary as double
In the Main method create object of Employee class and test the behaviour by calling read-only properties.

using System;

namespace Person
{
    class Person
    {
        private string? FirstName { get; set; }
        private string? LastName { get; set; }
        private string? EmailAddress { get; set; }
        private DateTime DateofBirth;

        public void person(string fname, string lname, string email, DateTime dob)
        {
            this.FirstName = fname;
            this.LastName = lname;
            this.EmailAddress = email;
            this.DateofBirth = dob;
        }
        public bool isAdult
        {
            get
            {
                int age = new DateTime(DateTime.Now.Subtract(this.DateofBirth).Ticks).Year;
                if (age > 18)
                {
                    return true;
                }
                else
                {
                    return false;
                }
            }
        }
        public string sunSign
        {
            get
            {
                string month = this.DateofBirth.ToString("MMMM");
                int day = Convert.ToInt32(this.DateofBirth.ToString("dd"));

                if (month == "March")
                {
                    if (day >= 21)
                    {
                        return "Aries";
                    }
                    else
                        return "Pisces";
                }
                else if (month == "April")
                {
                    if (day >= 20)
                    {
                        return "Taurus";
                    }
                    else
                        return "Aries";
                }
                else if (month == "May")
                {
                    if (day >= 21)
                        return "Gemini";
                    else
                        return "Taurus";
                }
                else if (month == "June")
                {
                    if (day >= 22)
                        return "Cancer";
                    else
                        return "Gemini";
                }
                else if (month == "July")
                {
                    if (day >= 23)
                        return "Leo";
                    else
                        return "Cancer";
                }
                else if (month == "August")
                {
                    if (day >= 23)
                        return "Virgo";
                    else
                        return "Leo";
                }
                else if (month == "September")
                {
                    if (day >= 23)
                        return "Libra";
                    else
                        return "Virgo";
                }
                else if (month == "October")
                {
                    if (day >= 24)
                        return "Scorpio";
                    else
                        return "Libra";
                }
                else if (month == "November")
                {
                    if (day >= 23)
                        return "Sagittarius";
                    else
                        return "Scorpio";
                }
                else if (month == "December")
                {
                    if (day >= 22)
                        return "Capricorn";
                    else
                        return "Sagittarius";
                }
                else if (month == "January")
                {
                    if (day >= 20)
                        return "Aquarius";
                    else
                        return "Capricorn";
                }
                else if (month == "February")
                {
                    if (day >= 19)
                        return "Pisces";
                    else
                        return "Aquarius";
                }
                return "";

            }
        }
        public bool IsBirthDay
        {
            get
            {
                if (DateTime.Now.Month == this.DateofBirth.Month)
                {
                    if (DateTime.Now.Day == this.DateofBirth.Day)
                        return true;
                    else
                        return false;
                }
                else
                    return false;
            }
        }
        public string ScreenName
        {
            get
            {
                char[] ch = this.FirstName.ToCharArray();
                ch[5] = Convert.ToChar(this.DateofBirth.Day);
                Console.WriteLine(this.DateofBirth.Day);
                string s = new string(ch);
                return s;
            }
        }
    }


    // class employee derived from Person class
    class Employee : Person
    {
        public double Salary { get; set; }

    }


    // Driver Code
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            // creating object of Employee class
            Employee emp1 = new Employee();
            emp1.person("Kuldeep", "K", "kuldeepkumar.jamshedpur.com", Convert.ToDateTime("2002/01/1"));
            emp1.Salary = 15000;
            Console.WriteLine(emp1.isAdult);
            Console.WriteLine(emp1.sunSign);
            Console.WriteLine(emp1.IsBirthDay);
            Console.WriteLine(emp1.ScreenName);
        }
    }

}

Output

2. Create a derived class HourlyEmployee and PermanentEmployee from the above
Person class which will have the below properties respectively .
HourlyEmployee
	1) HoursWorked as double
	2) PayPerHour as double
Permanant Employee
	1) HRA as double
	2) DA as double
	3) Tax as double
	4) NetPay as double
	5) TotalPay as double
create an instance in Main method and test the classes


3. Create an interface called IPayable and implement the interface in the above classes (HourlyEmployee & PermanantEmployee).

4. Declare a Method CalculatePay in the interface.

5. Implement the interface in above derived classes and test the interface implementation by passing some values.

using System;

namespace Employee
{
    // Creating an interface called IPayable
    public interface Ipayable
    {
        void Calculatepay();
    }

    class Person
    {
        public string? firstn { get; set; }
        public string? lastn { get; set; }
        public string? email { get; set; }
        public string? dob { get; set; }

    }

    class hourly : Person, Ipayable
    {

        public double HoursWorked { get; set; }
        public double PayPerHour { get; set; }

        // implementing Calculatepay
        public void Calculatepay()
        {
            double pay = 0;
            pay = HoursWorked * PayPerHour;
            Console.WriteLine("Pay : {0} ", pay);
        }
    }

    class permanent : Person, Ipayable
    {
        double HRA = 0, DA = 0, Tax = 0, Netpay = 0, Total = 0;
        public double hra
        {
            get; set;
        }
        public double da
        {
            get; set;
        }
        public double tax
        {
            get; set;
        }
        public double netpay
        {
            get; set;
        }
        public double total
        {
            get; set;
        }
        // implementing Calculatepay
        public void Calculatepay()
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Netpay : {0} ",netpay);
        }

    }

    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            permanent P1 = new permanent();
            P1.firstn = "Jack";
            P1.lastn = "Dorsey";
            P1.Calculatepay();
            
            hourly h1 = new hourly();
            h1.firstn = "Harry";
            h1.lastn = "Potter";
            h1.HoursWorked = 50;
            h1.PayPerHour = 100;
            h1.Calculatepay();
        }
    }

}

Output

Polymorphism

1. Write a Program to Implement the Compile time polymorphism using Function Overloading approach. Calculate the area of circle, triangle and rectangle using function overloading.

using System;

namespace Area
{
    class Program
    {
        // Area of circle
        public static void area(float a)
        {
            double area = 3.14 * a * a;
            Console.WriteLine("Area of circle : {0}", area);
        }

        // Area of rectangle
        public static void area(int l, int b)
        {
            double area = l * b;
            Console.WriteLine("Area of rectangle : {0}", area);
        }

        // Area of triangle
        public static void area(float h, float b)
        {
            double area = h * b / 2;
            Console.WriteLine("Area of triangle : {0}", area);
        }
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {

            // Area of circle
            area(3);


            // Area of rectangle
            area(4, 5);


            // Area of triangle
            area(4f, 4f);

        }
    }

}

Output

2. Write a Program to Implement the Compile Time Polymorphism
	a. Write a user defined Math class that implements the overloaded method to implement the mathematical functions.
		Return Type Method
		Int Add(inta, int b)
		Int Add(inta, int b, int c)
	b. Similarly implement the method overloading for Multiply, divide and subtract functionalities.

using System;
namespace Math
{
    class Program
    {
        // add two numbers
        public static int add(int a,int b)
        {
            return (a + b);
        }

        // add three numbers
        public static int add(int a,int b,int c)
        {
            return a + b + c;
        }

        // multiply two numbers
        public static int mul(int a, int b)
        {
            return a *b;
        }

        // multiply three numbers
        public static int mul(int a, int b, int c)
        {
            return a *b* c;
        }

        // substract two numbers
        public static int sub(int a, int b)
        {
            return (a - b);
        }

        // substract three numbers
        public static int sub(int a, int b,int c)
        {
            return a-b-c;
        }

        // divide two numbers
        public static int div(int a, int b)
        {
            return a / b;
        }

        // divide three numbers
        public static int div(int a, int b, int c)
        {
            return a / b / c;
        }

        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            Console.WriteLine("sum of two numbers : {0}",add(1,2));
            Console.WriteLine("sum of three numbers : {0}",add(2,4,5));
            Console.WriteLine("multiplication of two numbers : {0}",mul(1, 2));
            Console.WriteLine("multiplication of three numbers : {0}",mul(3,4,5));
            Console.WriteLine("substraction of two numbers : {0}",sub(3,2));
            Console.WriteLine("substraction of three numbers : {0}",sub(10, 2,2));
            Console.WriteLine("division of two numbers : {0}",div(3, 3));
            Console.WriteLine("division of three numbers : {0}",div(3, 3,1));
        }
    }
}

Output

Exceptions

1. Write a Program to handle FormatException. 1f a user enters values other than integer while entering the marks of each subject, catch Format Exception. The name of the students and marks in 3 subjects are taken from the user while executing the program.

2. In the same Program write a custom exception class called NegativeNumberException if the marks entered are less than zero.

3. Catch the following exceptions for the values entered by the user in the Person class created in the previous hands-on.

4. FirstName and LastName should not be Empty and only alphabets should be allowed.

using System;
using System.IO;
using System.Text.RegularExpressions;

namespace formatException
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {

            string[] name = new string[3];
            int[] mark = new int[3];
            for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
            {
                // Taking the name and marks from student
                Console.WriteLine("Enter \n1.Student Name\n2.Mark ");
                name[i] = Console.ReadLine();
                try
                {
                    mark[i] = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
                    check(mark[i]);
                }
                catch (FormatException)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("{0} is not a number", mark[i]);
                }
                catch (NegativeNumberException e)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine(e);
                }
                finally
                {
                    Person emp1 = new Person();

                    emp1.person("Kuldeep", "K", "kuldeepkumar.jamshedpur@gmail.com", Convert.ToDateTime("2002/01/1"));
                }


            }
        }
        public static void check(int num)
        {
            if (num < 0)
            {
                throw new NegativeNumberException("Negative not allowed");
            }
        }

    }

    // Creating the custom exception NegativeNumberException by inheriting the Exception class
    class NegativeNumberException : Exception
    {
        public NegativeNumberException() : base()
        {

        }
        public NegativeNumberException(string message) : base(message)
        {

        }
    }
    class Person
    {
        private string FirstName;
        private string LastName;
        private string EmailAddress;
        private DateTime DateofBirth;

        public void person(string fname, string lname, string email, DateTime dob)
        {
            try
            {
                check(fname);
                this.FirstName = fname;

            }
            catch (validateexeption ex)
            {
                Console.WriteLine(ex);
            }
            try
            {
                check(lname);
                this.LastName = lname;
            }
            catch (validateexeption ex)
            {
                Console.WriteLine(ex);
            }
            this.EmailAddress = email;
            this.DateofBirth = dob;
        }
        public static void check(string name)
        {
            if (!Regex.IsMatch(name, @"^[a-zA-Z]+$"))
                throw new validateexeption("Only Alphabets allowed");
        }
    }
    class validateexeption : Exception
    {
        public validateexeption() : base()
        {


        }
        public validateexeption(string message) : base(message)
        {

        }
    }
}

Output

File Handling

1. Create a Console Application to create a file and write contents, save and close the file.

using System;

public class CreateFileOrFolder
{
    static void Main()
    {
        // Specifying the parent folder path
        string folderName = @"C:\Users\wwwkk\Documents";

        // Specifying sub folder
        string pathString = System.IO.Path.Combine(folderName, "wipro");

        // Specifying file name
        string fileName = "wipro.txt";

        using (StreamWriter outputFile = new StreamWriter(Path.Combine(pathString, fileName), true))
        {
            outputFile.WriteLine("Welcome to Wipro");
        }

        // Keep the console window open in debug mode.
        System.Console.WriteLine("Press any key to exit.");
        System.Console.ReadKey();
    }

}

Output

Internal Job Portal.md

Description

BSc computer Science graduate from Delhi University. Trained in .Net and certified in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (MB 910, PL 900, PL 400, PL 200, MB 210). Good at python (for data analysis and visualisation using libraries like pandas, numpy and seaborn etc) with basic knowledge of html, css and javascript. Have woked for a US client as a video editor for nearly a year in 2021.

Introduction - Dotnet.md

Common Abbreviations

  • CLI (Common Language Infrastructure)
  • CLR (Common Language Runtime)
  • MSR / IL (Microsoft Intermediate Language)
  • CLS (Common Language Specification)
  • CTS (Common Type System)
  • BCL (Base Class Library) - Predefined class of libraries that are available.
  • JIT (Just in Time) - It selects specific codes that is to be executed, and is converted to 0's and 1's.

Objective

  • Provide interoperability to the user

Important points

  • Irrespective of the language chosen, the code is converted into intermediate language code with the help of this CTS.
  • CLR can only understand MSL/IL code.
  • The code which the CLR can understand is called managed code.
  • The code which the CLR can understand is called unmanaged code.

Basic Syntax

  • csc is a C# language compiler
  • .exe file cane be run executed directly. (for windows application)
  • .dll file needs to refer it to any other code in order to run it. (for web applications)

Managed code execution process

  • Manifest contains the version information.
  • IL stands for intermediate language code.

Introduction to DotNet and C sharp fundamentals.md

Project


Data Types

1. Create a console application to accept the side of a square and print the area of the square.

using System;
public class AreaOfSquare
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        // Taking input from the user
        Console.WriteLine("Enter the Side of Square: ");

        // converting string to integer
        int Side = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        //Calculating the Area
        int Area = Side * Side;

        //Printing the Area
        Console.WriteLine($"Area of Square with side {Side} is {Area}");
     }
}

Output

2. Create a console application that finds number of digits and alphabets in a given string.

using System;
public class count_char_digits
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        string str;
        int alp, digit, i, l;
        alp = digit = i = 0;


        Console.Write("\n\nCount total number of alphabets and digits:\n");
        Console.Write("----------------------------------------------\n");

        // taking input from the user
        Console.Write("Input the string : ");
        str = Console.ReadLine();
        l = str.Length;


        // Checks each character of string
        while (i < l)
        {
            // counting the alphabets
            if ((str[i] >= 'a' && str[i] <= 'z') || (str[i] >= 'A' && str[i] <= 'Z'))
            {
                alp++;
            }

            // counting the digits
            if (str[i] >= '0' && str[i] <= '9')
            {
                digit++;
            }

            i++;
        }

        Console.Write("Number of Alphabets in the string is : {0}\n", alp);
        Console.Write("Number of Digits in the string is : {0}\n", digit);
    }
}

Output

3. Create a console application that accepts a string and increments each character in the string by 1 and toggle all characters in the new string to UPPER CASE or LOWER CASE

using System;

class increment_and_toggle
{
	public static void Main(String[] args)
	{
		// taking input from the user
		Console.Write("Input the string : ");
		string str_input = Console.ReadLine();
		char[] str = str_input.ToCharArray();

		// toggle characters
		for (int i = 0; i < str.Length; i++)
		{

			// incrementing each character
			str[i] = (char)(str[i] + 1);
			
			// We can add this condition if we just want to increment alphanumeric characters
			//if ((str[i] >= 'A' && str[i] <= 'Z') || (str[i] >= 'a' && str[i] <= 'z') || (str[i] >= '0' && str[i] <= '9'))

			if (str[i] >= 'A' && str[i] <= 'Z')
				str[i] = (char)(str[i] + 'a' - 'A');
			else if (str[i] >= 'a' && str[i] <= 'z')
				str[i] = (char)(str[i] + 'A' - 'a');
		}



		Console.WriteLine("String after toggle ");
		Console.WriteLine(String.Join("", str));
	}
}

Output

4. Create a console application to accept a string and perform below string manipulation on the same
	1) Print the string in reverse order
	2) Extract part of the string from 2nd position till the end of the string
	3) Replace any given character by '$' and print the new string
	4) Copy the string to another string variable, Modify the data in 2nd string variable and print both the strings

using System;

public class StringFunctions
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        string str, str1 = "";
        int i, len;

        // Taking input from the user
        Console.Write("Input A String : ");
        str = Console.ReadLine();

        //Print a string in reverse order
        len = str.Length - 1;
        for (i = len; i >= 0; i--)
        {
            str1 = str1 + str[i];
        }

        Console.WriteLine("The string in Reverse order = {0}", str1);

        //Extract part of the string from 2nd position till the end of the string
        str1 = "";
        for (i = 1; i <= len; i++)
        {
            str1 = str1 + str[i];
        }

        Console.WriteLine("The extracted string = {0}", str1);

        // Replacing 'e' with '$'
        str1 = "";
        for (i = 0; i <= len; i++)
        {
            if (str[i] == 'e')
                str1 = str1 + '$';
            else
                str1 = str1 + str[i];

        }

        Console.WriteLine("New string after replacing 'e' with '$' = {0}", str1);

        // Copying the string to another string variable, Modify the data in 2nd string variable and print both the strings
        str1 = str;

        // Modifying the data
        str1 = str1 + " Wipro";

        Console.WriteLine("Original String str = {0}", str);
        Console.WriteLine("Copied String str1 = {0}", str1);

    }
}

Output

Operators

1. Write a simple program that accepts two number num1 and num2 .
	Assign num1 to num2 in two scenarios
	1) Assign num1 to num2 by pre-1ncrementing num1 and observe the output
	2) Assign num1 to num2 by post-incrementing num1 and observe the output
	3) Swap both values

using System;
public class num1_num2
{
    public static void Main()
    {

        int num1, num2;
        Console.Write("Input 1st number: ");
        num1 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        Console.Write("Input 2nd number: ");
        num2 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        // pre-incrementing num1
        num2 = ++num1;
        Console.WriteLine("Assign num1 to num2 by pre-incrementing num1 :" + num1);

        // post-incrementing num2
        num2 = num1++;
        Console.WriteLine("Assign num1 to num2 by post-incrementing num2. :" + num2);

        Console.WriteLine("values before swapping:");
        Console.WriteLine("num1 Value = {0}", num1);
        Console.WriteLine("num2 Value = {0}", num2);

        // swapping values
        int temp = num1;
        num1 = num2;
        num2 = temp;

        Console.WriteLine("values before swapping:");
        Console.WriteLine("num1 Value = {0}", num1);
        Console.WriteLine("num2 Value = {0}", num2);
    }
}

Output

Control Statements

1. Write a program which asks the user for his login and password. Both must be strings. After 3 wrong attempts, the user will be rejected.

using System;
public class password_check
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        string user, pass;
        int count = 0;

        do
        {
            Console.Write("Enter username: ");
            user = Console.ReadLine();

            Console.Write("Enter password: ");
            pass = Console.ReadLine();

            count++;

        }
        while (((user != "user") || (pass != "password"))
            && (count != 3));

        if (count == 3)
            Console.Write("Login attemp fail!");
        else
            Console.Write("Password correct!");
    }
}

Output

2. Write a program that accepts 2 numbers and prints whether the 2nd number is in unit's, ten's, hundreds or thousands place in 1st number.

using System;

class Place_of_n2_in_n1
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        int place = 0;

        // Taking input from the user
        Console.WriteLine("Enter the first number: ");
        // converting string to integer
        int num1 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        Console.WriteLine("Enter the digit to be searched: ");
        // converting string to integer
        int num2 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        // Loop to find the digits of num1
        while (num1 > 0)
        {
            // check if the digit is num2
            if (num1 % 10 == num2)
            {
                break;
            }

            num1 = num1 / 10;
            place++;
        }

        if (place == 0)
            Console.WriteLine("2nd number is in unit's place");
        else if (place == 1)
            Console.WriteLine("2nd number is in ten's place");
        else if (place == 2)
            Console.WriteLine("2nd number is in hundreds place");
        else if (place == 3)
            Console.WriteLine("2nd number is in thousands place");
        else
            Console.WriteLine("The second number is not present in either of unit's, ten's, hundreds, thousands place");
    }
}

Output

Arrays

1. write a program that finds number of element in an array without using built in features

using System;
public class array_size
{
    public static void Main()
    {

        // Declaring a sample 1D array
        int[] num = new int[] { 34, 345, 23, 5, 23 };

        // Counter Variable
        int count = 0;

        foreach (int element in num)
        {
            count = count + 1;
        }

        Console.WriteLine("The size of the array is = {0}", count);
        Console.Read();
    }
}

Output

2. Write a program to accept 10 integers to an array and perform the below actions
	1) Print the elements in descending order
	2) find the Min value, Max value entered
	3) print the the sum we after adding all the numbers in the array

using System;
public class array_task
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        int[] arr = new int[5];
        int i;
        int sum = 0;


        Console.Write("\n\nRead and Print elements of an array:\n");
        Console.Write("-----------------------------------------\n");

        Console.Write("Input 5 elements in the array :\n");
        for (i = 0; i < 5; i++)
        {
            Console.Write("element - {0} : ", i + 1);
            arr[i] = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
        }

        Console.Write("\nElements in array are: ");
        for (i = 0; i < 5; i++)
        {
            Console.Write("{0}  ", arr[i]);
            sum = sum + arr[i];
        }
        Console.Write("\n");

        // Sorting the array
        int temp;

        // traverse 0 to array length
        for (i = 0; i < arr.Length - 1; i++)

            // traverse i+1 to array length
            for (int j = i + 1; j < arr.Length; j++)

                // compare array element with all next element
                if (arr[i] < arr[j])
                {

                    temp = arr[i];
                    arr[i] = arr[j];
                    arr[j] = temp;
                }

        // print all element of array
        Console.Write("\nElements of array in descending order are: ");
        foreach (int value in arr)
        {
            Console.Write(value + " ");
        }


        // Printing the maximum and minimum value
        Console.Write("\n\nMaximum Value : {0}", arr[0]);
        Console.Write("\nMinimum Value : {0}", arr[arr.Length - 1]);

        // Printing the sum
        Console.Write("\n\nSum of all the elements in the array is : {0}", arr[arr.Length - 1]);

    }
}

Output

Methods and properties

1. Create an Employee class with the following specifications.
	1. Employee Name as string.
	2. Basic Salary, HRA, DA, TAX, Gross Pay and Net salary as decimal.
	3. Calculate the HRA (15% of Basic Salary), DA (10% of Basic Salary), Gross Pay (Basic Salary + HRA +DA), Tax (8% of Gross Pay) and Net Pay (Gross Pay - Tax).
	4. A Constructor to allow to define the Employee Name and Basic Salary.
	5. A method CalculateNetPay to calculate the HRA, DA, Tax, Gross and Net Pay values using the criteria mentioned in the Point 4.
	6. A method Display() to Display the Salary structure.

using System;

    class Employee
    {
        public string EmployeeName { get; set; }
        public double BasicSalary { get; set; }
        public double HRA { get; set; }
        public double DA { get; set; }
        public double TAX { get; set; }
        public double GrossSalary { get; set; }
        public double NetSalary { get; set; }


        public Employee(string name, double basicSalary)
        {
            EmployeeName = name;
            BasicSalary = basicSalary;
        }

        public void CalculateNetPay()
        {
            HRA = BasicSalary * 0.15;
            DA = BasicSalary * 0.1;
            GrossSalary = BasicSalary + HRA + DA;
            TAX = GrossSalary * 0.08;
            NetSalary = GrossSalary - TAX;
        }

        public void Display()
        {
            CalculateNetPay();
            Console.WriteLine($"Employee Name: {EmployeeName}\n" +
                $"Basic Salary: {BasicSalary}\n" +
                $"HRA: {HRA}\n" +
                $"DA: {DA}\n" +
                $"TAX: {TAX}\n" +
                $"GrossSalary: {GrossSalary}\n" +
                $"NetSalary: {NetSalary}\n");
        }
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        Employee employee = new Employee("Kuldeep Kumar", 15000);
        employee.Display();
    }
}

Output

2. Create a new class called "Stock which contains the following:
	1. A String for the stock name
	2. A String for the stock symbol
	3. A double storing the previous closing price of the stock
	4. A double storing the current closing price of the stock
	5. A constructor that allows you to define a stock' s name, symbol, previous closing price and current closing price
	6. A method getChangePercentage () that returns the percentage change from the previous closing price to the current closing price


using System;

class Stock
{
    private string symbol;
    private string name;
    private double previousClosingPrice;
    private double currentPrice;


    // constructor to initialise the variables
    public Stock(string symbol, string name, double previousClosingPrice, double currentPrice)
    {
        this.symbol = symbol;
        this.name = name;
        this.previousClosingPrice = previousClosingPrice;
        this.currentPrice = currentPrice;
    }

    // returns the percentage change from the previous closing price to the current closing price
    public double getChangePercent()
    {
        return (currentPrice - previousClosingPrice) / currentPrice * 100;
    }

    // To display details
    public void toString()
    {
        Console.WriteLine("\n{0} stock: Symbol : {1} \nClosing price:{2} \nCurrent price: {3} \nChange percent:{4:0}% \n", name, symbol, previousClosingPrice, currentPrice, getChangePercent());
    }

}

public class Test
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        Stock s1 = new Stock("Wipro", "Google", 134.67, 131.98);
        Stock s2 = new Stock("TCS", "Microsoft", 156.52, 161.22);

        s1.toString();
        s2.toString();
    }
}

Output

3. Create a new class called "RandomHelper" which contains the following :
	1. A static method called randint that accepts two integers and returns a random integer between them. Make sure that the numbers are inclusive (i.e. if you call randomint (1,18) you should be able to generate both 1 and 10.
	2. A static method called randdouble that accepts twO integers and returns a random double between them. For this method you should be able to generate numbers such that 1 (= x < 10 for the method call randdouble (1, 10)
	3. Call your method from another class without instantiating the class (i.e. call it just like you would call Math.random() since your methods are defined to be static)

using System;

public class RandomHelper
{
	public static void randit()
	{
		int ra_int1, ra_int2;
		int rand;
		Console.WriteLine("Enter the two Integral values");
		ra_int1 = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());
		ra_int2 = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());

		// Choosing a random value
		Random random = new Random();
		rand = random.Next(ra_int1, ra_int2);
		Console.WriteLine("The RANDOM NUMBER IN INTEGER FORM {0}", rand);
	}
	public static void randdouble()
	{
		int ra_double1, ra_double2;
		int rand1;
		Console.WriteLine("Enter the two Integral values");
		ra_double1 = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());
		ra_double2 = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());

		// Choosing a random value
		Random random = new Random();
		rand1 = random.Next(ra_double1, ra_double2);
		Console.WriteLine("The Random Double Numbers={0}", random.NextDouble() * rand1);
	}
}
public class Program
{
	public static void Main()
	{
		RandomHelper.randit();
		RandomHelper.randdouble();
	}
}

Output

# Is N an exact multiple of M - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/36c4ef58

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int isMultiple(int input1,int input2)
	{
    if(input1==0 || input2==0) 
        return 3; 
    else if(input1%input2==0)
        return 2; 
    else 
        return 1;	
	}
}

Is Odd - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/dbdac2a9

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
public class UserMainCode
	{
	public int isOdd (int input1)
		{
		if(input1%2!=0)
            return 2;
        else  
            return 1;
    }
}

Is Palindrome Number - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/28c41d9d

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int isPalinNum(int input1) {
    string str = input1.ToString();
    int len = str.Length;
    string str1 = "";
    for (int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
      str1 += str[i];
    }
    if (str == str1)
      return 2;
    else
      return 1;
  }
}
```# Is Palindrome Possible - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/f4fdb02

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531104007.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int isPalinNumPossible(int input1) {
    string str = input1.ToString();
    int[] count = new int[10];

    // initializing all values to zero
    for (int i = 0; i < count.Length; i++)
      count[i] = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < str.Length; i++)
      count[(int) Char.GetNumericValue(str[i])]++;

    int odd = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
      if ((count[i] % 2) != 0)
        odd++;
      if (odd > 1)
        return 1;
    }
    return 2;
  }
}
```# is Palindrome string - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/ffe8042

![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531104912.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int isPalindrome(string input1) {
    string str = input1.ToLower();
    string str1 = "";
    for (int i = str.Length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
      str1 += str[i];
    }
    if (str == str1)
      return 2;
    else
      return 1;
  }
}
```# Is Prime - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/b1efaa3d

![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531084209.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
//Read only region start
public class UserMainCode
{
	public int isPrime(int input1)
	{
		int count=0;
		for(int i=2;i<=Math.Sqrt(input1);i++)
		{
		 if(input1%i==0)
		     count++;
		}
		if(count==0)
		 return 2;
		 else
		return 1;
	}
}

# Long Word - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/1u226vvh8g

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public string find LongWord(string input1) {
    int str_len = input1.Length;

    string result = "";
    if (str_len > 10) {
      result = input1[0] + (str_len - 2).ToString() + input1[str_len - 1];
    } else {
      result = input1;
    }

    return result;
  }
}

Question # 9Topic 3

  • B. MarkupValue

Question # 20Topic 1

An international services company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance.
You need to help the implementation team set up the app.
What must be created and configured first?

  • A. Business unit
  • B. Chart of accounts
  • C. Project
  • D. Legal entity

Reveal Solution

MB-920 raw.md

1

Warehouse management can be used to manage complex warehouse processes such as outbound waves and location volumetrics. Warehouse management offers a broad spectrum of functionalities and enough flexibility to implement the warehouse processes in a variety of industries. For example, outbound waves help to manage picking work for sales orders, and location volumetrics allow a user to determine how much can be stored in a location depending on the physical volume of items. These advanced features are not supported by inventory management and are not related to product information management.

Inventory management can be used to fulfill sales orders via registering a picking list. Inventory management supports basic warehouse functionalities for inbound and outbound operations, simple quality control, and inventory closing. A picking list can only be created and registered with inventory management, and it is not supported by warehouse management nor by product information management.

Product information management can be used to create a released product and set up company-specific settings. Product information management offers functionalities to manage shared information about products in a central repository, and configure company-wide settings after a product is released to a specific legal entity. You cannot create a released product in warehouse management nor in inventory management.

2

Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management includes the following modules to maintain supply chains: Procurement and sourcing, Inventory management, and Sales and Marketing.

The Procurement and sourcing module is designed to maintain workflows related to item purchase requisitions and purchase orders.

The Inventory management module allows you to view, manage, and control your stock.

The Sales and Marketing module helps to manage item sales processes and work on item returns.

The Organization administration module helps you to manage the company’s main configuration and settings.

The General ledger module is a part of the Financial management function.

3

You should use the procurement and sourcing module to locate suppliers. This module identifies a need for a product, locates suppliers, monitors suppliers, and helps adhere to product standards.

You should use the warehouse management module to gain visibility over inventory, shipping, and receiving. Warehouse management is fully integrated with other business processes such as transportation, manufacturing, quality control, purchase, transfer, sales, and returns.

You should use vendor collaboration to enable suppliers to view purchase orders. Vendor collaboration is a system module that can be used to display information about purchase orders to external users, such as employees of a vendor.

You should not use inventory management. Inventory management manages inbound and outbound operations and all related control aspects, including quality assurance.

You should not use transportation management. Transportation management manages logistics, including shipping vendors and routing options for inbound and outbound orders.

4

The following two scenarios are supported by Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management:

Routing inbound and outbound orders using the most cost-effective freight optionProviding customizable configured-to-order product options to clients
The transportation management feature in Supply Chain Management allows your company to manage not only shipping completed orders, but also transporting raw materials you will use in your manufacturing processes. Supply Chain Management allows multiple source and destination routes, vendors, and transportation methods to be managed. When a new order is generated, the most cost-effective shipping method (for example, over-the-road vs. rail) can be identified and a load can be scheduled.

The product information management feature in Supply Chain Management allows your company to provide highly customizable product configurations to your clients. Additionally, Supply Chain Management allows you to source raw materials and manage inventory flows and production to minimize waste and streamline supply lines. This means that you can market and manufacture client-focused solutions effectively and efficiently.

Tracking all interactions with current and potential customers is not a feature of Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. To fulfil this requirement, a model-driven app such as Dynamics 365 Marketing should be used.

Generating customer sales quotes and converting quotes to orders is not a feature of Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. To fulfil this requirement, a model-driven app such as Dynamics 365 Sales should be used.

5

You should use a product master to define the rules for generating distinct products. Product masters hold the definition and rules that specify how distinct products are described. Based on these definitions, distinct products can be generated.

You should use a product variant to create products using a product configuration tool. Product variants can be either be defined by using the product dimensions of their masters or configured by using a product configuration tool.

You should use a product to create a uniquely identifiable item with no dimensions. A uniquely identifiable item is a product that does not vary and has no product dimensions. A product has two types: item or service.

You should not use a service. Services are product types that are usually used to represent non-stocked services such as cleaning or catering.

6

You should use a product master. A product master is not a specific product. You can use a product master to set the rules to generate specific products. These rules are called product dimensions, and the products generated from a product master are called product variants. In this scenario, you need to create a frame that can have various sizes, materials and colors. This means you need a product master to represent it.

You should not use a product. A product is an item or service that can be identified uniquely, without the need of additional information such as size or color. Since a product is already a specific item or service, it does not have any dimensions. An example of product is a frame that comes in a single model, without any possible variation.

You should not use an item. An item is a product type generally used for tangible products that can be bought, sold, manufactured, and stocked. An item can be either a product (a frame in a single model, with no variations) or a product master (a frame with various sizes, colors, and materials).

You should not use a service. A service is a product type generally used for intangible products that cannot be stocked; for example, cleaning or electricity.

7

You should identify released products. A released product is available in a given legal entity so that it can be transacted in that legal entity. Unlike a product definition, which exists in a central repository shared by all legal entities, a released product includes additional details to define how that product is handled in a given legal entity. For example, a released product includes storage and tracking dimensions.

You should also identify product variants. Product variants are specific, uniquely identifiable items or services that can be bought or sold in the system. A product variant is generated from a product master once specific values of its product dimensions are selected. For example, a t-shirt is a product master and a medium-size red t-shirt is a product variant. A product variant can be released to a legal entity and bought or sold within that legal entity.

You should not identify product masters. A product master is not a specific product. You can use a product master to set the rules to generate specific products. These rules are called product dimensions, and the products generated from a product masters are called product variants. You cannot buy or sell a product master in the system, because it does not represent a uniquely identifiable product.

You should not identify product dimensions. Product dimensions are characteristics used to describe product variants; for example, size, color, and style. Product dimensions are grouped and assigned to a product master. When specific values of product dimensions are selected for a product master, a uniquely identifiable product variant is created. You can then buy or sell a specific product variant in the system.

8

You should use product master to represent a cabinet produced with three, five, or seven drawers. A product master is not a specific product. You can use a product master to set the rules to generate specific products. These rules are called product dimensions, and the products generated from a product master are called product variants.

You should use product variant to represent a cabinet with a specified attribute value of five relating to the number of drawers. A product variant is a uniquely identifiable item generated from a product master after specific values of its product dimensions have been selected. In this case, the number of drawers is an example of product dimensions, and the selection of a specific value is an indication that this is a specific product variant.

You should use product to represent a model of cabinet manufactured with four drawers only. A product is an item that can be identified uniquely, without the need for additional information such as size or color. A product does not have any variants given by product dimensions. A cabinet that is manufactured only in one version is an example of a product.

9

A product variant does not represent all possible variations of a plant pot. A product variant represents a specific, tangible, and uniquely identifiable variation of a product master. A product master contains the rules to define all its possible variants based on the product dimensions assigned to it. A product variant is generated when specific values are chosen for the product dimensions. An example of a product master is a plant pot, while an example of product variant is a plastic plant pot with a diameter of 5 inches.

A product variant is not limited to only one product dimension. Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management offers five different product dimensions, such as size or color. Multiple product dimensions can be combined into one product dimension group, which is then assigned to a product master. The product dimension group defines all possible theoretical combinations of product variants for that product master. Therefore, the amount of product dimensions for a product variant is determined by the product dimension group assigned to the product master.

A product variant is a tangible variation of a product master. A product variant represents a specific, tangible, and uniquely identifiable variation of a product master. A product variant is created when specific values are chosen for the product dimensions associated to its product master. For example, choosing plastic as a material and 5 inches as diameter would generate a specific product variant.

10

An item is an example of a product type. The product type is a main classification of the product. Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management offers two product types: items and services. Items are generally used to represent tangible articles that can be stocked in the warehouse, such as electric components or wooden frames. Services are generally used to represent articles that cannot be stocked and are not tangible, such as cleaning or catering.

A product master is an example of a product sub-type. The sub-type is a sub-classification of the product. Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management offers two product types: products and product masters. Products are distinct and uniquely identifiable articles that do not require additional information to be identified. Product masters are not specific products, but rather they include the rules and definitions to create many possible variations, which are called product variants.

A product dimension is not a product type nor a product sub-type. Product dimensions are assigned to product masters via product dimension groups in order to determine how product variants are generated. Product dimensions are characteristics used to identify product variants, not types or sub-types of a product.

11

You should select product definition to identify a product with minimal information that is not tied to a specific legal entity. Product definitions are saved in a central repository in the system and exist independently of a legal entity. Only core information such as product number, type, and name are kept within the product definition. When a product is created in the central repository, it is not automatically released to a legal entity. In order to complete the product setup and allow transactions, a product must be released to a legal entity.

You should select released product to identify a fully configured product that is transacted within a specific legal entity. A released product is made available to a given legal entity. This allows product managers to complete the product setup by adding storage and tracking dimensions, for example. A product must be released to a legal entity before it can be transacted. However, a product can be created from scratch directly from the released products form of a legal entity. In this case, the central product definition is automatically created, as well as the released product record within the selected legal entity.

You should not select product dimension. Product dimensions are characteristics used to describe product variants, like size, color, and style. Product dimensions are grouped and assigned to a product master. Within a product master, you can specify one or more values for a product dimension, such as red, blue, and green for the color dimension. To create a product variant, you need to select specific values for all product dimensions associated to the product master.

12

You should use a trade agreement. Trade agreements are a flexible framework used to specify a set price or discount for one or more customers or vendors, for one or more products or product variants. Trade agreements are activated by creating and posting trade agreement journals. There are two types of trade agreements: sales price agreements and purchase price agreements. In this scenario, you should create a purchase price agreement type, specifying the relationship between a single item and a vendor group.

You should not use a purchase agreement. A purchase agreement is a contract between an organization and a single vendor in which the organization commits to buying a certain value or product quantity for a specific price or discount by using multiple purchase orders over a period of time. A single purchase agreement cannot be used to specify the price of an item for multiple vendors.

You should not use a sales agreement. A sales agreement is a contract between a single customer and an organization in which the customer commits to buying a certain value or product quantity for a specific price or discount over a period of time. Sales agreements cannot be used to specify the purchase price of an item with multiple vendors.

You should not use a service agreement. Service agreements are used in service management to provide support to customers, usually after a sale or as part of a project. They are used to define the type and level of service that is provided to customers, and cannot be used to specify the purchase price of an item with multiple vendors.

13

You should use a line discount trade agreement for a customer who gets a better price for buying a quantity of 10 or more. Line discount trade agreements are used to specify the discounts applied to one or more customers when they purchase a certain amount of a certain item. You can specify particular conditions on a line discount trade agreement, such as a double discount, minimum or maximum quantities, or a time period. Other trade agreement types and sales agreements do not support a discount applied only over a certain quantity.

You should use a sales price trade agreement for a group of customers who are given the same price for an item. Sales price trade agreements are used to specify the price at which one or more items are sold to one or more customers. You can specify particular conditions on a sales price trade agreement, such as minimum or maximum quantities or a time period. Unlike a sales price trade agreement, a sales agreement cannot be used to set a sales price for multiple customers at once, and discount trade agreements are used to set a discount from a base price.

You should use a sales agreement for a customer who commits to buy 1,000 units within the next six months. Sales agreements are contracts between a single customer and an organization, in which the customer commits to buy products at a certain value or a certain quantity of products for a specific price or discount over a certain period of time. Trade agreements, unlike sales agreements, cannot be used to represent a commitment to buy.

You should not use a total discount trade agreement. Total discount trade agreements are used to specify the discount applied to the total value of a sales order. In a total discount trade agreement, you can specify additional details such as a time period, but you cannot link the discount to a single item or a certain quantity.

14

You should use a packing slip to confirm that the goods have left the warehouse. A packing slip can be generated after the picking of a sales order is complete and it is then posted to confirm that the goods have been passed on to the courier. When the packing slip is posted, the system is updated to reflect that the goods have been sold and are no longer in storage. The packing slip is usually printed and given to the courier, in order to confirm the nature of the goods transported.

You should use a picking list to create instructions to retrieve the goods from their shelves. A picking list is a document with basic instructions to identify the products to be picked to fulfill a sales order. If the location of the goods is already specified in the sales order, it also appears on the picking list when it is generated. Otherwise, it must be specified when the picking list is registered. This step tells the system where the goods have been taken from and marks the completion of the picking list.

You should not use a product receipt. A product receipt is used to confirm that the goods have been received at the warehouse for an open purchase order. Product receipts are not used in the sales order fulfilment process.

15

You should perform picking and packing. Picking and packing are part of the sales process. They include the retrieval of the goods from the warehouse and the preparation of the goods for shipping. The picking and packing step is generally carried out by warehouse workers. It is performed after the goods are reserved on a sales order and before the sales order is invoiced to the customer.

You should also perform an inventory reservation. Inventory reservation is the step of the sales process that allocates goods in the warehouse to a specific sales order. This is not a mandatory step, but it is often used to prevent goods from being used elsewhere and it therefore avoids confusion at the time of picking. Once the inventory reservation is complete, the sales order is released to the warehouse for picking and packing.

You should not perform a product receipt. Product receipt is used to confirm that the goods have been received at the warehouse for an open purchase order. Product receipt is not used in the sales process.

You should not perform an inventory adjustment. Inventory adjustment journals are used to manually modify the amount of inventory in the warehouse. An example of this could be a write-off due to accidental damage. This process is not required when a sales order is processed, because the system automatically updates the inventory when the goods are shipped.

16

You should specify the terms of payment when setting up a new vendor account. The creation of a vendor account includes a number of different steps, such as adding contact details and a default address, selecting a vendor group, or adding payment terms. Terms of payment are used to calculate the due date of a vendor invoice.

You should generate a confirmation when creating and processing a purchase order. Processing a purchase order includes many different steps, but in general terms, the process consists of creation, approval (optional), confirmation, receipt, and invoice. The purchase order confirmation reflects the agreement with the vendor to purchase the goods. When a purchase order is confirmed, a journal stores the confirmation details and a copy of the order is usually sent to the vendor.

You should not reserve inventory. Inventory reservation is a step carried out in the sales process that allocates goods in the warehouse to a specific sales order, to prevent accidental double-booking and confusion at the time of picking. Inventory reservation is not involved in the processes of creating a new vendor nor in the processing of a purchase order.

17

You should reserve inventory on an order line as part of the sales process. Inventory reservation allocates goods in the warehouse to a specific sales order. This step prevents goods from being used elsewhere and avoids confusion at the time of picking. Once the inventory reservation is complete, the sales order is released to the warehouse for picking and packing.

You should post the product receipt as part of the purchase process. The product receipt is used to confirm that the goods have been received at the warehouse for an open purchase order. This step is carried out after the vendor has provided the goods and once they have been received by the organization. When the product receipt is posted, the goods appear as received in the system and are available to be used in other processes.

You should generate the picking list as part of the sales process. The picking list is a document with basic information to identify the products to be picked to fulfill a sales order. When a picking list is generated, warehouse workers receive instructions to pick the listed goods from the warehouse. Once all goods have been picked, the picking list is registered. This step tells the system where the goods have been taken from and allows you to progress to sales order shipping.

You should submit the order for approval as part of the purchase process. If change management is enabled in the procurement process, a purchase order must be submitted for approval after it has been created. The purchase order approval step uses the workflow infrastructure to escalate the document through the organization hierarchy for approval, usually according to signing limits. After the purchase order is approval, a purchase order confirmation can be generated and sent to the vendor.

18

You should specify the payment terms. Terms of payments are used to calculate the due date of a vendor invoice. This information is essential to pay the vendor on time and avoid issues with unpaid invoices. Adding terms of payment is part of the initial setup of a vendor account.

You should also add contact information. The contact information section of the vendor form allows you to add contact details such as a phone number or email address. Adding one or more contact details is generally carried out during the initial setup of a vendor account.

You should not set a default purchase price. Default purchase prices are not part of the vendor account form. Instead, a default purchase price can be specified on the released product form for a given item. Alternatively, specific prices under certain conditions can be set with the use of trade or purchase agreements.

You should not submit the vendor request. A vendor request is submitted for the approval to do business with a vendor who is not already on the list of approved vendors for the organization. If the vendor request is approved, a new vendor record is created in the system. However, in this scenario, the verification of the new vendor was already completed by the Finance department.

19

You should add a sales order line. After creating a new sales order, either from the customer form or from the sales order form, only the sales order header is generated. At this point, the customer details are in the sales order but there are no lines with products in it. Therefore, the next step is to add a sales order line and select a product to sell.

You should not generate the sales confirmation. Confirming the sales order is an optional step to create (and usually print) a summary of the sales order content. However, when a new sales order is created from the customer form, only the order header is generated. At that point, no products are present in the order yet.
