You should add at least one sales order line with a product before confirming the sales order.

You should not reserve the inventory. When you create a sales order from the customer form, only a sales order header with the customer details is generated. At that point the sales order contains no order lines, so no products are selected to be sold. You cannot reserve any inventory until a sales order line is created and a product is selected.

You should not create the invoice. Invoicing a sales order is the last step of the sales order process from an operational point of view. The sales invoice is generated after the sales order is shipped. After that, the order usually passes under the care of the accounts receivable team for payment collection.

20

You should recommend process manufacturing. Process manufacturing relies on formulas and is suitable for ingredients that are mixed together, creating a product that cannot easily be reverted.

You should not recommend discrete manufacturing. Discrete manufacturing relies on bills of materials (BOMs) and is suitable for creating products whose raw materials are mechanically assembled together.

You should not recommend lean manufacturing. Lean manufacturing relies on value streams and aims to deliver only what the customer requires, removing non-value added activities.

21

You should recommend a bill of materials (BOM). A BOM is used in discrete manufacturing, when raw materials are assembled together and transformed into a final product.

You should also recommend product masters. A product master represents a non-specific product and includes a set of definitions known as product dimensions; for example, color and size. Product dimensions can be used to generate several product variants from a common product master.

You should not recommend formulas. A formula is used in process manufacturing, when ingredients are mixed together to create a final product that cannot be disassembled into its components.

You should not recommend products. A product is a well-defined item or service that has its own settings. Products are usually independent from each other, which makes it more difficult to create and maintain multiple variants of the same product.

22

The discrete manufacturing type has a production process output of a specific item and is produced in individual production orders.​ Discrete manufacturing is used to produce a great variety of items through an order-based method, creating individual production orders that go through different stages until completion. The output for this manufacturing type is always a specific product and this production type uses a bill of materials (BOM) and a route for operations execution.

The process manufacturing type is used for items that have to be produced in a batch, using a formula, or a recipe. Some examples of process-manufactured items are food, beverages, and pharmaceutical and chemical products. This manufacturing type can have multiple outputs, including co-products and by-products.

The lean manufacturing type is defined through production flows to minimize waste and focus on activities that add value. Lean manufacturing is used to define the manufacturing process by focusing on what adds value and how to reduce waste. It uses activities, production flows, and Kanban rules to model the production process.

23

You should use Master planning. Master planning uses information from many different areas of the system to determine how much of each item you must purchase and by what date you must make a purchase. Master planning uses sales orders and inventory to generate a net requirements plan.

You should not use Product information management. Product information management maintains the product repository that contains all products that an organization buys, stores, distributes, manufactures, and sells.

You should not use Inventory management. Inventory management manages the inbound and outbound operations and all related control aspects, including quality assurance.

You should not use Procurement sourcing. Procurement sourcing identifies a need for a product, locates suppliers, monitors suppliers, and helps with adhering to product standards.

24

You should use discrete manufacturing for a bill of materials (BOM). Discrete manufacturing is the production of distinct items. Discrete manufacturing uses a BOM and production follows a route, such as an assembly line.

You should use process manufacturing for a process using a recipe or formula. Process manufacturing uses a recipe, and the ingredients are blended or refined in batches.

You should not use lean manufacturing. Lean manufacturing is a strategy of continuous improvement focused on removing activities that do not add value. It uses activities, production flows, and Kanban rules.

25

The company should use a dynamic plan. Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management Master planning, sometimes referred to as Materials Requirements Planning (MRP), allows a company to track the raw materials required for production. This information is vital to ensuring that the right amount of materials can be procured to meet current and forecast demand. Supply Chain Management supports two types of master plans: static and dynamic. Static plans are generated every time the master planning process is executed and do not change with new requirements. In contrast, dynamic plans are updated by new requirements and can help an organization gauge point-in-time supply and demand levels. If a large order comes in, the dynamic plan might indicate that additional raw materials need to be procured quickly to meet the increase in demand.

The company should not use a static plan. Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management supports two types of master plans: static and dynamic. Static plans are generated only when the master planning process is executed, so they cannot be used to take into account new requirements without regenerating the whole plan.

The company should not use a succession plan. A succession plan is not a type of master plan and is not related to production control. Instead, a succession plan allows an organization to identify employees with the skills required to replace a key employee. For example, a succession plan might identify a stand-in CIO in the event the current CIO becomes incapacitated.

The company should not use a maintenance plan. A maintenance plan is not a type of master plan and is not related to production control. Instead, maintenance plans facilitate the management and maintenance of an organization’s equipment. Such plans define when an asset is due for preventive maintenance.

26

You should use Configure to order for item variants that are manufactured according to specific customer requests. Configure to order is a manufacturing principle in which items are produced based on the exact requirement of the customer order. This approach is used when the item specifics are not predefined, and the exact variant to be produced is defined only when the order is placed by the customer.

You should use Make to order for items that are manufactured based on actual customer demand. Make to order is a manufacturing principle in which items are produced according to real orders placed by customers. This approach is best suited when the last steps of the production process are very expensive or generate variants of the product.

You should use Make to stock for items that are manufactured based on minimum amounts to keep in the inventory. Make to stock is a manufacturing principle in which items are produced to be stocked and the production quantities are decided on minimum stock levels or forecasts, which are usually based on historical data.

27

You should recommend an engineer-to-order strategy. This is the most suitable manufacturing strategy for any process that begins with an engineering phase in which the item is designed according to specific customer requirements before it is manufactured. When the design is complete, you can create production orders, kanbans, or batch orders according to the item's production process.

You should not recommend a make-to-stock strategy. The make-to-stock principle is used to produce items for stock based on sales forecasts, historical consumption, or to maintain a minimum stock quantity. Typically, this manufacturing strategy is suitable for products with standard features.

You should not recommend a make-to-order strategy. The make-to-order principle is used for standard items that are made to order or finished to order, with the final steps of the production process triggered by other steps in the value chain like transfer orders or sales orders.

You should not recommend a configure-to-order strategy. The configure-to-order principle is best suited for items whose product variant to be produced is defined based on the selected configuration model at the moment of sales order creation.

28

You should recommend Make to order. Make to order is a manufacturing principle in which items are produced according to real orders placed by customers rather than to stock predetermined quantities of finished products. This approach is best suited when the latest steps of the production process are very expensive or generate variants of the product, but the possible product variants are known in advance.

You should not recommend Make to stock. Make to stock is a manufacturing principle in which items are produced to keep a certain amount stocked in the warehouse. Production quantities are usually given by minimum stock levels or forecasts. This approach is preferred for high manufacturing volumes, when the production process does not involve steps to customize the product based on customer requirements.

You should not recommend Configure to order. Configure to order is a manufacturing principle in which items are produced based on the exact specifics of a customer, generating product variants that were undefined prior to the order confirmation. This approach is most suitable when production steps are expensive and highly customized to customer needs.

29

You can use item arrival journals to receive purchased items into inventory. An item arrival journal is used to register an item in the warehouse after an expected delivery takes place.

You cannot use inventory adjustment journals to change the location of an item in the warehouse. An item adjustment journal is used to add or remove an item in the warehouse and automatically post its cost to the predefined ledger account for that item.

You can use inventory counting journals to rectify stock discrepancies. An inventory counting journal is used to count the number of items physically present in the warehouse. If there is a discrepancy between the system quantity and the actual quantity, it can be rectified directly from the journal.

30

You cannot associate a warehouse to multiple sites. A site can contain multiple warehouses, but a warehouse can only belong to one site. You must create a site before you can create a warehouse.

You can configure a warehouse layout using elements such as zones, location types, and location profiles. A warehouse layout can be defined in a very flexible way by using a combination of system functionalities. A zone defines an area of the warehouse used for a common purpose, a location type identifies how a specific location is used, and a location profile specifies the item processing policies for a given location.

You cannot use location stocking limits to define how many items can be stocked on top of each other. A location stocking limit is used to easily set the maximum quantity of an item that can be stored in a given location without the requirement of using the more complex process of volumetric calculations.

31

You should use the inventory on-hand list to determine how many items are available in the warehouse at present. The on-hand list form displays current and updated quantities of all items available in the inventory. These quantities are calculated considering all transactions in the system, whether they already occurred or are expected to occur in the future.

You should not use inventory journals. Inventory journals are used to post different types of inventory transactions, such as item counting or quantity adjustments. Inventory journals may not reflect or take into account the quantities currently available in the warehouse.

You should not use inventory statuses. The inventory status is a dimension used to indicate the availability of an item, classifying it either as available or unavailable. It does not display the physical quantity of an item in the warehouse.

You should not use inventory locations. Inventory locations define physical or logical spaces where items can be stored, but they do not display the quantity stored in each location.

32

The movement journal type allows you to change the general ledger offset account when you create the journal. This journal type is used to post physical inventory movements and is useful when you need to overwrite the default offset ledger account to post the transaction. In each line, you can select the ledger account from the list and then post the journal.

The inventory adjustment journal type does not allow you to change the general ledger offset account when you create the journal. The inventory adjustment journal is used to post physical inventory movements like the movement journal type, but you cannot choose an offset ledger account because it is taken automatically from the setup of the item group posting profile.

The transfer journal type does not allow you to change the general ledger offset account when you create the journal. The transfer journal type is used to transfer items between different inventory dimensions such as warehouses, locations, or batches without any cost implications. When you create a transfer journal, you should specify both the from and to inventory dimensions. When the journal is posted, the movement of the items is reflected immediately.

33

You should use the on-hand list to check the expected inbound inventory across all warehouses. The on-hand list form is used to inspect details of the overall inventory currently held by the company. The form displays data in real time and it is updated automatically every time that inventory transactions are executed. This includes both forecasted and physical transactions. This means that the on-hand list form also shows inventory that is expected to be received from purchase orders as well as inventory that has been allocated to sales orders to be sold.

You should use a movement journal to manually rectify the inventory level in a specific warehouse. To manually change the inventory amount in the warehouse, you can use a movement journal or an inventory adjustment journal. The difference between the two is how the cost connected to the inventory is handled. Specifically, with an inventory adjustment journal the cost is automatically posted to the general ledger offset account associated with the posting profile for the item. With a movement journal you have to manually specify the ledger account, so you can override the default value.

You should use a transfer journal to move inventory between two locations of the same warehouse. Transfer journals are used to instantaneously change one dimension of an item in the inventory. For example, you can use a transfer journal to update the position of some inventory from one location to another within the same warehouse. Transfer orders can also be used for this purpose, but they are more suitable when transit time is involved; for example, moving stock between two geographically distant sites.

34

Country-specific functionalities for a legal entity are enabled according to the selected country/region in the address marked as primary on the legal entity page. When you create a legal entity, it is very important to choose the correct country/region in the primary address, because specific localization features are enabled according to your selection.

The sales tax codes that apply to a purchase transaction are included in both the item sales tax group and the sales tax group assigned to the transaction. Every transaction for which sales tax needs to be calculated must have a sales tax group and an item sales tax group. The applied sales tax codes to the transaction are those that match in both groups.

The company ID cannot be changed after recording transactions for the legal entity. The company ID is alphanumeric and can have a maximum of four characters. It cannot be changed after its creation.

35

A legal entity can represent a company that has a legislated structure and can enter into contracts. A legal entity is a legally recognized organization that is registered with a legal authority, such as the government of a country. When you create a legal entity in Dynamics 365 Finance, you generate a company ID to represent it. This ID is used to identify all system data that belongs to that company.

An operating unit can represent a department that exercises control over some processes of a business. An operating unit is a Dynamics 365 Finance element that is used to represent non-autonomous elements of a company such as business units, cost centers, or departments. Usually a company has multiple operating units whose structure is not legally recognized. Operating units do not operate in complete autonomy and must share the resources owned by the company.

An organization hierarchy can represent a reporting structure to view the company from a tax perspective. An organizational hierarchy is a tool used to represent a business from a certain point of view (for example, tax reporting). Each organization hierarchy must have a purpose that defines how the hierarchy can be used. One or more legal entities can be assigned to a hierarchy.

36

You can use Dynamics 365 Finance to handle tax rules for different regions and countries. Dynamics 365 Finance includes a versatile sales tax framework that allows you to manage different types of direct and indirect taxes, like sales tax and value-added tax (VAT). Taxation types and regulations vary between countries and regions, so functionalities such as sales tax groups and item sales tax groups can be configured to identify the correct sales tax to calculate and apply according to the requirements of each local authority.

You can attach sales tax codes to vendors, customers, and items. Sales tax codes include sales tax groups and item sales tax groups. Sales tax codes are attached to vendors and customers, while item sales tax groups are linked to items. They drive the sales tax calculation based on the setup of the transacted item for a given vendor or customer. Sales tax codes also link the posting to the general ledger for any transaction that is not posted specifically to a vendor or customer.

You can use sales tax reporting codes for country-specific reports. Sales tax reporting codes are linked to specific fields on a sales tax report. Due to the fact that different countries and regions have different requirements for tax reporting, sales tax reporting codes are used to configure the correct layout in any report that shows the sales tax amounts due to the authorities.

37

You should recommend the legal entity organization type. If a new organization that you are creating is subject to local tax requirements that are different from those of the existing legal entity and must report information independently to the tax authorities of the country where it operates, it is necessary to assign the legal entity organization type to the new organization.

You should not recommend operating unit. This organization type is defined for operational control, monitoring of processes and economic resources, and tracking financial performance. Operating units can be of different types, such as departments, business units, cost centers, and commerce channels.

You should not recommend team. This organization type is used to define a group of people that share a common responsibility or goal. For example, you can create safety and emergency preparedness teams that have members from various departments in your company.

38

Dynamics 365 Finance is not an appropriate solution for small businesses. Dynamics 365 Business Central would be the appropriate all-in-one business management application for a small business. Dynamics 365 Finance helps medium and large-sized businesses streamline their processes and operations.

Dynamics 365 Finance helps minimize operational costs related to your mobile production business with financial process automation, budget planning, and three-way matching. Companies can effectively manage their business processes with the help of role-based workspaces that provide intelligent automation, integration with Office apps, and task prioritization. These benefits provide operational costs reduction and help manage and control the budget.

Dynamics 365 Finance will help your accounting department to manage charts of accounts, dimensions, and taxes. These are some of the key functionalities of this solution.

Dynamics 365 Finance does not allow companies to generate marketing campaigns. Generating marketing campaigns is a task for Dynamics 365 Marketing.

39

You should select a journal name. Journal names are an important area of journal setup. They identify a certain type of journal and determine what is allowed for that specific journal; for example, whether the offset account is fixed or whether the posted amounts include tax. In general, journal names are created to reflect different purposes, such as adjustment transactions or intercompany transactions. You must select a journal name when preparing a journal.

You should also specify the transaction date. Every business transaction posted with a journal must have a date associated to it. Without a date, it would be impossible to record the transaction and associate it to an accounting period. When a journal line is created, if no criteria are specified, the system defaults the transaction date to the present day. You can still modify the date before posting the journal.

You should not unlock the journal. Journals are locked when they are in use to prevent accidental changes from other sources. When the system processes journals via a batch job, it locks them for processing and automatically unlocks them after the batch run is completed. The second part might happen if the batch job fails. In this case, you can use a dedicated button to release the journal. However, this step is not part of the process to manually create and post a journal.

A button is available on the journal page to unlock a journal that has a status of "locked by system" set to Yes. This unlock can be performed by an administrator of the system who has analyzed any executing batch jobs and confirmed that this journal is no longer actively being processed by a batch job. This button is enabled by the feature named Journal Unlock button on the Feature management page.

You should not run the period close. The period close is a set of procedures which are performed at the end of an accounting period. These procedures vary between companies but may include settling invoices and payments, posting period end transactions, or performing manual adjustments. Closing an accounting period is likely to involve posting one or more journals, but running the period close is not a step involved in creating and posting a simple general ledger journal.

You should not create a chart of accounts. A chart of account is an organized list of general ledger accounts for a legal entity. Transactions posted in these accounts are then processed to prepare financial reports used by authorities and shareholders. You must have a chart of accounts in place before you can create and post a journal, because any general ledger journal will affect one or more ledger accounts. However, planning and defining a chart of accounts is a prerequisite, not a step involved in creating and posting a general ledger journal.

40

You should link a sales tax group. Sales tax groups are part of the tax framework in Dynamics 365 Finance. The system can handle several types of indirect taxes, which are calculated during purchase and sales transactions. They are then reported and paid regularly to local tax authorities. Sales tax groups are linked to a customer or vendor and include one or more sales tax codes. These sales tax codes are applicable when buying or selling goods and services to the customer or from the vendor. However, the taxes actually applied also depend on the product selected on the transaction.

You should not link an item sales tax group. Item sales tax groups are part of the tax framework in Dynamics 365 Finance. They are linked to a product and include one or more sales tax codes. These sales tax codes are applicable when buying or selling the product. However, the taxes actually applied also depend on the customer or vendor selected on the transaction.

You should not link a sales tax code. Sales tax codes are part of the tax framework and define how taxes are calculated, the value which is used for the calculation, when the payment is made, and more. Sales tax codes are not associated directly to customers, vendors, nor products. Instead, they are grouped into sales tax groups and item sales tax groups before they are assigned. If the same sales tax code on a transaction is linked to both the product and the customer or vendor, then that tax is applied.

You should not link a legal entity. In Dynamics 365 Finance, a legal entity is an organization with a legal structure registered with a national authority. Legal entities enter contracts and prepare statements to report on their performance to local and national authorities. You must have a legal entity in place before you can create a customer record.

41

You should use a journal to create and post a business transaction in a general ledger account. In Dynamics 365 Finance, journals are mostly used to record transactions in ledger accounts. These transactions are then processed and consolidated to create financial statements, which are used by an organization to report on their performance. Different journal types are used depending on the nature of the business transaction to be recorded. For example, you could use a customer payment journal to settle account receivables or a project expense journal to record expense transactions on a project.

You should use a sales tax group to configure the basis for reporting what is due to local authorities. Sales tax groups, sales tax codes, and item sales tax groups are used to define when tax is applicable for transactions involving certain products, customers, and vendors. In particular, sales tax groups contain one or more tax codes and are attached to customers or vendors. At regular intervals, the sales tax due must be calculated, reported, and paid to local tax authorities.

You should use a legal entity to represent in the system an organization registered with a national authority. In Dynamics 365 Finance, a legal entity is an organization with a legal structure registered with a national authority. Legal entities can enter contracts and must prepare statements to report on their performance to local and national authorities. Creating a legal entity is one of the first steps in system configuration. The country and region selected for the legal entity in the system have an effect on the features available for later configuration.

42

The values for entity-backed financial dimensions are not entered and maintained by users. For entity-backed financial dimensions, the values are taken from existing records in the system like, for example, customers, vendors, projects, or items. In this case, financial dimension values are created from an entity selected in the Use values from field. Financial dimensions are used for analytics and reporting purposes, and they allow you to have more detailed information for financial transactions without the creation of a detailed chart of accounts. Department, cost center, and business units are examples of financial dimensions.

You can translate the main account description into different languages. Dynamics 365 Finance allows you to create a translated text for the specific main account in various languages using the Main account translation page.

When a report is generated, the transactions will be displayed according to the order of the financial dimensions in the selected financial dimension set. The order of financial dimensions in a financial dimension set defines how transactions are sorted and fields are printed on reports.

43

You should configure the chart of accounts. The chart of accounts is a list of a company's general ledger accounts. The list of accounts and its structure are used to prepare financial reports.

You should also configure financial dimensions. Financial dimensions are used as segments for charts of accounts. Dimensions can be added to reports to provide additional detail or to filter the reports.

You should not configure tax codes. A tax code stores the tax rates and calculation rules for a sales tax.

You should not configure currencies. Currencies are not included in the chart of accounts.

44

A financial dimension is a segment that allows tracking of a transaction when it is posted to a ledger account. Multiple financial dimensions can be assigned to a transaction, and they can be retrieved after the transaction has been posted. This feature makes financial dimensions an essential element for reporting purposes. Examples of financial dimensions include departments and cost centers, but Dynamics 365 Finance allows you to create custom financial dimensions depending on the reporting requirements of each company.

The chart of accounts is a structured list of a company's general ledger accounts. It provides an organized structure to separate all transactions incurred by a company into categories. A company can only have one general ledger, which is then connected to a chart of accounts. However, multiple ledgers from different companies can be associated to the same chart of accounts, which simplifies the process of consolidation.

Financial reporting is a tool to create and manage financial statements. Financial reporting is a powerful tool of Dynamics 365 that allows you to design and run fully personalized financial reports. Financial reporting natively handles financial dimensions, so reports can be created directly on the segmentation chosen by the company to track and report transactions.

45

Custom dimensions are a type of financial dimension. Custom financial dimensions and their values are freely defined by a user and they can be shared by different legal entities. Custom financial dimensions are relevant for a company that wants to track transactions based on specific entities that are not natively available in the system.

Entity-backed dimensions are also a type of financial dimension. Entity-backed dimensions rely on existing system entities and their values. Examples of system entities include customers or projects, and their values are defined by any customers or projects a user has created. Entity-backed financial dimensions may be shared across legal entities as long as the system entity supports this option.

Tracking dimensions are not a type of financial dimension. Tracking dimensions are configured within a tracking dimension group, which is then assigned to a product. Tracking dimensions are used to define how a product is traced when it is transacted within the system. Example of tracking dimensions include batch number and serial number.

Storage dimensions are not a type of financial dimension. Storage dimensions are configured within a storage dimension group, which is then assigned to a product. Storage dimensions are used to define how a product is stored when it is moved from one place to another. Example of storage dimensions include site and warehouse.

46

You should define the balance sheet as a consolidated statement of all transactions posted within a period. The balance sheet is one of the financial statements that a company must prepare at the end of each accounting period. It shows a consolidated list of all assets and liabilities of the company at a specific point in time, based on the transactions posted in the previous accounting period. The balance sheet displays these details in an organized table format, with assets and liabilities grouped by categories and sub-categories. In Dynamics 365 Finance, you can produce a balance sheet with the financial reporting functionality.

You should define the income statement as a report of the company's profits and losses over a period of time. The income statement is one of the financial statements that a company must prepare at the end of each accounting period. It shows details of the company's revenue and expenses during the previous accounting period. The income statement has the format of a list, with revenue at the top, expenses and costs in the middle, and profit or loss at the bottom. In Dynamics 365 Finance, you can produce an income statement with the financial reporting functionality.

You should define the main account as a key element where transactions are posted based on their type. Main accounts are used to record financial transactions in the general ledger related to assets, liabilities, revenues, expenses, and equity of a company as it runs its operations. Usually, main accounts represent important and broad categories, such as machinery and cash for assets or employee salary for liabilities. However, a company may have dozens or hundred of accounts depending on their size and reporting requirements. The full list of accounts constitutes the chart of accounts.

You should not use financial dimensions for any of these elements. Financial dimensions are segments of the accounting structure of a company. They are associated to transactions to facilitate reporting, since they allow you to separate transactions posted in the same main account when you run financial reports.

47

You should describe financial dimensions as segments associated to transactions for reporting purposes. Financial dimensions are segments of the accounting structure of a company. They are associated to transactions to facilitate reporting, since they allow you to separate transactions posted in the same main account when you run financial reports. Dynamics 365 Finance offers two types of financial dimensions: custom and entity-backed, the suitability of which depends on whether the values are created by users or are based on existing system entities, such as customers.

You should describe the chart of accounts as an organized list of accounts in which transactions are posted. The chart of accounts is a list of all general ledger accounts used by a company. They range from a few dozens to several hundreds, depending on a company's size and specific needs. Transactions are posted in general ledger accounts, and are then processed to prepare financial reports used by authorities and shareholders.

You should describe the period close as a set of procedures performed when the month is concluded. The period close is a specific sequence of procedures performed at the end of an accounting period. These procedures vary between companies, but may include settling invoices and payments, posting period-end transactions, or performing manual adjustments. Period close functionalities are a standard part of Dynamics 365 Finance.

You should not select the balance sheet for any of the above definitions. The balance sheet is one of the financial statements that a company must prepare at the end of each accounting period. It shows a consolidated list of all assets and liabilities of the company at a specific point in time, based on the transactions posted in the previous accounting period. The balance sheet displays these details in an organized table format, with assets and liabilities grouped by categories and sub-categories. In Dynamics 365 Finance, you can produce a balance sheet with the financial reporting functionality.

48

Financial dimensions can be grouped in financial dimension sets. A financial dimension set contains financial dimensions or financial dimension combinations. The order of financial dimensions in a set determines how transactions are sorted and how fields are printed when financial reports are generated.

Financial dimensions do not define the accounts in which transactions are posted. Posting profiles are the Dynamics 365 Finance functionality that controls how transactions are posted in general ledger accounts. In contrast, financial dimensions are segments of a company's accounting structure and these are associated to transactions to facilitate reporting.

Financial dimensions are used mainly for reporting purposes. Financial dimensions are segments which are associated to transactions in order to facilitate reporting. You can use these to separate transactions posted in the same main account when you run financial reports, for example to understand how much revenue was generated by a business unit. Dynamics 365 Finance offers two types of financial dimensions: custom and entity-backed, depending on whether the values are created by users or are based on existing system entities, such as customers.

49

You should modify the financial dimension sets. A financial dimension set contains financial dimensions or financial dimension combinations. The order of financial dimensions in a set determines how transactions are sorted and fields are printed when financial reports are generated. Modifying the structure of a financial dimension set has an impact on how data is displayed in any financial report that uses it.

You should not create a new financial dimension. Financial dimensions are segments associated to transactions in order to facilitate reporting. They allow you to separate transactions posted in the same main account when you run financial reports. However, they do not determine the structure of the report itself.

You should not clear the user's usage data. Usage data includes cached data about a user's interaction with the system, particularly with forms. Personalization applied by a user, such as resizing or hiding a field, is saved in the usage data. Clearing the usage data can be helpful to restore forms when they are not displaying correctly. However, it will have no effect on the structure of a financial report.

You should not generate the report again. Running the report a second time will not cause the structure of the report to change. Data in the report may be different if new transactions were posted between the two report runs, but new data will not affect the structure of the report.

50

Multiple customers can share a single credit limit if they are assigned to the same customer credit group. If you have multiple customers that share a single credit limit, you can create a customer credit group and assign all of them to that group. You should enter the credit limit, currency, and expiration date to be used for the system to control the credit limit for any member of the group.

You do not select the related sales order number to create and post a free text invoice. A free text invoice is not related to a sales order, so you cannot select a sales order for free text invoice creation and posting. You cannot select an item number either. To create the free text invoice lines, you should enter a sales amount, ledger accounts, and free text descriptions.

All collections information for a customer is shown on a single page and the collections agent can take action directly from this page. You can use the collections page to view the transactions, collections information, activities, and cases for a specific customer in a consolidated way and perform common actions using this form, such as creating new collections cases, scheduling a follow-up call, sending an email to the customer, or creating collections letters.

51

When three-way matching is enabled, the purchase requisition, purchase order, and supplier invoice lines do not need to match to ensure that the vendor can be paid. Three-way matching requires that purchase order, product receipt, and supplier invoice lines match to allow a payment to the vendor. The purchase requisition is not taken into account in three-way matching. Optionally, you can configure a tolerance for three-way matching, establishing the maximum difference allowed between the values ​​of the purchase order, the product receipt, and the supplier invoice. The tolerance can be specified as an amount ​​or a percentage.

When using a payment proposal, it is possible to filter and select all overdue invoices in one go. Payment proposals allow you to quickly select vendor invoices for payment using filters to combine different criteria such as due date, cash discounts, currency, and specific vendors.

You can use the prepayment invoice method to track the corresponding purchase order for an advance payment. There are two methods to post prepayments. The first is by using a payment journal and marking the journal entries as a prepayment. In this case, you cannot associate the advanced payment to a purchase order. The second is by creating a prepayment invoice from the specific purchase order. This method creates a link between the prepayment and the purchase order.

52

You should use the Accounts receivable module for mapping a customer payment to an invoice. When a customer payment is received, the Accounts receivable module maps it to the correct sales invoice.

You should use the Accounts payable module to pay vendor invoices. The Accounts payable module matches purchase orders to the vendor invoice to see if the invoice is qualified to be paid.

You should use the Accounts payable module to register a vendor invoice. The Accounts payable module allows to you to record on the system vendor invoices when they are received.

You should not use the Budgeting module. Budgeting is the process of planning and forecasting for resources and money.

53

In order to offer a tiered discount for all customers who pay invoices within 30 days, you should recommend your client to use the Accounts payable or Accounts receivable module to define terms of payment. Once this is complete, your client can use the Payments setup to define cash discounts. In addition to specifying a standard discount, tiered discounts can also be defined. For example, your client could define a 15% discount for customers who pay within 14 days, and a 10% discount for customers who pay within 30 days.

You should not recommend your client to define an e-commerce site. E-Commerce sites are a feature offered by Dynamics 365 Commerce. You can use the Dynamics 365 Commerce site builder module to define an online store and build an e-commerce site.

You should not recommend your client to define a Power BI script that flags invoices paid within 30 days. Power BI is a business intelligence platform designed to provide insights into and visualizations of an organization’s data.

You should not recommend your client to define a customer journey. Customer journeys are part of Dynamics 365 Marketing and are designed to allow you to visualize a customer’s journey from the time they discover and evaluate a product to making a purchase. By using customer journeys, your client can implement high-touch, highly customized marketing processes.

54

You can perform three-way matching on an invoice in the accounts payable module. Three-way matching is a process that compares the price and quantity information contained in the purchase invoice with the purchase order and the product receipt. If everything is in order or is within the acceptable tolerance, the invoice is paid. This process is part of the accounts payable module, which is related to purchasing and vendors.

You can raise a free text invoice for a one-off service in the accounts receivable module. Free text invoices are a type of invoice that can be raised without the need of creating a sales order first. Free text invoices are used when selling goods or services that have not been formally defined as products in the system. In fact, the content of a free text invoice can be freely defined by the user. This process is part of the accounts receivable module, which is related to selling and customers.

55

You can create a purchase order without creating a purchase requisition first. A purchase order can be created from scratch, without the need to be linked to a purchase requisition. A purchase requisition is a document that is used internally in the company, for the sole purpose of authorizing a purchase before raising the actual order with the vendor. A typical scenario for using a purchase requisition is a back office clerk requesting the purchase of a new printer and their line manager authorizing it. The actual sourcing and purchase is then carried out by the procurement department, who raises the purchase order.

You cannot add multiple vendors to the same purchase order. A purchase order is a direct agreement with a single vendor to purchase precise goods or services. Purchases from two different vendors require two separate purchase orders in the system.

You can perform two-way matching and three-way matching on different purchase order lines. Two-way and three-way matching refer to the processes of comparing the content of a purchase order and product receipt to their purchase invoice before authorizing the payment of the invoice itself. Matching can be set up at a legal entity, vendor, purchase order, or item level, but it is also possible to override these settings depending on the situation. For example, a given vendor may be configured to always require two-way matching, but a certain item sold by the vendor may instead require three-way matching. This would result in a purchase order with two lines that have different matching requirements.

56

You cannot use pro forma invoices to post revenues to the ledger. A pro forma invoice is a document that is prepared as an estimate or test run of actual invoice amounts of a sales order or free-text invoice. The posting option on a pro forma invoice is disabled and cannot be changed, so no ledger posting happens when a pro forma invoice is generated.

You can implement different payment methods to receive payments. Dynamics 365 Finance offers the ability to implement different payment types, such as cash or electronic payments. Each method of payment can be configured independently of each other to support different scenarios. For example, a certain payment method can be displayed on the customer invoice and temporarily posted in a bridging ledger account.

You can split the amount of a free-text invoice line to different accounts via the accounting distributions functionality. The accounting distributions functionality allows you to distribute the monetary amounts of a source document to specific ledger accounts. A default distribution is generated for a source document, but it can be modified as required. The accounting distributions functionality is system-wide, so source documents include free-text invoices as well as purchase orders or expense reports.

57

You should use settlement. Settlement is a process that allows you to match transactions from different documents to change the balance of each document. For example, a customer payment can be used to settle the outstanding payable amount on a sales invoice. The settlement process can be carried out across different legal entities. Depending on the outcome of the process and the updated balances, new transactions may also be generated in the system as a result.

You should not use bank account reconciliation. Bank account reconciliation is a process used to ensure that the transactions in a legal entity as generated in the system reflect the transactions on the bank account statement as generated by the bank. This process is generally started from the data contained in a bank account statement, but additional work may be required on the transactions to match a payment to an invoice.

You should not use a letter of guarantee. A letter of guarantee is a document in which a guarantor (usually a bank) commits to pay any outstanding balance in case the principal (usually a bank customer) defaults on the payment. Letters of guarantee are related to credit and the ability to fulfil debt, but they cannot be used to match a payment to an invoice.

58

Per diems are predefined amounts to cover incidental expenses. A per diem is a predefined allowance that is paid to an employee who is expected to incur work expenses (for example, when traveling to see a customer). Per diem rates can be configured according to the time of year, the travel location, or a combination of both.

Policies help to ensure that money is expended as intended and within budget. Expense policies provide an instrument to manage expenses effectively. Policies are date-effective and can be configured to provide a warning, an error, or a request for justification when an employee logs an expense.

Expense categories allow you to organize expenses depending on their types. Expense categories are logical groups used to define different expense types and are derived from shared categories, which are general categories that can also be used in the company for other purposes. Expense categories can be created for macro areas such as flights or accommodation. An expense category must be selected by an employee when logging an incurred expense.

59

Books are part of the fixed asset module. A book is used to track the independent financial lifecycle of an asset. Each book is associated to a depreciation profile, which allows you to monitor the value of a fixed asset across time. Books can be also set up to post depreciation transactions to the general ledger.

Depreciation profiles are also part of the fixed asset module. Depreciation profiles are used to allocate the depreciable value of a fixed asset across multiple fiscal periods. Details of a depreciation profile include the method of depreciation, the depreciation period, and the frequency of depreciation. A simple example of a depreciation period is a reduction of value in the balance of 10% per year.

Current assets are not part of the fixed asset module. Assets owned by a company can be current or fixed. This classification is based on the purpose of the asset and on whether the depletion of the asset is expected to occur within the next business cycle. For example, machinery can be classed as a fixed asset, while cash at hand can be classed as a current asset. By definition, current assets are not found in the fixed asset module.

Main accounts are not part of the fixed asset module. Main accounts are primary accounts in the chart of accounts and are used to record transactions. Main accounts are created in the general ledger module.

60

You can generate budget plans from demand forecasts. Budget plans contain the budget data for a budget cycle. Budget planning is integrated with several other modules, and budget plans can be generated from different entities such as demand forecasts or project forecasts. Based on the starting entity, several parameters can be configured when generating a budget plan (for example, using a factor to increase all the amounts of the source document).

You can use budget control to allow a user group to exceed budget limits. Budget control ensures that enough budget funds are available for planned or actual purchases. Several factors can be taken into account for budget control, such as considering the time frame or evaluating each line of a source document. It is possible to allow some users to skip the budget control checks by assigning these users to a user group and configuring a budget override for the user group.

You cannot create a budget that is shared by multiple legal entities. Budgets can be shared across elements of the same legal entity such as operating units, and multiple budgets can be created within the same legal entity for different purposes. However, you cannot create a shared budget that is used across legal entities.

61

You should recommend budget control to support the financial resources management of the company and ensure that enough budget amounts are available for actual and planned purchases and expenses. Budget control includes advanced features such as setting a budget threshold percentage that prevents posting or that generates a warning when budget level usage has been reached for the selected main account and configuring which documents and financial dimensions will be considered for budget control.

You should recommend budget planning to configure and manage the budget planning process. Budget planning allows defining the important aspects of the budget planning process such as procedures and requirements, planning stages, budget planning workflows, and the definition of multiple budget plans that can be used to create budget amounts for different business units (BUs) or departments.

You should not recommend basic budgeting. When you use the budgeting functionality at this level in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance, budget tracking is done in a basic way that does not allow setting a budget threshold to generate a warning or an error message for budget entry if this percentage of the budget have been consumed for the selected main account.

62

You should use the Procurement and sourcing module of Dynamics 365 Finance to post fixed asset acquisition transactions. If you select the fixed asset number in the purchase order line and then post the corresponding vendor invoice, a fixed asset acquisition transaction is posted at the same time. Additionally, you can enable the New fixed asset? option on the purchase order line so that the fixed asset is created automatically when the product receipt or the vendor invoice is posted.

You can also post fixed asset acquisition transactions in the Accounts payable module. You can post fixed asset acquisition transactions in the Accounts Payable module from a purchase order, using the same procedure as for the Procurement and sourcing module. The Accounts payable module also allows you to post the acquisition of fixed assets through an invoice journal by selecting the fixed asset and the fixed asset transaction type before posting.

You cannot post fixed asset acquisition transactions in the Accounts receivable module. Fixed asset acquisition transactions are not available to be posted in this module.

You should not use the Cost accounting module. This module is used to track, allocate, classify, and analyze the cost data of current operations that can be collected from multiple sources such as budgets and general ledgers to make better and informed decisions to improve the company's financial management.

63

You should demonstrate how to settle transactions. Transaction settlement is one of the processes that you can carry out in the cash and bank management module of Dynamics 365 Finance. During settlement, transactions are matched to each other to bring the balance of the documents to which they refer to zero. An example of this process is matching a payment to an invoice.

You should demonstrate how to manage letters of guarantee. Managing letters of guarantee is another of the processes that you can carry out in the cash and bank management module of Dynamics 365 Finance. A letter of guarantee is a commitment by a bank to pay a certain amount of money if a bank customer defaults on their obligations. They are often used with expensive purchases, to ensure further guarantees against the risk of a customer defaulting on a large payment.

You should not demonstrate how to create expense policies. Expense policies are not part of the cash and bank management module. Expense policies are used to ensure that employees follow the correct guidelines when they incur expenses on behalf of the organization and submit a report for a refund. For example, an expense policy could determine the maximum expense for a certain category. Expense policies are configured in the expense management module.

You should not demonstrate how to generate a trial balance. The trial balance report shows all balances of an account or a dimension for a given period of time. The trial balance is a financial report and it is generated in the financial reporting section of Dynamics 365 Finance. It is not part of the cash and bank management module.

64

You should use the cash and bank management module to settle an invoice against a payment. Transactions settlement is one of the processes that you can carry out in the cash and bank management module of Dynamics 365 Finance. During settlement, transactions are matched to each other to bring the balance of the documents to which they refer to zero. An example of this process is matching a payment to an invoice.

You should use the expense management module to set the per diem for the next quarter. Per diem allowances are used by organizations to give employees a flat amount each day to cover travel expenses, such as meals and accommodation. Per diem configuration is one of the processes that you can carry out in the expense management module of Dynamics 365 Finance.

You should use the fixed assets module to create a new depreciation method. Depreciation methods are a functionality of the fixed assets module of Dynamics 365 Finance. Depreciation is a way to account for the consumption of a fixed asset over its useful life; for example, a piece of machinery expected to operate for 10 years. Various methods can be used for depreciation, often depending on local legislations.

65

You should use budget planning to determine how proposed budgets are reviewed and approved. Budget planning defines how budget plans are created, updated, reviewed, and approved in an organization. Once a budget plan is approved, its funds can be consumed by creating transactions. The budget planning process depends on the budget cycle, which usually reflects the fiscal calendar of an organization.

You should use budget control to determine how available budget funds are evaluated and managed. Budget control allows an organization to measure and manage its financial resources during the fiscal year. Budget control uses tools such as thresholds and workflows to ensure funds are consumed in a responsible way. For example, you can prevent a transaction from being posted if it exceeds the budget, while still allowing certain employees to go over budget.

You should not use project budgeting for any of the processes. Project budgets are only relevant for projects in the projects management and accounting module. They are used for project forecasts, which include details about the hours, expenses, fees, and items to be consumed on a project.

66

CPOS cannot use cash drawers and receipt printers. CPOS runs in a browser and cannot directly access peripheral hardware or work in an offline state. Only MPOS for Windows directly supports peripheral devices.

MPOS is available on Apple iPad tablets. MPOS supports Windows, Android and iOS.

MPOS and CPOS can be used side-by-side in a given store. Any combination of POS software is permitted and can run concurrently. A store may use MPOS on computers that run Windows for its main registers and supplement those registers with browser-based terminals or mobile devices running MPOS and CPOS.

67

The company should use product assortments. Product assortments are used to specify the products available in a given channel over a certain period of time. To do so, products (such as clothes) and channels (such as a retail store) are assigned to an assortment, but a more advanced configuration is possible by using elements such as product categories and organization hierarchies. Product assortments also offer additional settings such as blocking a single product or configuring a date range for validity.

The company should not use loyalty programs. Loyalty programs have the purpose of incentivizing specific behavior from customers by rewarding them for every interaction with the brand. An example of a loyalty program is providing points for every article purchased in-store. Loyalty programs may allow qualified customers to access particular offers or options, but they are not related to defining what products are offered in a given channel over a period of time.

The company should not use distributed order management. Distributed order management (DOM) helps to improve order fulfilment when orders are placed on different systems and across multiple processes. Optimization is achieved by providing a global view of the inventory of the whole organization, regardless of the channel. DOM is not related to configuring what products are available in a given channel over a period of time.

68

Dynamics 365 Commerce supports the following three types of sales channels:

Retail – These are traditional brick-and-mortar stores.Call center – A call center can support phone-in ordering and/or customer service operations.Online – These are online sales portals or e-commerce sites.
Dynamics 365 Commerce does not support B2B, wholesale, or offline sales channels. If you needed to support a B2B or wholesale customer, you could do this through one of the three supported channels. Offline sales are often synonymous with traditional brick-and-mortar or retail sales operations.

Dynamics 365 Commerce is designed for organizations that operate either exclusively online or as a combination of online and offline businesses. Commerce presents online, traditional brick-and-mortar, and back-office features in a single, combined solution including inventory management, merchandising, e-Commerce, and customer management.

69

Cloud POS (CPOS) is a POS accessible via browser, with no offline mode. CPOS is one of the two POS deployments supported by Dynamics 365 Commerce. CPOS is cloud-based, so it is run on a remote server and does not require any installation on a local device. The local device must only connect to the internet and reach the URL with a browser, so you can use the web application to register the sales transaction. This also means that CPOS cannot work in offline mode, because there is no application on the device.

POS register is a generic device that can run sales transactions. A POS register is a generic electronic machine capable of accepting and processing sales in a store. This device can be very different in each store, from the large fixed supermarket scanners to the palm-size Bluetooth device of a coffee van. When you configure a point of sale in Dynamics 365 Commerce, you specify the POS register details as well as the device configuration, which allows you to select between modern POS (MPOS) and CPOS. These are the two POS deployments supported by Dynamics 365 Commerce.

Modern POS (MPOS) is not defined above. MPOS is one of the two POS deployments supported by Dynamics 365 Commerce. MPOS is a deployment installed on a local device that runs on a dedicated operating system. MPOS is connected to Dynamics 365 Commerce but works via its own application, which allows it to support offline mode. Therefore, if the connection is lost, the sales transaction can still be processed and it will be synchronized with Dynamics 365 Commerce once the connection is restored.

70

You should recommend the online channel for business customers who check the availability of devices by themselves and buy them remotely. Online stores are one of the three channel types supported by Dynamics 365 Commerce. The online channel allows customers to purchase from a digital storefront. This means that an e-commerce site must be created associated with the online store. Dynamics 365 Commerce has its dedicated Site Builder tool, but it also supports third-party e-commerce solutions.

You should recommend the store channel for retail customers who visit a showroom and try the devices before buying them on-site. Brick-and-mortar stores are also one of the three channel types supported by Dynamics 365 Commerce. This is the traditional experience of a customer visiting a physical site and completing the sales transaction there. Physical stores have additional needs such as maintaining local inventory and performing additional customer services. This requirement is supported by the Store Commerce application of Dynamics 365 Commerce.

You should recommend the call center channel for salespeople who contact eligible customers to offer product upgrades at regular intervals. Call centers are the last of the three channel types supported by Dynamics 365 Commerce. With this channel, salespeople can interact with customers remotely; for example, contacting them over the phone. Dynamics 365 Commerce caters for the specific needs of a call center, such as allowing a sales person to quickly access all relevant information like the customer purchase history and available discounts.

71

You should recommend distributed order management (DOM). DOM is an intelligent feature of Dynamics 365 Commerce that sources orders to the fulfilment centers that are most suitable for dealing with inventory needs. This is possible because DOM has visibility of the inventory across all channels, which means that all order sources are taken into account. DOM is able to optimize order fulfillment across a complex network of systems and processes.

You should not recommend modern point of sale (MPOS). MPOS is a POS deployment which is supported by Dynamics 365 Commerce. MPOS allows you to process sales transactions via an application installed on a compatible device. POS functionalities are focused on processing a sales transaction, but they do not offer any help in optimizing the order fulfilment.

You should not recommend product assortments. Product assortments is a Dynamics 365 Commerce functionality which is used to define the products that are available to sell via a given sales channel in a given period of time. They are not involved in the fulfilment of the orders and do not offer any optimization of the fulfilment side of the process.

You should not recommend planned cross-docking. Planned cross-docking is not a Dynamics 365 Commerce functionality. Instead, it is an advanced warehouse functionality of Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management which is used to move inventory directly from the receipt point to the shipping point, removing the need for separate put-away and picking operations. Planned cross-docking only takes into account warehouse operations and it is not related to sales channels or the fulfilment of a sales order.

72

You should use customer loyalty to reward customers for their interactions with your brand. Loyalty programs can help to increase customer loyalty by rewarding customers. Loyalty programs have earning rules, tiers, and reward incentives.

You should use clienteling to capture a customer's likes and dislikes, preferences, and important dates. The client book includes customer cards that show contact information and properties defined by the retailer such as preferences and birthdates.

You should use merchandizing to add products for sale in stores. Merchandizing involves creating products, configuring the product properties and attributes, assigning the product to retail category hierarchies, and making the products available to your channels.

73

The following two loyalty tasks are prerequisites for creating your customer loyalty program in Dynamics 365 Commerce:

Set up discounts – Loyal customers will be eligible for these discounts.Set up loyalty payment methods – This might be a customer card or code a customer uses when redeeming a loyalty reward.

The following loyalty tasks are not prerequisites for creating your customer loyalty program in Dynamics 365 Commerce:

Set up reward points – These can be points a customer redeems or uses to advance to a higher loyalty tier.Set up loyalty tiers – You can define optional loyalty tiers, each with unique benefits.Set up loyalty cards – Loyalty cards identify the customer as part of your loyalty program.

Dynamics 365 Commerce is designed for organizations that operate either exclusively online or as a combination of online and offline businesses. Commerce presents online, traditional brick-and-mortar, and back-office features in a single, combined solution including inventory management, merchandising, e-Commerce, and customer management.

74

You should use loyalty cards to enable a customer to participate in a loyalty program. A loyalty card can be assigned to a specific customer, and loyalty programs can be assigned to a card. The customer can use the loyalty card to collect points and climb tiers within the program. With a loyalty card, you can see a summary of all accumulated points and the transactions connected to the holder.

You should use loyalty rules to define how a customer can earn points in a loyalty program. Loyalty rules define the directives and conditions for a customer to earn points and redeem rewards in a loyalty program. They are also required in order to define which conditions a customer must satisfy in order to move between tiers of a loyalty program.

You should not use loyalty tiers. Loyalty tiers are used to define levels in a loyalty program. Discounts and rewards can be set up for a loyalty program as well as for specific tiers of the loyalty program. This offers an incentive for customers to actively participate in the program. However, loyalty tiers on their own do not allow customers to join a loyalty program nor do they specify how the customer can earn points.

75

You should configure tiers. Loyalty tiers are used to define levels in a loyalty program. Special discounts and rewards can be assigned to a tier as well as to the loyalty program itself. Loyalty rules are used to define which conditions a customer must satisfy in order to move between tiers of a loyalty program.

You should also configure date intervals. Date intervals define how long a tier can last for a customer or how much time a customer has in order to qualify for a tier. For example, a customer must spend 2,000 USD in three months in order to qualify for the Silver tier. Date intervals can be assigned to both loyalty tiers and loyalty tier rules.

You should not configure channels. Sales channels represent different ways of selling to customers; for example, in store or online. Each channel can have a dedicated configuration, such as the product offered and the employees involved. Sales channels are connected to loyalty schemes, not to loyalty programs directly.

You should not configure assortments. Product assortments define which products can be sold via a given sales channel over a given period of time. For example, Christmas toys may only be available in stores between November and December. Product assortments are not related to loyalty programs.

76

You should explain the algorithmic product recommendation. Dynamics 365 Commerce offers several product collection modules, which help retailers to engage with customers as they shop on an e-commerce website. Algorithmic is one of the two automated product recommendation types and it includes categories such as new items, best-selling, and trending products. The product recommendations service extracts data from the database and analyzes it to dynamically build recommendations for customers. This does not add to the marketing team's workload because they do not need to create the recommendations manually.

You should also explain the machine learning product recommendation. Dynamics 365 Commerce offers several product collection modules, which help retailers to engage with customers as they shop on an e-commerce website. Artificial intelligence machine learning (AI-ML) is the second of the two automated product recommendations types and it includes categories such as People also like and Frequently bought together. The product recommendations service extracts data from the database and analyzes it to dynamically build recommendations for customers. This does not add to the marketing team's workload because they do not need to create the recommendations manually.

You should not explain the editorial product recommendation. Dynamics 365 Commerce offers several product collection modules, both manual and automated. Editorial is one of the two manual product recommendations types and it includes categories such as Curated product lists and Related products. Both lists must be created and maintained manually by someone in the system, such as the marketing team. They are also static lists, which do not change dynamically based on new data or the customer profile. For these reasons, the editorial list does not match the requirements of the company.

You should not explain historical data. Historical data is not a type of product recommendation. Transactions and records from previous time periods that are not subject to change or processing anymore constitute historical data in a system. Historical data is useful to increase the accuracy of a model, usually by predicting future values based on a wide enough set of previous values. For example, Dynamics 365 Fraud Protection can use historical data to spot anomalies with more precision.

77

You should recommend Commerce analytics. Commerce analytics is a Dynamics 365 Commerce feature that consumes transactional data from multiple sources, transforms it, and aggregates it in the form of Azure Data Lake entities. These entities can then be retrieved and displayed as Power BI visuals to help a company monitor and analyze its performance.

You should not recommend Fraud Protection. Dynamics 365 Fraud Protection is a solution that protects merchants from costs and losses related to fraudulent activities. Fraud Protection analyzes historical data with the help of AI to identify patterns and spot fraudulent transactions. Fraud Protection cannot be used to monitor sales performance.

You should not recommend data management. Data management is a framework which is shared by multiple Dynamics applications and it is used to import and export data entities. Data management is especially useful when completing data migration from legacy systems or for bulk data manipulation. However, the data management framework does not offer any analytics on its own.

You should not recommend One Version. One Version is a Lifecycle Services (LCS) feature that facilitates product upgrades. Customers who use One Version can configure the cadence of their product upgrades to leverage the capabilities of the cloud, such as allowing continuous improvements with reduced operational impact. One Version is not related to analyzing sales performance.

78

You can create rules to define which employees are eligible for benefits. The Dynamics 365 Human Resources benefits management feature helps you to ensure the right benefits are assigned to the right employees through the configuration of eligibility rules.

A goal does not need to be assigned to a single review period. A goal can span multiple review periods and can be assigned to multiple performance reviews. Dynamics 365 Human Resources allows the creation of any number of goals that can be simple or complex. They must include a short name and description, a start date, and an estimated completion date.

The review type defines whether or not a workflow will be used for a review when you create it. When you create a review, selecting a review type is mandatory and helps define its behavior, including whether a workflow will be used for the review, and if the employee, the manager, or both will be required to sign off on the review.

79

To ensure that only members of your sales team receive reimbursement for mobile phone expenses, you should define a benefit eligibility policy. As the name indicates, benefit eligibility policies allow you to define requirements that must be met before an employee is considered eligible for a benefit. These requirements are embodied in policy rules. In this example, you could define an eligibility policy that checks an employee’s job title or department. If their title includes the word Sales, they would be eligible for mobile phone expense reimbursement.

You should not define an enrollment reason code. Enrollment reason codes are part of benefits management but are typically used during the benefits open enrollment process. This code indicates the reason an employee has made a change to a benefit plan enrollment.

You should not define a department with type set as Sales. Departments are used to organize employees, manage job definitions, and create an organizational chart.

You should not define a project time sheet. Project time sheets are used to track the number of hours an employee has worked on a project. These time sheets can be used in payroll calculations and for other budgeting processes.

80

You should recommend the compliance manager to monitor the organization's conformity to local regulations. The compliance manager functionality is a control center that helps organizations identify and implement compliance according to industry and regional standards and regulations. In particular, the compliance manager dashboard provides at a glance a summary of the compliance level, shows areas that need attention, and suggests actions for improvement.

You should recommend performance management to track the progress of an employee towards reaching their objectives. Performance management is a tool used to manage the development journey of an employee, from goal setting to performance review. Performance journals can be used to record actions undertaken by an employee as they progress towards achieving an established goal.

You should recommend benefits management to automatically identify employees eligible for company perks. Benefits management offers a flexible tool to define all types of perks offered by an organization, establish eligibility criteria, and enroll workers in benefits. Specifically, you can define eligibility rules so that a certain benefit is only available to employees that fulfil predefined criteria.

81

Performance journal and performance reviews are both part of the Dynamics 365 Human Resources Employee development workspace. The performance journal allows employees to create and track activities and events that can be referred to during performance reviews. Additionally, activities and events can serve as goals or objectives that an employee can strive to complete during a performance period. Employees can access their performance journal in the Employee self-service workspace.

Performance reviews are designed to provide a platform for traditional, scheduled performance review processes. Additionally, performance reviews can provide flexible, organic processes that encourage employee development. For example, during a performance review, an employee and manager can define future goals the employee will complete. During the performance period, the manager can provide continuous feedback as the employee completes each milestone.

Leave and absence is not included in the Dynamics 365 Human Resources Employee development workspace. It is a separate workspace that allows managers to define work calendars, create leave plans, and provide a workflow for leave requests.

Flex credit is is not included in the Dynamics 365 Human Resources Employee development workspace. It is part of the Dynamics 365 Human Resources Benefits workspace.
