Flex credits provide an employee with a pool of credits that they can allocate to certain benefits. For example, an employee may choose to exchange paid vacation credits for tuition reimbursement.

82

You should use the worker form to add the contact information for a new contractor expected to start the following week. Workers are a key element of an organization and represent individuals in a working relationship with the company, whether they are employees or contractors. The worker form allows you to specify a variety of information for the worker, such as employment dates, personal contact details, and skills.

You should use the position form to change the number of direct reports associated to the Tech Director. Positions are a key element of an organization's hierarchy. They are associated to departments and can have only one worker at a time assigned to them. By creating a reporting link between positions, you can build the organization hierarchy, which is then used for more advanced features such as the approval workflow. This reporting link determines the number of direct reports for a given position.

You should use the worker form to enroll an employee on the new benefit scheme for health insurance. Many functionalities of Dynamics 365 Human Resources are based on workers, including enrollment in benefit programs.

83

You should recommend safety and compliance to ensure that the company meets safety standards for all production floor specialist workers. In Dynamics 365 Human Resources, the safety and compliance feature helps a company to meet all local and national standards and regulations. This may include employees' eligibility to perform certain tasks, or it may cater for the special requirements of certain individuals. Any additional documentation which may be required to prove that the company complies with regulations can be stored directly in the system.

You should recommend compensation and benefits to make a new medical plan available only to workers who meet some eligibility criteria. In Dynamics 365 Human Resources, the compensation and benefits management feature allows you to create and maintain benefits and its related parameters. Once you have created a benefit plan, you can specify coverage and eligibility criteria to ensure that benefits are only applied to employees who qualify for them.

You should recommend performance management to review the progress made over time by specialist workers using different machinery. In Dynamics 365 Human Resources, performance management lets you define a progression path for employees in order to ensure their professional growth. Once you have specified a measurable goal, you can track progress using performance journals and performance reviews. You can also define skills and map employees against them, in order to understand the areas of strength and weakness within the company workforce.

84

You should recommend performance goals for the sales manager who wants the team to master negotiation skills over the next six months. Performance goals are used by managers to define the objective that their employees have to reach. A goal must have a name, a description, and a date interval, but it should also have measurable results and topics to describe what the employee should do to reach it. Managers can create multiple goals and they can also group them by category.

You should recommend performance reviews for the HR team that wants to discuss the progress of each salesperson with them every four weeks. Performance reviews are used to arrange a meeting between an employee and a manager to discuss the progress towards reaching a goal. Depending on the company's needs, performance reviews can range from formal discussions at regular intervals to short feedback sessions for continuous improvement. A performance review usually includes a date and a description of the topics discussed.

You should recommend performance journals for salespeople who would like the ability to log what they did to practice their negotiation skills. Performance journals contain details of the activities carried out by employees while working towards their goals. These details allow the manager to understand how the progress was achieved, as well as allowing the employee to review their effort. Performance journals can be used to support the discussion during a performance review and track the progress towards a performance goal.

85

You should create a coverage option. A coverage option determines who is covered or how much coverage is available in a benefit plan. For example, coverage could be limited to the single employee, or extended to one dependant, or to the whole family. Coverage options are attached to benefit plans, which determine the rate and deduction setup for each coverage option in the plan.

You should not create an eligibility rule. Eligibility rules determine if an employee qualifies for a benefit plan. To qualify, an employee must meet the criteria specified in the eligibility rule in order to enroll in the benefit plan. You can associate multiple rules to with a benefit plan and you can also specify multiple conditions for a single rule.

You should not create a benefit plan. Benefit plans are used to define the benefits available to the workforce. Benefit plans are the central element of the benefits capabilities of Dynamics 365 Human Resources and can support complex scenarios, such as rate tables or nested tiers of benefits. A benefit plan includes many details, such as coverage category, validity periods, or eligibility rules.

You should not create a compensation plan. Compensation plans are not directly related to benefit management. Instead, compensation plans are an element of the compensation management feature, used to determine the employee pay rates. Compensation plans can be fixed (e.g. base salary) or variable (e.g. performance bonuses).

86

You can add, remove, or update training certificates in the Employee self-service workspace. You can perform a wide variety of human resources-related activities within the Employee self-service workspace, including viewing training certificates and their expiration date.

You can also enter and submit time-off requests. The Employee self-service workspace includes an option to view the time-off balances and create and submit time-off requests.

You cannot create an expense report. There is no option to create an expense report within a self-service workspace.

You cannot see the cross-company on-hand inventory status. You cannot view the on-hand inventory within the Employee self-service workspace. You can see this information in the on-hand mobile workspace.

87

You should first create course types. Course types must be created before a course can be added to the system. The course type defines whether the course is standard and if it has an agenda or an agenda plus sessions.

You should not create course groups, course locations, or instructors first. Course groups, locations, and instructors do not need to be created before a course can be added to the system.

88

Employee self-service displays the time-off balance for an employee. An employee can submit time-off requests. The portal forecasts an employee's balance based on their accrual method.

Employee self-service does not list payroll deductions. Payroll deductions are those that are required by law. They include income taxes, social security payments, and other deductions. Dynamics 365 Human Resources does not have a payroll functionality.

Employee self-service enables managers to analyze team performance. You can configure team performance journals, team performance goals, and team performance reviews for managers.

89

Employees cannot connect their LinkedIn profile to automatically update their personal information in the self-service workspace. Employees can use the self-service workspace to edit their personal information, such as addresses or contact details. However, this functionality offers no connection to LinkedIn. Dynamics 365 Human Resources can instead be integrated with the LinkedIn Talent Hub, which is an applicant tracking system (ATS) platform, to easily create employee records for applicants who have been hired for a position.

Employees can submit time-off requests for approval by managers. Employees can use the self-service workspace to view their leave balance and submit absence requests. You can configure a workflow so that a manager can review the request for absence and decide whether to approve it.

Managers can monitor the performance of their teams. The self-service workspace also offers additional functionalities that are only available to managers. A dedicated tab allows managers to review different details of the workers they manage (for example, expiring certifications or pending absence requests). In particular, a manager can see a list of all performance goals of the team and the progress towards achieving them.

90

You should recommend training courses. Training courses are part of the course management feature, which allows a human resources administrator to maintain details and information about training that is provided to company workers. Specifically, a training course includes options to list prerequisites and specify registration deadlines, register participants, and define the agenda and sessions of each course, depending on the course type.

You should not recommend performance journals. Performance journals are used to record activities and events undertaken by employees while achieving their goals. This is part of the performance management feature. While a goal may require an employee to attend a course, the performance journal is not suitable to manage a training course from an admin perspective.

You should not recommend absence requests. Absence requests can be submitted by employees and approved by managers to allow them take time off. This functionality is part of the leave and absence management capabilities of Dynamics 365 Human Resources, but it is not related to training courses or employee development.

You should not recommend the self-service workspace. The self-service workspace is a flexible platform that allows employees and managers to carry out tasks autonomously. For example, employees can edit their personal details and managers can review the performance goals of the whole team. The self-service workspace offers an employee the ability to register to an open course, but it is not suitable to manage training courses from an admin perspective.

91

You can create plans to accrue leave at different frequencies. Leave and absence plans determine when and how often an employee is granted time off. Plans can be configured so that time off accrues at specific frequencies or at once (for example, at the start of each year). Tiered leave plans can also be configured to give employees leave as a benefit depending on how long they have worked for the company.

You can let employees request their own time off. Employees can use the self-service workspace capabilities to view their leave balance and request time off. The self-service workspace extends beyond this, offering employees a range of options to carry out tasks autonomously (for example, updating their personal details or reviewing their performance goals).

You can use workflows to manage requests approval. Dynamics 365 Human Resources offers a dedicated workflow to manage the approval of employees' requests for time off. Employees must fill in the required details to submit a request, and then the workflow can be configured to assign it to a manager for approval or even auto-approve it if predetermined conditions are satisfied.

92

You should use the employee and manager self-service to view the time-off balance and submit a new leave request. Self-service is an area of Dynamics 365 Human Resources that allows employees and manager to perform common tasks by themselves, without the need of paperwork or intervention from an HR employee. For example, employees can submit a new leave request or enroll in a training course. Different features are offered in the self-service area depending on whether an employee or a manager uses it.

You should use the personnel management workspace to review a list of potential candidates for a new opening. The personnel management workspace is a central control point to help HR employees to manage the workforce. The workspace provides summarized details from many different areas, such as employee changes, new starters, or recent hires. Like any workspace, you can also interact with the data displayed and perform relevant actions. For example, you could decide to reject or hire a candidate from the candidates section of the workspace.

You should use personnel actions to trigger managerial approval for a worker termination. Personnel actions are an optional feature of Dynamics 365 Human Resources, and are useful to collect additional information when common tasks are performed. Personnel actions are often used to ensure approval is provided before the task is complete. For example, if a request to terminate a worker is created, a workflow may be triggered to request a managerial approval before the termination is actually performed in the system.

93

You should assign a worker record to the user. Workers are a key element of an organization and represent individuals in a working relationship with the company. Worker records are required for more advanced functionalities of Dynamics applications, such as recording time on a production order or accessing the self-service area of Dynamics 365 Human Resources. To allow an employee to perform such tasks, the worker record with employees' details must be assigned to the user account used by the employee.

You should also assign the Employee role to the user. The Employee security role is a standard security role that grants access to the self-service area of Dynamics 365 Human Resources. The role-based security framework used by many Dynamics applications requires you to configure security roles to determine which areas of the system are accessible. Security roles are then associated to user accounts to allow an employee to perform only the appropriate tasks in the system.

You should not assign the System user security role to the user. The System user security role is a standard security role that grants access to the most basic functionalities of the system, such as navigation. The System user security role is automatically assigned to a user when the user account is created in or imported into the system. However, the System user security role is not sufficient to grant access to the self-service area of Dynamics 365 Human Resources.

You should not assign a position to the worker record. Positions are a key element for building an organization hierarchy. They are associated to departments and are assigned to one worker at a time. By creating a reporting link between positions, you can build the organization hierarchy, which is then used for more advanced features such as the approval workflow. However, assignment to a position does not enable a user to use the self-service functionality of Dynamics 365 Human Resources.

94

You should use a project contract. By using a project contract, a company can invoice multiple projects at the same time. A project contract helps to guarantee a consistent invoicing procedure. To invoice a project, the project must be associated with a project contract.

You should not use purchase orders. Purchase orders are for items from external vendors that you consume on a project.

You should not use funding sources. Funding sources are used to split billing for a project among multiple customers, grants, or organizations.

You should not use project quotations. A project quotation is the offer sent to a customer prior to starting the project. You can track invoices against quotations in invoice control.

95

You should use the time project type to create internal projects that only allow recording hour transactions with no accounting posting. You can use time projects to record, for example, illness hours and vacations.

You should use the internal project type to create projects where all incurred costs are assumed by the company and cannot be invoiced. For these projects, the costs can be posted to a balance sheet or profit and loss accounts.

You should use the investment project type to create internal projects that allow posting costs for hours, items, and expenses that must be capitalized at the end of the project. During the execution of the project, costs are posted in ledger accounts as a work in progress (WIP) and, when the project is completed, the WIP amounts are transferred to a fixed asset, a new project, or a ledger account.

96

You can use project number and worker number to configure sales prices for hour transactions in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. You can configure prices for any of the following options or any combination of them:

CategoryTransaction dateProject numberWorker number
You should not use site to configure hour transactions pricing in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Site is a storage dimension that groups multiple warehouses. In the context of the project management module, it is only relevant for the item transaction type, to indicate from which site the items are consumed.

You should not use item number to configure hour transactions pricing in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. The hour transaction type is used to record the time consumed in the project, not to post item consumption. These transactions do not support the selection of an item number and, therefore, you cannot select an item when setting the sale prices for hour categories.

97

Creating a project contract and defining a work breakdown structure (WBS) are part of the initiate phase. The initiate phase assumes that a binding agreement has been signed by the parties, but the bulk of the work has not started yet. Elements such as a project contract and a WBS are used to formalize the invoicing terms and the tasks to be carried out for each milestone, together with the expected cost and scheduling of each task.

Recording expenses and monitoring budget consumption are part of the execute phase. During the execute phase, project tasks are performed and the bulk of the work is carried out. In this phase, project members record both expenses and time, and the project manager monitors the budget to ensure spending is on track. Depending on the billing agreements, the execute phase can also include the creation of invoices and revenue recognition.

Negotiating discounts and defining required items and services are part of the sales phase. The sales phase generally takes place before the signature of a contract and the formal creation of a project in the system. A project quotation is used as a non-binding document to include elements such as items and services required, any discounts applied, possible taxes to be paid on the quoted price, and more.

98

You cannot modify a quotation after you have changed its status to sent. A project quotation is final after its status is changed to sent and no further modifications can be applied to it. However, you can still send a provisional version of the quotation via email to the client by generating a confirmation. If a negotiation follows, any requested change can be applied directly to the project quotation. Once the client is satisfied, you can update the quotation status to sent, which prevents further changes.

You can transfer quotation lines to a project. Once a project quotation has been confirmed, you can transfer some or all the quotation lines to a new or existing project. This is done via a dedicated wizard in the system, which also updates the target project with the new data from the quotation.

You cannot create legally binding offers with a project quotation. A project quotation is a non-binding estimate of the work to be performed and the resources required to deliver the desired results. Project quotations are used to provide a potential client with an attractive offer, which may also include discounts, terms, surcharges, and more. Once the quote is accepted by the customer, a project contract is used as a legally binding agreement, and a project is used to execute the work.

99

You can set up standard sales prices per project and per resource. You can define a specific sales price to be used for a particular project or for a particular resource. You can freely configure sales prices per project number, effective date, resource, category, and more. You can also configure a sales price for a combination of them, or multiple sales prices for overlapping combinations. When a transaction is recorded in a project, the combination with the highest level of detail is used to apply the sales price.

You cannot set up standard sales prices per quotation. A project quotation is a document used to provide a potential client with a non-binding offer prior to carrying out any project work. The total amount of a project quote may be based on the standard sales prices of the required items and resources, but this is not always the case.

You cannot set up standard sales prices per invoice. A project invoice is a document used to charge the customer with the amount due for carrying out project work. The content of a project invoice is determined by the transactions recorded against the project or by the terms defined on the project contract.

100

You should recommend funding sources to split the amount due across multiple organizations. Funding sources are used for projects that have multiple funders, such as private customers, government grants, or public organizations. Each of those is defined as a funding source, and the billing of the amount due can be allocated across them based on percentage or priority. For example, a research grant may cover the first million dollars of incurred costs in a large project, then any extra is billed to a private sponsor.

You should recommend billing rules to define how and when the customer can be invoiced. Billing rules are based on the project terms specified in a project contract, and may vary according to the project type. They define the frequency and mode in which the customer is invoiced the amount due for the project. For example, the client may be billed for the total costs incurred in a project stage once its related milestone is reached.

You should recommend project contracts to create invoices for one or more projects. In order to create a project and subsequently invoice it, a project contract must exist first. A project contract identifies the funding sources for all projects connected to that contract, and offers a consistent structure to create invoices for all projects and sub-projects associated with it. The invoicing method can then vary according to the project type, even if they share the same project contract.

101

The project contract represents the SoW for a project. The project contract is created when the customer has agreed to a project quote. The project contract defines the work to be done on a project and how the work will be invoiced.

You should not choose project lead. Project-based leads are used when a potential customer makes an enquiry for a new project.

You should not choose project opportunity. Project-based opportunities are used to capture the overall information about a potential project. High-level estimates are added to the project opportunity.

You should not choose project quote. Project-based quotes are used to create detailed estimates for the project that are sent to the customer for agreement. Once agreed, a project quote is converted into a project contract.

102

You should recommend time and material projects to invoice the client according to incurred costs plus a margin. Time and material projects are invoiced as costs in the project based on the transactions posted. The invoiced amounts usually include a margin with respect to the incurred costs. The billing frequency is not necessarily pre-determined or based on elapsed time.

You should recommend fixed-price projects to invoice the client according to a billing schedule. Fixed-price projects are invoiced via on-account transactions. The billing schedule for these projects is based on the project contract, with pre-determined amounts. The invoiced amounts do not take into consideration the transactions actually posted against the project.

103

You can use the Time and Material billing method in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Time and Material is used to bill the customer based on the effort and costs incurred on the project.

You can also use the Fixed Price billing method in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Fixed Price is used to bill the customer based on an agreed value, and the value is not affected by the effort and costs incurred.

You should not use the Funding source. Funding sources are used to split invoices when generating customer bills to different funding sources.

You should not use Not-to-exceed limit. The Not-to-exceed limit field is used to cap the amount you can bill the customer.

104

You should use a fixed price for a negotiated set of payments based on reaching milestones for the project. In a fixed-price project, the customer is billed based on reaching agreed milestones or deliverables.

You should use a retainer for a negotiated set of equally distributed payments for the duration of the project. In a retainer project, the customer is billed based on an agreed periodic value. This provides the customer with a predictable billing profile during the project.

You should use an advance for a one-time payment from a customer before the project begins. An advance is normally paid by the customer at the start of a project. Dynamics 365 Project Operations reconciles this as a pre-payment against the project bills as they are generated.

You should not use Time and Material. Time and Material is used to bill the customer based on the actual effort and costs incurred on the project. The customer will not be able to predict their costs.

105

You should use a fixed-price project to invoice the customer according to a billing schedule based on the project contract. Fixed-price projects allow you to generate an invoice according to a billing schedule defined in the project contract and agreed with the customer before the start of the project. In this case, the customer is not billed for the actual consumption and, instead, the invoices are posted according to the billing schedule. Therefore, the costs and revenues are not aligned. Optionally, you can use the work in progress (WIP) amount to calculate the degree of completion of the project.

Time and material projects are external projects where the customer is invoiced for all costs posted in the project with a direct match between the actual consumption, costs, and revenue.

Investment projects are internal projects that capitalize costs when a project is completed. This project type cannot be invoiced to a customer.

106

You should recommend Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Project Operations includes an extensive project management and accounting feature set, including the ability to create work breakdown structures (WBS). A WBS is designed to divide work into manageable tasks, with each task composed of scheduling and interdependency information. Finally, each task can include labor and materials requirements that facilitate cost estimates. Project Operations WBSs can aid your client in managing project costs by presenting real-time budget status for completed and uncompleted work.

You should not recommend Dynamics 365 Commerce. Commerce is designed for organizations that operate either exclusively online or as a combination of online and offline businesses. Commerce presents online, traditional brick-and-mortar, and back-office features in a single, combined solution including inventory management, merchandising, e-commerce, and customer management.

You should not recommend Dynamics 365 Guides. Guides is a mixed-reality application that is designed to present holographic instructions as users learn a procedure or process flow. Guides is part of the Dynamics 365 Mixed Reality offering.

You should not recommend Dynamics 365 Field Service. Field Service is designed for organizations that offer on-site customer service. Field Service enables the creation and management of support cases, including the ability to monitor and track technicians as they work through support cases.

107

In the work breakdown structure, a task can have estimated cost amounts for labor, expense, and item transaction types, and the total estimated cost for the task is the sum of them all.

You cannot modify the cost estimation for a summary task in the work breakdown structure. The estimated cost for a summary task is calculated automatically as the sum of the estimated costs of the child tasks assigned to it.

In a work breakdown structure, if a task has multiple predecessor tasks, it cannot start until all predecessor tasks are completed. When you assign a predecessor to a task, its estimated start date is set to the end date of its predecessor.

108

The planning WBS view is used to represent the baseline estimate of the costs and tasks schedule. In the planning view you can see relevant information about the task scheduling, such as estimated effort, predecessors, and planned start and end dates. Also, in this view you can see the estimated costs for material, labor, and expenses assigned to the task.

Effort tracking view is used to track the progress of the tasks comparing planned effort to actual effort hours. In this view you can see essential information about the advancement of the task such as the calculation of the progress percentage and estimated time to complete it.

The cost tracking view is used to track the cost consumption of a task to date by comparing actual costs with planned costs. This view allows visualizing relevant information about cost consumption for the task, such as the percentage of consumed cost and estimated cost.

109

If a purchase order is originated from and linked to the project itself, purchased items are consumed in the project when the vendor invoice is posted.

If a purchase order is originated from an existing sales order that is linked to a project, purchased items are consumed in the project when the sales order invoice that includes these items is posted for the customer.

If a purchase order is originated from an existing item requirement, purchased items are consumed in the project when the packing slip is updated for the corresponding item requirement transactions.

110

Budgeting and forecasting are included in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Project budgeting and project forecasting are two options to manage and control projects. Generally speaking, a company with a strong focus on operations may prefer project forecasting, while a company with a stronger focus on financial monitoring may prefer project budgeting. Even if the approach is different, both project budgeting and project forecasting are used to estimate the costs to be incurred as the project unfolds. This feature is natively included in Dynamics 365 Project Operations.

Production orders are not included in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Production orders are an element of the manufacturing capabilities of Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. They define the items to be produced when the discrete manufacturing methodology is used by a company. Manufactured items may be required in the context of a project, but production orders are not included within project management functionalities.

Warehouse management is not included in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Warehouse management is a module of Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. This module lets you manage warehouse processes in companies that perform manufacturing, distribution, and retail activities. Warehouse management is integrated with other modules such as transportation and manufacturing, but it is not related to project management functionalities.

A chart of accounts is not included in Dynamics 365 Project Operations. Instead, it is a functionality of Dynamics 365 Finance. The chart of account is a structured list that includes all general ledger accounts of a legal entity. The list is used to prepare financial reporting documents for authorities and stakeholders. While all transactions incurred in a company (including project ones) are ultimately posted to general ledger accounts, the chart of accounts itself and its features are not related to project management functionalities.

111

You can soft book a resource if the allocation is not confirmed yet. Resources can be hard booked or soft booked for a project. Hard booking is used when the allocation is secure, while soft booking is used for tentative allocation. The different booking types help a project manager understand the capacity of each resource with respect to project requirements, and ensure smoother planning and scheduling.

You can define roles to be used as generic resources in place of specific workers. Project managers can create roles as temporary generic resources for a project. This approach is useful when a resource requirement is clear but the specific worker to fulfil the requirement has not been determined yet. Roles can be defined and assigned in a work breakdown structure (WBS) to ensure the whole planning phase can be completed even if there are no confirmed resources for the tasks yet.

You can use competencies to understand if a resource is suitable for a project. Competencies such as skills, education, or certifications can be defined and assigned to each resource in order to have a clear understanding of each resource's ability to perform different jobs. Competencies can also be assigned to roles in order to correctly identify the requirements for a certain project task. This way a project manager can easily compare the available and required skills and ensure an effective allocation of workers to a project.

112

You cannot consume hours on a project with an inventory journal. Inventory journals can only be used to record consumption of items, in a project or elsewhere. To record hours against a project, you can use a hour journal instead. Hour journals are used exclusively for projects.

You cannot use transfer orders to allocate items to a project. Transfer orders are used to move items between sites and warehouses and are not related to projects. Different methods can be used to allocate and consume stock on a project, such as item requirements.

You can use consume items on a project with an item requirement. Item requirements allow you to record items on a project to be consumed at a later stage. This way, you can create an item requirement to track the stock required on the project, then update it when the stock is actually consumed. An item requirement may be fulfilled by consuming stock from the inventory, generating a purchase order to purchase it from a vendor, or triggering a production order to manufacture what is required.

113

You can use the project time entry mobile workspace to record billable time. The project time entry mobile workspace allows workers to log their time against a project from a mobile device. Workers can use this workspace to record both billable and non-billable time, on different projects and on different dates. The advantage of this is that the workspace can be accessed from any mobile device, which is especially useful for project resources who are often engaged in travel activities.

You can consume hours on any project type, not just time and material projects. Hours are a type of transaction that can be recorded against a project, together with other transaction types such as items or expenses. Some project types include limitations on what transactions you can record against them. For example, you cannot consume an item against a time tracking project. However, hours can be recorded against any project type.

You can use per diem rules to manage project expenses. A per diem represents a predetermined allowance paid to a worker who travels for work and is expected to incur expenses such as meals or accommodation while doing so. Per diem rules allow you to configure how these allowances are paid to workers, for example based on travel locations. Per diems represent an alternative to the worker logging the actual incurred expenses against a project.

114

You can generate project statements to review the status of a project. Project statements offer a quick view of the progress of a project. You can use different types of project statements and also further refine the criteria used to generate the statement. For example, you can run a profit and loss statement for a certain group of projects during the first quarter of the year only.

You can calculate the utilization rate of a project resource. A worker associated to a project as a project resource has their capacity defined by a calendar. Therefore, a worker's utilization rate is obtained by dividing the number of billable hours by the number of working hours in the selected period. The calculation of the utilization rate of a worker also allows you to see other types of hours, such as productive hours that are not billed to a client, burden hours that cannot be billed, and more.

You can monitor both the actual costs and remaining budget of a project. You can also monitor committed costs, which are allocated to the project but not incurred yet. In fact, comparing the original budgeted costs of a project with the incurred and committed costs is a key requirement to assess whether the project is on track or not. Cost control is an essential task during the execution phase of a project.

115

You should use a prebuilt report to generate an income statement. The income statement report is one of the prebuilt reports included with Dynamics 365 Finance.

You should use report designer to generate a trial balance with business units. The trial balance report is one of the prebuilt reports included with Dynamics 365 Finance, but if a dimension such as a business unit needs to be added to the report, you will need to use the report designer tool.

You should use Excel for budget planning. The budget plan is created by exporting the budget data to Excel using a template, updating the data in Excel, and then uploading it back into Dynamics 365 Finance.

You should not use Power BI. Power BI is used for trend and analytics reporting.

116

You should use Excel to publish new records after editing a system data entity. The Open in Excel feature allows you to manipulate a data entity related to form data in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. You can update existing records or add new ones, then upload the changes by publishing the data. Any update goes through the OData entity logic validation to provide real-time feedback on any data inconsistency, for example, a missing mandatory value.

You should use Power BI to visualize data from multiple sources in one dashboard. Power BI is a business analytics service that can collect data from multiple sources and display them in a meaningful and visual way, which is ideal to gain an insight to key performance indicators (KPIs) and make informed decisions. Dashboards and tiles are used in Power BI to build visualizations, such as bar or pie charts, which display data in a direct and clear way for decision makers.

117

You should recommend workspaces. A workspace is a configurable and central work center with data and actionable items designed to display information in a summarized way and increase efficiency when processing data. Workspaces can help drive productivity in many different ways, including answering specific questions (for example, how many sales lines are in status delivered?) and providing direct access to tasks, for example, to create an invoice from a delivered sales order.

You should not recommend Export to Excel. The Export to Excel functionality is useful when advanced data manipulation is required for reporting purposes. This functionality does not allow you to modify system data, since the export only works one way.

You should not recommend Power BI. Power BI is a business analytics service that displays data in a meaningful and visual way, which is ideal to gain insights and make informed decisions. Power BI is used for advanced reporting and data analytics, but it does not provide a direct link to process system data.

You should not recommend Open in Excel. The Open in Excel feature extracts data in an Excel workbook and then allows you to modify the records and upload any changes back to the system. However, the data manipulation is only limited to the extracted system data entities. Complex system operations such as invoicing a delivered sales order can only be carried out directly in the system.

118

You should mention workspaces. Workspaces are configurable control centers with data and actionable items designed to increase productivity in many different ways. Workspaces are natively included in Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations and are available in most system modules.

You should also mention SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports. Reports are defined as visualizations of a structured data set, and SSRS is a tool that allows you to run predefined system reports or create personalized reports to fulfill more complex business reporting requirements. SSRS reporting is a native Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations feature.

You should not mention Power BI dashboards. Power BI is a business analytics service that can collect data from multiple sources and display it in a meaningful and visual way, using elements such as dashboards and tiles. Before these functionalities can be used, a PowerBI.com license is required to integrate Power BI with Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations.

You should not mention SharePoint document management. SharePoint provides organizations with a secure place in the cloud to store, organize, share, and manage content. Information within SharePoint can be retrieved via any device with a web browser. Specifically, different types of documents can be uploaded to SharePoint directly from the attachment feature of many Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations entities. However, a valid SharePoint subscription is required to enable this integration.

119

SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports can be generated in multiple ways. A report can be generated to be shown on your screen, or you can save the report as a file with multiple file types available such as Excel, Word, and PDF. It can also be sent by email or sent to a printer.

You cannot use the Export to Excel feature to publish new data in Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations apps. The Export to Excel feature is used to export static data from the selected entity in Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations apps. If you need to publish data in a Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations app, for example in Dynamics 365 Finance, you must use a different feature, such as Open in Excel or Data Management workspace.

SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports have a drill-down capability to allow you to browse data. SSRS reports in Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations apps allow you to navigate the data through a drill-down capability. The detail of transactions or the original document is shown when clicking the record in the report.

120

A workspace is a centralized view that displays data and allows users to perform light tasks. Workspaces are forms designed to display all data necessary for a user to carry out a business function. For example, a procurement workspace may display the number of open purchase orders and a list of purchase orders pending approval from managers. Workspaces are interactive and allow users to complete simple tasks without leaving the page.

An SSRS report is a static and structured display of data, presented in a format suitable for printing. SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports retrieve data from the SQL database and display it in a non-interactive tabular layout, usually in an A4 format suitable for printing. To use an SSRS report, you need to specify a set of parameters and then generate the report.

Financial reporting is a tool specifically designed to build and generate statements such as a balance sheet. Financial reporting is a feature of Dynamics 365 Finance that allows users to efficiently create, generate, and view financial statements, such as a balance sheet. This reporting tool allows end users to design various types of reports without the need of a developer.

121

Excel allows an advanced manipulation of data, including calculations and bulk update. Data manipulation in Excel from Dynamics 365 is part of the Office integration. Opening data from system entities in Excel allows users to perform advanced tasks that would take a long time in the system, such as calculations or bulk updates. From Excel, modified data can be re-uploaded in the Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain Management using the standard system validation rules.

A workspace presents an overview of all information relevant to perform a business function. Workspaces are forms designed to display all data necessary for a user to carry out a specific business function. They offer a centralized view, from which users can drill down to retrieve more information or move to a related form. Workspaces are also interactive, allowing users to complete simple tasks without leaving the page.

You should not identify Power BI. Power BI is a business intelligence tool designed to analyze a wide amount of data and gather insights from it. The Power BI integration with Dynamics allows you to gather data and use it to build embedded experiences that require visuals; for example, charts or pie diagrams. Since the data consumed by Power BI is aggregated to generate insightful information, this integration offers very limited scope when it comes to modifying or using the data for operational purposes.

122

You should use Export to Excel to manipulate data and display it with visual charts. The Export to Excel functionality extracts all the grid data to an Excel workbook. Once the data is in a workbook, you can use the Excel functionalities to freely manipulate them and create summaries or visual charts. The Export to Excel functionality does not allow you to upload exported data back to the system.

You should use Open in Excel to modify the content of a data entity and publish the changes. When the Open in Excel functionality is used, an Excel workbook is generated with the columns that are defined in the AutoReport field group of the data entity. Further configuration of the columns is possible via the Design button. The Open in Excel feature maintains a link between the workbook and the system, so you can edit the extracted records or add completely new records and publish the changes back to the system. Any uploaded data has to pass through the existing OData entity logic validation before it is published to the system.

You should use Export to Word to generate lightweight reports with predefined templates. The Export to Word functionality can be used for simple reporting needs when advanced data manipulation is not required. You can define a Word template and use it for document generation with Dynamics 365 data.

123

You should use the Excel Data Connector add-in. The Excel Data Connector app interacts with Excel workbooks and OData services that are created for publicly exposed data entities. The Excel integrator is commonly used for journal entry uploads and for small data uploads to common entities. There is a limit of 10,000 records in the OData interface.

You should not use the Data management framework. The Data management framework allows you to import data, but it is generally used for large volumes of data where the 10,000 record limit of the ODATA interface is exceeded.

You should not use business events. Business events send messages to Azure and external systems when selected actions occur in Finance and Operations apps.

You should not use the Excel workbook designer. The Excel workbook designer allows you to create additional Excel templates to output data.

124

You cannot integrate both cloud and on-premises instances of Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement. You can only integrate cloud instances of Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement, which includes Dynamics 365 apps such as Dynamics 365 Sales and Dynamics 365 Customer Service. The Microsoft Teams integration is not supported for on-premises installation of Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement, nor in case of any legacy web client or legacy application.

You can integrate Microsoft Teams without a SharePoint integration. Microsoft Teams integration uses the SharePoint integration in the backend, so a configured SharePoint integration is recommended to enjoy the full benefits of the integration. However, integrating Microsoft Teams to Dynamics 365 apps without an active SharePoint integration is also possible, although in this case there should not be any active SharePoint site in the organization and the OneDrive integration must be disabled too.

You can share files directly from Microsoft Teams when the integration is enabled. File editing and file sharing are a central functionality of the Microsoft Teams integration with Dynamics 365 apps, so documents can be co-authored via Microsoft Teams and automatically synchronized with customer engagement apps in Dynamics 365. In fact, if the integration with SharePoint is configured, files are saved to SharePoint and become accessible in both Microsoft Teams and in the Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement apps.

125

The outcome of email integration is affected by both administrator configuration and user configuration. The system behavior of the email subsystem is affected by a combination of administrator configuration, user configuration, and user choices. Administrator configurations include technical setup such as the batch email provider and the Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP) port number, while user configuration and choices include operational details such as using the system email client or editing the predefined subject and body fields of an email.

The maximum allowed size of an email attachment can be set by the administrator. One of the configuration options available to the administrator is the ability to specify the attachment size limit, which reflects on the maximum size of a single outgoing email that can be handled by the email subsystem. Users of the email integration can attach files to an email, but they do not have access to this parameter.

Users can choose whether to send the email via the system email client or an email app. Users can make a number of choices that affect how an email is sent by the email subsystem. In particular, the user can choose whether to use an email app such as Outlook, the Exchange Online email server associated with the Dynamics 365 tenant, or the system email client, which sends the email via SMTP.

126

The company should integrate the system with Office. The Office integration with Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management includes Word and Excel, and supports both data export and data import. Specifically, the Open in Excel feature extracts the content of a supported system data entity into an Excel workbook, allows you to modify the records within it or add new ones, and uploads any changes back to the system. The integration with Excel is the most effective way to edit Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management system data outside of the system. In fact, the system natively supports it, so this feature can be used as long as Office is licensed and the Dynamics add-in for Excel is installed.

The company should not integrate the system with Outlook. Outlook is an email client and the integration with Dynamics 365 apps lets you synchronize Outlook contacts, tasks, and appointments. The integration is limited to Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement apps, even if some data may be common to Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management thanks to the Microsoft Dataverse framework of shared system data entities. The best platform to specifically edit Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management data entities is Excel.

The company should not integrate the system with Power BI. Power BI is a business analytics service that can collect data from multiple sources and display them in a meaningful and visual way, using elements such as dashboards and tiles. Business intelligence (BI) is generally related to extracting and summarizing data to measure key performance indicators (KPIs). Power BI does not allow you to modify Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management data entities and upload the changes back to the system.

The company should not integrate the system with Teams. Microsoft Teams is a communication platform, and its integration with Dynamics 365 apps mainly supports file sharing and editing. The integration does not allow you to edit system entities and it is only limited to Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement apps, whereas Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management is one of the Finance and Operations apps.

127

You should recommend the SharePoint integration to co-author and share files within the organization. The integration with SharePoint gives companies a cloud-based place to store, organize, share, and manage documentation and content. Information within SharePoint can be accessed from any device that has a web browser without requiring the user to authenticate again after they have completed single sign-on (SSO) login. The SharePoint integration is particularly suitable for sharing documents within the boundaries of the organization.

You should recommend the Outlook integration to send a purchase order to a vendor after it has been confirmed. The email integration with Dynamics 365 apps allows you to rely on the Outlook capabilities to send emails directly from the client app after documents have been generated in the system. More advanced settings are available to both the admin and users to configure the precise behavior of the email integration, such as setting up the attachment size limit or using predetermined templates. The email integration is particularly suitable for sharing documents with parties that do not belong to the organization.

You should recommend the Excel integration to export all records in a form for reporting purposes. Dynamics 365 apps can be integrated with multiple applications in the Office suite. In particular, the Export to Excel feature allows you to extract all grid data from a system page to an Excel workbook. Once the records are in a workbook, you can use the features offered by Excel to manipulate the data for various reporting needs (for example, visually displaying data in chart form).

128

You should recommend the Excel workbook designer. The Excel workbook designer is used to design a custom template to export and import data for a selected entity in Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations apps. To create a custom template, you should select the appropriate entity. The mandatory fields for the entity are selected by default and you can add others that are available. You can also set the order in which the selected fields will be displayed in the workbook template.

You could also recommend the Design option in the Excel Add-In. Excel Add-In includes a Design button that lets you use the design experience for the selected entity. This lets you perform multiple changes, such as add more columns, change the order, or remove fields. This in an alternative method to design custom templates for data export and import.

You should not recommend the Export to Excel feature. Export to Excel is used to retrieve and move data from Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations apps grids to an Excel spreadsheet. This is triggered by the Export to Excel option in the Microsoft Office menu in the selected grid. The information is exported in a static way, and you cannot import data using this feature.

You should not recommend an email template. Email templates are used to make sending emails more agile and efficient through the configuration of standardized texts. Typically, email templates contain standard text and bookmarks to insert data created in Finance and Operations apps.

129

You can use a Microsoft Word template to create a custom layout for business documents generated in Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations apps. You can create a Word template using the design experience available in the Office Add-in to build the layout and upload it in Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations when it is ready. Once it is published, you can select this template to show the information for the selected Finance and Operations entity.     

Export to Excel is used to retrieve static information from Dynamics Finance and Operations grids. In this case, you cannot modify the layout to show the information in a custom template. The columns and the order in which they are displayed is arranged by default. You can only modify the data once it is in Excel.

SharePoint integration can be used to define SharePoint as the repository to store Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations attachments, which can be notes or different types of files such as text files, images, Word, and Excel, among others. Many Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations forms have an attachment button, which lets you create a note or upload the document to be attached. Attached documents can be stored in SharePoint according to the document management configuration.

Measureup.md

Enable Select code

(function() {
  'use strict';

  let style = document.createElement('style');
  style.innerHTML = '*{ user-select: auto !important; }';

  document.body.appendChild(style);
})();
  • A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Each time a new sales order is created, materials buyers must be able to evaluate supply levels for core components by updating their master plan locally, without regenerating the whole plan. Which type of plan should the company use?
    • Dynamic plan

# Merged Code Practise - Mettl.md

Notes

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/dbdac2a9

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
public class UserMainCode
	{
	public int isOdd (int input1)
		{
		if(input1%2!=0)
            return 2;
        else  
            return 1;
    }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/454f012b

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int lastDigitof(int input1)
		{
		// converting a -ve number to +ve
	     if(input1<0)
		  {
			   input1*=-1;
		  }
		  int n=input1%10;
		  return n;
	}
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/9f87004e

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int second LastDigitof(int input1)
	{
	// handling a single digit number
	if(input1>=-9 && input1<=9)
	return -1;
	
	// converting a -ve number into +ve number
	if(input1<0)
	input1*=-1;
	
	input1/=10;
	int n=input1%10;
	return n;
	}
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/783a1fcf

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int addLastDigits (int input1, int input2)
	{
	// converting -ve number to +ve number
    if(input1<0)
	input1*=-1;
    if(input2<0)
    input2*=-1;

    int x=input1%10;
    int y=input2%10;
    int sum = x+y;
    return sum;
	}
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/36c4ef58

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int isMultiple(int input1,int input2)
	{
    if(input1==0 || input2==0) 
        return 3; 
    else if(input1%input2==0)
        return 2; 
    else 
        return 1;	
	}
}

using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int count Evens (int input1,int input2,int input3,int input4,int input5)
	{
		int count=0;  
		if(input1%2==0)  
		 count++;
		 if(input2%2==0)   
		    count++;  
		if(input3%2==0)  
		   count++;  
		if(input4%2==0)   
		   count++;  
		if(input5%2==0)   
		  count++;  

		return count; 
	}
}

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int count countEvensOdds (int input1,int input2,int input3,int input4,int input5, string input6)
	{
		int count=0;  
		if(input1%2==0)  
			count++;
		if(input2%2==0)   
		    count++;  
		if(input3%2==0)  
		    count++;  
		if(input4%2==0)   
		    count++;  
		if(input5%2==0)   
		   count++;  

		if(input6 == "even")
			return count;
		else
		   return 5-count;
	}
}

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
//Read only region start
public class UserMainCode
{
	public int isPrime(int input1)
	{
		int count=0;
		for(int i=2;i<=Math.Sqrt(input1);i++)
		{
		 if(input1%i==0)
		     count++;
		}
		if(count==0)
		 return 2;
		 else
		return 1;
	}
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/8c1f2ae

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
//Read only region start
public class UserMainCode
{
public int nFactorial(int input1)
	{
	if (input1 == 0)
		return 1;

	return input1 * nFactorial(input1 - 1);
	}
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/f390cadf

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public long nthFibonacci(int input1)
	{
	if(input1==1)
		return 0;
	if(input1==2)
		return 1;
	else
		return nthFibonacci(input1-1)+nthFibonacci(input1-2);
	}
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/34fdaa41

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int NthPrime(int input1) {
    int c = 0, num = 2, i, letest = 0;

    while (c != input1) {
      int count = 0;
      for (i = 2; i <= Math.Sqrt(num); i++) {
        if (num % i == 0) {
          count++;
          break;
        }
      }
      if (count == 0) {
        c++;
        letest = num;
      }
      num = num + 1;
    }

    return letest;

  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/87c41143

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531103410.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int count Primes InRange(int input1, int input2) {
    int count = 0, ctr;

    for (int num = input1; num <= input2; num++) {
      ctr = 0;

      for (int i = 2; i <= num / 2; i++) {
        if (num % i == 0) {
          ctr++;
          break;
        }
      }

      if (ctr == 0 && num != 1)
        count++;
    }

    return count;
  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/b7aac4a5

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int uniqueDigitsCount(int input1) {
    String str = input1.ToString();
    int len = str.Length;

    int count = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < len - 1; i++) {

      for (int j = i + 1; j < len; j++) {

        if (str[i] == str[j]) {
          count++;
          break;
        }
      }
    }
    return len - count;
  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/e46500f5

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531103621.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int nonRepeat DigitsCount(int input1) {
    string str = input1.ToString();
    int len = str.Length;
    int count = 0, pcount = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
      count = 0;
      for (int j = 0; j < len; j++) {
        if (i != j)
          if (str[i] == str[j]) {
            count++;
            break;
          }
      }
      if (count == 0)
        pcount++;
    }
    return pcount;
  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/ab1d60cc

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int digitSum(int input1) {
    int neg = input1;
    if (input1 < 0) {
      input1 *= -1;
    }
    int len = input1.ToString().Length;
    if (len == 1) {
      if (neg < 0)
        return input1 * -1;
      else
        return input1;
    } else {
      int sum = 0;
      while (input1 != 0) {
        int rem = input1 % 10;
        sum += rem;
        input1 /= 10;
      }
      if (neg < 0)
        return digitSum(sum * -1);
      else
        return digitSum(sum);
    }
  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/b55d1714

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int EvenDigitsSum(int input1) {
    int sum = 0;
    while (input1 != 0) {
      int n = input1 % 10;
      if (n % 2 == 0)
        sum += n;
      input1 /= 10;
    }
    return sum;
  }
}

public class UserMainCode {
  public int OddDigitsSum(int input1) {
    int sum = 0;
    while (input1 != 0) {
      int n = input1 % 10;
      if (n % 2 != 0)
        sum += n;
      input1 /= 10;
    }
    return sum;
  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/a05abbcf

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int EvenOddDigitsSum(int input1, string input2) {
    int sum = 0;
    if (input2 == "even") {
      while (input1 != 0) {
        int n = input1 % 10;
        if (n % 2 == 0)
          sum += n;
        input1 /= 10;
      }
    } else {
      while (input1 != 0) {
        int n = input1 % 10;
        if (n % 2 != 0)
          sum += n;
        input1 /= 10;
      }
    }
    return sum;
  }
}

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531103925.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int isPalinNum(int input1) {
    string str = input1.ToString();
    int len = str.Length;
    string str1 = "";
    for (int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
      str1 += str[i];
    }
    if (str == str1)
      return 2;
    else
      return 1;
  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/f4fdb02

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531104007.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int isPalinNumPossible(int input1) {
    string str = input1.ToString();
    int[] count = new int[10];

    // initializing all values to zero
    for (int i = 0; i < count.Length; i++)
      count[i] = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < str.Length; i++)
      count[(int) Char.GetNumericValue(str[i])]++;

    int odd = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
      if ((count[i] % 2) != 0)
        odd++;
      if (odd > 1)
        return 1;
    }
    return 2;
  }
}

- [ ] ```

- [ ] 

==https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/be582d9f==

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531104756.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int createPIN(int input1, int input2, int input3) {
    int[] arr = {
      input1,
      input2,
      input3
    };
    int max = 0, min;
    double sum = 0.0;
    double place = 1.0;
    int num;
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
      num = arr[i];
      while (num != 0) {
        int r = num % 10;
        if (r > max)
          max = r;
        num = num / 10;
      }
    }
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
      min = 99;
      for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
        int rem = arr[j] % 10;
        if (rem < min)
          min = rem;
        arr[j] /= 10;
      }
      sum = (min + (sum / place));
      sum *= place;
      place *= 10;
    }
    return (int)(max * 1000 + sum);
  }
}

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public string secondwordUpperCase(string input1) {
    string[] strArray = input1.Split(' ');

    string stt = "LESS";
    if (strArray.Length == 1) {
      return stt;
    }

    return strArray[1].ToUpper();
  }
}

using System;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int isPalindrome(string input1) {
    string str = input1.ToLower();
    string str1 = "";
    for (int i = str.Length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
      str1 += str[i];
    }
    if (str == str1)
      return 2;
    else
      return 1;
  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/387952fc

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531105009.png)
>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531105029.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int weightOfString(string input1, int input2) {
    string str = input1.ToUpper();
    int sum = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < input1.Length; i++) {
      if (input2 == 0) {
        if (str[i] == 'A' || str[i] == 'E' || str[i] == 'I' || str[i] == 'O' || str[i] == 'U' || !Char.IsLetter(str[i])) {
          continue;
        } else {
          int a = str[i] - 64;
          sum += a;
        }
      } else {
        if (!Char.IsLetter(str[i]))
          continue;
        else {
          int a = str[i] - 64;
          sum += a;
        }
      }
    }
    return sum;

  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/916310b8


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int Most FrequentDigit(int input1, int input2, int input3, int input4) {
    int[] arr = {
      input1,
      input2,
      input3,
      input4
    };
    int[] temp = new int[10];
    int num;
    for (int i = 0; i < arr.Length; i++) {
      num = arr[i];
      while (num != 0) {
        int n = num % 10;
        temp[n]++;
        num /= 10;
      }
    }
    int max = -1;
    int x = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < temp.Length; i++) {
      if (temp[i] >= max) {
        max = temp[i];
        x = i;
      }
    }
    return x;
  }
}

- [ ] ```

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/e4df74e5

![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531105214.png)
![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531105232.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int findStringCode(string input1) {
    string str = input1.ToUpper();
    string[] word = str.Split(' ');
    string value2 = "";

    for (int i = 0; i < word.Length; i++) {
      int sum = 0;

      for (int j = 0; j < word[i].Length / 2; j++) {
        int first = word[i][j];
        int last = word[i][word[i].Length - 1 - j];
        sum += Math.Abs(first - last);
      }
      if (word[i].Length % 2 != 0)
        sum += (word[i][word[i].Length / 2] - 64);
      string value = sum.ToString();
      value2 += value;
    }

    return Int32.Parse(value2);

  }
}

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/75c9faf0

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int getCode ThroughStrings(string input1) {
    string[] word = input1.Split(' ');
    int sum = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < word.Length; i++) {
      sum += word[i].Length;
    }
    return (1 + (sum - 1) % 9);
  }
}
