To create the template that shows all patient appointment bookings, you should do the following: • Create a Microsoft Word template for the Patient table and add the 1-to-many relationship with the Booking table to get all related appointments. • Upload the document as a Word template. You should not convert the Word document to Excel. You can upload a Word file directly to the system. You should not select the Booking table and add the relationship with the Patient table when you want to show all patient appointments. The file will contain information about all patients that have a booking, but not about all bookings for the patient.

Question 157

To create the Excel template for managers and display this information on a chart, you should perform the following actions in order: Add formulas for calculating revenue. Add the chart to the template. Select the Refresh data when opening file option in Excel. Allow managers to use the new template. First you should add the formula to the Excel file to summarize the revenue for all departments. Next, you should add the chart to the Excel template that will build graphics based on the data you receive from the Dataverse. Then, you should select the Refresh data when opening file option in Excel. You should enable this option in Excel to allow the users to have up-to-date information when they open their Excel files. Finally, you should share the uploaded template with the managers to allow them to work with the template. You should not create an SSRS report when you create an Excel template. SSRS is a server-based reporting system. It requires custom development and is not related to creating Excel templates. You cannot group records and perform any calculations for them using classic workflows. For this purpose, you need to implement some custom plug-in or action. The document can be visible only for managers, so you cannot share it with all users.

Question 158

You should update the column length in either the default or the unmanaged solution and publish only the Contact table without publishing the whole solution. If you publish all customization, the changes from other entities will apply to the environment. When you want to publish only specific changes, you need to publish a specific table. If you edit the column length on the Contact table but publish changes on the Account table, the changes will not be applied to the environment.

Question 159

You should add a form, a connection role, and a choice to the solution. These are all components that are solution-aware and can be added to a solution. You should not add a word template to the solution. Word templates are not solution-aware. You should not add a duplicate detection rule to the solution. Duplicate detection rules cannot be included in solutions and are not solution-aware.

Question 160

You should add an email template to the solution. This is the only template type that can be added to a solution. All the other templates are not solution-aware and cannot be included in a solution.

Question 161

To remove components of unmanaged solutions from a Power Platform environment, you need to manually remove every single customization. You should not delete the environment in the Power Platform admin center. Once you delete the environment, you will lose everything, including data and configurations. There is no way to restore the removed instance again. Installing the previous version of an unmanaged solution or changing the version number just changes the version number of the solution on environment. It does not remove a customization of the newer version.

Question 162

In order to export and import a solution only with custom tables and some custom columns added to the Account table, you need to perform the following actions: Create a new custom table in the new solution. Include the Account table in the solution. Add new custom columns to the Account table. Microsoft does not recommend renaming the unused tables to use as a customization. You should create a new table from scratch if needed. You should not create the custom table in the default solution and add appropriate columns, views, and forms to the Account table. You cannot export the default solution.

Question 163

You should use a managed solution with a custom publisher. You should use a managed solution when it will work as a third-party component. This will allow the end user to remove the solution from the system with all related customizations. A custom publisher has a unique prefix that allows you to understand what solution the components are part of. You should not select the default publisher in combination with any type of solutions. The default publisher has the prefix: new. When two or more different solutions use the default publisher, you will not know which solution the component is part of. You should not use an unmanaged solution if you want to deliver functionality to other systems. Users will not be able to remove customizations completely by removing the solution.

Question 164

Solution A will cause errors and prevent the solution from importing. A dependent component that is missing from a solution will cause an error when importing. This often happens when a field is created in another solution (or the default solution) and another consultant adds the fields to the form and adds the form to the solution. Solution B will not result in errors that prevent the solution from importing. A field that has been deleted will not cause an error on import. Managed and Unmanaged solutions behave differently with deleted fields. Solution C will not result in errors that prevent the solution from importing. A workflow that references a record not in the target system will raise a Warning, the workflow will be in Draft, but the import will not error on import. This scenario often occurs when using queues or teams or assigning to users. Although names might be the same, the Globally Unique Identifiers (GUIDs) of the records might be different, and thus the workflow cannot find the record. Solution D will not result in errors that prevent the solution from importing. A solution previously imported as Unmanaged will not cause an error when imported as Managed. The user will, however, be prompted to convert the solution and its components to managed. Note that if the solution had been imported as Managed, trying to import as Unmanaged will error and stop the import.

Question 165

Solution components cannot be moved from one publisher to another publisher. When a component is created it belongs to the publisher for the solution in which it was created. You cannot change the publisher for a component. An existing solution component can be added to a solution that belongs to a different publisher. It is possible to add an existing component created by one publisher into another solution owned by a different publisher. However, the component's publisher may have restricted the changes that can be made to the component with managed properties. You can change the publisher prefix after the publisher has been created. The prefix on the publisher can be edited but the prefix on any component that was previously created for the publisher will not be changed. New components created for the publisher will use the latest prefix.

Question 166

The Run a Child flow action is only available for flows created inside a solution. Both the parent and child flows must be in the same solution. You can then add the Run a Child flow action to the parent flow and call the child flow. This action is not available if the flow is not inside the solution. To run a flow from a canvas app that is in a solution, the flow must also be in the solution. Power Automate instant flows that are run from a canvas app must be in the same solution as the canvas app. You cannot add a flow from outside a solution. Power Automate flows that are in a solution cannot be monitored from the Teams Flows list. Flows that are in a solution are not visible under My Flows or Team Flows and can only be viewed from inside the solution.

Question 167

Only the Power Platform CLI has the ability to create a new solution. The Power Platform Build Tools are concerned with moving solutions between environments. The Solution Packager adds existing solution files into a package and cannot create a new solution. The Power Platform CLI has the ability to export a solution from a Dataverse environment. The Package Deployer is used to deploy packaged solutions to an environment and does not export solutions. The Solution Packager adds existing solution files into a package and cannot export a solution. The Power Platform Build Tools has the ability to unpack a zipped solution file into multiple XML files for each component. This is typically so that the files can be added to a source code control system. The Package Deployer is used to deploy packaged solutions to an environment and does not unpack solution files.

Question 168

You should not edit the managed solution provided by the ISV. Managed solutions cannot be edited. You should not create a new managed solution and add the table to the solution. You cannot create a managed solution. When created, solutions are unmanaged. You should not change the managed properties of the entity. You cannot change the managed properties of a component from a managed solution. You should request the ISV to make the changes. The ISV can supply a new updated solution including the changes. You could also create an unmanaged solution and add the table to the solution. New columns can be added in an unmanaged solution to a custom entity from a managed solution.

Question 169

You should use a managed solution. This is the only option that will allow the changes to be uninstalled. You should not use the Default solution. The Default solution contains every component in your Common Data Service environment. The Default solution is special and cannot be deleted. The Default solution cannot be exported. You should not use the Common Data Services Default solution. This solution is designed for quick changes where there is not a deeper knowledge of solutions. This solution is good for personal projects but not when customization activities need to be coordinated. You should not use an unmanaged solution. An unmanaged solution cannot roll back the changes applied by the solution.

Question 170

You should set the child property to allow a Dataverse classic workflow to be initiated by another classic workflow. Setting the on-demand, real-time, and background properties will have no effect as to whether the workflow can be called from another workflow. You should set the Dataverse classic workflow to run in real-time if the results are to be visible immediately. If the classic workflow is set to background, the user will need to wait and refresh their screen to see the results. On-demand simply defines whether the workflow can be run by the user manually from within a form. The real-time or background setting determines if the results are visible immediately or not. Setting the child property will have no effect on the visibility of the results. You should set the Dataverse classic workflow to run in the background if there are any wait steps in the workflow. A real-time classic workflow cannot have any wait steps. Setting the child or on-demand properties does not determine whether a wait step can be used. You should set the on-demand property to allow the Dataverse classic workflow to be called as a step in a business process flow. Setting the child, real-time, or background properties has no effect as to whether the workflow can be used in a business process flow.

Question 171

You should perform the following actions: Create an advanced find view on the Process Sessions entity. Deactivate the workflow. Edit the workflow. Select the Keep Logs for workflow jobs that encountered errors option. Activate the workflow. You should look in Process Sessions for real-time workflows. Process Sessions has a record for each real-time workflow that is run. Process sessions is not in the SiteMap, so you will need to create a view to see the errors for the workflow using Advanced Find. You should deactivate the workflow. You must deactivate the workflow to be able to edit it. You should edit the workflow so you can change its options. You should select the Keep Logs for workflow jobs that encountered errors option in the workflow. Process sessions are automatically deleted if they are successful by default, so you need to enable this option to see the logs for each workflow you want to monitor. You should activate the workflow so that it runs. You should not look in System Jobs. System Jobs has a record for every background workflow that is run. System jobs are not used by real-time workflows. You should not look in plug-in trace logs. Plug-in trace logs are where the logs for plugin code are stored. It will not have logs for real-time workflows unless the workflow uses .NET assembly code. You should not look in Power Platform analytics. Power Platform analytics records the number of executions of each workflow and the number of errors, not the details of any error. You should not change the workflow to run in the background. Just changing the workflow to run in the background will not enable you to monitor because the system jobs that are created will still be deleted.

Question 172

You should use a managed solution to protect your intellectual property. A managed solution cannot be repackaged and exported as a different solution. You should also use a managed solution to enable rollback. A managed solution can be deleted, and its components will be uninstalled. You should use an unmanaged solution to allow the components to be changed. An unmanaged solution simply adds and overwrites the components in default solution.

Question 173

In order to view component changes, you should access solution layers and select the relevant property details. You should not use solution history. Solution history contains information about solution operations (import, export, delete) but not the solution components. You should not use solution checker. Solution checker analyzes your solutions against a set of best practice rules but does not track changed components. You should not use solution segmentation. Solution segmentation is an approach to creating solution patches in order to transfer minor updates of a parent solution.

Question 174

You should use Upgrade. This allows you to update the solution without components that are not part of the new version of the solution. You should not use Stage for upgrade. With this option, you would have two solutions: an old one and a new one. This option is used when you want to migrate some data from one solution to another. You should not use Update. With this option, the components from the old version of the solution would be included in the new version. You should not use Overwrite customization. Overwrite customization is a customization option, not a solution option.

Question 175

You should use 3.6.0.1 as the version number. When you use clone a solution, you are able to change the first two numbers. The second number will increment automatically. There are no requirements to change the version of the Power Platform environment, so the first number should not be changed. When you clone the patch, you must update the last two numbers of the solution.

Question 176

You should check the Stage for Upgrade solution action when you want to keep two solutions in the system to do data migrations before you complete the importing process. You need to select the Overwrite customizations option when you want to be able to keep all old customizations until you apply the solution upgrade manually. You would need to select Apply solution upgrade after the solution has been imported. You should not select the Maintain customizations option if you want to upgrade the solution completely. This option allows you to maintain the unmanaged components that were applied to the solution that is already in use. Some upgrades within the new version of the solution related to those components will not be applied. When you do not select Stage for Upgrade, your system will apply changes to the old version of the solution regarding the selected import option.

Question 177

You should use an environment variable. Environment variables hold key-value pairs that can change from one environment to another. You configure an environment variable to hold configuration data such as the URL for the internal system and then can reference it from canvas apps and Power Automate flows. When you transport the solution into another environment, you can edit the environment variable in one place and the apps and flows will use the updated value. You should not use Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault is used to store secrets such as passwords, not configuration data such as URLs. You should not use a connection reference. Connection references connect a user account to a connector and are used to streamline the use of connections when flows are transported between environments. They do not hold configuration data such as the URL the connection uses. You should not use the unsecure configuration in a plug-in. The unsecure configuration in a plug-in step is a way to pass configuration data to a plug-in. You have to manually edit the unsecure configuration for each environment and it is therefore not suitable for application lifecycle management processes. Additionally, unsecure configuration cannot be accessed or used by in a Power Automate cloud flow.

Question 178

You should first create a connection reference. Connection references separate the connection from the connector and enable the connection reference to be updated as part of the application lifecycle management process. When an app or a flow is created in a solution, it will reuse the existing connection reference. By creating connection references before you create apps and flows, you will reduce the effort required when transporting solutions. You should not create a connection. Connections are specific to an environment and if you use connections in flows, you will need to edit the flow after importing it into the flow and update all the connections in the flow. You should not create an environment variable. Environment variables hold key-value pairs that can change from one environment to another. They are used for configuration data that changes between environments. They do not hold connection or authentication information. You should not create a custom connector. Custom connectors are used to connect to external systems with APIs.

Question 179

You should trigger the workflow when the email row is created. The Email table in Microsoft Dataverse is responsible for e-mails. When the Power Platform receives a new e-mail message, it creates a new e-mail record. You should also check if the email direction property is Incoming. The Direction column shows whether a record comes from external systems (Direction = ‘Incoming’) or is being sent to the external world (Direction = ‘Outgoing’). You should add a step for the email creation if the condition is met. When all conditions above are met, you must add a new step to create the auto-reply e-mail for the message that is just received. You should not add a wait condition for this workflow. The system does not wait for any conditions to be met before processing any of the steps that complete the creation process. You should not set up an email signature. This not a part of workflow creation. You need to set this up when you create an email template.

Question 180

You should choose the Static Analysis Results Interchange Format (SARIF) format. This is a standard format for the output of static analysis tools. You should not choose the eXtensible Markup Language (XML), Tab Separated Values (TSV), or YAML Ain’t Markup Language (YAML) formats. These are not used by the checker tools.

Question 181

You should perform the following steps in order: Enable the other languages in your environment. From the Actions toolbar in the solution, select Export Translations. Add the translated text to the exported XML file. From the Actions toolbar in the solution, select Import Translations. To create translations for custom tables and columns, forms, views and option sets, you need to first enable the languages in your environment. You should then click on Export Translations from within the solution. This downloads all the strings for the labels for all enabled languages into a zip file. You should then edit the XML file contained in the zip file by using Excel and enter the translated text. Alternatively, you can send the XML to a specialist translation agency or use The Microsoft Dynamics 365 (DTS) Translation Service in Lifecycle Services (LCS). Finally, you should import the translated file using the Import Translations menu option in the solution. You should not update the form labels with the translated text. This will change the labels for the existing users. You should not update the display names on the columns with the translated text. This will change the display names for the existing users. You should not create a web resource to change the labels at runtime. This will require extensive JavaScript that will need to be maintained for every change.

Question 182

You should add US Dollars to Currencies in the Power Platform admin center. Microsoft Dataverse includes multi-currency capabilities. You need to add currencies and their exchange rates in relation to the currency that was defined when the environment was created, known as the base currency. Users can then select the currency from the list of currencies added to the system. All monetary amounts are automatically converted and stored in the base currency column. You should not enable the US English language. The language and currency features are not associated with each other. You should not configure regional options. Regional options control how dates and money amounts are formatted. They do not add additional currencies to the system. You should not create a choice column for currencies and add Euros and US Dollars. Dataverse contains multi-currency capabilities, and you would need to add processing to convert from one currency to another.

Question 183

You should add US Dollars to Currencies in the Power Platform admin center. Microsoft Dataverse includes multi-currency capabilities. You need to add currencies and their exchange rates in relation to the currency that was defined when the environment was created, known as the base currency. Users can then select the currency from the list of currencies added to the system. All monetary amounts are automatically converted and stored in the base currency column.\n\nYou should not enable the US English language. The language and currency features are not associated with each other.\n\nYou should not configure regional options. Regional options control how dates and money amounts are formatted. They do not add additional currencies to the system.\n\nYou should not create a choice column for currencies and add Euros and US Dollars. Dataverse contains multi-currency capabilities, and you would need to add processing to convert from one currency to another.\n

PL 400 - Edited.md

Question 1

How can you configure the event handler, when the library does not contain the function ?

Answer

You should add a JavaScript web resource to the JavaScript library.

Question 2

How can you add a custom command button to a Dynamics 365 page ?

Answer

Expand the “new.department.EnableRule.EntityRule” enable rule to check that the EntityLogicalName is the same as the current entity you are in.

Question 3

How to create a custom connector that retrieves data from the APIs of the third party companies.

Answer

You should configure OpenAPI and authentication model. You can use a file or a URL to define OpenAPI.

Question 4

How to retrieve customer feedback by creating an Azure Function using JSON format ?

Answer

You should import a RESTful API and create an API definition.

Question 5

How to authenticate Azure Stream Analytics ?

Answer

Access the Managed Identity option, log in using your Power BI account, set the Authentication mode to Managed Identity and click Save.

Question 6

Which application pattern will benefit from the durable function used?

Answer

The Human interaction pattern benefits from the durable function used.

Question 7

What authentication type can ensure that employees can access the Customer self-service portal to raise a request on behalf of the customer.

Answer

They should use Azure Active Directory.

Question 8

How to retrieve and transform data from applications to Microsoft Dataverse ?

Answer

You should use WebHook and Azure Function.

Question 9

How to migrate documents to Microsoft Dataverse associating them with the relevant customer without consuming much database memory ?

Answer

You should use SharePoint, Console application and WEB API. The Console application as a one time activity, will create a hierarchy of folders in SharePoint. WEB API makes the connection with Dynamics 365 and also to retrieve the unique identifier, like customer GUID.

Question 10

How to check that the role assigned to logged-in mobile users ?

Answer

Register with Azure AD app and then call Custom Connector in Canvas app to retrieve the role assigned.

Question 11

You need to use the components that enable the customers to track their order shipment status without interacting with any employee.

Which two components should you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Answer

You should use Power Virtual Agent. Power Virtual Agent is one of the components provided by Microsoft that allows developers to build Chat BOTs. You can embed this in any external website or PowerApps Portal. In those external websites or PowerApps Portal, customers can chat with a BOT and check information such as order status, shipment status, cancellation request, refund request, etc. Power Virtual Agent can call Power Automate in the background to collect the information from Microsoft Dataverse and show it to the customer.

You can also use PowerApps Portals. PowerApps Portals is a component provided by Microsoft for the external audience. Customers can raise inquiries, requests, and complaints through the Portal. They can also track their shipment history and order tracking.

You should not use Omnichannel. Omnichannel is a type of component that allows customers to directly chat with live agents or employees.

You should not use Business Process Flow. Business Process flow is a Dynamics 365 component that allows Dynamics 365 internal users to track the sales process and stages. However, it cannot be used for an external audience.

You should not use the Unified Service Desk. Unified Service Desk is a component provided by Microsoft only for an organization's internal service desk users to interact with customers via call, email, chat, etc.

Question 12

You are integrating the Microsoft Dataverse Sales Hub with your company's website through a third-party API. Your company has the following requirements:
You should be able to create leads in Dataverse generated from various data sources.
You should be able to aggregate lead data submitted from different sources and transform them into Microsoft Dataverse format.
The developers should be able to write and execute the code locally on their machines.
You should be able to troubleshoot and monitor the integration using Application Insights.
Solution: Use Azure Logic Apps.

Does the solution meet the goal?

Answer

This solution does not meet the goal. Azure Logic Apps can be used to create lead data in Microsoft Dataverse. However, aggregating data from various source systems and transforming them into Dataverse format using Azure Logic Apps is complex and requires code to write the logic. Also, Azure Logic Apps is a workflow-based cloud service that cannot run locally on a developer machine. You need to have access to Azure Portal in order to design the Logic Apps. Logic Apps has its own workflow monitor to track the status (success/failure) of the last job and it has no out-of-box (OOB) integration with Application Insight.

Question 13

Solution: Use Power Automate.

Does the solution meet the goal?

Answer

This solution does not meet the goal. Power Automate is a workflow-based cloud service that is intended for Office 365 users and business profiles who do not have a coding background and who want to automate business processes without writing code. Power Automate can be used to create lead data in Dataverse. However, aggregating data from various source systems and transforming them in Dataverse format using Power Automate is complex and requires code to write the logic. Also, Power Automate is a workflow-based cloud service that cannot run locally on a developer machine. You need to have access to the Power Automate portal in order to design the workflow. Power Automate has its own workflow monitor to track the status of the last run and no out-of-box (OOB) integration with Application Insight.

Question 14

Solution: Use Azure Functions.

Does the solution meet the goal?

Answer

This solution meets the goal. Azure Functions is an event-driven serverless solution that allows you to write the code that handles complex integration. Durable functions are an extension of Azure Functions that allow the following application patterns to simplify complex integrations, logics, and data transformation:
Function chaining
Fan-out/fan-in
Async HTTP APIs
Monitoring
Human interaction
Aggregator (stateful entities)
Azure Functions is the best fit to run and troubleshoot the code locally on the developer machine without being logged in to the Azure portal. Azure Functions has out-of-box (OOB) integration with Application Insights to monitor the code runs.

Question 15

You work in the data security department of one of the branches at your company. Your branch invites colleagues from an overseas branch to work with you on a certain project that will last for 80 days. The colleagues from other branches are going to use their personal devices that are not included in your intranet. Because the colleagues are going to access sensitive data in your branch, your manager asks you to elevate the security policies for their accounts by setting appropriate authentication.

You need to add multi-factor authentication (MFA) for these colleagues.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

Answer

You should not set a time limit of 366 days for the users to trust their devices. The permitted range for this limit is one to 365 days. When a device is made a trusted device, device users will not need to enter a security code every time they need to access confidential information. This will make it easier for them to access the data quickly and safely.

You should not skip MFA for requests received from federated users on your intranet. Federated users are users that work in the same company but in another branch. This option does not meet the requirement because the users from overseas are using personal devices that are not included in your intranet. This means that not applying the authentication method on their devices will endanger your branch’s data.

You should choose the Text Message to Phone option and the Notification Through a Mobile App option as verification methods. With this option, colleagues will receive a verification code that they need to insert into their device to verify. They will also receive a notification on their mobile app. This is a necessary step to elevate the colleagues' security policies. These verification methods are preferred over other methods. A person's mobile phone contains a lot of personal information and both verification methods are complicated enough to protect the data from getting stolen.

Question 16

You are an IT consultant at a school that collects student data from several sources and combines them in an excel sheet on an old computer. The number of students is increasing rapidly and the records of the students are getting more complicated to handle. The principal contacts you for assistance. You suggest creating a workflow to make things easier when collecting data and give the principal instructions about creating the flow using his mobile phone.

You need to create a workflow using a mobile phone workflow service.

What procedure should you recommend?

Answer

You should create a workflow using Power Automate. Power Automate is easy to use and will allow you to create and use workflows on a mobile phone whether your mobile phone runs Android, iOS, Windows, etc.

You should not create a workflow using Logic Apps. Logic Apps are not supported as a mobile app for iOS and Android and would require a computer.

You should not create a workflow using Power BI. Power BI is an analytics service that depends on business intelligence functionalities. For example, it is used in airports to track performance and critical data related to flights. This does not match the requirement and is more complicated to use than Power Automate.

You should not create a workflow using SharePoint. This option only displays data, it does not support creating workflows.

Question 17

A company uses a model-driven app that integrates with an external application to display news and events to Dynamics 365 users. You are asked to design a reusable low-code/no-code component that makes it easier for the users to view the information in the model-driven app, Microsoft Teams, and PowerApps portals.

You need to design the component.

What component should you create to meet the requirements?

Answer

You should create a canvas app. A canvas app is a low-code/no-code component of Power Platform that can be used to display external data using its default controls and connectors. Canvas apps can also be embedded in model-driven apps, PowerApps portals, and Microsoft Teams.

You should not use a Power Apps component framework (PCF) control. You can use PCF controls to design a code-based reusable component. You can embed a PCF control in model-driven apps and Microsoft Teams but not in Power Apps portals.

You should not use a web resource. You can use web resources to design a code-based reusable component. You can embed web resources in model-driven apps and Microsoft Teams but not in Power Apps portals. Power Apps portals do not use the Dynamics 365 XRM Object model to write the script and design the User Interface (UI).

You should not use IFrame. IFrame is not a low-code/no-code component and requires web resources and HTML code to display information. Also, IFrame is designed for a model-driven app and cannot be used in Microsoft Teams and Power Apps portals.

Question 18

CompanyA operates in different regions and the currency exchange rate varies on a daily basis. The company plans to integrate the currency exchange rate API from a third-party provider.
You need to design a custom connector that retrieves the latest exchange rates for all currencies.
Which three components should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should use an OpenAPI deﬁnition to create a custom connector because you need to define API operations to connect with the third-party provider. OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) is an API description format for REST APIs.

You should also use an authentication type on the security page to choose how to authenticate the API call. You must configure the authentication type when you are creating a custom connector because it allows you to secure your connector using different authentication methods. It also allows you to connect to different instances under the same tenant. The following four types of authentication methods can be used within custom connectors: No authentication, Basic authentication, API Key, OAuth 2.0.

You should use an HTTP verb to specify the operation that you want to connect to the API. An HTTP verb deﬁnes a set of request methods that indicate which actions need to be performed for a given resource. These request methods are also known as HTTP verbs. GET, DELETE, PATCH, POST, and PUT are examples of HTTP verbs.

You should not use a test connector. When you use an API key, it takes time for the test connector to connect to the defined API and testing the connector immediately will not work as expected. After you have created the connector, you can test the connector using the test connector option to ensure that it is working properly.
You should not use an app registration. You use an app registration to create a custom connector for Azure functions that are secured via Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). App registrations provide permission to custom connectors when calling an Azure function.

Question 19

CompanyA uses Dynamics 365 for Sales. The company's sales representatives complain that there are many open opportunities in the system and that they cannot close opportunities when they have active or draft quotes associated to them. They want to close opportunities in bulk using the Advanced Find feature.

You need to create a custom workflow activity to achieve this.
Which five steps should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following actions in order:
Write custom C# code to close active and draft quotes and to close the opportunity.
Build the code using Visual Studio and register the assembly using the Plugin Registration Tool.
Create a workflow and configure it to be run on demand.
Add a new step and choose the assembly file.
Save and activate the workflow.
You should first write custom C# code in Visual Studio to create a custom workflow activity that closes all active and draft quotes. You need to write custom C# code to change the status and the status reasons of the quotes that are in active or draft state and to close the opportunity.

Next, you should build the code using Visual Studio and register the assembly in Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE) using the Plugin Registration Tool.

Next, you should create a workflow and configure it to be run on demand. You can create workflows from the Customization menu in Dynamics 365 CE.

Then, you should add the assembly file as a step in the out-of-the-box workflow. You can add multiple steps to a workflow to perform actions. To use custom C# code inside workflows, you have to add the assembly file.

Finally, you should save the workflow and activate it. Workflows need to be in the active state.
You should not build the code using Visual Studio and register the assembly using XrmToolBox because XrmToolBox is an open source tool with add-ons available for different use cases. To register assemblies in Dynamics 365 CE, you have to add the Plugin Registration Tool to XrmToolBox and then use the Plugin Registration Tool.
You should not use Advanced Find to filter and close the opportunities. If you want to close the opportunities in bulk, you should move all the associated quotes from the draft or active state.

Question 20

You are designing a Power Apps canvas app for a healthcare organization. The organization has no professional developers and low code/no code components such as a welcome screen, a header, and a footer.

You need to reuse those components in other canvas apps.

Which feature should you use?

Answer

You should use the component library. You can use this feature to design components for your canvas apps that can be reused in other canvas apps. If you create a component library for header and footer controls, you can use them in the canvas app for the healthcare organization and reuse them in other canvas apps as well. The component library provides a low-code/no-code solution to design the reusable component for canvas apps, unlike PCF controls.

You should not use a component. A component can be used to design a reusable component for a single canvas app only. You cannot reuse it for other canvas apps.

You should not use a custom component (PCF controls). You can use PowerApps Component Framework (PCF) to design reusable components in a canvas app. However, PCF is for a professional developer or someone with extensive knowledge of JavaScript and TypeScript. In this scenario, you have to design a low code/no code component, so PCF control is not the best option. PCF controls in canvas apps are currently in PREVIEW mode according to Microsoft, therefore, they should be used for experimental purposes only.

You should not use IFrame. IFrame is not directly supported in canvas apps. You also need to create PCF controls in order to embed an IFrame in your canvas app.

Question 21

You are creating a custom connector for an API. You reach the last step of the process during which you need to test the connector. An error message that says operation failed (500) is displayed.

You need to identify the cause of the error and correctly create the custom connector.

Which field(s) should you review in the swagger to solve the problem?

Answer

You should review the Path and Host fields. Swagger is a tool for describing and documenting RESTful APIs. The operation failed (500) error is most commonly caused by an invalid expression value in these two fields. To correct the mistake, the path field should begin with / and be followed by a string value. In Swagger terms, endpoints (resources) that are exposed by your API are called Paths. Hosts define the base URLs on the root level of the API specification.

You should not review the Schemes field. This field defines the transfer protocol of the Application Programming Interface (API). This will not produce this error when testing the custom connector. The values of the transfer protocol must include one of the following: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP), Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS), WebSocket (WS), and WebSocket Secure (WSS).

You should not review the Consumes field. This is a list of Multipurpose Internet Mail Extension (MIME) types that APIs can consume. Not defining this field will not lead to the error mentioned in the scenario.

You should not review the Definitions field. This field holds the data types that are produced and consumed by the process of creating the custom connector. It is not related to the Path and Host fields. An error in this field will not lead to the error mentioned in the scenario.

Question 22

Your manager asks you to create a canvas app using Power Apps to help important guests from abroad visiting your company. The main components of the application are based on geographical assistance and taxi services. You have to show the locations of the guests when they are on a tour so that your security department can make sure they are safe at all times.

You need to add an interactive map component to your application to show the location of the users.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following steps in order:
Access the Insert tab then expand Media.
Choose the Map component then turn on Show current location.
Insert Location.Latitude under the Current location latitude property.
Insert Location.Longitude under the Current location longitude property.
First, you should open Power Apps then access the Insert tab, which is used to insert components, then expand the Media section that contains several components that can be used in the canvas app.

Next, you should choose the Map component, which will be placed in the middle of the app’s display by default, then turn on the Show Current Location option to start monitoring the settings that allow the application to show the current location of the guests.

Then you should insert Location.Latitude under the Current location latitude property to configure the location latitude of the guest.

Finally, you should insert Location.Longitude under the Current location longitude property to configure the location longitude of the guest.

You should not access the Custom Maps Options box. This option does not meet the requirement. It is used to insert a background picture when creating a custom map in Power Map.

You should not configure the ItemLatitudes option. This option does not meet the requirement and will not show the current location of the user. You should set this option to TestData.Latitude to add pins using data from Excel.

You should not choose the Address input component. This does not meet the requirement. This component is required in the process of adding an address input component, but it does not determine the current location of a user. The address input component allows you to view dynamic address suggestions while typing. It makes it easier to add addresses, especially when using a mobile phone.

Question 23

You are designing a Power Apps portal for a retail company. The company uses this portal for support and FAQ purposes and wants to integrate it with their main website.

You need to customize the portal's out-of-box login page so that it matches the UI of the main website.

Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order

Answer

You should perform the actions in the following order:
Create a content snippet for the login page.
Change the content snippet type to HTML.
Write Script/HTML in the content snippet.
Save the configuration.
Sync the configuration from the Power Apps portals Studio.
To customize the out-of-box login page of the portal, you should first create a new content snippet record with the name Account/SignIn/PageCopy. A content snippet is a Power Apps portal component that allows you to manage the content of the portal and to customize default portal pages like login, registration, etc.

Next, you should change the content snippet type to HTML so that you can write HTML/CSS/Script in the content editor. By default, the content snippet type is set to Value, which is used to display any message/label on the portal.

Then you should write the HTML/CSS/Script in the content snippet content editor in order to customize the login page as required.

Once you are done with the content snippet configuration, you should save the configuration.

Finally, you should sync the configuration from the Power Apps portals Studio in order to synchronize the latest changes in Dataverse. Until recently, you had to clear the portal cache in order to get the updated Microsoft Dataverse data on the portal. You can now use Microsoft's Power App portals Studio, which allows developers to directly edit the portal's User Interface (UI) along with a new feature named Sync Configuration. This feature immediately synchronizes the latest portal configuration changes in Dataverse to the Power Apps portal.

You should not create a login webpage. This is not a necessary step in this scenario. Portal has its own login page that is customizable using content snippets.

You should not create a new webpage and write HTML/Script to customize the default login page. A new webpage for login may be required if you do not want to use an out-of-box portal login page and want to create your own custom login page instead.

You should not restart the portal to sync the configuration on the portal. Restart is only needed when you have made changes to the portal admin center configuration, such as enabling diagnostic logging, updating Dynamics 365 URL, enabling/disabling custom error, etc.

Question 24

CompanyA is using a canvas application to manage employee information.

You need to add a Power BI report to the canvas application screen showing employee turnover.
Which six steps should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should complete the following actions in order:
Select the Charts dropdown from the Power Apps menu.
Select the Power BI tile option from the dropdown.
In Power BI service, open the report and click on the ellipsis icon.
Choose Embed from the dropdown and select Website or portal.
Copy the link to embed the report.
Use the link in TileUrl property of the Power BI tile inside Power Apps.
You should select the Charts dropdown from the Power Apps menu. This dropdown is a control that allows you to add line charts, pie charts, bar charts and Power BI tiles.

You should select the Power BI tile option from the dropdown. This allows you to add your existing data analysis and reports inside your app from Power BI. Power BI tile is simply a container for Power BI content.

You should open the report and click on the ellipsis icon in Power BI to look for options to embed the Power BI report in an external website or portal.

You should choose Embed from the dropdown and select Website or portal. This will provide you with the link to embed the report in your app.

You should copy the link to embed the report in a different application.

You should use the link in the TileUrl property of Power BI tile inside Power Apps. The TileUrl is the URL of your Power BI tile that you can extend with filters.

You should not copy the HTML code. The HTML code is used inside blogs or web pages to show the Power BI report.
You should not choose the Media dropdown from the Power Apps menu. The Media dropdown allows you to insert images, videos, barcodes and so on.

Question 25

CompanyA is using Dynamics 365 for Sales and Power Apps portals as a page view capacity add-on to allow unauthenticated access to external users.

You need to apply custom logic using JavaScript code on Power Apps portals to show notifications to external users.
Which portal entity should you use to write custom JavaScript for the Power Apps portals?

Answer

You should use the Web Form Step entity. In Power Apps portals, web forms have steps. These steps have some common properties, including the name of the step and the name of the form with which the step is associated. The Web Form Step entity contains a field named Custom JavaScript that is used to write custom JavaScript.
You should not use a Web Form entity. A Web Form entity allows you to add branching logic and to add multiple entity forms to a single web form.
You should not use a Web Page entity. A Web Page entity has a particular URL for each record and forms the hierarchy of a website using parent and child relationships.
You should not use a Web Form Metadata entity. A Web Form Metadata entity enables you to add further configurations like predefining certain values and enhancing field styles.

Question 26

Refer to the exhibit. You are designing a PowerApps Starter Portal for one of the training institutes that allows students to register for an event, webinars, and bootcamps.

You need to use the portals WEB API to allow students to view, create, update, and delete their registered event through the portal without having to navigate away from the page, as shown in the exhibit.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No

Answer

The WEB API cannot read the data from Portal configuration tables. The portals Web API can only be used to perform operations on portal non-configuration entities like contact, account, lead, case, etc. It cannot be used to perform operations on portal configuration entities like a webpage, table list, basic forms, etc.

The PowerApps Portal version must be 9.3.3.x or later for WEB API to work.

You can disable the WEB API for a particular entity on Portals by turning the Webapi/<entity name>/enabled site settings value to false. For example, in order to disable the WEB API for the contact entity, you can create a new site setting with the name Webapi/contact/enabled and set its value to false.

You do not need to clear the portal cache in order to retrieve the updated data through the WEB API. The portal cache refresh is only required when you make changes in portal configuration entities like webpages, basic forms, etc. This option is also not optimal since it causes temporary performance degradation.

Question 27

Your manager asks you to create a canvas app to help the customer service department when dealing with customers. The canvas app should contain a bot that interacts with customers and receives feedback from them according to the services they receive from your company. The bot needs to reply to each sentence received from a customer. You create the bot and want to test it in a way that allows you to simultaneously view the conversation topics path and make adjustments to the bot as necessary.

You need to test the chatbot's functionality.

Which option should you use?

Answer

You should set the Track between topics option. Turning on the Track between topics option allows you to track the conversations between the customers and the bot as the conversation moves from topic to topic. With this option, your display is divided into two sections, one showing the conversation and the other showing the nodes containing the topics. This allows you to detect and solve any issues. For example, if the bot does not reply to a test text in the topic, you can directly detect where the issue in the created nodes is and modify it.

You should not set the Topic Checker. This option displays the errors that occurred in your process after the conversation has finished. This does not meet the requirement because you need to review the bot conversation as it progresses and make any modifications in the node of the authoring canvas app immediately.

You should not set the Monitor Performance option. This option allows you to analyze the performance of the chatbot after it is published. It does not allow you to walk through the topics of the conversation while you are testing the bot.

You should not set the Analytics option. This option takes you to a new page with analytical data for your chatbot, including engagement over time. This helps you to keep track of performance, but it will not allow you to track the conversation between you and the bot as it moves from topic to topic.

Question 28

Your HR department uses Microsoft Power BI in its analytical tasks. You are tasked with creating a custom visual for Power BI to facilitate analytics for the HR department.

You need to make sure that you are able to create the Power BI custom visual.

What two prerequisites should you ensure that your company meets before carrying out the task? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should ensure that the company has Visual Studio Code Integrated Development Environment (IDE). This is needed to create custom visuals in Power BI. Visual Studio Code Integrated Development Environment (IDE) is used to develop JavaScript and TypeScript applications.

You should also ensure that the company has node.js installed. This uses JavaScript as its preferred programming interface. This prerequisite will allow you to create custom visuals in Power BI.

You should not ensure that the company has Windows PowerShell version 3.0. To create a custom visual in Power BI you need version 4.0 or later.

You should not ensure that the company has Windows 7. This will not support Power BI Desktop after January 31, 2021. The versions that support Power BI are Windows 8 and later.

You should not ensure that the company has the free version of Power BI. This version does not support creating custom visuals. The versions necessary to create custom visuals are Power BI Pro or Premium Per User (PPU).

Question 29

You are designing a model-driven app for a finance organization. This model-driven app has an account entity that stores customer profiles and transaction-related information. The model-driven app and account entity are regularly accessed by the support team and the loan department team.

You need to prevent the support team from being able to read customer transactional-related information.

What two security features should you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Answer

You can use field-level security to control access to sensitive information on the form. Field-level security restricts access to sensitive fields (like account numbers or credit cards) for specific users and teams. For example, if you need to allow only the support team to read the customer's account number, you should first enable field security on the account number field. Then you need to create a field security profile. Finally, you should give access to this profile only to the support team so that only they can access the account number.

You can also use a role-based form to hide sensitive information on the form. You should use a role-based form to restrict access entity forms for specific users and teams. You can also use this security feature to hide sensitive information on the form by keeping all sensitive fields on a separate form and providing access to the forms for a specific team only.

You should not use security roles. You would use a security role to provide record-level security in a model-driven app. For example, the security role would be the best fit if you wanted to restrict support team records from the loan department team and vice versa. Security roles cannot be used to control access data at the field level, they can only be used to control access to data present in Microsoft Dataverse.

You should not use record-level security. Record-level security sets restrictions on specific records or tables in the database. For example, if you want to allow a salesperson to see only customers that they manage, you should provide record-level security on the account entity. Record-level security cannot be used to control access data at the field level, it can only be used to control access at the record level. For example, if you only want to allow a user to read the contact record, you should handle this using record-level security.

You should not use a business unit. You can use business units for grouping business activities running in a specific unit or department. For example, if you want to prevent support team members in Dynamics 365 from interacting with data that is owned by the loan department and vice versa, you could use a business unit. Business unit cannot be used to control access to data at the field level, it can only be used to group the organization's data by departments or units.

You should not use access teams. You can use access teams to give access to records to more than one user. You first need to enable the access team feature for a particular entity in order to leverage the access team feature on that entity's records. Access teams cannot be used to control access to data at the field level, they can only be used to control the sharing of data.

Question 30

You are working as a Security Administrator for an organization. You are tasked to help secure access to the database and the resources in an environment.

Following the principle of least privilege, you need to give User A access to the environment in order to perform the following tasks:
Create Power Apps and Power Automate flows.
Distribute the Power Apps to other users in your organization.
Build custom APIs and connections.
What role should you assign to User A?

Answer

You should assign User A the Environment Maker role. This role provides the required permissions to build and distribute the necessary resources for the environment including PowerApps, Power Automate, connections, and custom APIs.

You should not assign User A the Environment Admin role. You should only assign this role if a user has to perform administrative actions in an environment. For example, if User A needed to add or remove a user, set data loss prevention policies, or provision a Dataverse database, this role would be appropriate. Since you must follow the principle of least privilege, the Environment Maker role provides sufficient permissions to give them access to the app and API creation.

You should not assign User A the System Administrator role. You should assign this role to users in order to let them customize the system and view all the data in the system. For example, if a user wants to create a table, column, views, relationships in Dataverse and needs access to all the records available in Dataverse tables, then the user needs to have the System Administrator role. The System Administrator role does not provide permission to create resources in the Power Platform environment like PowerApps, Power Automate, Custom Connectors, API, etc.

You should not assign a Basic User role. You should assign this role to users if they need to run an app within an environment and perform common tasks for the records that they own. This role does not provide sufficient permissions to create resources in the Power Platform environment like PowerApps, Power Automate, Custom Connectors, API, etc.

Question 31

A company is using Dynamics 365 for Sales. The company has two separate teams for sales and marketing. The lead score field is used to target leads that have a low score in different marketing campaigns. The lead score field should only be visible for the marketing team, and the sales team should be restricted from making changes in lead score or consulting it.

You need to design a solution without customization to meet the requirements.

What should you do?

Answer

You should create a field security profile, set permissions for the lead score field and add the marketing team. Field security profiles can be used to add users or teams. Field security profiles hide the information in the relevant fields from the users or teams that are not added, and they will not be able to edit the field.
You should not create a business rule. A business rule can be configured to set the field as read-only, but the information would still be visible to the users. Business rules are used to apply form logic, such as setting field values, showing or hiding a field on a form, or setting a requirement level for the fields.
You should not use JavaScript code as this option would require customization. You need to provide a solution without customization. JavaScript code can also be used to show/hide fields on form and set a requirement level for the fields.
You should not create a separate form only to hide information in a single field. Separate forms can be used with security roles when multiple fields have information that needs to be hidden from users or teams.

Question 32

You are setting up security roles in the Power Platform Environment for a financial organization.

The organization has the following requirements:
A user can run an app in the environment.
A user should not be able to perform any operation in Microsoft Dataverse.
A user can set data loss prevention policies in the environment.
Which two security roles should you use to meet the requirements? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should use the Environment Admin role. The Environment Admin role can perform administrative tasks in the environment, such as add/remove user, provision Microsoft Dataverse, and set data prevention policies.

You should also use the Environment Maker role. The Environment Maker role can create new resources in the environment, such as create canvas apps and Power Automate.

You should not use the Basic User role. A Basic User role can perform operations in the Microsoft Dataverse data that they own. In this scenario, users should not be able to perform any operation in Microsoft Dataverse.

You should not use the System Customizer role. A System Customizer role can perform an operation in the Microsoft Dataverse data that they own and can customize the system. In this scenario, users should not be able to perform any operation in Microsoft Dataverse.

You should not use the System Administrator role. A System Administrator has full permissions to customize the application as well as perform any operations in the Microsoft Dataverse. This does not meet the requirements.

Question 33

You are working as a developer for a company that complains that one of their users cannot access the Dynamics 365 Marketing platform.

You need to modify permissions so that the user can access the platform.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following steps in order:
Select an environment in the Admin Center then access Users.
Open the user record then access Manage Roles.
Access Security Roles then choose the needed security role.
Choose Core Records then set the User Level to the Read permission.
To modify permissions so that the user can access the Dynamics 365 Marketing platform you should go the Admin Access and select an environment. You should then access the Users section.

You should then open the user record and access Manage Roles. The user record contains the data related to the user in addition to settings assigned to them that you can change.

Next, you should access Security Roles and choose the needed security role. A security role is used to define how a user can access different records.

Finally, you should choose Core Records then set the User level to Read permission. This permission will allow the user to view the content in the needed record without being able to change it.

You should not access Settings then Security then Field Security Profiles. You would carry out these steps, for example, in the process to restrict the mobile phone field of the Contact entity. This is not required in this scenario.

You should not choose Field Security Profiles then enter the name of the user. This will not meet the requirement. You would need to select this field when configuring the security profiles that restrict the mobile phone field of the Contact entity.

Question 34

You are working as a developer for a company and are tasked with creating an activity entity for the accounting department. This entity contains data related to commercial transaction records such as consumer orders that are managed by department coordinator.

You need to make sure that new employees are unable to access certain sensitive fields.

What should you do?

Answer

You should restrict access to the fields by setting up a field security profile. By setting up field security profiles in an entity, you can control user access to these fields, safeguarding sensitive data such as commercial transaction records.

You should not modify the permissions of the fields that users do not have access to. This option is not available when enabling or disabling field security. You can only enable or disable the security of a certain field that the user has access to.

You should not update the permissions that allow certain users to create and delete data fields. This option allows users to update the data of a certain field after it has been created. This does not meet the scenario requirements because you need to restrict user access to certain fields in an entity.

You should not get the role principal ID of the group of employees that you want to add permissions for. This does not meet the scenario requirement because this action is used when using HTTP requests to change item level permissions in SharePoint. This is not related to restricting user access to certain fields in an entity.

Question 35

Your company has several divisions with different customer and marketing data. Employees should be able to access the data of their own division only.

You need to create business units that map all company divisions in order to protect user data.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

To create a business unit, you should select the environment of your company by accessing the Environments section and choosing the company’s environment. Then you should navigate to Settings > Users + permissions > Business Units to reach the Business Units page. By creating business units you will be able to organize and protect user data so that employees can access the data of their division only.

You should also enter a name for the new business unit that you are creating to give it a unique identity. Any existing customer engagement apps will automatically fill in the Parent Business field. This action is included in the process of creating a business unit. By creating business units you will be able to organize and protect user data so that employees can access the data of their division only.

You should not modify the data in the Business Unit dialog box. This does not meet the scenario requirements. Modifying the data in the Business Unit dialog box will change the settings of an existing business unit. This is not related to creating a new business unit.

You should not select the Users record type in the Organization section. This does not meet the scenario requirements. Selecting a record type in the Organization section will allow you to change the settings of a business unit. This is not related to creating a new business unit. If you select the Users record type, you can view the list of users found on a chosen business unit.

You should not select a value for the new parent business unit. This does not meet the scenario requirements. You would need to select a value for a new parent business when assigning a business unit to a different parent business. This will not create a new business unit.

Question 36

You are integrating Dynamics 365 with an external system in order to sync contact data in Dataverse.

You need to implement logic in Dynamics 365 to restrict users from creating duplicate contact records.

Which three Dynamics 365 components should you use to implement the logic? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Answer

You should use an alternate key to uniquely identify the records in Dynamics 365. Alternate keys are principally used for data migration and integration requirements. The field types that can be defined as alternate keys are: decimal, whole number, single line of text, datetime, lookup, and picklist type.

You could also use a real-time workflow. Real-time workflows are synchronous in nature and allow users to write the server-side code to detect duplicate records in Dataverse.

You could also use plug-ins. Plug-ins are useful if you have a complex business scenario to check for duplicate records. For example, if a contact's mobile number and company website URL are the same they restrict the user to create a record in Dataverse. In this condition, you need to perform a query on the Account entity in order to find the information from the website URL field.

You should not use JavaScript. JavaScript is a client-side language and it will always trigger when you are working with Dynamics 365 forms (load/save/change). While syncing the data from the external system to Dataverse, you need to have duplicate detection logic on the server-side. Therefore, you cannot choose JavaScript for this purpose.

You should not use Power Automate. Power Automate is a non-real-time (asynchronous) component and can only be used to write the logic for duplicate detection. It cannot be used to restrict users from creating duplicate records.

You should not use Azure Logic App. Azure Logic Apps is a non-real-time (asynchronous) component and can only be used to write the logic for duplicate detection. It cannot be used to restrict users from creating duplicate records.

Question 37

CompanyA is planning to use a model-driven app to manage accounts and contacts. The data for accounts and contacts should be saved in Microsoft Dataverse.

You need to help the company manage accounts and contact data.

Which relationship type should you define to achieve the following goals? To answer, drag the appropriate components to the correct requirements. Each component may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should use Cascade Active when you also want to assign associated records when the parent record is reassigned. Cascade Active replicates the action performed on parent records to all associated records that are in active state.
You should use Referential, Restrict Delete when you do not want the deletion to complete if there are records associated with the parent record. In a referential restrict delete relationship, the parent record will not be deleted if there are associated records in the parent record.
You should use Parental when you want to delete the child records when the parent record is deleted. In a parental relationship, whatever action is performed on the parent record is also replicated on the associated records.

You should not use Referential. In a referential relationship, whatever action is performed on the parent record is not replicated on the associated records. This component does not fulfill any of the requirements.

You should not use Cascade None: Nothing is performed on the associated records, so this component cannot be used.

Question 39

You are building a lead generation solution for an organization that integrates with an external application. As part of the system design, you create some custom tables and fields to match the data model with the external database. You notice that the external database has made some modifications in its data model.

You need to make some modifications to your data model to match the database by changing the properties of your fields.

Which three field properties can you change after creation? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Answer

You can change the field requirement after creation. For example, the field requirement can be changed from Business Required to Optional, or from Optional to Business Recommended. The field requirement property is used to make the field optional or business required on the form.

You can also change the Date and Time field behavior from User Local to Date Only or to Time-Zone-Independent. User Local displays the time in the user's local time zone (set by a user in their personal settings), while Time-Zone-Independent is independent of the user's local time zone.

You can also change the option set order by clicking on the up-down arrow under the option set control. For example, if you have set the option set field's value as A, B, and C, then you could change it to C, B, A. The option set field is a kind of dropdown field in Dynamics 365 that allows users to pick a value from the available options. For example, you can create gender as an option set field and add its values as male, female, transgender, and other options.

You cannot change the field type once it has been created. If you need to modify it, you need to create a new field. For example, the lookup field cannot be changed to Option Set and vice versa. The field type is used to create different types of fields in Dynamics 365 like integer, decimal, string, etc.

You cannot change the schema name of the field. The schema name of the field gets auto-populated when you provide the name of the field. The schema name format is:<publisher prefix_entity's display name in lowercase>. For example, if the field name is First Name, then its schema name would be new_firstname. Dynamics 365 creates a unique schema name of each component you create in Microsoft Dataverse. For example, if the field name is firstname and publisher name is arp then the schema name of the field would be arp_firstname.

You cannot change the prefix of the field. You need to create a new publisher in order to set a new prefix for new components. For example, if you create a solution component in the default solution then the component prefix would be new and the component name would be new_firstname. If you create your own publisher with the name ABC, then the component prefix would be ABC and the component name would be ABC_firstname.

Question 40

CompanyA is using Dynamics 365 Sales. They plan to calculate the time spent on an opportunity before it is marked as won or lost.

You need to use out-of-the-box capabilities of the platform to achieve this goal.
To answer, drag the appropriate components to the correct requirements. Each component may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should use DIFFINMINUTES to calculate the time spent on an opportunity by a sales representative before it is marked as won or lost. DIFFINMINUTES returns a whole number value.
You can use the out-of-the-box Created on and Modified on fields to calculate the time spent on an opportunity. These fields can be passed as parameters to the DIFFINMINUTES function.
For the second scenario, you should use the Duration data type as the scenario requires data transformation before the data is displayed to the end user. You can use a Duration type field to store the time spent on an opportunity. Duration fields are used to show a whole number in hours, days, or minutes.
For the third scenario, you should choose the status reason Canceled when the opportunity is marked as lost. This status reason corresponds to status value Lost.
You should not use SUBTRACTDAYS. SUBTRACTDAYS is not appropriate for the first scenario because it returns a date value that will change every day and will not reflect how much time the sales representative has spent on each opportunity.

You should not use the Customer data type. The Customer data type is a lookup field that is used to look for records that are targeted to accounts or contacts.
You should not use the status reason In Progress. This corresponds to the status value Open, and the scenario explains the opportunity is to be marked as lost.

Question 41

You are writing a C# Console application to retrieve the contact records from Microsoft Dataverse where:
Contacts are in an inactive state.
Contacts do not have an email address.
Which of the following five Dynamics 365 Software Development Kit (SDK) Classes should you use in sequence to retrieve the data? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should use the C# SDK Classes in the following order:
IOrganizationService
Query Expression
Condition Expression
Filter Expression
Entity Collection
First, you should use IOrganisationService. The IOrganisationService class is used to make the connection with Microsoft Dataverse, which is the first thing you need to do before performing any operation in the database. This class is also used to provide the Dynamics 365 web services in order to perform the create/update/retrieve/delete operation in Microsoft Dataverse.

Next, you should use Query Expression. Once you make the connection with the database, you must then write a query to get the desired data from Microsoft Dataverse.

Next, you should use Condition Expression. Condition Expression is used to write the condition in your query. For example, you need to retrieve the data from Microsoft Dataverse, where contacts are in an inactive state and the email address field value is null.

Next, you should use Filter Expression. Filter Expression is used to combine the multiple conditions using AND and OR operators.
