Since you have used two conditions, one for inactive records and another for the email address null check, you must use Filter Expression after Condition Expression to combine both the conditions with the AND operator.

Finally, you should use Entity Collection. Once you make the connection, create a query, write the multiple conditions, and filter the conditions with the AND operator, the next thing you must do is run your query to get the results from Microsoft Dataverse. The Entity Collection SDK class is used to store the collection of records after running the query.

You should not use the Input Parameter SDK class in the console application to retrieve the data. Input Parameter is a class that is required in plug-ins to read the input parameters passing from Dynamics 365 application to plug-ins. For example, table name, step name, stage name, impersonate user, etc.

You should not use the Service Provider Parameter SDK class in the console application. The Service Provider SDK class is not mandatory in the C# Console application. It is a class that should be used in plug-ins to retrieve all necessary dynamics services like IOrganizationService, TracingService, and IPluginContext.

You should not use the Tracing Service SDK class in the console application. The Tracing Service SDK class is not mandatory in the C# Console application. It is a class that should be used in plug-ins to write the trace log.

Question 42

You are creating a custom table for an application in Power Apps that includes data related to your company. There are a number of required fields in the new table panel that must be filled. You want to fill the fields that will give the table a unique identity across the environment and display the table in two different IDs on the application.

You need to fill in the required fields in order to meet the requirements.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should fill in the Plural display name section. This section gives a plural name to the table that you created and will be displayed in the built application containing the table.

You should also fill in the Name section. This section can contain only a maximum number of 24 characters.

You should not change the table type. This is not necessary to create a table. You can leave this section unchanged.

You should not fill in Table Description section. This is not necessary to create a table. The Description section contains a description of the table that you created.

Question 43

You are designing a Power Platform application for a retail company. The company wants to package all the components and plans to deploy them on a User Acceptance Testing (UAT) instance for testing. You create a solution, export it with version number 11.0.0.1 and deploy it in the UAT instance. Based on the feedback received from the UAT, you fix some issues in the code.

You need to publish an updated version of the solution to the UAT instance.

Which version identifier should you use?

Answer

You should use the 11.0.1.2 version. The Dynamics 365 PowerApps solutions format is 

<major>.<minor>.<build>.<revision>

. The system will automatically increment the build and revision version number when you export the patch from the original solution. So if the original solution version is 11.0.0.1, then its version will become 11.0.1.2 when you export a patch from that solution. For example, if the solution starts with version number 11.0.0.0, when you export this solution it becomes 11.0.0.1. Then if you create a patch of this solution to fix some issues, it builds and the revision version will be incremented by 1, making the patch solution version 11.0.1.2.

You should not use the 12.0.0.1 version. The major version never increments when you export the patch solution. When you clone the solution (combine all patch solutions to the original solution), then you should increase the major version, because in this case you would be deploying a completely new solution that is not being generated from the parent or main solution.

You should not use the 11.1.0.1 version. You should only increment the minor version of the solution when you are cloning a patch solution. The solution cloning feature is used to combine all the patch solutions created from the original solution. For example, if the original solution version is 11.0.0.1, then the clone solution version would be 11.1.0.1 or 12.1.0.1.

You should not use the 11.0.0.2 version. Build and revision of both versions should be incremented by 1 when you export the patch solution. For example, if the original solution version is 11.0.0.0, then it becomes 11.0.0.1 when you export it for the first time. When you export the patch solution from the solution, both its build and revision versions should get incremented by 1. Therefore, it must be 11.0.1.2, not 11.0.0.2.

Question 44

A healthcare organization uses Power Platform to design its application. The organization uses development and production instances. The organization is planning to go live with the application and also wants to distribute it with its partners and vendors.

You need to deploy the solutions from the development instance to the production instance.

What outcomes should you anticipate? For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. otherwise, select No.

Answer

The organization should not share the unmanaged solution with their partners and vendors. An unmanaged solution is a solution that is still under development and not intended to be distributed. Once you are done with the development, you should export the solution as a managed solution and share it with your vendors and partners.

You can use Power Build Tools to auto-deploy the solution. Power Build Tools is the Microsoft-provided Azure DevOps tool that can be used to auto-deploy your Dynamics 365 solution using the Azure DevOps CICD pipeline. Power Build Tools provides various build tasks that let you automate your solution deployment.

You should not deploy an unmanaged solution in the production instance. The unmanaged solution contains only those solution components (table, fields, plug-in, workflow) that are currently under development. Therefore, unmanaged solutions must be used only in the development instance. For target instances like testing, UAT, and production, the solution that is deployed must be a managed solution.

You should not import add-on solutions like Power Apps portals and Customer Insights along with your Dynamics 365 solution in the production instance. Add-on solutions are always managed solutions and cannot be exported from your development instance. Therefore, all the add-on solutions that you have installed manually in your development instance must be manually installed in your production instance as well. For example, Portals, Unified Service Desk, Customer Insights, Adobe, etc.

You should ensure that the development and production environments have a different security group. Security groups in Dynamics 365 are used to control access to environments. If you want to restrict the access of a development instance user to the production instance you must not add the user to the production security group and vice versa.

Question 45

CompanyA is using Microsoft Dataverse to develop solutions. The company has a development instance, a production instance, and multiple sandbox instances. The sandbox instances are used for unit testing and user acceptance testing. Once the development is complete, all changes are moved to sandbox instances. After the business user has successfully tested the changes, the solution is deployed in production.
You need to streamline the deployment process to other instances considering that changes should be uninstalled or removed from the sandbox and production instance.
What two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Answer

You should create an unmanaged solution in the development environment, add changes that you need to export, export it as a managed solution, and then import the solution to other sandbox and production environments. When you create a solution, it is by default created as unmanaged and when you export that solution you get the option to either export it as managed or unmanaged. Managed solutions can be uninstalled or deleted after installation to a sandbox or a production environment and the requirement is that the changes can be uninstalled. Managed solutions can be used to change default system components in Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement.
You could also identify an unmanaged solution in which you need to make changes, clone a patch, make changes to it, and export it as a managed solution. Patches from unmanaged solutions are used to deploy changed system components. Patches are created when you do not want to deploy the complete solution again and you just want to deploy a small upgrade to the previously installed solution.
You should not recreate the changes in sandbox and production instances because the changes are created as unmanaged components and to delete those changes you would have to delete each individual component from the sandbox and production instances.
You should not use the Configuration Migration tool to deploy the changes to production and sandbox instances. The Configuration Migration tool is used to deploy configuration data across environments and does not include all changes to different components of Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement.

Question 46

You are using Microsoft Power Platform Build Tools to automate your power platform components from a development instance to a User Acceptance Testing (UAT) instance.

You need to deploy your Dynamics 365 solution.

Which three Power Platform build tasks should you use in your Azure DevOps CICD pipeline? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should use Power Platform Tool Installer to deploy the solution. The Power Platform Tool Installer build task is used to install all pre-requisites tools/services/software on a virtual machine (VM) where your Azure DevOps CICD pipeline is running.

You should also use the Power Platform Export Solution to deploy the solution. The Power Platform Export Solution build task is used to export the Dynamics 365 solution from the development instance.

You should also use Publish Pipeline Artifact to store your Dynamics 365 exported solution file somewhere in the Azure pipeline. Once you export the Dynamics 365 solution from the development instance, you need to keep the solution somewhere in your Azure DevOps, so that in your release pipeline you can get the solution from that location and import it to the UAT instance. The Publish Pipeline Artifact task is used to publish or upload your artifacts to a particular location given in the CICD pipeline. For example, you can export the Dynamics 365 solution and upload it to a particular folder in your GIT repository or in the staging directory.

You should not use Power Platform Unpack Solution. The Power Platform Unpack Solution build task is used to unpack/extract Dynamics 365 components from a Dynamics 365 solution file. The unpack solution is only required when you have to unpack the solution and structure the Dynamics 365 components (table, plug-in, workflow, dashboards, etc) in a specific folder in the repository.

You should not use Power Platform Backup Environment. The Power Platform Backup Environment build task is used to make a backup of your Dynamics 365 environment. When you import a solution to the target environment, it is always recommended to make a backup of that environment to avoid any unforeseen issues in your existing customization. You do not need to make a backup of your development instance while exporting the solution.

Question 47

CompanyA uses Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2011 to manage health insurance claims in MENA countries. The company is migrating to Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE) in EMEA countries.

You need to deploy the supported customizations from Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2011 to Dynamics 365 CE.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should add all customizations in an unmanaged solution and export the solution as unmanaged. Unmanaged solutions are used to deploy customizations to any environment where you want to edit unmanaged components. On development environments, all customizations are unmanaged so that they can be exported as a managed or an unmanaged solution to other production and sandbox environments.
You should also import the unmanaged solution in Dynamics 365 CE. Importing an unmanaged solution gives you the leverage to modify solution components. The developers can use this solution to make changes and export it to deploy it on other Dynamics 365 CE sandbox and production environments.
You should not add customizations in an unmanaged solution to later export the solution as managed because you need to move customizations from Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2011 to Dynamics 365 CE. Exporting the solution as a managed solution would restrict the developers from modifying components in Dynamics 365 CE that are part of the solution.
You should not import the managed solution in Dynamics 365 CE. Importing a managed solution would restrict developers from editing any solution component and you will not be able to export the managed solution later to deploy it on other sandbox and production environments.

Question 48

You work as a developer for a company that wants you to create and deploy packages with HTML content on Microsoft Dataverse instances. The HTML files should be in German. You are using a commonly used development environment for this process.

You need to create packages for the Package Deployer tool.

Which solution should you use for each requirement? To answer, select the appropriate solutions from the drop-down menus.

Answer

You should use Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6.2. This is the required version to create packages for the Package Deployer tool. .NET Framework is the original implementation of .NET that supports the running of services and websites.

You should use Visual Studio 2015 as the development environment. This is the required version to create a package in the the Package Deployer tool. Visual Studio is a development environment that helps developers to create their projects.

You should use NuGet Package Manager that includes .NET as the tool for Visual Studio. This tool allows you to produce and consume packages.

You should create a copy of en-us folder, the default folder name, under the content section of PkgFolder to add HTML files in a package in other languages. This is the first step to do if you want to add an HTML file in a package in other language. This step is followed by renaming the copied folder to the suitable language. After that, you would modify the content of the Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) to add the German content so in order to add the HTML file in another language.

You should not use Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 or 4.5.2. These versions are not used to create packages with HTML content. Older versions of Microsoft .NET Framework are not compatible with other components used to create packages.

You should not use NetBeans as the development environment. This software cannot create packages for the Package Deployer tool. NetBeans IDE is an open-source integrated development environment (IDE) for developing applications.

You should not use Eclipse as the development environment. This software cannot create packages for the Package Deployer tool. Eclipse is widely used for developing Java applications (Java SE and Java EE) as well as Android apps.

You should not use CodeMaid for Visual Studio. This tool simplifies and cleans up types of coding. It does not create packages.

You should not use VSCommands for Visual Studio. This tool provides generation improvements and code navigation. This is not needed when creating packages.

You should not specify a .zip file name to add HTML files in a package in other languages. This is part of the process of specifying the configuration values for the package you want to deploy. If you specify a .zip file name in the ImportConfig.xml file available in the PkgFolder, this will add a pop-up during the package deployment process that will prompt you to select a location for the file. This action is not related to adding HTML files in a package in other languages.

You should not add a Dataverse solution in the PkgFolder folder to add HTML files in a package in other languages. This is part of the process to use when adding files to the project created from templates provided by Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Software Development Kit (SDK) Templates. This is not related to adding HTML files in a package in a different language.

Question 49

You create two applications for a company that specializes in accounting and management. You want to move a solution containing the two applications from one environment to another. You apply certain changes and find out that the solution needs additional features before exporting the solution.

You need to export the solution from Power Apps and add the additional features.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following steps in order:
Select Switch to Classic option.
Choose a solution then click on export.
Select Publish All Customizations before selecting Next.
Access Export System Settings (Advanced) then choose the required system settings.
To export a Power Apps solution using the classic experience, you should go to the toolbar found on the solutions page then hover the mouse to the right side of the screen and click on the Switch to Classic option. The classic experience allows you to add additional features or components upon exporting a solution. The modern experience of Power Apps does not offer this option.

The next step is to choose the solution you want to export then click on the export button found on the toolbar. This step will take you to a series of steps that pop up upon clicking on the export button.

You should then access the Publish Customization section that pops up for the user. There, you can find a button tagged as Publish All Customizations. After clicking on it, you will be able to ensure that all the recent changes you did in the solution will be exported.

Finally, you should access the Export System Settings (Advanced) section that follows the Publish Customization section where you can choose required system settings. This will allow you to add features to your solution like Calendar, Email Tracking, Marketing, etc.

You should not select New Solution then enter the required data in the correct columns. This step is included in the process of creating a solution, not exporting a solution.

You should not choose the Include All Components option in the Select Entities pane. This step is also related to creating a solution, not exporting one.

You should not choose the Browse option to locate the compressed (.zip or .cab) file. This step is related to updating a solution, not exporting one.

Question 50

A university wants to use a model-driven app for managing student counseling and admissions.

The university also wants to have seamless integration of the model-driven app with:
Microsoft Teams to establish effective communication with students.
Power Platform components to design low-code no-code apps.
Existing third-party applications to provide a unified view of student data.
You need to check the feasibility of the university's requirements and map them with model-driven app features.

For each of the following statements about model-driven apps, select Yes if the statement is true. otherwise, select No.

Answer

You can embed the canvas app in the model-driven app to show the data of existing third-party applications. You should first create a custom connector in order to retrieve the data from external third-party applications and then use this connector to display the data in the canvas app using the List type screen. Finally, you can embed this canvas app in your model-driven app to display the data on a model-driven app form.

Users must have at least the Basic role in the system to access the model-driven app. The Basic role type is a type of security role available in Dynamics 365 that allows users to run the model-driven app and access the data that they own. The Basic security role is enough to access the model-driven apps in Dynamics 365.

Users can also access the model-driven app by Microsoft Teams. The model-driven app can be embedded in Microsoft Teams so that users can directly view and perform operations on Dynamics 365 data without being logged in to Dynamics 365.

The university does not need to have SharePoint integration to integrate the model-driven app with Microsoft Teams. To enable the Microsoft Teams integration with model-driven apps, you only need to turn on the 'Allow model-driven apps to be embedded within Microsoft Teams' setting from the Power Platform admin center.

Question 51

You are designing a model-driven app for a healthcare organization. The organization does not have access to skilled User Interface (UI) developers that are able to write code.

You need to enhance the data visualization in the application.

Which two components should you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Answer

You should use a canvas app. Canvas apps can be embedded in model-driven apps for data visualization purposes. For example, if you want to display the hierarchy of all the contacts associated with a particular account, you can create a canvas app and embed it in an account form.

You could also use custom controls. Custom controls let you transform app components like views and fields into data visualizations. For example, you can use the flip control for a boolean field, or the radial gauge control to display a range value using a needle on a circular face. Custom controls can be used on fields, views, and dashboards.

You should not use PowerApps Control Framework (PCF) controls. PCF controls require coding to design a component for the app to enhance the user interface. There are many business requirements where you are required to create your own code component in Dynamics 365 like Address finder, Progress bar control, Weather widget, etc. To design the PCF controls you need to write Typescript code and import its package to the Dynamics 365 instance in order to use it on the model-driven app forms.

You should not use web resources. A web resource is a container of web-related components in a model-driven app. It requires code like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to design the UI.

You should not use PowerApps Studio. PowerApps Studio is a tool that is used to design canvas apps. You would use the App designer to design the model-driven app.

You should not use a theme. You would use a theme in a model-driven app to change the look and feel of the app. For example, the theme allows you to change the logo, the color of the navigation bar, the app background color, etc.

Question 52

CompanyA is using model-driven apps to manage customers. The company operates in more than 100 countries and requires tax numbers to be configured correctly based on the selected country. You decide to use a Power Apps component framework control to show the format of the tax number based on the selected country.
You need to get the list of formats when a customer record is created and the user enters the tax number.
Which function should be used to call RetrieveMultipleRecords?

Answer

You should use the updateView function to call RetrieveMultipleRecords. Using RetrieveMultipleRecords inside this method will retrieve the tax number format based on the selected country. This method is used when a value gets changed in the property bag, including data sets and global values.
You should not use the init function to call RetrieveMultipleRecords. This method is used for initializing the component instance. Components then trigger other initialization actions.
You should not use the getOutputs function to call RetrieveMultipleRecords. This method is used to return a value for each property and is called by the framework prior to the component receiving any changes in data.
You should not use the notifyOutputChanged function to call RetrieveMultipleRecords. This method is used to call the CRM client-side layer to update the changes, making the form dirty.

Question 53

CompanyA is using Dynamics 365. The sales team is using the Sales Hub app and the marketing team is using the Marketing app.

You need to make sure that the marketing team can consult the trial subscription dashboard that is part of the Sales Hub app.
Which two steps should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should add a trial subscription dashboard to the Marketing app using App Designer. Only the dashboards that are added to the dashboard tile on the App Designer canvas will be visible. The App Designer contains dashboards, entities, views and forms that are part of the application. You can use it to create components like forms, views, charts, and dashboards.

You should enable a relevant security role for the marketing team on the dashboard. The dashboard is only visible to users that have security roles enabled. Users with a security role will be able to make dashboards based on their user roles.

You should not create a new dashboard for the marketing team. You should only create a new dashboard if the visualizations are different or the data source is different.

You should not add a trial subscription view to the newly created dashboard. This dashboard is visible to the sales team. A view defines the columns to display, the width of each column, how the list of rows should be sorted by default and what default filters should be applied to determine which rows will appear in the list.

Question 54

You are a developer at a sales company. You are tasked with streamlining the company's order placement process.

You need to create a model-driven app that meets the requirement.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No

Answer

Model-driven apps cannot use any data source to store Dynamics 365 data. Unlike canvas apps, which can be designed from the data stored in any other data source like OneDrive, SharePoint, Excel, etc, model-driven apps can only store data in Microsoft Dataverse.

You should not use PowerApps Studio to design the model-driven app. PowerApps studio is used to design canvas apps, not model-driven apps. You should use the App Designer to design a model-driven app.

You need to have at least the Basic User role to run the app. Any user with the Basic User role can run the app and perform the operation on their own data in Microsoft Dataverse.

Model-driven apps can be exported and shared with Dynamics 365 users. A user must have Share access on the model-driven app component in order to share the model-driven apps with other Dynamics 365 users.

Question 55

Your company uses Teams for collaboration and data sharing between users across different business units. You are creating a team template for a specific account entity. You configure the access privileges on the account record that the users will have in case the team is created automatically. After creating the team template, you must configure the main form of the entity so you can include the newly created team template.

You need to add the team template to the main form of the entity.

Which two steps should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should select the Sub-Grid option found on the ribbon when adding a team template to the main form of an entity. This option will allow you to view the Set Properties dialog box where you will set the display information including Name and Data source. These properties also include the formatting of the sub-grid, where you can set the layout and row layout. The Set Properties dialog box also includes a tab named Control where you can add controls to your sub-grid or use the default control, which is Read-Only Grid. Setting these properties is part of the process of adding a team template to the main form of an entity.

You should also select All Record Types in the Records drop-down list when adding a team template to the main form of an entity. This will allow you to specify the primary data source of the main form’s list. In this scenario, the primary data source is all types of records. In the Records drop-down list you can set up several fields including Name, Data source, and Chart Option.

You should not select the Access Team Templates option. This option is included in the process of creating a team template. Choosing Access Team templates will allow you to create a new team template but it will not help you to add it to the main form of the entity.

You should not select Settings then access Personalization Settings. This step is included in the domain of viewing user information. User information is where all the data related to users and the organization they work in is displayed.

You should not select the Access Teams checkbox found in the Communication and Collaboration section. This step is included in the process of enabling the selected entity for access team, not adding a team to the entity's main form. Enabling an entity for accessing Teams is the first step to carry out when creating a team template to allow controlling the access rights of teams when it is automatically created.

Question 56

Your company uses Microsoft Dataverse and model-driven applications. Users of the graphic design department complain that their application only includes a few entities and that the Project form misses advertisement data.

You need to create a new model-driven application for the users of the graphic design department. Advertisement data must be accessible only to the graphic designers.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following steps in order:
Edit the Project main form then choose Save as.
Create a model-driven application then add the project entity.
Enable security roles.
Access the Maker portal then share the graphic design app.
To create a new graphic design form, you should first edit the Project main form then choose Save as option. Here, you can add the missing advertisement field and remove all the fields that are not related to the graphic design department.

The next step is to create a new model-driven application and add the project entity. In this step, you will access the graphic design department's form.

You should then enable the necessary security roles. In this step, you can make the graphic design main form available for graphic designers only.

Finally, you should access the Maker portal then share the created graphic design application then choose the Security role. This step is the final step you need to take after creating the application in which you share the application with the graphic designers and assign special security roles for them so that they are the only users able to access the newly created model-driven application.

You should not access the Fields section then choose Add a field. This does not meet the scenario requirement. This step is part of the process you would carry out to create a canvas app where you design the screen that the user will see.

You should not select the Schedule checkbox then select Connect. This does not meet the scenario requirement. This step is part of the process of connecting a canvas app to data found in the cloud storage of a user account.

Question 57

You are designing a canvas app for a sales agent. The app must allow the sales agent to store data even with limited or no internet connectivity.

You need to ensure that the app:
Stores the data locally when the app is offline.
Reloads the data automatically when the app is online.
Which set of functions should you use?

Answer

You should use the LoadData and SaveData functions to provide the desired offline capabilities in the canvas app. The SaveData function stores the data collection locally on the mobile/tablet when the device is offline, and the LoadData function automatically loads the data from the mobile/tablet when the device is online.

You should not use the Collect and ClearCollect functions. The Collect function stores the data in the app local storage, which is also known as a collection in canvas apps. The ClearCollect function deletes all the records from the collection and adds a new set of records in the same collection. In real-time implementation, these functions are used to store the reusable, configurable, and global data in the collection, so that you do not need to get the same information from the datasource repeatedly.

You should not use the Patch and Remove functions. The Patch function inserts/upserts the data in the database, while the Remove function removes a specific record from the collection.

You should not use the Lookup and Reset functions. The Lookup function finds a specific record in the database that matches one or more criteria, while the Reset function resets a canvas app's controls (textinput, label, datetime, dropdown, etc) to its default property.

Question 58

You are designing a canvas app for the sales department of a tech company. The sales manager uses the app to track the sales performance and approve or reject requests made by salespeople. Salespeople use this app to view their customers, daily appointments, and for capturing meeting notes. You are tasked with designing a header for this app that is common across all screens and that displays a dynamic message based on the input provided to the screen. The sales department also wants to publish the header as a reusable component in the organization so that it can be reused by the developers in other canvas apps as well.

You need to design the header for the app.

Which seven steps should you perform in sequence to design the header component? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order

Answer

You should perform the following seven steps in order to create a component header:
Create a +New component library and rename the default component header.
Add a label control in the new component.
Add a custom text property and name it header msg.
Set the Label Text property to header msg.
Save the component library.
Click on Get more components, and import the component.
Insert the header component in the app screen.
First, you should create a +New component library and rename the default component header. You should create a component in order to use the component only inside your canvas app. You should create a component library when you want to make your component available for other canvas apps.

Then, you should add a label control to the new component. You need to add this label control in the component to display the header message.

Next, you should add a custom text property and name it Header Msg. The custom property in the component library allows you to pass input/output parameters to the control. You need to create a custom property for the Label control to dynamically display the header message based on the input parameter passed to the control.

Then, you should set the Label Text property to header msg. This will set the header msg custom property value to the label control on the component. For example, if you pass the welcome to the sales app message to the header msg custom property, the label will display the same message on the header.

You should then save the component library.

Next, you should click on Get more components, and import the component. This step will add your component library to your canvas app. Other developers can also perform the same step in order to add this component to their canvas app.

Finally, you should insert the component into your canvas app screen. Once the component has been imported into your canvas app, you can insert it in your canvas app screen to view it.

You should not publish the component. The first time you create a component library, you only need to save the component. Publishing the component is only required when you are updating the component library.

You should not click on +New component and rename the default component header. You should create a component only when you want to use the component inside your canvas app. You need to make this component available for other canvas apps, so the component library must be created.

Question 59

A company is using Power Apps for crisis management and Teams for internal communication. You need to embed the Power Apps application in Teams and adjust the settings for improved performance.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should choose the crisis management app in Power Apps and select Add to Teams. This embeds the Power App in Teams. You can also edit the advanced settings and details of the application.
You should also use app settings and toggle Preload app for enhanced performance to Yes. This will load the app when a user signs into their Teams account. This improves the performance of Power Apps that are embedded in Teams, since when the user signs in to Teams the application is already loaded.
You should not select Apps from Teams and then select Upload a custom app. This is used to add an application as a personal app or as a tab to any conversation in Teams.

You should not use the pass assignment in the app settings. The pass assignment toggle is used to share the app with users that do not have Power Apps.

Question 60

Your company uses Microsoft Teams to conduct meetings and store work data.

You need to embed a canvas app as a tab into Microsoft Teams to facilitate the work of certain departments.

Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following steps in order:
Go to the general channel.
Click the + sign on the tab.
In the Add a tab dialog box, choose Power Apps.
Click Sample apps.
Select the required app.
To embed a canvas app as a tab in Microsoft Teams you should first access the general channel of the team.

Next, you should click the + sign found on the tab section.

Then you should choose Power Apps from the Add a tab dialog box.

Next you should click Sample Apps from the Power Apps display to display all the available apps you can embed.

Finally, you should select the app that you want to embed and save it.

You should not click the Share button and then click the Embed button. You would perform this action to embed a form in Sway. Microsoft Sway is a web application used for presentations. It is available for anyone with a Microsoft account. You can embed several platforms inside Microsoft Sway, including forms.

You should not click the Cards pane and then click the Embed button. You would perform this action to embed a form in Sway.

You should not click the Copy button. You would perform this action to embed a form in Sway.

Question 61

You are designing a canvas app for a field service agent who often travels to customer locations for face-to-face meetings.

You need to determine which canvas app component you should choose for each requirement.

To answer, drag the appropriate component to each requirement. A component may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should use the Collection component to store configuration data. This component serves as a local memory in the canvas app that you can use to store configuration data like user roles, user profile data, etc. You should store values that you want to use repeatedly on multiple screens in the Collection component.

You should use the SaveData component to save data on the mobile's local memory when the mobile user is offline. SaveData and LoadData are two functions that enable mobile users to save and load data when users are working in a remote area.

You should use the Launch component to view the customer's location in Google Maps. You should use the following formula on the onselect property of the canvas app control to launch Google Maps from the canvas app:

Launch("http://maps.google.com/?q="&EncodeUrl("customeraddress"))

You should use the Patch component to save meeting notes in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system. Patch is one of the functions available in the canvas app that allows you to create, update, and merge the record in a data source. For example:

Patch(Notes, Defaults(Notes), { Subject: "Customer is interested in buying a loan" } )

You should use Power Automate to send an email along with attachments. You can trigger Power Automate from a canvas app and pass all the documents that you have collected during the meeting with the customer. Power Automate will take the input from the canvas app and use an Outlook connector to send the data to the customer.

You should not use the Navigate component. You should use the Navigate function to navigate users from one screen to another inside the canvas app. For example:

Navigate('Success_Screen');

Question 62

You are building a financial-based canvas app for your company to help the accounting department with some tasks. Before publishing the app, you want to test it to ensure that there are no bugs.

You need to test the app using Test Studio and apply best practices.

Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should use test assertions to validate the results. This is the best method to validate the results of testing the app against the real outcomes.

You should also divide single test cases into multiple test cases. Dividing the test cases makes it easier to test the app and isolate any test failures.

You should automate the test cases related to the stable features of the app and perform manual testing. Automation allows you to save time and effort.

You should not use big multi-action test expressions. This practice can affect the ability of debugging failures and does not follow the best practices recommendations.

You should not use the Dynamics 365 EasyRepro tool. This does not meet the scenario requirement. EasyRepro is used to test model-driven apps, not canvas apps. Model-driven apps are built using low-code components. EasyRepro contains a testing tool and more than two hundred sample test cases that help you facilitate the testing process of a model-driven application.

Question 63

You are working for a health care organization that uses PowerApps portals to publish updates about Covid-19 cases, vaccination, and bed availability.

Patients can login to the portal through their LinkedIn, Google, Facebook, or Twitter accounts.

Some patients report that they cannot see any information on the webpages after login.

You need to troubleshoot the issue.

Which two portal components should you check? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should check the Entity Permission and Web Role components for security related issues and requirements. If a user is unable to view any information on the portal pages, it means that they do not have the appropriate entity permission and web role configured in the system. The Entity Permission component along with the Web Role component is used in the portal to provide record-level security on portal data.

You should not check the Web Page Access Control component. You should use Web Page Access Control to control access to a particular webpage. In this scenario, the users cannot see any information, and therefore this would not be resolved by using the Web Page Access Control.

You should not check the Security Role component. You should use Security Role to control data access or record-level security on the Dataverse table, not for portal data. For portal data security, you should use web roles instead of security roles.

You should not check the Site Setting component. You should use Site Setting to manage the portal configuration and authentication settings.

Question 64

You are customizing the Microsoft Dataverse platform for a client to deliver complex business requirements. After going live with the application, the client experiences a performance issue. Your client asks you to investigate the issue and share a detailed report. You run a solution checker tool on the production instance and receive an error stating the solution checker is missing required security roles.

You need to determine the cause of the issue and add the required roles.

Which two security roles should you assign to the user to resolve the issue? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should assign a Solution Checker role to the user. The Solution Checker role is required to run the solution checker tool in the application.

You should also assign an Export Customization role to the user. Solution checker returns a detailed report of a list of issues. To download the report, a user requires the Export Customization role in the application.

You should not assign a System Customizer role. The System Customizer role is required for customizing the application. For example, you would assign this role for creating an entity, a workflow, etc. It is not necessary for the scenario requirements.

You should not assign a System Administrator role. The System Administrator role is required for admin activities and customizing the application. For example, you would assign this role for creating a role, assigning and removing a role, creating an entity, creating a workflow, etc. It is not necessary for the scenario requirements.

You should not assign the Environment Maker role. The Environment Maker role is required for creating resources in the environment. For example, you would assign this role for creating a canvas app, creating Power Automate flows, etc. It is not necessary for the scenario requirements.

You should not assign the Environment Admin role. The Environment Admin role is required for performing all administrative actions in an environment. For example, you would assign this role for adding or removing users from the environment, setting data retention policies, etc. It is not necessary for the scenario requirements.

Question 65

A company is using PowerApps Portal for its partners and vendors.

Many users are complaining that they are getting the error message shown in the exhibit while logged into the portal.

You need to see the detailed exception message of the issue in order to troubleshoot the possible cause.

Which three steps should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following actions in order to see the detailed exception message of the issue:
Open the Power Apps portals admin center.
Go to Portal Actions, and click on Disable custom errors.
Restart the portal.
To see the detailed exception message on the portal page, you should first open the Power Apps portals admin center.

Next, you should click on Portal Actions from the left panel and click on Disable custom errors. This will disable the default error message and will display the detailed exception message on the portal.

Finally, you should restart the portal. You made the changes in the setting from the admin center, so you should restart your portal to reflect the changes on the portal.

You should not go to Portal Actions and click on Enable custom errors. Enabling a custom error will display the default error message provided by Microsoft stating This is a custom error, please file a support ticket with a screenshot of the error.Error ID: #edh43e45-2145-341f-dcb4-912f025e3fd9k.

You should not create Portal Site Settings. Portal Site Settings are only required if you want to display the custom error message for a plugin. For example, when you need to create a new site setting with the Site/EnableCustomPluginError name and set its value to true in order to display the plugin error message on the portal.

You should not click on Sync Portal Configuration to reflect changes on the portal. You should click on Sync Portal Configuration only when you make changes in the portal configuration, like entity forms, site settings, entity list, etc.

You should not go to Portal Actions and enable diagnostic logging. Enabling the diagnostic logging is only required when you want to store the portal error log in Azure Blob storage.

Question 66

You are developing a canvas app for CompanyA. Orders are being displayed on the main gallery, you want to filter the gallery to show all orders that are scheduled to be shipped in the next seven days.
You select the item property of the gallery and write the following expression to filter records, which gives a delegation warning in the app checker.
Filter(Orders, 'Shipping Date' <= DateAdd(Today(),7, Days))

You need to resolve the issue to rectify the delegation warning.
What two options should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should use the Set function with the following expression: Set(DateDuration, DateAdd(Today(),7, Days)) to set the value of the result from the DateAdd function in a variable. Then, you should use the variable DateDuration in the expression: Filter(Orders, 'Shipping Date' <= DateDuration). DateAdd is not a constant value in the expression shown in the question. So the filter was dependent on the dynamic value that is returned from the DateAdd function and the entire Filter operation was not delegable.
You should not use the Set(DateDuration, DateDiff(Now(), Today(), Minutes)) expression. This will set the value of DateDuration to the current time, and you need to filter orders that are to be shipped in the next seven days.
You should not use the LookUp(Orders, 'Shipping Date' = DateDuration) expression. This expression returns a single record and the gallery control in Power Apps expects a list of records. The LookUp function in Power Apps is used to look for a specific record that satisfies the condition provided in the expression.

Question 67

You are a developer working for a company using a canvas application that manages events. The application is using Microsoft Dataverse as a data source. Business users are reporting issues while using the application.

You need to identify why these issues are occurring.

How should you troubleshoot the following errors? To answer, drag the appropriate component to each issue. A component may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should use App checker to resolve issues related to formulas and expressions as in this scenario where unexpected characters are identified. App checker provides a list of all issues in one place. You can open the App checker by clicking on the stethoscope icon in the upper right corner of the Power Apps studio to look for errors, warnings and tips.

You should use Service Performance in Power Apps Analytics to identify performance related issues. The service performance reports in Power Apps Analytics give you a holistic view of the connectors or APIs that are causing performance bottlenecks.

You should not use Solution Checker. Solution Checker is used to validate model-driven applications. Solution Checker analyses Microsoft Dataverse plug-ins, custom workflow activities, web resources and configurations.

You should not use Power Platform admin center. The Power Platform admin center is a one-stop shop for admin users to control settings and environments for Power Platform. Environments, resources, data gateways and data integrations can be managed through the Power Platform admin center.

Question 68

The company you work for sells shoes. You are assigned to create a canvas app for the customer service department. The app will be created for customer service employees so that they can interact with customers and receive their feedback on the company’s products. The application uses several connectors that connect the app to services including cloud services. You try to connect your application to a Box application and to Microsoft Exchange using the API App connector. The process is not working well and you receive several error messages from both connectors as shown in the exhibit.

You need to identify and resolve the connector and API errors.

What should you do to troubleshoot the issues causing these errors? To answer, select the appropriate options from the drop-down menus.

Answer

To troubleshoot error one, you should ensure that the Box is verified as secure on your Cloud App Security. If the Box is unverified, you will be unauthorized to connect to the Box application. This is an issue because it requires security verification in the cloud before you can connect your application to it. To solve this problem, you should connect the Box to Microsoft Cloud App Security.

You should not set the Box account to Enterprise to troubleshoot this error. This will not meet the requirement. This process should be done if the user cannot access a certain feature in Box.

You should not ensure that the Box refresh token is valid. This will not meet the requirement. This problem would cause the following error message:

( ContextManagerServiceException: com.adallom.adalib.httputils.exceptions.TokenRefreshException: {"error":"invalid_grant","error_description":"Invalid refresh token"}' )

To troubleshoot error two, you should ensure that the user account that you are trying to log into in Microsoft Exchange has a primary mailbox in Exchange. This problem can be solved by adding Exchange to Cloud App Security again using a new admin account.

You should not check whether the username or password is inserted incorrectly when error two is displayed. This will not meet the requirement. When the username or password is incorrect, the following error message will be displayed when trying to connect to Microsoft Exchange:

(HttpRequestFailure: Server returned: 401 Unauthorized).

To solve this problem, you should ensure that you are entering the correct username and password then connect Exchange to Cloud App Security again.

You should not check that your tenant is assigned an Office 365 license when error two is displayed. This will not meet the requirement. You are connecting your app to Exchange and not Office 365. This would be the correct solution for the following error:

(HttpRequestFailure: Server returned: 400 Bad Request: {"error":{"code":"AF20012","message":"Specified tenant ID (Tenant_ID goes here) is incorrectly configured in the system.").

Only in this case should you assign an Office 365 license to your tenant to solve the problem.

Question 69

You want to create a custom connector on the Power Automate platform that parses the contents of a CSV file posted as a message in a general channel of a team in Microsoft Teams, then returns it as JSON data and sends it to a particular user by email. In this flow, you use Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Outlook 365, Encodian connectors, and a random API_key. You create the flow and want to test it. You ask an employee to test the flow and set the receiving email to be your work email. The employee triggers the flow by posting a text message, but you don’t receive an email.

You need to troubleshoot the flow by analyzing the JSON code shown in the exhibit.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

Answer

The error code 401 does not represent a conflict failure. An error code 401 represents an unauthorized trigger in the flow that caused the failure. Error code 409 represents a conflict error in the flow. This error is caused due to a conflict that happens between two processes in the flow that try to update the same document concurrently.

The error is caused by a response that is not in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format because the employee in the scenario posted a text message in the general channel of the team and not a Comma-separated Values (CSV) file. To parse the CSV file using Encodian, it needs to be in JSON format. In this scenario, the employee should post a CSV file in JSON format so that Encodian can parse it as needed.

You should send an Encodian API_key parameter via the request body to solve the problem in the flow. An API key is a one-of-a-kind token that is used to connect to or execute an Application Programming Interface (API) call. One of the errors that caused a failure in the flow, in the Encodian action specifically, is due to the usage of an invalid API_key. To utilize the Encodian Power Automate Connector, you need an Encodian API_key to be added to the flow. However, in the scenario, a random API_key was used. Therefore, the Encodian action did not work and no email was sent to you.

Question 70

A company wants to use the following automation capabilities in its web application:
Remote Process Automation.
Organizing their documents in a specific file and folder.
Extract data from the website and store it in an excel file.
Automate User Interface (UI) testing.
You need to recommend an appropriate solution.

Which Power Automate flow should you use?

Answer

You should use a desktop flow. A desktop flow enables you to automate all repetitive desktop tasks. For example, to manage remote process automation, to organize your documents in a file or folder, extract data from the website and store it in an excel file, capture UI elements and images from your machine.

You should not use an automated flow. You should use an automated flow for trigger-based events. For example, to send an email when a new lead is created in Dataverse.

You should not use an instant flow. You should use an instant flow for on-demand based events. For example, to send a push notification to a sales manager by clicking on the send button from your mobile device.

You should not use a scheduled flow. You should use a scheduled flow for scheduled-based events. For example, schedule a Power Automate flow to daily upload a file on Onedrive or send a due date reminder notification for a task.

You should not use a business process flow. You should use a business process flow to guide users to get their work done. For example, to guide users to convert leads into an opportunities, guide users how to cross-sell and up-sell the products.

Question 71

CompanyA is using a canvas app for financial services and the data is stored in Azure SQL Database.
You need to design a solution using Power Automate that should allow create, read, update and delete operations at the click of a button from the canvas app.
Which type of flow should you use?

Answer

You should use an instant cloud flow in Power Apps. Instant flows are triggered manually or on-demand, for example using the OnSelect property of a Button control in Power Apps.
You should not use an automated cloud flow. Automated cloud flows are triggered when an event happens. For example, an automated cloud flow can be triggered when a record is created in Microsoft Dataverse.
You should not use a scheduled cloud flow. Scheduled cloud flows do not have a trigger and are configured to run on a specific schedule. For example, the flow can be scheduled to run every 24 hours.
You should not use a Desktop flow. Desktop flows are used to automate processes that use Robotic Process Automation on your desktop environment.

Question 72

CompanyA is using Power Automate and Microsoft Dataverse with Dynamics 365 for Customer Service. The support team is planning to filter out emails that contain images with issues related to the customer portal. You need to build a Power Automate flow that should filter out emails containing product-related issues with images as attachments.
Which AI Builder model should you use in Power Automate?

Answer

You should use the text recognition model. This is because you need to filter out emails that contain images with product-related issues. The text recognition model allows you to extract words from documents and images and convert them into machine-readable character streams.

You should not use the business card reader model. This will only allow you to extract information from business card images. You are required to recognize images with product-related issues. If this model detects a business card in the image, the AI model extracts information such as name, email, job title.

You should not use the key phrase extraction model. This will only allow you to identify the key points of discussion in a text document. It can extract a list of key phrases from unstructured text documents. However, it does not help in this scenario.

You should not use the text translation model. This will allow you to translate your text data in real time across more than 60 languages. It can also detect the language of the text data you want to translate. However, it does not help in this scenario.

Question 73

You work as a developer for a company. You are using Power Automate to automatically create a lead in Microsoft Dataverse when a new lead gets registered on the company website. While creating the lead in Power Automate, you experience the issue shown in the exhibit.

You need to determine the possible root cause of this issue.

Which field should you check to identify the issue's root cause?

Answer

You should check the Lookup field. The Lookup field value always refers to another table record. If its value does not exist in any Microsoft Dataverse table, or if it includes incorrect syntax then you will get a Resource not found issue in Power Automate. This is because Power Automate is not able to find the specified resource/record in the Microsoft Dataverse table that the lookup field is referring to. You should use the following syntax in order to set the value in the lookup field:

<entity logical name>/<record GUID>

If you want to set the value in the account lookup, you should use account/12341234-1234-1234-1234-123456123456.

You should not check the Option Set field. The Option Set field value does not refer to any resource or table record in Microsoft Dataverse. Its value needs to be set either using a label or integer value. For example, if there is an Option Set field named Gender on the lead table, then its value can be set either using its label value: Male/Female/Other, or using its integer value: 1/2/3.

You should not check the MultiSelect Option Set field. The MultiSelect Option Set field value does not refer to any resource or table record in Microsoft Dataverse. Its value needs to be set using its integer value.

You should not check the Currency field. The Currency field value does not refer to any resource or table record in Microsoft Dataverse. Its value needs to be set between -922,337,203,685,477 and 922,337,203,685,477 using the Format Number action in Power Automate.

Question 74

Your company conducts surveys to receive feedback from customers. When the survey is completed, the employees implement the responses in MS Planner manually before analyzing them. After analyzing the responses, the employees publish the tasks in the general MS Teams channel of their department. This operation takes too long because it is done manually.

You need to create a workflow using Power Automate to decrease the time consumed.

What actions should you perform to meet the requirements? To answer, select the appropriate actions from the drop-down menus.

Answer

You should create a task to create a task in Planner. MS Planner is a Kanban solution that makes task management for teams easier and that is integrated across Microsoft 365 applications. The employees are implementing their responses in MS Planner. This means that they will create new tasks in MS Planner containing the responses of the survey before analyzing them. This meets the scenario requirement.

You should not update a task. This option allows you to add new information to an already created task in the planner. In this scenario, you need to create a new task.

You should not get a task. This option gets you an already created task in Planner. In this scenario, you need to create a new task.

You should use post a message. This option allows you to post the message related to the created task.

You should not get messages. This option allows you to get the messages from certain team channels. In this scenario, you need to post a new message in Teams related to the new task created.

You should not post a reply. This option allows you to post replies to messages in certain team channels. In this scenario, you need to post a new message in Teams related to the new task created.

Question 75

Your company is working on a project that deals with important vendors from outside the region. You are receiving emails from these vendors constantly but they speak in different languages so the content of the emails need to be translated.

You need to create a flow with complex expressions that export the email content to a solution that translates them.

Which paths should you use to complete the code? To answer, complete the commands by selecting the correct parts from the drop-down menus.

Answer

In line 6, you should select "apiId": "/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/shared_office365". This expression defines the API path where "shared_office365” represents the connection name that the data will be taken from. This expression should be written in this order to meet the logic of API path formula.

You should not select "apiId": "/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/shared_office365/apis". You cannot use this path to meet the scenario requirement because the connection name is not apis.

You should not select "apiId": "/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/Microsoft_office365". The correct connection name is Shared_office365.

In line 9, you should select "messageId": "@triggerOutputs()?['body/body']". This path exports email content, which meets the scenario requirements.

You should not select "messageId": "@triggerOutputs()?['body/subject']". This will not meet the scenario requirement. This path exports data from the subject of the message and not the content of the message.

You should not select "messageId": "@triggerOutputs()?['body/from']". This path exports data from the mailbox and the sender of the message, but not the content of the message.

In line 11, you should select "authentication": "@parameters('$authentication')". This path authenticates which requests to Azure Key vaults are secure.

You should not select "authentication": "parameters('authentication')". This path misses the correct symbols before parameters and authentication. Therefore, authentication will not be achieved.

You should not select "authentication": "('$authentication')@parameters". The @parameters should come before $authentication. Authentication will not be achieved if the expression is not typed correctly.

Question 76

CompanyA sells smart bicycles and uses Dynamics 365 for Sales to generate invoices. The company plans to implement a solution that enhances communication with customers. The solution should allow sales representatives to send invoices as PDF files via email.

You need to design a solution that allows the company to generate PDF files for the invoices and send emails to the customers at the click of a ribbon button. The process should run in real time and must allow the monitoring of integration. You want to use minimum customization to achieve the goal.

Which process should you use?

Answer

You should use Power Automate. Power Automate flows can be triggered at the click of a ribbon button using JavaScript code. In addition, you can generate PDF files from Power Automate and use those files to send emails. The question requires you to monitor the submissions and Power Automate allows you to monitor flow runs, which gives you the possibility to look at the failures and resubmissions. Since Power Automate flows are built in designer mode and allow you to generate PDF files to send as emails, the customization effort is minimum.

You should not use Microsoft Dataverse web API. Although you can call Microsoft Dataverse web API using Javascript code, it does not allow you to generate PDF files. Microsoft Dataverse Web API performs create, read, update, delete, and execute operations on Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Dataverse data.

You should not use a custom workflow activity. Custom workflow activities can be triggered at the click of a ribbon button using JavaScript code and allow the generation of PDF files if you write custom code. However, you are required to achieve the goal with minimum customizations and a custom workflow activity requires you to write custom code. Custom workflow activities can be used when the action is triggered from Dynamics 365 to execute custom code for features that are not available in out-of-the box workflows. Therefore, you can write custom code and use that code in workflows.

You should not use a plug-in. You cannot directly trigger a plug-in using JavaScript code. Plug-ins are triggered on create, read, update and delete events in Microsoft Dataverse and are triggered on those events.

Question 77

CompanyA is using Dynamics 365 Sales and a customer portal integrated with Dynamics 365 Sales via Web API to manage orders. Orders are created in Dynamics 365 Sales either by using Sales Order form or Finance Order form. They are also created from the customer portal. The company wants to check whether the tax number format provided is correct for the selected country when the order record is created.

You need to create a business rule.

How should you configure the scope of the business rule?

Answer

You should use the business rule with the scope set as Entity. This is because orders are created from different channels, and using the entity scope allows the business rule to trigger on server-side logic. Business rules are used to perform validations, set the requirement level of the fields, and to show/hide fields on forms.
You should not use the business rule with the scope set as All Forms. This will only work on orders created from Dynamics 365 Sales, and the orders created from the customer portal will not have the tax number format validation applied to the records.
You should not use the business rule with the scope set to Sales Order form. This will only work for orders that are created from Dynamics 365 Sales using the Sales Order form.
You should not use the business rule with the scope set to Finance Order form. This will only work for orders that are created from Dynamics 365 Sales using the Finance Order form.

Question 78

You are designing a business process flow for a sales organization to help them solve the following requirements:
Sales persons should follow the same steps to complete the sales process (shown in exhibit 1).
Sales managers should follow the same steps to handle the approvals process (shown in exhibit 2).
Sales persons should not be able to see the business process flow of sales managers and vice versa.
Sales manager should be able to send an SMS/email notification to the customer when the L3 Approval stage is completed.
The business process flows color and theme should follow organization User Interface (UI) guidelines.
You need to set up the business process flow.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

Answer

You should not write JavaScript to hide the business process flow of the salespersons for the sales managers and vice versa. Business process flow accessibility can be managed through security roles. When you create a business process flow on a table, it creates a new table in Microsoft Dataverese for that business process flow. You can now provide the security on the business process flow table in Dynamics 365 to hide/show it for a particular user.

You can use custom controls in the business process flow to enhance data visualization. Business process flow supports custom controls like flip control, slider control, etc. for enhancing data visualization. You just need to add the custom control on a particular field, add a business process flow stage, and publish the form changes to display the control in the business process flow.

You should use Power Automate to send notifications from the business process flow. Power Automate supports Twilio and Office 365 Outlook connectors to send SMS and email notifications respectively. Twilio is a connector available in the PowerApps that enables apps to send and receive global SMS, MMS, and IP messages. While Office 365 Outlook connector is used to connect to the Office 365 mailbox and send emails. Users can trigger Power Automate manually through the business process flow in order to send the notification.

You can change the color of the business process flow by changing the Dynamics 365 theme. Dynamics 365 allows users to change the theme of the application. User needs to navigate to Dynamics 365 Settings > Customizations > Theme to change the theme of the Dynamics 365 application. You can also change the toolbar color, button color, business process flow color, etc.

You cannot reuse the same business process flow on other entities (tables). A business process flow is always associated with a single table. Each time you create a business process flow for a table, it creates a new table with the same name as the business process flow name, and it stores all the information related to the current stage of the business process flow. A business process flow is tightly coupled with a particular table so you cannot reuse it on other tables.

Question 79

You are designing a solution for a sales organization.

You need to ensure that the solution meets the requirements of the organization with minimal customization.

Which components should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate components to each requirement. Each component may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

To automatically send a thank you email to a customer when a sales is closed, you should use a workflow. You need to set the trigger of a workflow to Process Completed in the business process flow to send an email to close a sale.

To ensure that a quote is approved by the sales manager before sending it to the customer, you should use a business process flow. Business process flows help ensure that the users are following the right process or steps to get their work done.

To display an error message or recommendation for providing the wrong input, you should use business rules. Business rules provide a simple user interface that validates user input without writing code. For example, hide/show a field, set/clear field values, show error messages, and send a recommendation if a user provides wrong input.

You should not use Power Automate. Power Automate can neither be used to display error messages nor to ensure that the user has performed the correct steps on the form. To send an email when a sales is closed, you can easily use a system workflow. Power Automate also requires an additional license along with the Dynamics 365 license.

You should not use plug-in code. All requirements can easily be achieved through Dynamics 365 out-of-the-box (OOB) features like Workflow, Business Process Flow, and Business Rules. Therefore, you do not need to write C# code. Plug-in code is required when you need to trigger complex business logic on the trigger (create/update/delete) of Microsoft Dataverse data.

You should not use JavaScript code. All requirements can easily be achieved through Dynamics 365 out-of-the-box (OOB) features like Workflow, Business Process Flow, and Business Rules. Therefore, you do not need to write a client-side script. JavaScript is used to perform operations in Microsoft Dataverse using WEB API and perform complex client-side validations that cannot be achieved through business rules.

Question 80

Your manager asks you to create a business rule that enforces and preserves commonly used rules. You create the business rule but realize that it is not running properly.

You need to solve the issue.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should make sure that you do not have competing business rules. Competing business rules occur when the same field is being used in several rules with the same rule behavior. This may be the cause of the scenario issue.

You should also stop any JavaScript running on your application’s form. If there is any JavaScript running, you should stop it because web resources usually take priority on loading a form over business rules. This may be the cause of the scenario issue.

You should not make sure that the field you want to use in the business rule is a calculated field. This will not meet the scenario requirement because calculated fields cannot be used in business rules. Calculated fields include calculations that use fields from the entity that the user is currently using.

You should not add an Else condition. Adding an Else condition will not solve the issue described in the scenario. You would use this solution if, for example, you were setting a condition for approval status in your business rule, in which the Package Type field should be hidden when the Approval Status is equal to Approved. An issue would arise if the Package Type field becomes hidden again when the Approval Status is not equal to Approved. This problem can be solved by adding an Else condition for the Business Rule to determine the action of the Package Type field specifically when the Approval Status is changed or cleared.

You should not clear the package type. Clearing the package type is an action included in the process of adding an Else condition. The Package Type field is found on the user's application form. Clearing it will not solve the issue because monitoring this field is not a requirement for setting up a business rule.

Question 81

Your company has a customer service department. Each employee has a specific method of dealing with customer requests. The department coordinator asks you to set a business process flow so that all employees handle customer requests in the same way. You create the required workflow and set a Boolean field to trigger the workflow. You get an error message with the privileges that need to be monitored as shown in the exhibit.

You need to find the required privileges in the given code.

What privileges should you monitor?

Answer

You should monitor the Create Activity, Read Activity, Write Activity, and Delete Activity privileges. You should recognize these privileges from the given code by searching for prv in the code. In the code, Prv is used as an abbreviation for privilege.

You should not monitor the Create Activity and Read Activity privileges. There are other missing privileges that you should also monitor to solve the issue: the Write Activity and the Read Activity privileges.
