You should then write/modify the code in the Azure function to read the customer data from Dataverse and publish the Azure function from Visual Studio. You need to publish the function to push your code in the Function app in Azure.

Next, you should register a new webhook in the plugin registration tool. This is an Azure-aware plug-in that allows developers to directly send/pass the data from Dynamics 365 to Azure Function on a particular event. You should provide a Function App endpoint URL and its key value in the webhook to connect the Azure function from Dynamics 365 through a plugin.

Finally, you should register a new step of account creation in order to trigger the webhook on the account creation.

You should not write plug-in code to read customer data from Dataverse. In Webhook, you do not have the option to add a class library and write the c# code to read data from Dataverse like in other types of plug-ins. In Webhook, you only need to write the code/logic in Azure Function.

You should not call the Azure function in plug-in code. In Webhook, you do not have the option to add a class library and write the c# code to read data from Dataverse like in other types of plug-ins. In Webhook, you need to provide the function app endpoint URL and its key while registering to connect with Azure Function.

Question 98

You are working as a developer for a company that wants you to migrate its Microsoft Dataverse data to an external database.

You need to identify the pipeline stages in which to register the plug-in.

What stages should you use to meet the requirements? To answer, drag the appropriate stages to the correct descriptions. Each stage may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should register the plug-in in the pre-validation stage to check for duplicate data. Pre-validation is the stage in the plug-in execution pipeline that validates the data available on the form and that shows an error message to the Dynamics 365 user, if needed. The pre-validation stage always performs the operation/transactions outside of Microsoft Dataverse.

You should register the plug-in in the pre-operation stage to update the case resolution time on case closure. Pre-operation is the stage in the plug-in execution pipeline that lets you modify the data before the actual database transaction is made in the core operation stage. You cannot use the post-operation stage here, because the post-operation stage is the stage that comes after the core operation stage. Once the case is closed in the core operation stage, you cannot make any changes in the database on read-only data in the post-operation stage. That is why you should register the plug-in in the pre-operation stage.

You should register the plug-in in the post-operation stage to send the Microsoft Dataverse table data to an external API. You should always register the plug-in in async mode to call the external API through a plug-in code. An asynchronous plug-in can only be registered in the post-operation stage.

You should not use the core operation stage. Core operation is part of the plug-in execution pipeline in which the main operation (create/update/delete) is performed in Microsoft Dataverse. However, Microsoft does not allow you to register the plug-in directly in this stage to avoid any direct changes in the database.

Question 99

You are tasked to create a plug-in. You create a Visual Studio project to create the plug-in and you plan to edit the class file in order to enable the plug-in. Editing the class file requires you to replace the contents of the Execute method with code including expressions that allow you to write to the tracing log and give you access to the context for the event that executes the plugin.

You need to add expressions that meet these requirements and allow you to edit the class file.

Which expressions should you use to complete the plug-in? To answer, complete the commands by selecting the correct parts from the drop-down menus.

Answer

In line 2 you should use the GetService(typeof(ITracingService)); expression. To enable writing to the tracing log, you must obtain the ITracingService. This is the only expression that allows you to obtain the tracing service. ITracingService provides a method to log plug-in run-time data. This will also help developers to record run-time custom information that will help them to view or diagnose the code of the plug-in.

You should not use the GetService(typeof(IOrganizationServiceFactory)); in line 2. This expression is used to obtain the organization service reference, which is used for web service calls.

You should not use the GetService(typeof(IPluginExecutionContext)); in line 2. This expression is used to get the execution context from the provider of the service. This provides access to the context for the event that is executing the plugin and does not allow you to obtain the tracing service as mentioned in the scenario requirement.

In line 3 you should use the context = (IPluginExecutionContext) expression. This allows access to the context for the event that is executing the plug-in. This also provides some information about the Stage the plug-in is registered for as well as data about ParentContext. Data about ParentContext provides information about operations that trigger the plug-in.

You should not use the GetService(typeof(IOrganizationServiceFactory)) expression in line 3. This expression is used to obtain the organization service reference which is used for web service calls.

You should not use the context.InputParameters expression in line 3. This expression does not meet the scenario requirement since it provides parameters for the CreateRequest that the plug-in will be registered for.

Question 100

You are designing a canvas app for a retail organization.

You need to make sure that only the Global administrator is able to login to the app. The Global admin should also be able to manage (create/update/delete) the users in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

Which of the following two components should you use to implement the requirement?

Answer

You should use a custom connector. A custom connector functions like a wrapper around an API, acting as a middleware between the source and target to establish communication. In order to make the connection between the canvas app and Azure AD, you need to create a custom connector that calls the Microsoft Graph API to perform an operation in Azure AD.

You should also use the Microsoft Graph API. Microsoft Graph is a kind of REST API provided by Microsoft to interact with the data and services available in Azure AD, Microsoft Teams, Office 365, etc. In order to perform an operation in Azure AD through a canvas app, you need to call the Microsoft Graph API from the canvas app. It is not possible to call the API directly from the canvas app, so you need to create a custom connector as described in the first paragraph.

You should not use a standard connector. Standard connectors are useful to connect the data available in commonly used data sources like Dataverse, Microsoft Excel, SharePoint, etc. However, they do not meet the scenario requirements.

You should not use the Web API. The Web API is provided by Microsoft to interact with the data available in Dataverse. You have to perform operations in Azure AD so you do not need to use the Web API here.

You should not Azure Logic Apps. Azure Logic Apps cannot be called directly from a canvas app to perform an operation in Azure AD. It is also asynchronous in nature. This is not the right fit for the first requirement, in which a user needs to login to the app based on their role in Azure AD.

Question 101

You are designing a canvas app for an event management organization that organizes PowerApps events online.

You need to build a custom connector that meets the following requirements:
Create a new team each time a new event is published.
Send a Microsoft Teams invite to all the participants.
Add the event organizer as Owner of the team.
Add participants as members of the team.
Which API authentication type should you use?

Answer

You should use OAuth 2.0. Microsoft Graph API uses OAuth 2.0 authentication and to interact with Microsoft Teams you should use the Microsoft Graph API. For example, this will allow you to create a teams invite, add a member to the teams, add an owner to the teams, etc. Microsoft Graph requires interaction with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) in order to add members/owners to the teams, so the API must have Azure AD permissions.

You should not use Basic authentication. You should use Basic authentication only when you have a username and password to authenticate the API. You need to use Microsoft Graph API to perform the required operations in Microsoft Teams. Microsoft Graph API does not use Basic authentication.

You should not use API key based authentication. You should use API key based authentication only when you get a unique key from your API owner to authenticate the API or web services. Microsoft Graph API is a Microsoft-provided REST-based API that does not require an API key to authenticate. For example, if you use Azure Cognitive Services for text or sentiment analysis, you need to use API key-based authentication.

You should not use No authentication. You should use No authentication only when the API does not need any authentication to consume the data. This kind of authentication is often used for the creation of public APIs. For example, Facebook and Google have many public APIs that developers can directly consume without any authentication.

Question 102

You are designing a canvas app for an automobile company. The company wants employees to be able to save the data in SharePoint, Dynamics 365, and Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) through the canvas app.

You need to use the appropriate connectors in the canvas app to meet the company's requirements.

Which connectors should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate connector to the correct requirement. Each connector may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should use a standard SharePoint connector to allow employees to upload documents. For example, pictures taken from mobile phones can be stored in Sharepoint. You should only create a custom connector to communicate with systems or applications for which Microsoft has not provided any standard connector. For example, you would need to create a custom connector if you have to pull/push data from Azure AD, Microsoft Teams, or any external third party system.

You should use a standard Microsoft Dataverse connector to allow employees to create notes in Dynamics 365. You should only create a custom connector to communicate with systems or applications for which Microsoft has not provided any standard connector.

You should use a custom connector to allow employees to create a new user in Azure AD. In order to perform a create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) operation in Azure AD, you need to use the Microsoft Graph API, which can only be called in Canvas App using a custom connector.

Question 103

CompanyA is using Microsoft Dataverse with Dynamics 365 for Sales. Orders are created in different currencies for different regions in Microsoft Dataverse. CompanyA plans to add daily exchange rates for each currency in Microsoft Dataverse.

You need to design an integration that allows the company to retrieve exchange rates and use that exchange rate when orders are created. You want the exchange rate records to be viewed inside Microsoft Dataverse, but not to be stored in Microsoft Dataverse.

What data source should you use for each requirement? To answer, drag the appropriate data source to each requirement. A data source may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should use a virtual entity to create, update, and delete data in the external systems. Virtual entities allow you to display data from external systems in the form of views and columns in Microsoft Dataverse and the data still resides in external database. You should not use custom connector as this only allows you to communicate with REST or SOAP APIs.
You should use a virtual entity to add a numeric primary key. Virtual entities have the feature of alternate keys to support records that use a numeric column as a primary key. You should not use a custom connector because it is not possible to add a primary key to a custom connector.

You should use a custom connector to ensure that data is available to all Microsoft Dataverse clients. Custom connectors are used for Logic Apps, Power Automate, or Power Apps to communicate with REST or SOAP API. You should not use a virtual entity because it is only available in Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement.

Question 104

You are developing a single-page web application that uses Dataverse. The organization wants its users to submit lead data.

You need to use the Dynamics 365 Web API in order to authenticate your app using OAuth. The solution should follow Microsoft's recommendations.

What should you use?

Answer

You should use Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL). MSAL enables developers to get access tokens from the Microsoft identity platform to authenticate users and provide access to data. Since June 2020, Microsoft recommends that developers use MSAL in their application development, not ADAL.

You should not use Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL). ADAL used to be the way to get access tokens from the Microsoft identity platform to authenticate users and provide access to data. However, Microsoft no longer provides support for ADAL and recommends that developers start adopting MSAL in their application development.

You should not use Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS). CORS enables applications to communicate regardless of what platform they use and the programming language they support. The Dynamics 365 Web API supports CORS, which means that it can be called from any platform and through any language. CORS is neither a DLL nor a component that should be used to support Dynamics 365 OAuth authentication. It is a mechanism/feature that Dynamics 365 WEB API already supports in order to support the API calling from any platform and language.

You should not use Windows Communication Foundation (WCF). WCF is a framework for building APIs and applications that establish communication between two endpoints. It cannot be used to generate access tokens and authenticate Dynamics 365 users.

Question 105

You are working for a company that uses Dynamics 365 for Sales. The company plans to integrate an event management system that is built using Node JS.

You need to provide the web development team with an authentication strategy that uses OAuth 2.0 with permissions on specific entities of Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE).

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following actions in order:
Register an application in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
Add permissions to the application to control access to Dynamics 365 online.
Navigate to the Keys area and add a new key, then copy the value of the secret and save it.
Create an application user in Dynamics 365 CE and add the Application ID of the app from Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
You should first register an application in Azure AD to use OAuth 2.0 to access Dynamics 365 online. To register an application in Azure AD you need to navigate to App registrations and create a new app.
Then, you should add permissions to the application to control access to Dynamics 365 online. To add permissions, go to API access and in required permissions, add Dynamics CRM Online.
You should navigate to the Keys area in the API access and add a new key that acts as a client secret. This client secret is used to access the Dynamics 365 API.
Finally, you should create an application user in Dynamics 365 CE and add the Application ID of the app from Azure AD while creating the user. Application users do not have the credentials to log into Dynamics 365 CE but they allow developers to access Dynamics 365 CE tables in code.
You should not add a secret to Azure Key Vault. You should use Azure Key Vault when the application does not need a client secret and requires managed identity authentication to access resources in Azure.
You should not create a user-assigned managed identity. A user-assigned managed identity is used to authenticate Azure resources and managed identities allow authentication without requiring you to manage credentials.

Question 106

You are designing a single-page application for your business partners to give them limited access to Dynamics 365 data.

You need to use the Web API to connect the application with Dynamics 365 and perform operations.

Which three actions should you perform to authenticate users through the Web API? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Answer

You should create an application user. An application user should be created in Dynamics 365 to connect Dynamics 365 application programmatically through the WEB API. This is a special type of user that does not require a Dynamics 365 license in order to connect or perform an operation on Microsoft Dataverse.

You should also provide Dynamics CRM user impersonation API permission and grant Admin consent. You need to register an Azure AD app in order to authenticate Dynamics 365 users via the WEB API OAuth 2.0. Once you register the app, you need to grant Dynamics CRM user impersonation API permission and select Grant Admin consent so that the web app can authenticate users on behalf of Dynamics CRM.

You should also generate a client Id and secret key. Client and secret keys must be captured at the time of Azure AD app registration. These two details are mandatory to connect Dynamics 365 via the WEB API.

You should not assign the System Administrator role to the user. You should assign the role to the user based on the operation they need to perform in the Microsoft Dataverse table. You should avoid giving the System Admin role to external users.

You should not assign a Dynamics 365 license to the user. You should assign a Dynamics 365 license only to those users who need to access Dynamics 365 features by logging into the application. Application users do not need to be assigned a Dynamics 365 license.

You should not assign an Environment Maker role to the user. The Environment Maker role should be assigned to create resources in a Power Platform environment like create PowerApps, create Power Automate, etc. The Environment Maker role does not have access to Microsoft Dataverse data. Therefore, this role is not the right fit for the application user in this scenario.

Question 107

You are developing an application that uses the Dynamics 365 Web API to perform operations in Dataverse.

You need to handle exceptions in your code by identifying the correct Web API error codes.

To answer, drag the appropriate error code to the correct code descriptions. Each code may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You get a 405-Method Not Allowed error for using an incorrect operation and resource combination. For example, you cannot use the DELETE operation on a collection of tables because you will get a 405 - Invalid Operation error message in your code.

You get a 401-Unauthorized Access error for using invalid credentials, an invalid connection, or an expired access token. For example, you will experience this code issue if you are making an HTTP request and the request is not able to make contact with the server due to invalid credentials, an invalid connection string, or an expired security token.

You get a 429-API limit exceeded error for exceeding the request limits in a specific time limit. For example, when a client makes too many requests, Microsoft Dataverse returns a 429 error code indicating that too many requests have been made. Microsoft Dataverse also returns the header key Retry-After in the WEB API response, which tells you how long you have to wait before making another request.

You get a 413-Request length too large error when the requested length is larger than the limits defined by the server.

You get a 403-Invalid Access Rights error when the server refuses to authorize your request due to access rights or permission issues on the requested resource. For example, you will get this error when you make a WEB API request to update the contact table but you do not have access to Microsoft Dataverse.

You get a 400-Bad Request error when the server does not process your request due to an invalid request message made by the client. This issue may occur when you have any syntax or formatting-related issues in your request message.

Question 108

The company you work for uses Microsoft Dataverse. You plan to develop system views that are available for every user. You want the advanced find queries to be reusable in the application that the users are using. You use the Dataverse Web API to create the entity record shown in the exhibit.

You need to anticipate how the entity record will perform and identify any required changes.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

Answer

The Prefer: return=representation in line 6 is a header that returns the values of created records. In this scenario, you should use the Prefer: return=representation header. This will allow you to create a new record along with the existing product.

The @odata.context expression is not missing from line 9. This property returns the context URL for the payload. In this scenario, you should use the @odata.bind property in line 9. By using the @odata.bind annotation you can link new entities to already existing ones when they are created.

The $select query option in the first line is appended to the URL to the entity set. In this scenario, you should append the $select query option to the URL to the entity set. Using this action will allow you to control which properties are returned.

Question 109

You are designing a Power Apps portal for a retail organization. The organization wants both their customer and the internal Helpdesk team to have access to the portal.

You need to ensure that only those users in the organization can access the portal.

Which three PowerApps features should you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Answer

You should use Portal Invitation to restrict the portal access to a limited audience. This feature allows you to give access to the portal only to invited users.

You should also use Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Conditional Access. Azure AD Conditional Access allows you to restrict a specific user or group of users from accessing a particular resource. For example, if you want to give access to Power Apps portals to the Helpdesk team only, you can create an Azure AD Conditional Access policy in Azure AD and block access to the Power Apps portal resource to all the users of the organization except the Helpdesk team.

You should also use Site Settings. Site Settings allow you to disable the Azure AD login option on the portal. Once you set the Azure AD site setting value to false, no internal user can log in to the portal using their Azure AD user accounts unless someone in the organization invites them to access the portal.

You should not use Web Roles. Web roles are similar to security roles in Dynamics 365. They provide record-level security and control read/write access of Microsoft Dataverse data. Using web roles, an authenticated user will be able to access the content of the portal, but an anonymous user will not be able to do so. Web roles cannot be used to restrict access to the portal, they can only be used to restrict the data that is available on the portal.

You should not use Entity Permissions. You should use entity permissions to manage the access level and data privilege on the portal. For example, you could create a new entity permission for the opportunity table and enable only read privileges on it. Then, if you associate this entity permission with the web role ABC, that means all users who have an ABC web role can only read the opportunity data on the portal. So, entity permissions along with web role cannot be used to restrict access to the portal, they can only be used to restrict the data that is available on the portal.

You should not use Webpage Access Control. You should use Webpage Access Control to manage portal page permissions. For example, you can give access to a particular page to anonymous users, so that they can access the information without being logged in to the portal.

Question 110

You are using a model-driven app for a healthcare organization to maintain the information of doctors and patients.

The organization is planning to set up multiple vaccination centers across the world and has the following requirements:
Each doctor in the organization should have the capability to fetch information about the relevant health records of a particular patient from the government's official website.
The organization should be able to send an update related to vaccination to all patients. For example, the date of the first and the second vaccination dose and vaccination availability.
The organization reports that the government's website takes a long response time due to using an outdated applications and heavy traffic load.

Which component should you use to fulfill the requirements and optimize the process?

Answer

You should use an Azure Function. In order to fetch the patient's past disease details and publish the updates about vaccinations, you need to perform multiple transactions in Microsoft Dataverse along with a long response time from the government's official website. Dynamics 365 components (plug-in, workflow, custom actions, etc.) are not recommended for long-running processes especially when you are expecting a delay in response from the server because each waiting process will be responsible for performance overhead. The more long-running process instances you have, the more Dynamics 365 server resources will be consumed by the Asynchronous processing services.

You should not use a plug-in. Plug-ins should not be used for long-running processes. If you choose an async plug-in, it has a timeout of 2 minutes. When multiple doctors work simultaneously in the application this will impact the app's performance.

You should not use a custom workflow. A custom workflow can be considered for a long-running process using wait conditions. However, since it is a Dynamics 365 component, it is not recommended to use a custom workflow for a long-running process.

You should not use a custom action. A custom action is a chunk of code that can only be called either through a plug-in, workflow, or Javascript. All of these components are Dynamics 365 components, which may impact Dynamics 365 performance.

Question 111

You are building a PowerApps portal for an organization. The portal is going to be used by internal and external users as well as business partners.

You need to choose an identity provider for your portal audience so that everyone can access the portal with limited access to internal data.

What providers should you use for each audience type? The solutions should follow Microsoft recommendations. To answer, drag the appropriate provider to the correct portal audience. Each component may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should choose Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) B2C for customers, consumers, and anyone else that does not require access to internal resources. Azure AD B2C is the recommended and default PowerApps authentication method.

You should choose Azure AD B2B for business partners, suppliers, and stakeholders that are not part of your organization and that want access to your organization's internal data. Azure AD B2B allows you to simply invite them to access your resources in a controlled manner.

You should choose Azure AD for employees or organization users with an account in the organization's home Azure AD tenant. This authentication type is often used for Dynamics 365 internal users that do not need any additional license to access the portal and that access the portal with their Dynamics 365 Apps user account.

You should not choose Local Authentication. Local Authentication used to be the recommended authentication provider for customers/citizens. However, due to GDPR constraints, it is no longer recommended. Local Authentication stores user credentials in a Dynamics 365 contact table, which is not a good practice from a security perspective. Therefore, Microsoft recommends using Azure AD B2C instead of Local Authentication. Local Authentication is still available on the portal but you should use it only for testing portal functionalities.

Question 112

You are designing a canvas app for an event management organization. The organization has its own security system that maintains the role of each user participating in the event.

You need to ensure that these users see information in the canvas app based on their roles assigned in the system.

Which component should you use?

Answer

You should use Azure Function. You can write the server-side code in Azure Function to communicate with the organization's security system and read the role of logged-in canvas app users. This Azure Function can be called in the canvas app by creating a Custom Connector or Custom API.

You should not use a plug-in. A plug-in is a method of applying business logic that runs only when an event triggers in Microsoft Dataverse. Plug-ins cannot be used in a canvas app to read user roles from the organization's security system.

You should not use Microsoft Graph API. Microsoft Graph API is a Microsoft-provided REST-based API that can only be used to communicate with other Microsoft applications like SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Azure AD, OneDrive, etc. It cannot be used to read data from the organization's security system.

You should not use a custom code component. Custom code components should be used to provide data visualization components in canvas apps like progress bar control, auto-complete control, address finder, iframe control, etc. They cannot be used to communicate with any external third-party system.

Question 113

You are developing a model-driven application for CompanyA. The model-driven application will be integrated with several on-premises and cloud environments.

As a Power Apps developer, you need to identify the method that should be used for each integration.

To answer, drag the appropriate method to each integration. Each method may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

Answer

You should use webhooks to send synchronous outbound calls. By using webhooks with Microsoft Dataverse, you can send data about events that occur in web applications. Webhooks enable developers to integrate custom code that is hosted on external services with Microsoft Dataverse.
You should use Azure Event Hubs to make calls to and from websites hosted in Azure. Azure Event Hubs is a platform that is used for big data streaming and to handle high peak loads. It can be used to process millions of events per second.
You should use plug-ins to make calls to multiple on-premises and cloud systems. Plug-ins can be used with create, read, update, and delete operations. Plug-ins can also be invoked using custom actions to make calls to both on-premises and cloud systems.
You should not use Power Automate. Power Automate flows run asynchronously as background processes. Power Automate flows can be used instead of background workflows and can be used to connect to different data sources.

Question 114

CompanyA is using a canvas application to manage timesheets and allowance approvals of their employees. The master data for timesheets and employee allowances is stored on a website database hosted in Azure.
You need to use an Azure function that retrieves the master data from the website database and shows it in your canvas app.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following actions in order:
Create an Azure Function.
Use Swagger to define the REST API signature.
Use Power Apps to add a custom API.
Use the newly added custom API from Power Apps.
First, you should create an Azure function. You need to have an existing Azure subscription for this. Azure functions are used for event-driven serverless computing and can be created from Visual Studio using .NET, Node JS, Java, Python and TypeScript.
Next, you should use Swagger to define the REST API signature for the Azure function. Swagger is widely used for describing REST APIs using JSON. Swagger provides automated code generation.
You should then use Power Apps to add a custom API after navigating to connections. You should provide a name and the JSON file downloaded from Swagger to create the new API in Power Apps.
Finally, you should use the newly added custom API from Power Apps using Power Apps studio. In Data sources, you should create a new connection and add your custom API.
You should not use a custom connector to call an Azure function. Custom connectors need to be built and configured before they can be used to call HTTP triggered Azure functions.
You should not create a folder structure. A folder structure is automatically created when you create and publish an Azure function. The function code resides in a root project folder that contains all the configurations.

Question 115

You are working as a developer for a company that uses Dynamics 365 for Sales. The company wants opportunities to be marked as closed when an order is confirmed.

You need to pass data to an http triggered Azure function and configure the Plugin Registration Tool to send data to an Azure function when an order is confirmed in Dynamics 365 for Sales.
Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

Answer

You should perform the following actions in order:
Select Register New Web Hook.
Enter the Endpoint URL.
Set Authentication to WebhookKey.
Add the key-value for the http triggered Azure function.
Register a new step on the update of the sales order and update the filtering attributes to check the status field only.
You should select Register New Web Hook. Web hooks can send data about operations performed in Dynamics 365 to the external services or application. The executionContext information is passed in JSON format here.
Next, you should enter the Endpoint URL. After registering the web hook, you need to define the Endpoint URL that you get from the Azure portal.
You should set Authentication to WebhookKey. The WebhookKey option is used with Azure Functions because the authentication query string is expected to have a key name of code.
You should also add the key-value for the http triggered Azure function because you must provide the keys that will identify the request as legitimate.
Finally, you should register a new step on the update of the sales order and update the filtering attributes to check the status field because you need to send data only when the sales order is confirmed.
You should not register a new step on the update of the sales order. This will send data to Azure Functions if any attribute is updated and you just need to send data when a sales order status is confirmed.
You should not select Register New Service Endpoint. Service endpoints are used for external messaging with an Azure Service Bus solution endpoint.

Question 116

CompanyA is using a model-driven application that uses Dataverse. CompanyA wants to send out emails for customers that do not pay their invoices.

You need to use C# code to dynamically replace the custom email tags. You plan to implement an Azure function that is triggered on a daily basis.
How should you define the CRON expression to send emails everyday at 12:00 AM?

Answer

You should use the 0 0 0 * * expression to trigger the function every day. CRON expressions are used to define schedules and expressions that contain 5 or 6 characters that are separated by a whitespace character. Time-triggered Azure functions use CRON expressions to define a schedule. The format for a CRON expression in Azure is as follows: {second} {minute} {hour} {day} {month} {day of the week}. Five-character CRON expressions are not supported in Azure.
You should not use 0 /12 * * * . This expression would trigger the function every 12 minutes.
You should not use 0 0 /12 * * . This expression would trigger the function every 12 hours.
You should not use 0 0 0-12 * *. This expression would trigger the function once every hour from 12 AM to 12 PM.

Question 117

You are designing a mobile App for the Global Admin of the organization.

The organization wants to share this app with the Office 365 and Azure Administrators to perform the following activities:
Create user in Azure AD/office 365.
Search user in Azure AD/office 365.
Update user details in Azure AD/office 365.
Which of the following three components should you use to implement this requirement?

Answer

You should use Custom Connector. Custom Connector should use to create an API that allows developers to communicate with an external system or application.

You should use Azure Function. Azure Function should use to write the server-side code in Canvas App. You can write your code in Azure Function in order to perform the operation in Azure AD and Office 365.

You should use Microsoft Graph API. Microsoft Graph API is the REST-based API provided by Microsoft to communicate with other Microsoft applications like Office 365, Azure AD, Onedrive, Microsoft Teams, etc.

You should not use Office 365 Connector. You should use Office 365 Connector to get the Office 365 user's profile details. For example, firstname, lastname, email, mobile phone, etc.

You should not use Plug-in. Plug-ins are a trigger-based Dynamics 365 component that can perform an action only when any changes made directly in the Microsoft Dataverse. Here, you have to perform an operation in Office 365, not in Microsoft Dataverse, therefore you should not use the plug-in to fulfil the requirement.

You should not use Custom Action. Custom Action are a Dynamics 365 component that supposed to be used to perform an operation in Microsoft Dataverse. Also, Power Automate is the only way available in the Power Platform in order to call Custom Actions, Here, we don't have any option of Power Automate, therefore you should not choose Custom Action to fulfil the requirement.

Question 118

You are developing a Power Automate flow for CompanyA using Microsoft Dataverse Connector and Finance and Operations Connector to sync account records from Dynamics 365 for Sales to Finance and Operations. You create the flow, setting the flow trigger to When a record is created. After creating a record in Dynamics 365 for Sales, you check the flow run page and see that the flow was not triggered.
You need to troubleshoot the flow.

What is a possible reason for the flow not being triggered?

Answer

A possible cause for the flow not being triggered is that change tracking is not enabled for accounts. To use flows for an entity in Microsoft Dataverse, change tracking must be enabled. In this case, you must navigate to customizations in Dynamics 365 for Sales, and enable change tracking for accounts.
A possible cause for the flow not being triggered is not that the flow is turned off. This only happens when the flow is copied and the scenario does not mention that. If the flow is turned off, you are not able to trigger it. However, all flows are turned on by default unless you explicitly turn off a flow.
A possible cause for the flow not being triggered is not that the flow has errors. The flow will not be created if it has errors at the time of creation and you will not be able to test it from Dynamics 365 unless all errors are resolved.
A possible cause for the flow not being triggered is not that there is a data loss prevention policy in place. In the case that an account is created and data loss prevention policies restrict usage of connectors that export data from Microsoft Dataverse, the flow would not be triggered. In this case, the data is not being exported. Data loss prevention policies are used to prevent users from accessing organizational data. Organizations classify some connectors for Power Automate as blocked to prevent unnecessary access to organizational data.

Question 119

CompanyA is planning to implement Dynamics 365 for Sales.

You need to make sure that duplicate leads with the same first and last name are not created. You cannot use customization.
What should you use?

Answer

You should use alternate keys to prevent the generation of duplicate data. Alternate keys are unique keys that can also be used as a combination of multiple fields. You can use both the first and last name as an alternate key to prevent the generation of duplicate leads in the system.
You should not use a duplicate detection job. Duplicate detection jobs are used to identify potential duplicates that work on existing records. You can query the data using a duplicate detection wizard by providing the appropriate filters to check for potential duplicate records.
You should not use a plug-in. A plug-in requires customization. Plug-ins can be used to throw an error if there are duplicate records with the same first and last name. Plug-ins are triggered on create, read, update and delete operations and action plug-ins are triggered on custom messages.
You should not use a duplicate detection rule. A duplicate detection rule shows a warning when duplicate records are being created but it does not prevent the users from saving those records. You can configure a duplicate detection rule for leads with the same first name and last name, but it will only warn you that some matching records are found in a modal pop-up window and the user will still be able to save the record with the same information.

Question 120

You are synchronizing Dynamics 365 data with a third-party application.

You need to enable the Change Tracking setting in your Dynamics 365 instance to only sync the data that has been changed after the last synchronization.

Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of possible actions to the answer area and arrange them in order.

Answer

You should perform the following actions in order to enable change tracking on a particular table:
Navigate to Settings.
Click on Customizations.
Click on Customize the System.
Expand the Entities tab.
Enable the Change Tracking option on the table.
First, you should navigate to Settings from the top navigation bar. This will take you to the page where you can change the settings of your Dynamics 365 instance.

Then, you should click on Customizations. This will take you to the page where you can customize your Dynamics 365 components.

Next, you should click on Customize the System. This will take you to the page where you can see the list of solution components like tables, plug-ins, workflows, and so on.

Then, you should expand the Entities tab from the left navigation bar. This will display the list of all available tables in your Dynamics 365 instance.

Finally, you should enable the Change Tracking option on the table whose data you want to sync with an external system. Change Tracking is not the global setting that you can enable for all the tables in the Dynamics 365 instance. You need to individually go to a particular table to enable that option.

You should not go to Advanced Settings. You can use the Advanced Settings option to change the organization-level global settings in your Dynamics 365 instance.

You should not navigate to the Entities tab under Advanced Settings. You should navigate to the Entities tab to change the global settings on tables, for example to enable Power Automate.

You should not click the Publish All Customization option. This option is mandatory when you make any change to the global settings of the organization.

PL 400 QNA.md

Question : How can you configure an event handler if the library that you are using does not contain the function you want to add

Answer :  To add the required function, you should add a JavaScript web resource to the JavaScript library.

Question : How to add custom command button to a Dynamics 365 page

Answer : You should expand the  “new.department.EnableRule.EntityRule” enable rule to check that the EntityLogicalName is the same as the current entity you are in.

Question : How to create a custom connector that retrieves data from the APIs of third party companies

Answer : You should configure OpenAPI. When you create a custom connector, you can use a file or a URL to define OpenAPI.

You should also configure the authentication model when creating the required custom connector. API key authentication is the most suitable authentication in this scenario because you are creating the custom connector through OpenAPI.

 You can use HTTP verb that deﬁnes a set of request methods that indicate which actions need to be performed for a given resource. GET, DELETE, POST, and PUT are examples of HTTP verbs.

Question : How can you retrieve customer feedback by creating an Azure Function ?

Answer : You should import a RESTful API hosted in Azure Logic Apps or Azure Functions.

Then you create an API definition for the Azure function. An OpenAPI definition includes data related to the operations that are available in an API and related to the structure of the API.

Question : What are the steps to authenticate Azure Stream Analytics ?

Answer : You should perform the following steps in order:

  1. Access the Managed Identity option in the Configure section.
  2. Click the Authorize button and log in using your Power BI account.
  3. Set the Authentication mode to Managed Identity and click Save.

Question : Which application pattern will benefit while running long process by using Azure Functions ?

Answer : The Human interaction pattern benefits from the durable function used. In this scenario, you can use an orchestrator function to implement the pattern where the approval is sent to the manager. In case the manager does not approve the request in a specified time, another process occurs which is defined by Escalation.

Question : What is Function chaining pattern?

Answer : It is a sequence of specific functions is executed in a specified order. The output of one function will be applied to the input of another.

Question : What is Fan out/Fan in pattern ?

Answer : Here you can execute multiple functions in parallel and then wait for all of them to finish.

Question :  What does Async HTTP APIs pattern do ?

Answer : This pattern addresses the conflict of managing the state of long-running operations with customers.

Question : How can you ensure that employees can access the Customer self-service portal to raise a request on behalf of the customer.

Answer : You should use Azure AD. The employees are internal users of the organization and they already have their Azure AD account in an Azure AD home tenant.

Question : What is Azure AD B2B and  B2C?

Answer : It is used to invite external active directory users such as business partners, vendors, and contractors to access the portals.

Azure AD B2C should be used for all types of customers. According to Microsoft, Azure AD B2C should be the default authentication type of Power Apps portals for all types of external customers.

Question : What do you mean by local authentication ?

Answer : This is the only recommended authentication to use for testing purposes because it stores the user's login information in the contact table of Microsoft Dataverse. However it has been deprecated and should be replaced by Azure AD B2C.

Question : What are the components required to retrieve and transform the existing data from Company's applications to Microsoft Dataverse.

Answer : You should use WebHook and Azure Function. WebHook can be registered on Microsoft Dataverse tables and can call Azure Function to allow developers to retrieve data from an external application and transform it into the Microsoft Dataverse format.

Question : Explain Web Resource and WEB API ?

Answer : Web Resource is used to write client-side language like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. You can embed web resources in model-driven apps and Microsoft Teams but not in Power Apps portals. WEB API is used to make the connection with the Microsoft Dataverse and perform operations like create, update, and delete.

Question : What do you understand by Graph API ?

Answer : Graph API is a type of REST API that allows developers to communicate with Microsoft resources and internal applications like Office 365, Microsoft Teams.

Question : Which components should you use to migrate large documents to Microsoft Dataverse and associate them with the relevant customer in Dynamics 365 sales app.

Answer : You should use SharePoint to store all the customer documents and associate them with customer data in Microsoft Dataverse

You should use Console application (C#) to move the documents them to SharePoint. It conducts the one time activity of getting the details of the customer from Microsoft Dataverse and accordingly creating a hierarchy of folders in SharePoint.

WEB API should be used to make the connection with Dynamics 365 and also to retrieve the customer GUID (unique identifier) from Microsoft Dataverse.

Question : What are Notes in Microsoft Dataverse ?

Answer : Notes are the out-of-box table of Microsoft Dataverse that allow a user to capture a quick note and attach relevant documents usually recommended for small files.

Question : Users with Global Admin rights must be able to manage users in the organization that are using the mobile app. You need to check that the role assigned to logged-in mobile users is appropriate before allowing them to access the mobile app. In which order should you perform the actions?

Answer : You should perform the actions in the following order:

  1. Register with Azure AD app.
  2. Request Graph API permissions.
  3. Grant Admin consent to API permissions.
  4. Create a Custom Connector.
  5. Call Custom Connector in Canvas app.

Question : What do you mean by Omnichannel ?

Answer : Omnichannel is a type of component that allows customers to directly chat with live agents or employees.

Question : What is Unified Service Desk ?

Answer : Unified Service Desk is a component provided by Microsoft only for an organization's internal service desk users to interact with customers via call, email, chat, etc.

Question : What are Azure Functions ?

Answer : Azure Functions is an event-driven serverless solution that allows you to write the code that handles complex integration.

Question : What is the permitted range trusted device ?

Answer : The permitted range for this limit is one to 365 days.

Question : Why MFA is required for the Federated users ?

Answer : Federated users are users that work in the same company but in another branch and they may include users from overseas who shall be using personal devices that are not included in your intranet.

Question : List the most preferred verification method ?

Answer : You should choose the Text Message to Phone option and the Notification Through a Mobile App option as verification methods.

Question : Which devices support logic apps ?

Answer : Logic Apps are not supported as a mobile app for iOS and Android and would require a computer.

Question : Which type of app can be used to display external data ?

Answer : A canvas app is a low-code/no-code component of Power Platform that can be used to display external data using its default controls and connectors. Canvas apps can also be embedded in model-driven apps, PowerApps portals, and Microsoft Teams.

Question : What is Power Apps component framework (PCF) control ?

Answer : You can use PCF controls to design a code-based reusable component. You can embed a PCF control in model-driven apps and Microsoft Teams but not in Power Apps portals.

Question : What is the scope of an IFrame ?

Answer : IFrame is designed for a model-driven app and cannot be used in Microsoft Teams and Power Apps portals.

Question : List the steps to close opportunities in bulk using the Advanced Find feature.

Answer : You should perform the following actions in order:

  1. Write custom C# code to close active and draft quotes and to close the opportunity.
  2. Build the code using Visual Studio and register the assembly using the Plugin Registration Tool.
  3. Create a workflow and configure it to be run on demand.
  4. Add a new step and choose the assembly file.
  5. Save and activate the workflow.

Question : Differentiate between component and component library.

Answer :  A component can be used to design a reusable component for a single canvas app only, whereas using component library we can design components for canvas apps that can be reused in other canvas apps.

Question : Which fields are responsible for operation failed (500) error and explain how it is related with swagger ?

Answer : Swagger is a tool for describing and documenting RESTful APIs. The operation failed (500) error is most commonly caused by an invalid expression value in these two fields. To correct the mistake, the path field should begin with / and be followed by a string value. In Swagger terms, endpoints (resources) that are exposed by your API are called Paths. Hosts define the base URLs on the root level of the API specification.

Question : What do you understand by Schemes field ?

Answer : Schemes field defines the transfer protocol of the API like Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP), WebSocket (WS) etc.

Question : Explain briefly Consumes field and Definitions field.

Answer : Consumes field is a list of Multipurpose Internet Mail Extension (MIME) types that APIs can consume.

Definitions field. This field holds the data types that are produced and consumed by the process of creating the custom connector.

Question : Write the steps to add an interactive map component to your canvas application to show the location of the users.

Answer : You should perform the following steps in order:

  1. Access the Insert tab then expand Media.
  2. Choose the Map component then turn on Show current location.
  3. Insert Location.Latitude under the Current location latitude property.
  4. Insert Location.Longitude under the Current location longitude property.

Question : What is Address input component ?

Answer : The address input component allows you to view dynamic address suggestions while typing. It makes it easier to add addresses, especially when using a mobile phone.

Question : Which actions should you perform to customize the portal's out-of-box login page so that it matches the UI of the main website.

Answer : You should perform the actions in the following order:

  1. Create a content snippet for the login page.  A content snippet is a Power Apps portal component that allows you to manage the content of the portal and to customize default portal pages like login, registration, etc.
  2. Change the content snippet type to HTML.
  3. Write Script/HTML in the content snippet.
  4. Save the configuration.
  5. Sync the configuration from the Power Apps portals Studio.

Question : Under which circumstances, restart is needed to sync the configuration ?

Answer : Restart is only needed when you have made changes to the portal admin center configuration, such as enabling diagnostic logging, updating Dynamics 365 URL, etc.

Question : Which steps should you perform add a Power BI report to the canvas application screen showing employee turnover?

Answer : You should complete the following actions in order:

  1. Select the Charts dropdown from the Power Apps menu.
  2. Select the Power BI tile option from the dropdown.
  3. In Power BI service, open the report and click on the ellipsis icon.
  4. Choose Embed from the dropdown and select Website or portal.
  5. Copy the link to embed the report.
  6. Use the link in TileUrl property of the Power BI tile inside Power Apps.

Question : Which portal entity should you use to write custom JavaScript for the Power Apps portals ?

Answer : The Web Form Step entity contains a field named Custom JavaScript that is used to write custom JavaScript.

Question : Explain briefly Web Form, Web Page, Web Form Metadata entity.

Answer : A Web Form entity allows you to add branching logic and to add multiple entity forms to a single web form.

A Web Page entity has a particular URL for each record and forms the hierarchy of a website using parent and child relationships.

A Web Form Metadata entity enables you to add further configurations like predefining certain values and enhancing field styles.

Question : Why WEB API cannot read the data from Portal configuration tables ?

Answer : The portals Web API can only be used to perform operations on portal non-configuration entities like contact, lead, etc. It cannot be used to perform operations on portal configuration entities like a webpage, basic forms, etc.

Question : Mention the PowerApps Portal version required for WEB API to work.

Answer : The PowerApps Portal version must be 9.3.3.x or later for WEB API to work.

Question : How can we disable the WEB API for a contact entity ?

Answer : In order to disable the WEB API for the contact entity, you can create a new site setting with the name Webapi/contact/enabled and set its value to false.

Question : While testing the chatbot's functionality how can you simultaneously view the conversation topics path and make adjustments to the bot as necessary ?

Answer : Turning on the Track between topics option allows you to track the conversations between the customers and the bot as the conversation moves from topic to topic. With this option, your display is divided into two sections, one showing the conversation and the other showing the nodes containing the topics.

Question : What are the prerequisites to create the Power BI custom visual.

Answer : You should ensure that the company has Visual Studio Code Integrated Development Environment (IDE) which is used to develop JavaScript and TypeScript applications.

You should also ensure that the company has node.js installed. This uses JavaScript as its preferred programming interface.

The system should have windows 8 OS or more and Power BI version should be 4.0 or later with a Pro or Premium Per User (PPU).

Question : List the security features that can be used to prevent the support team from being able to read customer transactional-related information.

Answer : You should use field-level security and role-based form. Field-level security restricts access to sensitive fields (like account numbers or credit cards) for specific users and teams.

You should use a role-based form to restrict access entity forms for specific users and teams.

Question : Define Environment Maker role.

Answer : This role provides the required permissions to build and distribute the necessary resources for the environment including PowerApps, Power Automate, and custom APIs.

Question : Define Environment Admin role.

Answer : You should assign this role if a user has to perform administrative actions in an environment. For example, if user needs to add or remove a user, set data loss prevention policies, or provision a Dataverse database, this role would be appropriate.

Question : Define System Administrator role.

Answer : You should assign this role to users in order to let them customize the system and view all the data in the system. For example, when a user wants to create a table, views, relationships in Dataverse and needs access to all the records available in Dataverse tables. This role does not provide permission to create resources in the Power Platform environment.

PL-100 raw.md

1

This solution does not meet the goal. You cannot use the App Picture control to capture an image of the note. The Add Picture control is used to load an image from a local data source or upload an image to a data source.

2

The solution meets the goal. The Power Apps camera control lets you use the device camera to capture an image. You can then use the Power Apps text recognizer component in Power Apps to retrieve the text for entry into the form. You can also use the text recognition prebuilt model in Power Automate to retrieve the text.

3

The solution meets the goal. The Power Apps camera control lets you use the device camera to capture an image. You can then use the text recognition prebuilt model in Power Automate to retrieve the text. You can also use the Power Apps text recognizer component in Power Apps to retrieve the text.

4

This solution does not meet the goal. Only part of the goal is met. The Power Apps Camera control lets you use the device camera to capture an image. The key phrase extraction prebuilt model requires a text string or text file as input. It cannot be used to extract text from an image.

5

This solution does not meet the goal. A calculated field is only re-calculated when a row is saved, not when a column is changed. This will not display the commission calculation immediately after you enter the sales amount.

6

This solution meets the goal. You should create a business rule to determine the commission. A business rule will automatically execute when a column referenced by the rule is changed, for example, the sales amount column used to calculate the commission value field.

7

This solution does not meet the goal. You can use a business process flow to help users enter data consistently by following a defined procedure. This will not display the commission calculation immediately after you enter the sales amount.

8

You should use a Power BI report for pending dispatches. You can use a Power BI report when you need to create a report with visuals that contain multiple pages.

You should use a Power BI report for financial results. You should use a Power BI report if you need to filter or drill-down data from a report.

You should use a Power BI dashboard for executive KPIs. You should use a Power BI dashboard to consolidate visuals from multiple reports or datasets in a single-page report. You cannot filter or drill-down data in a dashboard. However, you can configure data alerts in pinned visuals for specific visual types, like gauges or card visuals.

9

You should create a new workspace first. You need to create a separate workspace to give access only to the managers for the financial reports and datasets. Publishing this report in the same workspace as the other reports can make it available for other employees.

You should not assign the Viewer Role to managers first. The Viewer Role should be assigned to the managers to be able to view the financial reports. You should assign this role to the managers after creating the new workspace only.

You should not publish the reports and datasets to My workspace. This is a special type of workspace where each user has access to work on their own content. You should use a workspace to share and collaborate with other BI analysts while designing reports.

You should not create a shareable link to the report. You can use a shareable link to share a report or a dashboard with people inside or even outside your organization. You can use a shareable link to share reports inside the My workspace as well. However, anyone with a shareable link can access the financial reports, not only the managers.

10

You should use a Word template. You can use a Word template to generate standardized documents from a customer's information stored in Dataverse tables. You need to create a Word document template with placeholders that map with the table columns and upload the document as a template in the Power Apps Advanced Settings panel.

You should not use an Excel template. You can use an Excel template to share your data as a worksheet with pre-built customized analysis, like charts and pivot tables.

You should not use a Power Apps gallery control. You can use a gallery control in a canvas app to list multiple records from a table.

You should not use Power BI Desktop. You can use Power BI Desktop to model datasets and design reports that can be published and shared in the Power BI service.

11

You should add a Power Apps visual in the report from the Power BI service. You can include this visual to show an existing canvas app or create a new canvas app as part of the Power BI report canvas. You can only include this visual from Power BI service; this visual is not available from Power BI Desktop.

You should not enable Power BI visualization embedding from the Power Apps portals admin center. Before embedding Power BI visuals in Power Apps portals, you need to enable Power BI visualization from the Power Apps portals admin center. You do not need to enable Power BI visualization embedding to embed a canvas app inside a Power BI report.

You should not add a Power BI tile control in the canvas app from the Power Apps Studio. After enabling Power BI visualization embedding from the Power Apps Admin center, you can embed tiles from dashboards or reports inside a canvas app.

You should not install a new Power BI app in your workspace from the Power BI service. You can use a Power BI app to deploy and distribute multiple related components, like dashboards, reports, and datasets as a part of a single package.

12

You should create a new Power Automate instant cloud flow. You cannot use the invoice processing model directly from a canvas app because there is no control integrated with this prebuilt AI model. However, you can create a Power Automate instant cloud flow that is invoked from the canvas app and analyze the invoice with the prebuilt AI model.

You should also include a step to analyze the invoice file with the AI Builder invoice processing model. This will analyze an invoice file and output the data to be used for the following steps, like sending the data back to the canvas app or composing an email to the delivery company.

You should also insert a picture control that executes the Power Automate cloud workflow. Adding this control allows the dispatch team to take a picture of the printed invoice from the canvas app and forward it to the Power Automate flow, automating the business process.

You should not build a form processing AI model. This custom model is used to read information from documents and extract the relevant information based on the training with sample documents.

You should not train the prebuilt AI model with sample documents. The invoice processing model is a prebuilt AI model that does not require training before you can use it.

You should not add a form processor control that executes the trained AI model. This control should be used to take a picture from the app of a standard document with a trained and published form processor custom AI model. You cannot use this control with the prebuilt invoice processing model.

13

You should choose a canvas app. Canvas apps can be shared with external vendors by providing them with guest access in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and assigning them the Power Apps per app/plan license. Additionally, canvas apps have a barcode scanner control that lets you use your phone or mobile device to scan product barcodes, extract the information, and insert it into Microsoft Dataverse.

You should not choose a model-driven app. Model-driven apps also have a barcode scanner; however, they cannot be shared with external vendors.

You should not choose a Microsoft Teams app. Microsoft Teams can also provide a barcode scanner feature by embedding a canvas app or model-driven app. However, it cannot be shared with external vendors.

You should not use Power Automate. Power Automate is used to automate the business process and write complex business logic. It can neither be used to scan product barcodes nor be shared with external vendors. It can only be shared with the organization's internal users.

14

You should create a business rule to set the column as Required and set the Scope for the business rule to Entity. This is the only way in which the column can be enforced as being required across all types of power apps. Business rules are used through the interface to avoid having to write code. They can allow columns to be set as Required or Not Required, show or hide columns on the form, etc.

You should not use JavaScript on the model app form. This would only work on the model app form. In this scenario, both model apps and canvas apps should be updated.

You should not set the column Data card value as Required. This would only work within the canvas app. In this scenario, both model apps and canvas apps should be updated.

You should not set the column as Required in the table within the solution. This would only work within the model app. In this scenario, both model apps and canvas apps should be updated.

15

You should use a premium connector for DatasourceA. You should use a premium connector to connect with enterprise systems, like Dynamics 365, SAP ERPs, Dataverse, relational databases, and Azure services. This type of connector requires premium licenses with Power Platform.

You should use a standard connector for DatasourceB. You should use a standard connector to connect with systems in the Microsoft 365 ecosystem, like Excel, Outlook, Sharepoint, Teams, and also third-party services like Google Drive, Google Sheets, and others. You do not need premium licenses with Power Platform to use these connectors.

You should use a custom connector for DatasourceC. You should use a custom connector to connect with internal systems that are not covered by standard or premium built-in connectors. You can build a custom connector by using OpenAPI definitions to map the system API endpoints with the actions in the connector.

16

You should recommend a canvas app to enable users to communicate with data stored in different data sources. Unlike a model-driven app and Power Apps portals, a canvas app can store and retrieve data stored from various data sources like SharePoint, Azure SQL, OneDrive, SQL. Model-driven apps and Power Apps portals can store the data only in Microsoft Dataverse.

You should also recommend a canvas app to provide version control capabilities. Canvas apps support version control, which provides the ability to track the app changes made by app developers, and users can restore the app to a previous version. However, model-driven apps and Power Apps portals do not support version control.

You should recommend a model-driven app to write complex business logic and manage user security roles. Model-driven apps provide capabilities to include business rules and JavaScript to handle complex business logic. Also, a model-driven app allows users to manage user security roles through its advanced settings. Canvas apps and Power Apps portals do not have capabilities to manage user security roles.

17

You should consider the standard connector to create a security group and Office 365 group in the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant. Standard connectors are used to connect the most commonly used Microsoft-provided data sources like SharePoint, Azure AD, OneDrive, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Teams, etc., and these connectors do not require an additional license for use in Power Apps. Microsoft has provided an Azure AD standard connector, which lets you manage security groups in Azure AD. You can trigger this connector either through Power Apps or Power Automate or Logic Apps.

You should also consider a custom connector to obtain user details (both custom and out-of-the-box attributes) from Azure AD. The standard connector, like Azure AD, does not have the capability to retrieve the custom attribute value of Azure AD. To retrieve custom attributes, you need to call the Microsoft Graph API using a custom connector.

You should not consider a premium connector to fulfill any of the given requirements. Premium connectors are only available if you purchase a license, like DocuSign, Salesforce, Amazon, etc. Premium connectors should only be used when the standard and custom connectors do not fit the requirements. For example, if an organization wants to use DocuSign to automate the contract document signing process, then they need to purchase a DocuSign license in order to use its connector in PowerApps/Power Automate.

18

You should identify a Power Apps portal app to create an app for new employees so that they can access data anonymously if their user account is not set up. The Power Apps portal is a Power Platform component that enables developers to create a public-facing website and, unlike other Power Platform components, it allows users to anonymously access data stored in Microsoft Dataverse.

You should identify either the Power Apps portal or a canvas app to enable Azure AD authentication. Power Apps portal and canvas apps both support Azure AD-based authentication to allow users to seamlessly access all applications with Single Sign-on (SSO).

You should identify a canvas app to allow employees to connect to it via the Power Apps mobile app. Employees can download this app from either the Play Store or App Store and use it to access/connect to the canvas app developed by the organization. Connecting to a Power Apps portal app in this way is not supported.

19

You should use Power Automate cloud flow to write the business logic to call the REST API. Dataverse for Microsoft Teams allows app developers to create Power Automate cloud flow to call any REST-based API. Power Automate cloud flow provides an HTTP Request connector that allows you to call any REST-based API and store its response in Microsoft Dataverse.

You should not use a Dataverse plug-in to call the REST API. Plug-ins are the custom C# code that can trigger the business logic when any event occurs from a table that exists in Microsoft Dataverse. However, unlike Dataverse, Dataverse for Microsoft Teams does not have the capabilities yet to write a plug-in code.

You should not use Azure Service Bus to call the REST API in Dataverse for Microsoft Teams. Azure Service Bus is an Azure-based messaging service that establishes communication between two different cloud applications and services. Unlike Dataverse for the model-driven app, Dataverse for Microsoft Teams does not have the capabilities yet to use Azure Service Bus.

You should not use Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse to call the REST API in Dataverse for Microsoft Teams. Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse provides the near real-time data insights of the data stored in Microsoft Dataverse. Additionally, it also allows developers to run data analytics, business intelligence, and machine learning scenarios on your data. Unlike Dataverse for the model-driven app, Dataverse for Microsoft Teams does not have the capabilities yet to use Azure Synapse Link.

20

You should use Power Automate to automate processes that require multi-level approval and write complex business logic that requires being executed on multiple entities. Power Automate provides a UI Approval connector that allows developers to automate approval processes within an organization. For example, approval of documents that need sign-off, expense reports, etc. Conversely, other components do not provide this capability. Power Automate also allows app developers to write expressions to execute complex business logic and for data transformation in the case of external system integration with Microsoft Dataverse.

You should use Power Fx, an open-source formula language, to store the data locally within a canvas app to avoid processing time. Canvas apps use Power Fx. You cannot store the data locally in other types of Power Apps.

You should not use a custom connector. Custom connectors are used to integrate with external system/data sources that are available as pre-built connectors. They cannot be used to meet any of the given requirements.

You should not use Power Virtual Agent. Power Virtual Agent is used to design a chatbot that can be embedded in other applications like Microsoft Teams, portals, and any other external website. It cannot be used to meet any of the given requirements.

21

You should use Power Fx to write expressions for cost estimation and discount calculation. You should design the calculator app using a Power Apps canvas app, as this will allow developers to write formulas and expressions using the Power Fx language. Power Fx is a low-code language that is used for expressing logic across the Microsoft Power Platform.

You should not use a business rule. Business rules are used in model-driven apps to perform field-level validation and for basic calculations like SUM and SUBTRACT. It should not be used for complex business logic like cost estimation and discount calculation.

You should not use JavaScript. JavaScript can only be written in model-driven app forms. In this scenario you need to use a canvas app due to the ability for Power Fx to write the formulas and expressions necessary for a calculator app. You cannot write JavaScript in a canvas app.

You should not use a background classic workflow. Classic Dataverse background workflows are asynchronous in nature and cannot be used to write complex business logic unless used with a custom workflow. Background classic workflows can only be used to perform basic operations in Microsoft Dataverse like creating, updating, assigning, sharing data, and sending emails. You would need to create a custom workflow assembly and call it from within a classic workflow to perform the necessary calculation business logic.

22

You should design a Power Virtual Agent component to be embedded on the company's website. Power Virtual Agent is used to design a chatbot that can easily be integrated or embedded in any external website. Once published, Power Virtual Agent also provides IFrame code that can easily be shared with website developers to place in their HTML code.

You should not use a model-driven app. Model-driven apps are components intended for an organization's internal users. It can only be shared with the organization's users who have a valid Power Apps license. This component cannot be embedded in any external website.

You should not use a canvas app. Canvas apps are used to design a mobile and tablet-based app from scratch or from the templates given by Microsoft. It can only be embedded in the app/portal that has Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) authentication enabled. For example, model-driven apps, PowerApps portal, etc. However, in this scenario, the company's website uses SQL Server-based authentication, within which it cannot be embedded.

You should not use Microsoft Teams app. The Microsoft Teams app can neither be shared nor embedded in any external website. It can only be downloaded from the Play/App store on the user's local machine or mobile device.

23

You should use the Office 365 Users connector, as this connector can be used to retrieve the profile details of users in Azure AD including their full name, job title, department, phone number, email, and profile picture.
