You should not use a custom connector. The Microsoft Graph contains profile images, and you could create a custom connector to retrieve the images, but this would require additional effort to call the Microsoft Graph API.

You should not use a Microsoft Dataverse connector. The Microsoft Dataverse connector is used to perform operations in Microsoft Dataverse and does not hold images of users.

You should not use the Azure AD Connector. The Azure AD connector is used to perform operations in Azure AD. It does not provide capabilities to retrieve the profile images for users.

References

Office 365 Users

Create a custom connector from scratch

Microsoft Dataverse

Azure AD

24

You should identify a custom page to meet the requirement to view the organization's newsletters and World Health Organization (WHO) updates along with vaccination slots stored in Microsoft Dataverse. Custom pages are a new feature introduced by Microsoft that lets you design a standalone custom page that can be embedded on the landing page of the model-driven app so that the users can see the external system/application details as soon as they log in to the app. Custom pages can also call external APIs like the WHO API using a custom connector to bring the external system data to Microsoft Dataverse.

You should identify a Power Apps component framework (PCF) control to design an address finder control on the form. A PCF control (code components) is the type of solution component used to design the custom controls for a model-driven app like an address finder, drag & drop control, color-picker, and so on. These controls are used to enhance the data visualization within the app.

You should not identify a canvas app in order to meet any of the stated requirements. A canvas app is the best fit for scenarios where you need to design a mobile and tablet-based app that consists of multiple screens. It is not the correct solution in order to design a single-page application that could be embedded on the landing page of model-drive apps. Canvas apps should also not be used to design a control like an address finder. You should use a PCF control to design this feature.

25

You should use an unmanaged solution type in the Power Platform development environment to edit apps in and add new apps to the solution. An unmanaged solution is a type of solution that is still under development and not yet ready to be distributed. It is recommended to create a new unmanaged solution before starting to make customizations in your Power Platform environment. Therefore, you should always use an unmanaged solution in the development environment to create and edit components like canvas apps, model-driven apps, and custom connectors.

You should use a managed solution type to export the solution. A managed solution is a type of solution that is intended to be distributed and installed in the target environments. Once your development is completed in the development environment as part of an unmanaged solution, you can package and export the solution as a managed solution.

You should not use a default solution to meet any of the given requirements. When you install or set up a new Power Platform environment, all out-of-the-box components come under a default solution. A default solution is useful for finding all of the components and configurations in your Power Platform environment. You should always create a new solution to customize components instead of customizing components directly in the default solution. You cannot export the default solution.

26

You should identify that you can share Power Apps portals with external vendors by creating a guest account for them in the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and inviting them to access the portal using their own organization's Azure AD account. You need to enable Azure AD B2B authentication in the Power Apps portal to allow external vendors to access the portal using their organization's Azure AD account.

You should also identify that you can share a canvas app with external vendors by creating a guest account in the Azure AD directory, assigning them the Power Apps per app/per user license, and then sharing the canvas app URL with them.

You cannot share a model-driven app with external vendors, as it can only be shared with an organization's internal users, who have Power Apps licenses. Model-driven apps are intended to be made only for an organization's internal users and they cannot be shared with external vendors. You need to be a licensed member of the organization's internal Azure AD in order to log in to the model-driven app.

You cannot share an embedded canvas app with external vendors. Embedded canvas apps can only be embedded in a model-driven app and cannot be shared outside of an organization. Also, users with access to the model-driven form can only access its embedded canvas app and the data that it uses.

27

You should use the decimal number data type. This data type supports values between -100,000,000,000 and 100,000,000,000 and up to 10 decimal points of precision.

You should not use the floating point number data type. This data type supports values between -100,000,000,000 and 100,000,000,000 but only eight decimal points of precision.

You should not use the whole number data type. This data type supports integers only with values between -2,147,483,648 and 2,147,483,647.

You should not choose the currency data type. This data type supports values between -922,337,203,685,477 and 922,337,203,685,477. You can specify the precision, but are limited to no more than four decimal points of precision.

28

You need to create the EntityA table and RelationA relationship only. When you create a new Dataverse database, you have to add custom relationships and tables to this new environment.

You do not need to create the account table. Standard tables like the account table are automatically created in a new Dataverse database. You do not need to create a standard table.

29

You should use the Customer data type to allow sales agents to choose either the company's name or a contact person to schedule a meeting. The customer data type is a different type of look-up column that allows users to specify a customer, which can either be an account (company name) or a contact (contact person).

You should use the Choices data type to choose preferred time slots for the meeting. The Choices data type allows users to choose multiple values that will be available for users to select.

You should not use the Lookup data type to meet any of the given requirements. The Lookup data type allows users to choose the data only from a single table. So, you would need two lookups: one to choose the company name and another for the contact person. One lookup field cannot be used to choose either company name or contact person.

You should not use the Choice data type to meet any of the given requirements. The Choice data type allows users to choose only a single value that will be available for users to select. While choosing the timeslots, a user needs to have an option to choose multiple values.

30

1:N (One-to-Many) is the type of relationship where a row of one table can be associated with multiple rows of another table.
N:1 (Many-to-One) is the type of relationship where multiple rows of one table can be associated with a single row of another table.
N:N (Many-to-Many) is the type of relationship where multiple rows of one table can be associated with multiple rows of another table.

You should use the 1:N (One-to-Many) relationship between the Speaker and Session tables. A speaker can submit multiple sessions for a particular event. It cannot be N:N (Many-to-Many), as multiple sessions cannot be associated with multiple speakers, nor the N:1 (Many-to-One) relationships, as multiple speakers cannot have the same session.

You should use the N:N (Many-to-Many) relationship between the Speaker and Skill tables. A speaker can have multiple skills and one skill can be associated with multiple speakers. These tables cannot have, therefore, the 1:N (One-to-Many) or N:1 (Many-to-One) relationships.

You should not use the N:1 (Many-to-One) relationship between any of the given tables, because one session cannot be associated with multiple speakers. Also, multiple speakers cannot have only one skill.

31

You should create a calculated column to calculate the sum of interior designer cost and product cost. Calculated columns let you automate calculation on model-driven app forms used in your business process. For example, calculating estimated revenue, weighted revenue, aggregations, and so on. A calculated column performs the calculation immediately on the form. Therefore, users do not need to wait to see the result.

You should, alternatively, create a business rule to calculate the sum of interior designer cost and product cost. Business rules support formulae to sum, subtract, and multiply the field values available on the model-driven app form. Business rules perform the calculation immediately on the form. Therefore, users do not need to wait to see the result.

You should not create a classic workflow. Classic workflows are asynchronous in nature and cannot be used to produce the result immediately.

You should not create a Power Automate cloud flow. Power Automate is asynchronous in nature and cannot be used to produce the result immediately.

32

You should set the control Size property to 0 and the TabIndex value to 0. Setting the control Size to 0 makes the control invisible to sighted users, and setting a TabIndex value of 0 means that the control is accessible through keyboard navigation. You will also need to configure the AccessibleLabel to a descriptive text string to show the control to screen-reader users.

You should not set the AccessibleLabel property to an empty text string. This makes the control invisible to the screen-reader.

You should not set the TabIndex to -1. If you set the value to -1, the control does not participate in keyboard navigation.

You should not set the Visible property to false. This hides the control from sighted users and screen-reader users.

33

You should use the Language function. The Language function returns the language tag of the current user so you can tailor your app across locales.

You should not use the Location signal. The Location signal returns the device location based on device information, such as Global Positioning System (GPS) and IP address. This does not necessarily determine the appropriate language for the user.

You should not use the UpdateContext function. This function is used to create or update context variables for the current screen.

You should not use the Match function. This function is used when testing to see if text strings match. The Match function returns information for the first match found.

34

You should create a component library. A component library is used to create reusable components for the canvas app. Unlike components, a component library can be reused in multiple canvas apps. Any changes made in the component library notify canvas app logged-in users to merge the latest changes in the app. You can create a translation component library to create a reusable component for language translation and store the translated text in JSON format. You can also create an input parameter to take the Language Code Identifier (LCID) from the canvas app and then return the translated texts accordingly.

You should not create a component. A component also has the same features as a component library. However, its scope is local; this means that it can only be used within a particular canvas app, not in other canvas apps.

You should not create a collection to store language translation. A collection is a temporary storage available in the canvas app that is used to temporarily store the data until the app is opened either in the browser or in the mobile app.

You should not read the language translation file from Microsoft Dataverse. Language translation files in Microsoft Dataverse are for translating the language in the model-driven app, but they cannot be read in the Power Apps canvas app.

35

You should use the card form to display the company details in a compact format on the dashboard. Card forms are used to present the information in a compact format that is also suitable for mobile devices. Unlike other forms, card forms can only be added to views in the model-driven app. In addition, these forms can only be available on interactive dashboards, but not standard dashboards.

You should use a Quick view form on the Main form to view contracts associated with an account on the Contact form without having to leave the form. Quick view forms are used to provide a quick view of related entity data. For example, you can display the Account data and its associated data (contracts) on the Contact form without opening the account form.

You should not use only Main forms to meet any of the requirements. Main forms in model-driven apps are used to provide the main user interface for viewing and interacting with table data. It can neither be used to display the data on the dashboard in compact format nor display the related table data.

You should not use the Quick create form to meet any of the requirements. Quick create forms provide a basic form along with a streamlined data entry experience for creating new records. It can neither be used to display the data on the dashboard in compact format nor to display the related table data.

36

You should use Microsoft Chart Controls to build user-owned and organization-owned charts as column, bar, area, line, and pie charts. Microsoft Chart Controls enable you to build charts in model-driven apps. Microsoft Chart Controls do not support building charts for canvas apps.

You should create a user-owned chart if you want to assign and share the chart with other users and teams. The chart visualization is owned by an individual user but can be assigned and shared with others.

You should not create an organization-owned chart if you want detailed control over access privileges and security. You should create a user-owned chart for this purpose. You cannot control assigning or sharing the chart for an organization-owned chart.

37

You should use an interactive dashboard. You can configure the view in the interactive dashboard to display all of the construction sites in the dashboard and you can also highlight the rows in green and red by configuring the colors for the choice column (Options: Overdue, Completed) on the card view form.

You should not use the standard dashboard. The standard dashboard does not support the card view form and there is no out-of-the-box way to highlight the view rows. Hence, you would need to write JavaScript code to highlight the rows in green and red. However, the requirement is to use an out-of-the-box method to implement the requirement.

You should not use a custom page. Custom pages are a new feature introduced by Microsoft that allows developers to create a custom page within model-driven apps. Custom pages can be shown as the main page, side dialog, and center dialog within model-driven apps. It is the best solution to design a standalone customized page for a model-driven app, where you can pass contextual parameters from the model-driven app to display the dynamic content as well. However, it cannot be used to highlight rows in the dashboard.

You should not use a canvas app. Canvas apps can only be used to design a custom list view and can be embedded in a dashboard using IFrame and web resources. You should not create a new component just to highlight the list view rows as the requirement is to use the out-of-the-box capabilities of model-driven apps.

38

You should recommend an interactive dashboard to display the counts of events, speakers, and participants. An interactive dashboard provides a Tile view in a single stream type dashboard, where you can display the count of records available in a particular View or Queue. In contrast, this feature is not present in the standard (User and System) dashboard.

You should recommend a system dashboard (standard) to display external application data. You can either embed a custom page or canvas app or web resource to display external application data to the system dashboard. These components can call external APIs to retrieve the data and can display on the system dashboard. Currently, the interactive dashboard does not have a feature to display external application data.

You should not choose a user dashboard (standard) to meet any of the given requirements. User dashboards are created by an individual user of the organization for their personal usage. These dashboards cannot be accessible by other users in the organization unless it is shared with them. This means that the event manager would not be able to update/delete the dashboard created by the event organizer.

39

You should use a global filter. Global filters in interactive dashboards provide you with the capability of filtering data based on multiple filters. You can save your most frequent global filters in your saved filter list as well. For example, you can use global filters to filter out the patients who are from the United States and fully vaccinated by using the Country and Vaccination Status filters respectively. Global filters always filter based on a particular column present in the table.

You should not use a visual filter. Visual filters are also called interactive charts. These filters are used to refresh or filter the dashboard when you click on a particular chart available in the dashboard. For example, if you have a chart on the dashboard that displays the country-wide patients diagnosed with a particular condition or illness and you click on United States in the chart, the dashboard will refresh all charts to display data based on the United States. You cannot apply multiple filters using the visual filter.

You should not use the timeframe filter. This filter is used to filter the dashboard data based on a date or date range. For example, you can use a timeframe filter to filter the patients who had tested positive for a particular viral infection in the last month or last week.

40

Managers cannot edit/delete the dashboards created by users. Dashboards created by individual users in a model-driven app are considered personal dashboards. Personal dashboards can only be edited/deleted by the user/team who created them, unless they are shared with others.

Users cannot apply security roles on their own dashboards. Security roles can only be applied to the system dashboards because they are accessible to the entire organization. Dashboards created by individuals are considered personal dashboards, and no one in the organization can access them unless they are shared by the dashboard owner. Therefore, there is no need to apply security roles on personal dashboards.

Users can set their default dashboard. A dashboard can be set as default by an individual user from the dashboard ribbon toolbar by clicking on the button Set as default. This setting is only applicable to an individual user and not to the entire organization.

41

You cannot distribute the app as part of the solution to other environments. This is because the default solution cannot be exported.

Components created in the default solution only use the default publisher assigned to the solution. This can result in the wrong publisher prefix being applied to some components.

The default solution contains all components in the system. This makes the default solution useful for discovering all the components and configurations in your system.

42

You should create a new solution in the existing sandbox environment. A sandbox environment is designed for developing and testing apps and components. You can create multiple solutions in the same sandbox environment.

You should not create a new sandbox environment. This is not necessary because you can use the existing sandbox environment.

You should not create a new developer environment. This is a special environment that is created by users who have the Community Plan license. The environment is available to the user who created the environment only and cannot be used with a development team.

You should not create a new solution in the default environment. One default environment is created automatically for each tenant. A default solution cannot be exported to another environment.

43

You should recreate the instant flow in your new canvas app. The instant flow must exist in the same solution as the canvas app.

Instant flows are flows that can be triggered manually from any device. You should not export the solution containing the flow because you cannot add a flow into another solution if the flow trigger is set to manual. For this reason, an instant flow cannot be added to a different solution. This also prevents you from adding the instant flow directly to your new canvas app.

There is no need to verify that the flow trigger is set to manual. Setting the flow trigger to manual is part of the process of creating an instant flow.

44

A newly created solution does not contain any components. You must either create new components or add existing components before the solution contains any components. The solution is created as an unmanaged solution, which means you can create or add components to the solution.

When you create a new component in the context of the solution, it is automatically added to the solution. Use the New command in Power Apps to create a new component.

You can add existing components to a newly created solution. Use the Add existing command in Power Apps to display a list of available components.

45

You should use the solution checker. The solution checker is used to run a rich static analysis of your app to check the app solutions against a set of best practice rules. After the check is complete, the solution checker returns a detailed report that includes issues identified and links to documentation describing how to resolve issues.

You should not use the app checker. The app checker is supported for canvas apps only and is designed to help list formula and accessibility issues in an app.

You should not use Microsoft Compliance Manager. Compliance Manager is not used to validate an app against best practices. Instead, Compliance Manager is designed to help you manage your organization's compliance requirements.

You should not use the Power Platform admin center. The admin center provides a unified portal that enables administrators to manage environments and settings. It does not provide the functionality to test and validate specific apps.

46

When a Power Platform environment is created, a default database is created with it. This default database has certain behaviors. For example, users cannot be restricted from accessing the database, and you cannot define Data Loss Prevention policies for the database. The default database is also created with a default solution publisher and a randomly generated publisher prefix. You cannot change these in the default solution. If a custom publisher prefix (such as a company name) is required, then another database will need to be created. In this non-default environment, you can create custom publishers, as well as custom publisher prefixes.

When creating Power Automate flows in a solution, the flow uses the prefix defined in the publisher for the solution.

When creating environment variables in a solution, the variable uses the prefix defined in the publisher for the solution.

You cannot change the publisher of a default solution.

You cannot change the prefix of a default solution.

47

You should perform the following actions in order:

Open a solution.Click the Add Existing button on the toolbar.Choose the Outside Solutions tab.Select the Power Automate flow, and click Add.
To add an existing Power Automate flow that has been created as a standalone flow into a solution, you first need to navigate to the solution that you want to add the flow to.

Once you are in the solution, you should click the Add Existing button on the menu toolbar. In the screen that appears, you should select the tab for Outside Solutions to find your flow. After you have selected it, you then click the Add button. This will add your Power Automate flow into the solution.
You should not open the Power Automate flow because you cannot add the flow to the solution from within the flow, you need to navigate to the solution you want to add the flow to.

You should not edit the Power Automate flow. This allows you to change the functionality of the flow, but it does not allow you to add it to a solution.

48

You should export an unmanaged solution with all customizations. An unmanaged solution could be used to share development environments while you are making changes to them. After you make more changes, you can export it again as an unmanaged solution or as a managed solution ready to be deployed for non-development environments.

You should not export a managed solution with all customizations. A managed solution is a solution ready to be deployed for non-development environments. You cannot perform more changes after you export a managed solution.

You should not export the default solution with all customizations. The default solution is a special solution that contains all components and customizations from all solutions in the environment. It is not possible to export the default solution to another environment.

You should not publish a new version of the app. Publishing a new version of the app will make it available in your environment only. Your customizations and new components will not be available in the other app maker environment.

49

You need to create a site map. The site map defines the navigation for your app. The site map is created and configured through the site map designer.

You should not create a dashboard. A dashboard acts as a palette on which you can place one or more graphic visualizations and provide an overview of business data.

You should not create a data model. The data model is part of the initial model-driven app design process where you determine the types of data that your app will be working with and how that data relates to other data.

You should not create a form. A form is a user interface entity that is used for data entry.

50

You should embed the app as a tab app. This is the only option supported for embedding model-driven apps in Teams. Apps are embedded through the Power Apps tab in teams. You can also embed canvas apps as tab apps. You must enable the integration of model-driven apps in Teams for your environment.

You should not embed the app as a bot. Bots are used for initiating workflows in teams from conversations.

You should not embed the app as a webhook. A webhook is used to communicate with external apps by automatically sending notifications from another app to a Teams channel.

You should not embed the app as a personal app. This is supported for canvas apps, but not for model-driven apps.

51

You should use the Power Platform admin center. The tenant admin can enable Microsoft Teams Integration. Integration must be enabled separately for each environment from which you want to embed model-driven apps.

You should not use the Microsoft 365 admin center. The Microsoft 365 admin center is used to manage your Microsoft 365 subscription, which includes monitoring service health, managing users, requesting support, and managing subscriptions.

You should not use the Microsoft Teams admin center. The Microsoft Teams admin center is a suite of administrative tools that enable you to manage Microsoft Teams and Team profiles.

You should not use the Power Apps app. The Power Apps app is available through Microsoft Teams and lets you create and manage apps across available Power Apps environments.

52

You should designate the specific form as the table's fallback form. Form access is determined through security roles. If a user has not been assigned a security role, you can identify a default fallback form, which will be displayed even if the user does not have any other access permissions.

You should not ensure that the form is listed either first or last in the form order. The form order determines the default form for users assigned access to main forms. Changing the form order has no impact on the form that shows as the fallback form. The fallback form is typically listed last in the form order.

You should not create the form as a Quick Create form. Quick Creates are supported for a limited subset of system tables only and cannot be designated as a fallback form.

53

A personal view can be created from a table entity, an existing system view, or an existing public view. You cannot create a system or public view from a personal view.

A personal view is owned by the user who created the view. By default, the view is available to that user only, but the owner can choose to share the view with other users.

A personal view is created based on a saved query. The query is defined by using Advanced Find or by using the Save Filters as New Views and Save Filters to Current View options in the list of views.

54

Views are used to display data in different ways for each table. You can use them to specify which columns of data you want to be shown in the view, or alternatively, to pre-filter the data that is shown to the user in the view and display only a subset of all of the records that are available in a specific table. Users can switch easily between views in the model-driven app interface.

You can create a new view directly from the App Designer. You do not need to open the table to do this.

You can also go directly to the table and create the new view there.

You cannot create a table view through the table form. You can only use this to create table forms.

You cannot create a table view through the table dashboard. You can only use this to create table dashboards.

55

You should perform the following actions in order:
Ask the tenant admin to enable integration of model-driven apps in Teams for the app's environment.In Microsoft Teams, select the relevant team.In Microsoft Teams, select the relevant channel.Click the + icon to add a tab.In the dialogue box, select Power Apps.Select model-driven apps, and select the app that you want to embed.Click the Save button.The first necessary step is to ensure that model-driven app integration is enabled in Microsoft Teams for the environment that the app is located in. This needs to be carried out by the Teams tenant admin.

Once this has been enabled, you should go into the correct team and channel, and click the + icon to be able to embed a new app.

Then, you should select the type of app you want to use. You need to select Power Apps to be able to find the model-driven app.

Once you have selected the correct model-driven app, you need to click the Save button. The app will then be embedded and accessible for users within the Microsoft Teams channel.

56

You should use the Site Map to define and configure the navigation for the model-driven app. The site map designer also lets you define the area, subarea, or group titles in the languages supported by the environment.

You should not use App Designer. This is used to configure the views and forms for each table that is displayed within the app, but it is not used to modify the navigation menu bar. You need to open the site map designer from App Designer to be able to modify the navigation menu bar.

You should not use Solution Checker. This is used to see if there are any issues within a solution, it does not control the app navigation. Solution Checker is used to validate the solution and will highlight any issues or coding errors within it.

You should not use App Details. This displays information about the app but is not where the navigation menu bar is configured. This is where users can view the URL for the app, the version history for the app, and other information.

57

You should edit the Site Map section. You can edit the Site Map section to define the navigation for your app. You can define areas, groups, and subareas in the Site Map to change how users navigate inside the app.

You should not edit the Dashboards, Business Process Flows, and Entity View sections. These sections focus on which data is available to users, like dashboards, business processes, and entity forms, charts, and views.

58

You can save the app in Power Apps Studio and publish the app by going to the File Menu, and clicking Save and then Publish.

You should not publish the app in the App Designer. The App Designer is used for model-driven apps, not for canvas apps.

You should not publish all customizations from the solution. Publishing the solution itself does not publish the latest version of the canvas app.

You should not publish the latest version of the app from the Settings tab of the Power App. The app has to be saved, either manually or by allowing autosave before you can publish it. After saving the app, you could publish the latest version of the app from the Versions tab in Power Apps Studio by going to the Power Apps homepage, selecting Apps on the left hand side, and finding the app that you want to publish.

59

You should navigate through to the Power Platform admin center and verify that each of the users has the required security roles to access the application. Because some users have access to the application, it means that the correct roles were assigned to the application but only some of the users have the correct security roles assigned to them. You should navigate through to the Power Platform admin center, select the correct environment, select settings, expand users and permissions, click on users, select the user that you need to edit, click on manage security roles in the command bar at the top, and add the roles that are missing.

You should not verify that the application was published in the correct environment. In this scenario, you are building the application for a particular set of users and the assumption is that these users would be set up in the same environment. Once again, because some of the users have access to the application you know that the application is in the correct environment and the issues with access must have a different cause.

You should not verify the security roles assigned to the application because some of the users do have access to the application. Consequently, you know that there is a match between the roles assigned to the application and those assigned to specific users. You need to verify that the users who did not have access to the application have the correct security roles assigned to them.

You should not navigate to https://make.powerapps.com and verify that the app was shared with all the users in the Power Apps portal. The process of assigning security roles to the application and matching those security roles to each of the user profiles will ensure that users have access to the model-driven application.

60

You should use security roles to control forms visibility in a model-driven app. Model-driven apps provide form-based security to control form visibility based on security roles. For example, you create two forms (Form A and Form B) in the model-driven app and want that User A is only able to see Form A and User B is only able to see Form B. You should provide Role A to User A and Role B to User B, and then associate Role A to Form A and Role B to Form B. By doing this, all users who have Role A can see only Form A, and all users who have Role B can see only Form B.

You should use a model-driven app designer to control the visibility of views available in the model-driven app. App designer lets you design/manage the components you create within the app. These include forms, dashboards, views, tables, and others. You can uncheck the unused views from the view list to make them appear as hidden in the app.

You should not use the site map designer to meet any of the given requirements. Site map designer is used to design the site map (left navigation panel) of the model-driven app. It can only manage which components will be displayed in the left navigation panel of the app by grouping them in a particular area. For example, you can create a new area called Sales and display lead, opportunity, and contact tables within that area.

61

You should use the PowerApps checker module. This is a PowerShell module that interacts with the PowerApps checker service to run static analysis jobs and provide the results of the analysis as a consolidated report. The module provides a mechanism to run static analysis checks against customizations and extensions to the Microsoft Dataverse platform based on best practices.

You should not use the Accessibility checker. The Accessibility checker checks for and provides recommendations for correcting accessibility problems with canvas apps and flows.

You should not use the Solution checker. The Solution checker is used to perform a rich static analysis of model-driven apps against a defined set of best practice rules.

You should not use the PowerApps admin module. This module is used to administer apps and environments in the Power Platform admin center.

62

You should use the ClearCollect function. The ClearCollect function clears the cache before loading cached data. The data is cached locally. This function is used when the data does not change during the user session.

You should not use the Set function. The Set function can also be used to load cached data, but it does not first clear the cache. This function is used when the data is unlikely to change during the user session.

You should not use the Collect function. The Collect function is used to retrieve and cache data collections, but it does not clear the cache before loading.

You should not use the Concurrent function. This function is not used for caching data. It can be used with the ClearCollect function to help further improve performance through concurrent ClearCollect data loads.

63

The only types of charts that you can add directly to a canvas app are line, pie, and bar charts. Line charts are effective in displaying a series of values and how they compare over time. Pie charts are used to help you visualize how parts relate to a whole value, with each part of the chart showing information represented as a percentage. Bar charts, which can also be created as column charts, are a standard way of looking at a value across different categories. You need to choose the chart time and import chart data when creating charts.

Doughnut, funnel, and gauge charts all require Power BI. Doughnut charts are a variation to pie charts and are also used to visualize the relationship of parts to a whole. Funnel charts are used to help visualize process stages and process flows. Gauge charts show the current status in the context of a goal, such as percentage completion of an activity.

64

You should use the Patch Power Apps function. The Patch function lets you create or modify records in a data source. When online you can also use the Patch function to synchronize records back to the original online data source. You can use the Connection.Connected property to determine if the app is online.

You should not use the SaveData or the LoadData function. The SaveData function is used to save data to a collection for later use. The LoadData function is used to reload a collection previously saved using the SaveData function.

You should not use the Collect function. The Collect function can be used to add records to a data source but cannot be used to modify records.

65

The "Focus isn't showing" error indicates that the control's FocusBorderThickness property is set to 0. This means that users who do not use a mouse, such as those using keyboard navigation, cannot see when they interact with the app control. You need to set the property to a value greater than 0 to correct the error.

The error does not indicate that the control's Visibility property is set to false. Setting the Visibility property to false hides the control and means that the control is not included in navigation. This would not be reported as an error or as a warning in Accessibility checker.

The error does not indicate that the control's AccessibleLabel property contains an empty text string. This would be reported as a "Missing accessible label" error. This would effectively hide the control from the screen reader. You could add a text string to the AccessibleLabel property to correct this error.

The error does not indicate that the control's TabIndex property is set to a value greater than 0. This would be reported as a "Check the order of the screen items" tip rather than an error or a warning. Microsoft recommends setting this control to either 0 to participate in keyboard navigation or -1 to not participate in keyboard navigation whenever possible. You would use values other than 0 or 1 if you want to manually control navigation order for controls to set navigation to occur in TabIndex numerical order.

66

You should use a data table. A data table lets you connect to a data source and choose which fields from the data source that you want to show. Data is displayed in the table as read-only data.

You should not create a form. Forms are used for entering and editing data in an app.

You should not create a site map. A site map defines the navigation for the app.

You should not create a flow. A flow is part of the app business logic created through Power Automate and is used to automate activity between apps and services.

67

Canvas apps use charts to show data within the app visually. These charts take the data that is accessed through the canvas app and display it in various formats. Currently, canvas apps only have the ability to show line charts, pie charts, and column charts.

It is not possible to use or show funnel charts or area charts in canvas apps, although this may change over time with further development of the platform. It is possible to use or show funnel charts or area charts in model-driven apps.

68

You should use a context variable to calculate the running total. This is because context variables can only be referenced from the screen that they are on. They cannot be referenced from other screens. Context variables are used to hold values for the screen that they are implemented on and cannot be used across multiple screens.

You should not use a global variable. Global variables can be referenced across the entire app, not just from a specific screen. They are used to set and hold values that can be used in any place within the canvas app.

You should not use a collection. A collection is a table that can be referenced anywhere within the app, not just from a specific screen. Collections are used to hold data and can have the data in them updated in the app. Other components, like galleries, can display data that is held within a collection.

You should not use a button. Buttons are controls for users to click that lead to a specific action occurring like navigating to a different screen or another functionality.

69

You can use the app checker in the canvas app to check if there are any issues in the app itself, such as formula problems. When you run this tool, any issues found will be displayed in the app checker window.

You can also use the solution checker, which will display any formula issues for a canvas app that is held within the solution.

You should not use the analytics center. This provides general analytics and usage of the platform, but it will not show formula issues for a specific app.

You should not use the admin center. This is where environments are handled, and it will not show issues for specific apps or solutions.

70

You should use the Image control. The Image control can show an image from a local file or data source. You can specify the image size, placement, and rotation.

You should not use the Attachment control. The Attachment control is used to enable users to upload or download a file.

You should not use the Camera control. The Camera control is used to capture images from a device's camera. The device must have a camera and the user must explicitly allow the app to use the camera. The most recently captured image is available from the control's Photo property.

You should not use the Label control. The Label control is used to display a literal text string. You can set the text through the control's text property or enable the user to type text into the control.

71

The Camera, Barcode scanner, and Power BI tile controls cannot be used with Microsoft Teams mobile. The Camera control is used to capture images from a device's camera. The Power BI tile control is used to display a Power BI tile in an app. The Barcode scanner control is used to input data from a barcode. In addition, the Address input and Map controls are not supported.

The Import and Video controls are supported. The Import control is used to import data from elsewhere in Power Apps. The Video control is used to play a video clip from a local file, a data source, or YouTube. The Stream Video control, which is used with the Microsoft Stream service, is also supported.

72

Azure Blob Storage is a function-based data source. Function-based data sources use functions to interact with the data source and provide you a way to implement more extensive actions, such as updating permissions. Azure Blob Storage is Microsoft's cloud-based object storage solution and is optimized for storing unstructured data.

SharePoint List and Microsoft Dataverse are tabular data sources. SharePoint List provides organizations with a secure place to store, organize, share, and access information. Microsoft Dataverse is the new term for what was formerly named Common Data Service, and you will find both terms in use. Dataverse provides a secure location to store and manage data used in business applications with data organized into tables consisting of data rows and columns.

73

You can insert custom components on screens in the canvas app. A component can be used once or used multiple times across different screens in the canvas app. Custom components allow the platform to be extended through custom development, where the standard components cannot provide the required functionality.You cannot insert the component in a gallery. You can insert controls into galleries, but not custom components. Galleries are used to display data to users. They also allow users to select and open records as needed.

You cannot insert the component in a form. You can insert controls into forms, but not custom components. Forms are used for data entry by users, allowing them to capture and save information.

You cannot insert the component in a label. Labels are used to display information such as text on a form, but they are not user-interactive.

74

You should perform the following steps in order:
Click the Custom button in Power Apps Studio.Choose the Import components option.Select the component.Click the Import button.You can use components that have been created in other canvas apps within the same environment. To add an existing component to a canvas app, you should open the canvas app in Power Apps Studio. When the canvas app is open, you need to click the Custom button on the menu toolbar and then select Import component.

This will provide you with a listing of all of the components that are available to be selected and imported into your new canvas app. From here, you can select the component that you want to use and click the Import button. The component will then appear in your canvas app.

You should not export components since this will save a zip file to your local system containing the component.

You should not import the solution. Importing a solution will not add a component to the canvas app. Importing a solution would allow you to transfer the solution into a different environment.

You should not export the solution. This is not how components are added to canvas apps. Exporting a solution would save all the solution's components into a single file. This would help you to import the solution and its components into a different environment.

You should not add an existing solution component configuration. This will add component metadata to the solution rather than to a specific app.

75

You can use global variables to configure the inputs for the custom component. Custom components are able to take global variables as inputs, and then use them to either display information, or set further information. In this scenario, you would need to calculate the number of completed tasks and the total number of daily tasks and set these as global variables.

You should not use a collection. Collections are local tables of data that can be referenced, but they cannot be used to configure inputs for a custom component. Components such as galleries can be pointed to a collection to display the data held within them.

You should not use a context variable. Context variables, also known as local variables, are only referenced in the context of a specific screen. Custom components cannot use these for input.

You should not use an environmental variable. Environmental variables are used to allow apps and flows to be deployed to different environments without needing to change things like URLs. They are used instead of hard coding specific environment values directly within components, which would then need to be changed after deploying to a different environment.

76

You should use a Gallery control to show a list of manufactured hardware. This control type shows a list of multiple records from a data source.

You should use a List box control to allow users to choose multiple predefined values. This control displays a list of values from which the user can select one or more items.

You should use an Add picture control to upload a picture from a mobile device. This control allows users to take photos or upload image files from their device to update items in the data source.

You should not use a Drop down control. This control can be used to select a single item from a list of values.

You should not use an Image control. You can use this control to display an image on the screen.

77

You should use the UpdateContext function. The functionality needed requires a context variable. The UpdateContext function lets you create a context variable scoped to a single screen. For example, to create a context variable named "MyVar" and set it to a value of 5 you could use:

UpdateContext( { MyVar: 1 } )

You could also use the Navigate function to create a context variable scoped to the screen to which you are navigating.

You should not use the Set function. The Set function is used to create a global variable, which is available throughout your app.

You should not use the Collect function. The Collect function is used to create or add records to a collection, which is a table variable that can be referenced from anywhere in the app.

You should not use the Update function. The Update function is used to replace an entire record in a data source and cannot be used to create a variable.

78

You should use:

Set( MyVar, 1 ); Back();

The Set function is used to create or set the value for a global variable. The Back function navigates you back to the previous screen.

You should not use:

UpdateContext( { MyVar:1 } ); Back()

The UpdateContext function is used to create or update Context variables, which are scoped to a single screen.

You should not use either of the following:

Set( MyVar, 1 ); Navigate(Previous);
UpdateContext( { MyVar:1 } ); Navigate(Previous);

The Navigate function is used to navigate to a specific screen by screen name. Either formula would navigate to a screen named Previous.

79

You should use a context variable to pass a value to a screen as a parameter that is valid within that screen only. You can use the Navigate function to establish the variable as you navigate to a destination screen. You can also use UpdateContext to establish a context variable. Context variables can contain any type of value.

You should use a global variable to load a variable with a text-string value and make the value available from anywhere in the app. A global variable is available anywhere in your application and can contain any type of value. The Set function is used to set the value of a global variable.

You should create a collection variable to create a table as an empty table that supports data modification and is available from anywhere in the app. The ClearCollect function clears (deletes) all records before loading the collection with rows as a table. It can also be used to create a new, empty table. You can also use the Collect function to load a collection, but the Collect function does not empty the table first.

You should use a global variable to include a variable that increments each time a user navigates to a different screen and maintains a running total. A global variable is needed to provide a global context to the variable and support the necessary data type. The Set function is used to set the value of a global variable.

80

You should use the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) data source to manage users in Microsoft Dataverse. To create a new user manually in Microsoft Dataverse, you must first create that user from the Microsoft 365 admin center. By doing this, a new user gets added in Azure AD and then synchronizes to the Dataverse user table. In addition, if you want this operation to be performed through Power Apps, you should use the Azure AD data source to directly create users in Azure AD.

You should not use the Office 365 Users data source to create users in Microsoft Dataverse. Office 365 Users only lets you access user profiles from your Office 365 account. For example, a user's city, company name, job title, email, profile picture, etc. This data source cannot be used to create a new user in Dataverse.

You should not use the Microsoft Dataverse data source to create users in Microsoft Dataverse. Microsoft Dataverse only lets you perform operations in Microsoft Dataverse out-of-the-box, as well as custom tables like contact, account, lead, etc. It does not let you create a new user directly in Microsoft Dataverse, as you have to create it from Microsoft 365 admin center.

You should not use the Office 365 Groups data source to create users in Microsoft Dataverse. Office 365 Groups only allows you to manage group membership and calendar events in your organization using your Office 365 account. For example, adding members to the group, and retrieving members of a specific group. Office 365 Group does not allow for the operation to create users in Microsoft Dataverse.

81

You should use Power Apps Test Studio. Test Studio lets you write, organize, and automate tests for canvas apps. Tests are structured as test cases made up of test steps used to simulate user interaction. Test results are evaluated against test assertions, which are the expected results for a test. You can create test steps manually or record app interaction and automatically generate test expressions.

You should not use Build Tools. Power Platform Build Tools provide a way to automate common app build and deployment tasks. Build Tools do not provide app testing.

You should not use Flow Checker. Flow Checker is used to test and evaluate Power Automate flows, not apps.

You should not use Solution Checker. Solution Checker is a test tool used to validate Power Apps mobile apps.

82

You should use Accessibility Checker. The Accessibility Checker can identify and help to correct potential accessibility problems. It will also provide you with recommendations for correcting accessibility problems. Results are classified as:
Errors: conditions that made the app difficult or impossible to use.Warnings: conditions that can make an app difficult to use or understand for users with a disability.Tips: suggestions for improving usability for users with a disability.You should not use Power Automate. Power Automate is a set of tools and technologies that help you automate business processes. Power Automate is not used for app testing or validation.

You should not use Build Tools. Power Platform Build Tools provide a way to automate common app build and deployment tasks. Build Tools do not provide app testing.

You should not use Compliance Manager. Microsoft Compliance Manager is a tool that enables you to investigate your organization's current compliance posture and provide recommendations for improving compliance.

83

You should use App Checker. You can launch App Checker from the App Checker icon in Power Apps. App Checker will return a list of errors and suspected errors with a short explanation of why they were included in the list. App Checker also provides accessibility errors and warnings.

You should not use Solution Checker. Solution Checker is used with model-driven apps to analyze Dataverse solution components. You run Solution Checker from Power Apps. You can download a report with the results after Solution Checker completes.

You should not use Flow Checker. Flow Checker is used to test and evaluate Power Automate flows, not apps.

You should not use Build Tools. Power Platform Build Tools provide a way to automate common app build and deployment tasks. Build Tools do not provide app testing.

84

Test Studio is available within Power Platform to build end-to-end tests for canvas apps. It is important to test out canvas apps to ensure that the right quality is adhered to. Test Studio is a user-friendly interface, which is used to create, store, and run tests for canvas apps.

You should organize the test scenarios in the following order:
Test suitesTest casesTest stepsTest assertionsYou should first create a test suite. This is a holder for one or more test cases to reside in.

Then, you should create a test case within the test suite. Test cases are executed to validate that your app, or specific features in your app, are working as expected.

Once the test case is created, you should then add test step(s) within the test case.

Finally, you should create test assertions. Every test case that is created should also have an expected result associated to it. Users create these expected results in Test Studio. Test assertions can either evaluate as true (passing the test) or as false (failing the test).

85

You should use the Filter and Lookup functions, which provide delegation in the canvas app. The concept of delegation in a canvas app is to minimize the data movement over the network between the data source and your app. Using delegation, a canvas app delegates data-processing to the data source rather than processing it locally in the app to improve the app's performance. Canvas apps provide some delegable functions like Filter, Search, Lookup, etc., to reduce the amount of data being retrieved in the app. Filter and Lookup can use the And, Or, Not, In operators to retrieve the appropriate records from the data source.

You should not use First, FirstN, Collect, ClearCollect, GroupBy and Ungroup functions to provide delegation in the app. These functions do not support delegation. They retrieve the entirety of the data from the data source to the app first, and then process it locally.
The First function returns the first record of the table. For example First(Doctors).The FirstN function returns the set of records of a table based on the number specified in the second argument of the function. For example First(Doctors, 10)The Collect function is used to add a record to the collection in the canvas app. Example: Collect(Doctors, { Name: "ABC", Location: "Spain" }, { Name: "XYZ", Location: "France" } )The ClearCollect function deletes all existing records from the collection and then adds a new record to the collection. Example: ClearCollect(Doctors, { Name: "ABC", Location: "Spain" }, { Name: "XYZ", Location: "France" } )The GroupdBy function returns a table with records grouped together based on the value in one or more columns.The Ungroup function returns a table with separate records that were grouped together.References

Understand delegation in a canvas app

86

You should use the SaveData function to save the data in collection locally on your device while you are working offline or in a remote area. For example, SaveData(OfflineData, "XYZ") will save the OfflineData collection to the user's device under the name XYZ, which would be available for LoadData to retrieve later.

You should use the LoadData function to load the collection data in the app that was saved with the SaveData function. For example, LoadData(OfflineData, "XYZ") will load the OfflineData collection from the user's device under the name XYZ, which was previously stored on calling SaveData.

You should not use the Collect function to provide offline capabilities in the app. Collect is used to store data locally in the canvas app's temporary storage, which you would want to reuse across the app rather than retrieving it repeatedly from data sources. For example, Collect(Configurations, {Username: "xyz@yahoo.com", password: "Pass@word1"}) will create a configuration table in the canvas app's local storage and store the username and password in that table.

You should not use Patch function to provide offline capabilities in the app. Patch is used to create/update data in the data source. For example Patch(Employees, Defaults(Employees), {Name: "XYZ"}) function will create the employee data with the name XYZ in the Employees table.

87

You should create a virtual table. A virtual table is a custom table that provides access to external data. You must specify the data provider and data source rows when creating a virtual table. Data access is read-only.

You should not create a standard table. Standard tables do not support direct access to external data. Microsoft Dataverse includes default standard tables provided for your use. You can also create custom standard tables that can be used to store data.

You should not create an activity table. Activity tables are default Dataverse tables that include a time dimension that lets you track when an action occurred or will occur.

You cannot create a private table. Private tables are used by Microsoft and are not available to third-party developers.

88

You need to create a 1:N relationship. This type of relationship creates a hierarchical structure between the tables where one row in the parent table is associated with one or more rows in the child table. You have multiple options for creating the relationship including:
Using Power Apps portal to define the relationshipUsing Solution explorer to define the relationshipCreating a Lookup column in a model-driven app or creating a new Lookup column for the related tableIf you import a solution that includes table relationships, those relationships are maintained.

You should not create an N:1 relationship. This would associate multiple rows in CurrentCustomers with one row in Orders.

You should not create an N:N relationship. This creates a peer relationship between the tables with no hierarchical structure in the relationship.

You should not create a self-referencing relationship. This is a relationship between rows in the same table.

89

You should complete the following actions in order:

Open the relationships tab of the ColdCall table.Select Add relationship and select Many-to-many.Select ProductOffers as the related table.Click OK to create the relationship.
You need to create a N:N (many-to-many) relationship between the tables. This creates a peer relationship between the tables with no hierarchical structure in the relationship. In this relationship, a row in one table can be related to one or more rows in the other table. This process creates a new table to maintain the relationships between the tables.

You start by opening a table in the relationship. Based on the available steps in this scenario, you should create the relationship from ColdCall. You specify that you want to create a many-to-many relationship. The relationship is with the ProductOffers table, so you should select this as the related table. When you click OK, the relationship is created.

You should not select ColdCall as the related table. This would create a self-relationship.

You should not select Many-to-one as the relationship type. This would create a hierarchical relationship where one or more rows in the parent table are related to the same row in the child table.

You should not select One-to-one as the relationship type. This would create a relationship where one row in the parent table is related to one row in the child table.

90

You can use the Power App portal or solution explorer to define an N:N (many-to-many) relationship. This creates a peer relationship between the tables with no hierarchical structure in the relationship. In this relationship, a row in one table can be related to one or more rows in the other table. Solution explorer is more flexible in what you can do but can be more difficult to use.

You should not use SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS). SSMS is used for managing a SQL Server infrastructure, including on-premises and Azure SQL Server.

You should not use the PowerApps admin module. This is a PowerShell module that is used to administer apps and environments in the Power Platform admin center.

91

You should use Power Query to create and load the tables with test data. Power Query supports multiple data sources, including SQL Server and Excel, and lets you filter, transform, and combine data. For each table, you will need to identify the source data and select the data columns to load. Power Query lets you create a new table or load data to an existing table. You can launch Power Query directly from Power BI Desktop.

You could also use Power Apps table import to import data, but this requires significantly more effort and does not support creating a new table. This method only lets you load data into an existing table.

You should not use Power Apps Import function in Power Apps Solutions. The Power Apps import function is not used for importing data from external sources. It is used to import components into your solution from an existing solution.

You should not use SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS). SSMS is used for managing a SQL Server infrastructure, including on-premises and Azure SQL Server.

You should not use the Power Apps test framework. Power Apps test framework is provided as a way to create user interface (UI) automation and end-to-end tests.

92

You cannot create multiple databases in an environment. You can create an environment without a database or create one database in the environment. If you need multiple databases, you will need multiple environments.

Users and groups assigned to the environment are not automatically given access to the database. Access to the database must be given to users and groups separately.

Only members of the System Administrator role or Environment admin role can administer the database. You must be a member of the Environment admin role to create a database. Only a member of Environment admin can create a database. You can also choose to create the database when you create the environment.

You can use the Power Platform admin center or the Tables pane in the Power Apps portal to create a database.

93

You should perform the following steps in order:

  1. Select the environment that the database needs to be created in.
  2. Configure the currency and language settings.
  3. Select Create my database.

You can create environments in Power Platform with a Dataverse database or without a Dataverse database. To create a Dataverse database in an environment that does not have one, first you should select the environment that you want to create the database in.

Next, you should configure the currency and language settings to match your requirements and then select Create my database.

You should not configure database collation settings because these are applied to the back-end SQL database automatically, based on the applied currency and language settings. Collation settings affect elements like recognized characters, sorting, quick find, etc. They are not configurable for Dataverse databases.

You should not set the environment type to Production. In this scenario, the environment is for development purposes. Production environments should not be used for development purposes.

94

You should use an N:N (many-to-many) relationship. You can only associate records with each other through a sub-grid for an N:N relationship. This is because it is not possible to use a lookup column on the form for these types of associations. In an N:N relationship, the existence of either type is dependent on something outside both of them. Therefore, it is possible to have one student associated with many courses, as well as a single course associated with many students.

You should not use 1:N (one-to-many) or N:1 (many-to-one) relationships. Both of these allow you to use a lookup column on the record form, as well as a sub-grid, to associate records together. In an 1:N or N:1 relationship, one object is the parent and the other is the child. The parent controls the existence of the child. With these relationships it is not possible to have one student associated with many courses, as well as a single course associated with many students.

You should not use 1:1 relationships. This creates a direct relationship between both records, without allowing any other relationships to other records to exist. This does not meet the scenario requirements.

95

You would use the Sample Data option in Data management to remove the test data that is generated during the environment creation. The options for Sample Data allow both adding and removing the test data that is auto-generated through this process.

You should not use templates for data import, since these are used for mapping data that is imported into the system. They are not able to remove data from the system once it has been loaded.

You should not deploy sample apps and data. This can be used only when creating an environment. It is not able to be accessed after environment creation to remove the data that has been auto-generated.

You should not use the Data Import option under Data management. This is used for managing manual imports of data, including deletion of the data loaded, but it does not work for the sample data that can be generated during environment creation.

96

You should perform the following steps in order:

Open the relationship tab of the EndUser table.Add a new one-to-many relationship.Select the SlaContract table as the related table.
First, you should open the relationship tab of the EndUser table. This tab lists the existing relationships for the EndUser table and also allows you to create new relationships.

Next, you should add a new one-to-many relationship. You can create different types of relationships, like one-to-many, many-to-one, or many-to-many relationships using the EndUser table as reference. You need to create a one-to-many relationship to ensure that one EndUser can relate with many SlaContract, and a SlaContract is related to only one EndUser.

Finally, you should select the SlaContract table as the related table. This would create the desired relationship between those two tables, where you can relate many SlaContracts to one EndUser.

You should not open the relationship tab of the SlaContract table or select the EndUser table as the related table. You can create the relationship from the SlaContract table, but you need to use a many-to-one relationship to relate both tables correctly.

You should not add a new many-to-many relationship. This would allow a SlaContract to be owned by more than one EndUser, which does not meet the requirements.

97

You can use Power Apps Maker portal or Power Apps solution explorer. Both tools are capable of creating relationships between tables in Dataverse. Relationships in Dataverse contain a customization prefix. You should use solution explorer if you need to change the customization prefix.

You should not use Power Platform Admin center or Visual Studio Code. Those tools are not capable of creating relationships between tables in Dataverse. You can use Power Platform Admin center to manage environments and settings for Power Apps. You can use Visual Studio Code to develop applications in a cross-platform code editor.

98

The following types of business rule actions are supported for canvas apps:

Set and clear column valuesValidate data and show error messages
You can also apply business rules with actions that set column requirement levels.

The following types of business rule actions are not supported for canvas apps:

Show or hide columnsEnable or disable columnsCreate business recommendations based on business intelligence
These types of actions are supported for model-driven apps.

99

You should use a business process flow to guide users through steps that must be carried out for onboarding new employees. Business process flows are used to ensure that users enter data in a specified order, along with ensuring that required columns are completed. Users have to follow this order and cannot skip steps that are set as required.

You should use a business rule to make date of birth mandatory when creating a new record. Business rules are used to control column visibility, required level, etc., on a model-driven app form.

You should use Power Automate to implement an approval flow for expense reports to be sent to managers. Power Automate is used for approval processes and has a built-in available template to implement this so that approvals can be sent to the right person for confirming or denying the request.

You should not use Power Virtual Agents for any of the scenarios. These are chatbots aimed at providing self-serve information to users.

100

You should use a business rule to set columns as required across all types of apps. Business rules are used to enforce column data entry, show and hide columns, and set default column values.

You should not use the column properties. Although you can set the column as required in the column's properties, this setting only applies to model-driven app forms and will not make the column required in the canvas app.

You should not use a business process flow. These are used within model-driven apps only to enforce users to enter data in a specific order. They cannot be used in canvas apps.

You should not use a Power Automate flow. These are used for automation purposes and do not affect user functionality in either model-driven or canvas apps.

101

Users assigned the System Customizer and System Admin roles can author the following resources:
Dataverse table
Model-driven app
Solution framework
Desktop flow
AI Builder

The System Customizer role also lets you author solution-aware cloud flows.

Users assigned the Environment Maker and Environment Admin roles can author the following resources:
Canvas app
Cloud flow
Connection
Default gateway
Dataflow
References

Security concepts in Microsoft Dataverse

Configure user security to resources in an environment

Understand environment roles

102

You should configure the security role that the sales teams have so that they can only see records that are owned by the team. You need to ensure they do not have organizational level access to the records, because this would grant the teams access to all of the records across all of the sales teams.

You should not use a security group. Security groups are used to control access to an environment and are not used to control access to data within an environment.

You should not use field security profiles. The default behavior of the system is that users can open records and access all the columns that are present on the form, as well as being able to modify the column values. Column-level security can be used to restrict access to columns on records, so that users are either not able to modify the column values or not able even to see the data held within that column on the form. However, field-level security profiles do not control access to records.

You should not use an access team template. Access teams have users associated with them, while users have security roles assigned to them. Access teams do not own records and do not have security roles assigned explicitly to them. They are used for sharing records that users would not have access to. For example, you could use an access team to give certain users access to a specific record, along with the rights available for the specified record, such as Read, Write, or Append.

103

You should use a business rule to calculate the sum of the ticket price and tax price. You need to create a business rule of type Formula and choose the + operator to calculate the sum of the two field values.

You should not use a background workflow. Background workflows can only run in the background and do not require user interaction to automate the business logic. They are asynchronous in nature. Therefore, they cannot produce immediate results. However, you need to calculate the sum synchronously, and hence you should not use this component to calculate the sum.

You should not use a rollup field. A rollup field does not calculate the sum of two fields available on the form. Rollup fields work only on One-to-Many relationships to aggregate or count the child records.

You should not use Power Automate. Power Automate can calculate the sum of two field values; however, it is asynchronous in nature. Therefore, you cannot expect the immediate result on the model-driven app form.

104

You need to create a business process flow. A business process flow is used with model-driven apps to define the steps that users should follow to reach a desired outcome. The stages and steps of the process are displayed in the process bar at the top of a form when a user starts a business process flow. You can control who can create, read, update, or delete the business process flow instance. For example, some users can be given read-only access so that they can only monitor activities.

You should not create a desktop flow. A desktop flow is used to automate the playback of manual steps on legacy software.

You should not create a cloud flow. A cloud flow automatically performs one or more tasks after an event triggers the flow, such as when a row is updated in a Dataverse table.

You should not create an instant flow. Instant flows let you initiate automated tasks, such as from the tap of a button in your app. An instant flow is used to run a repetitive tasks from any place and at any time.

105

You should use Power Automate. Power Automate solutions let you build an instant flow that can be used in a business process flow. Instant flows let you initiate automated tasks, such as from the tap of a button in your app. An instant flow is used to run a repetitive tasks from any place and at any time.

You should not use the Power Platform admin center or Power Apps admin center. Both are management portals for managing Power Apps environments. Neither includes the functionality to create Power Automate flows.

106
