You should use an approval flow. Approval flows are automated flows dedicated to documents or processes across several services, including SharePoint items. After a new overtime work request is created, you can approve the request by using the approvals portal or the Power Automate mobile app.

You should not use an instant flow. This is a flow that is activated on-demand to automate repetitive tasks. Although you can use this flow to create overtime work requests, you cannot use it with a SharePoint list.

You should not use a scheduled flow. Scheduled flows are used for scheduling recurrent tasks like sending a weekly report or sending daily follow-up emails. Approving overtime work requests is not a recurring task.

You should not use a business process flow. This flow can be used to configure a set of steps to be followed by users, resulting in a standard business process. For example, you might need a business process flow to handle customer service requests in the same way. You should use a business process flow for more complex processes that involve multiple company teams and uses tables stored in Microsoft Dataverse.

107

When you need to run repetitive tasks from any place and at any time through a flow app on a mobile device you need an instant flow. Instant flows let you initiate tasks from the tap of a button in your app.

If your app requires a flow that performs one or more tasks automatically being triggered by an event, you need to implement a cloud flow. A cloud flow automatically performs one or more tasks after an event triggers the flow, such as when a row is updated in a Dataverse table.

A model-driven app flow that performs one or more tasks based on a predetermined schedule uses a scheduled flow. The scheduling options are flexible, such as running on a specified date or at a specified time, once a day, hour, or minute, or after a specified time period has passed.

None of the scenarios refer to a business process flow. A business process flow is used with model-driven apps to define the steps that users should follow to take the user to a desired outcome. It would be used to define the steps for an activity such as complex data entry to post a customer invoice.

None of the scenarios refer to a desktop flow. A desktop flow is used to automate the playback of manual steps on legacy software.

108

You should use a mobile button triggering an instant flow. This is an example of using an immediate flow and can be used to automate mobile or desktop tasks. Warehouse workers keep the pick slip until they are finished and can then immediately forward the pick slip to their supervisor.

You should not use a scheduled trigger. A scheduled trigger activates periodically based on a schedule you define. For example, if you wanted to wait until the end of the day and then forward all pick slips, you would use a scheduled trigger.

You should not use an automated trigger from data field update. While this might be possible, the logic and conditions for controlling triggering of the flow could be complicated to implement, and may well be impossible.

You should not use a polling trigger. A polling trigger is designed to make a periodic call to a service to look for new data. One scenario where a polling trigger might work is a supervisor app that periodically polls pick slip status on a data store, but this would not meet the solution requirements in this scenario.

109

You should specify When an item is created. This is one of the default triggers supported by Microsoft SharePoint Connector. The trigger will fire on item creation only and will perform the actions designated in the flow.

You should not specify When an item is created or modified and add a trigger condition. This is a workable solution but does not minimize the effort necessary to implement the solution. You would need to define specific trigger conditions to limit the trigger to newly created records and you may need to modify how records are entered to include a tag identifying new records.

You should not specify When an item or a file is modified and add a trigger condition. The trigger should fire for new, not modified, contact information.

You should not specify For a selected item. This is used to enable a user to manually execute a flow from a list after an item is selected.

110

You should use button trigger tokens with the button flow. Button trigger tokens are data points known and available to the device on which the button flow is running. Button trigger tokens include data points such as timestamp, date, and address information. You can use button trigger tokens with the button flow to include the current address in the email.

You should not add a condition. A condition is used to help determine when a button should fire. When added, the button flow is executed only if the conditions are met.

You should not add a navigation to a screen prompting for the address. This provides a way to enter the address but requires additional interaction by the user.

You should not add a navigation to a screen with an interactive map component. An interactive map control can be used to graphically display the current device's geographic location. It is not used to provide the location as a text string for use with an email.

111

You should add a condition to the flow as follows:

@equals(triggerBody()?['RunAutomation'],true)

You can specify one or more conditions to a flow and include logical expressions to combine multiple conditions. The flow will run only if the flow is triggered and the conditions are true.

You should not change the trigger to When an item or a file is modified. This is not a complete solution because it does nothing to ensure that the value conditions are met before performing any tasks.

You should not change the trigger to For a selected item. This is used to enable a user to manually execute a flow from a list after an item is selected. This does not keep the effort to manage the flow to a minimum.

You should not replace the automated flow with an instant flow. You need an automated flow to have the tasks performed automatically when the tasks are met. An instant flow starts the automation after a button is clicked.

112

You should add the Power Automate flow to the existing development solution. Power Automate flows need to be in a solution before they can be moved between environments. In this scenario, there is an existing solution that has been created for this. You should add the flow that has been created to the existing solution to deploy it to the production environment.

You should not add the flow to the default solution in the development environment. This is not the solution that you want to export.

You should not add the flow to the default solution in the production environment. This is because the flow has been created in the development environment and does not exist in the production environment.

You should not change the environment for the flow. This would not allow the flow to be moved between environments.

113

When a Power Automate flow errors or fails, by default no following actions are carried out. The flow will stop at the point where it failed.

You should use the Run after option in this scenario. This will allow you to specify an action to be carried out when a Power Automate flow fails. Run After is the only method by which specified steps within the Power Automate flow can run when the flow has failed or is erroring.

You should not use the Apply to each action. This action will not work if there is a failure or error in the Power Automate flow process before this step. This action is used to run a specific action against all records that have been passed through to the action from a previous step.

You should not use the Loops action. Loops are used for blocks of actions for desktop flows, not cloud flows. They are used to repeat one or more actions together multiple times.

You should not use the Split action. This is used in conjunction with collections and strings to break strings of text into substrings.

114

You should use a trigger to start the flow. A trigger is an event that causes a Power Automate flow to start running. Once triggered, the actions and steps that make up the Power Automate flow will run to send out the sales notification.

You should not use a business event. Business events are used in Finance and Operation apps, and not in Dataverse. Finance and Operation apps are not Dataverse-based apps.

You should not use an action. Actions are used in response to a trigger item and make up the different steps within a Power Automate flow to carry out the desired functionality. Actions are the building blocks used to set out what the flow will do.

You should not use a custom connector. Custom connectors are used within actions to connect to other systems that do not have a pre-built Power Automate connector available for them. Custom connectors need to interface with an API for the system that they are connecting to.

115

You should use the When an item is modified trigger. You can use this trigger to start an automated flow when an item is modified in the SharePoint list and verify if the status field has changed to Unsubscribed to start the unsubscription tasks.

You should not use the When an item is deleted trigger. You should use this trigger to start an automated flow when an item is deleted from the SharePoint list. In this case, the item is not deleted from the list.

You should not use the When an item is created trigger. You can use this trigger to start an automated flow when an item is created in the SharePoint list. Using this trigger would start the flow when the user is included in the subscription list.

You should not use the For a selected item trigger. You can use this trigger to enable a user to manually execute a flow from a list after an item is selected.

116

You should use the When a feed item is published trigger. This trigger will start a new flow run every time a new blog post is published in the blog.

You should use the Delay action. This action will pause the flow execution during a specific time period. You need to delay the flow to receive the email 10 minutes after the post is published.

You should use the Send me an email notification action. This action will send an email after the delay time.

You should not use the Send a push notification action. This action will send a push notification to the Power Automate mobile app instead of an email.

You should not use the Recurrence trigger. This trigger starts a new flow execution in a specific schedule, like once a week or every day. You need to start a new flow run every time a new blog post is published in the company blog.

You should not use the Manually trigger a flow trigger. This trigger starts a new flow execution based on user input.

117

You should set up entities that will provide a list of financial terminology options for users to select from when they request assistance. You should also ensure that smart matching is enabled to allow the bot to understand variations in grammar, misspellings, and similar words. You build an entity list to provide users with static options (slot filling options) that they can select from when chatting with the bot.

Entities provide a list of options that are displayed in the chat and available for the user to select. These entity values can be stored in variables and used throughout the topic flow. Smart matching in entities allows the bot to use the built-in natural language understanding of the AI capabilities in power platform to better understand and interpret the language used by users.

You should also add synonyms to each of the items in the list to further enhance the bot's capabilities of understanding variations in phrases and words that users might use when requesting support assistance. Synonyms can be added either when you set up the entity or later while editing the applicable entity.

You should not add trigger phrases to the topic as this will not address the need for static or pre-populated responses to be selected by the users. Trigger phrases still rely on the user to phrase the question in such a way that it can be matched with the words in the trigger phrase. Trigger phrases also do not supply a preset list of values for the user to choose from. It is, however, a good idea to review the trigger phrases to optimize the matching of the user requests to the trigger phrases that start or route to a particular topic.

You should not add a question with multiple choice options, as this will not allow the use of the AI functionality to improve the bot's responses to user requests. In this scenario, an entity with preset options that the user can click on is the preferred solution.

118

You should use topics. In Power Virtual Agents, topics represent the potential conversation path between end-users and a chatbot. Each topic in Power Virtual Agent contains triggers and a conversation path that helps dictate how the conversation will proceed. For example, a topic will decide what the conversation path should be if the customer types 'Good morning' in the chat.

You should not use entities. Entities in Power Virtual Agents refer to categories of information that exist in the real world, like phone numbers, email addresses, age, zip code, city, state, etc. Entities help Power Virtual Agents to make the conversation more natural; however, they cannot be used to decide how the chat conversation path will be carried out between user and chatbot.

You should not use variables. Variables in Power Virtual Agents are used to store the user's response either for further processing or to use in the chat conversation. For example, if a customer provided their email address, you can store it in a variable and use it to check the customer's details in the database in the subsequent conversation. Variables cannot be used to decide how the chat conversation path will be carried out between user and chatbot.

You should not use channels. Power Virtual Agents can be published to various channels Like Microsoft Teams, Facebook, Live websites, mobile apps, but it cannot be used to manage conversation paths between the user and chatbot.

119

You should copy the IFrame Snippet of Custom Website from Power Virtual Agent Channels. Once you publish the Power Virtual Agent bot, you need to navigate to Manage > Channels > Custom Website and then select Copy to copy the Iframe code snippet. Once copied, you should share the Iframe code snippet with the web developer of the organization to embed the chatbot into the website's HTML.

You should not copy the code under the Web-based apps section from Power Virtual Agent Channels and share it with the app developer of the organization. Web-based code is needed when you have to embed the chatbot into mobile apps.

120

You should share the chatbot with the security group to which the program manager belongs. Power Virtual Agents bots created within Microsoft Teams cannot be shared with individual users directly. You need to share the bot with the security group the user belongs to. Security groups are basically used to control which licensed users can be a member of a particular environment/team.

You cannot share your chatbot with the program manager directly in Microsoft Teams. Power Virtual Agents bots within Teams can only be shared either with security groups or with everyone in the organization, but not with individual users.

You should not share the chatbot link with the program manager directly. The program manager cannot access the chatbot using the chatbot link, shared either through email or Teams chat unless the chatbot itself is shared with them.

You should not assign the Owner role to the program manager and then share the chatbot link. The Owner role is required to create, edit and manage all the chatbots in the team. You should only assign this role to the user who is going to develop the chatbot within Teams. Additionally, the program manager cannot access the chatbot via the link shared either through email or Teams chat unless the chatbot itself is shared with them.

121

You should use the Call an action node to send an office pass to the employee's email address, once the request is approved by the manager. The Call an action node in Power Virtual Agent is used to call Power Automate to perform the operation in Microsoft Dataverse and other data sources. It also allows you to pass input and output parameters between Power Virtual Agent and Power Automate.

You should use Topics to answer the common questions asked by the employees related to the back-to-office processes. Topics in Power Virtual Agent for Teams are the collection of phrases, keywords, and common questions that a user is most likely to ask. Topics also have trigger phrases that decide the conversation path of the chat. For example, if the user types Office Pass in the chat, then a topic that has that keyword will get triggered, and the chatbot will automatically ask the questions that the user defined for that topic.

You should not use entities to meet any of the given requirements. Entities in Power Virtual Agent are the information units that represent the most commonly used real-world subjects, like name, email, address, color, age, mobile number, etc. You can add multiple items in an entity and use them in topics while configuring a Power Virtual Agent.

122

You must use the Power BI service to share reports with other users. Power BI is designed to support collaboration, which includes sharing reports. If you want to share a report that you created in Power BI Desktop you can first save the report to Power BI workspace, where you can set up collaboration with other users.

Both the Power BI service and Power BI Desktop support filtering report data. Data transformations require Power BI Desktop.

Both the Power BI service and Power BI Desktop let you include visualizations in your reports. A variety of chart types are supported by both tools.

You must use Power BI Desktop if you want to include computed columns in a report. Computed column values are one of the features supported by Power BI data transformations.

123

Shared reports are accessible from the Power BI service and mobile devices. You share a report by saving the report in a Power BI service workspace. The report can be a report you created in the Power BI service or in Power BI Desktop.

The Power BI service can automatically create reports from supported data sources, including Azure SQL Database and several software as a service (SaaS) online applications.

The Power BI service does not support data transformations in reports. Data transformations require Power BI Desktop.

You can use the Power BI service to create dashboard tiles. Dashboards and dashboard tiles are a feature of the Power BI service. A dashboard tile is a snapshot representation of your data. Neither is supported by Power BI Desktop.

124

You should use the Power BI Desktop Power Query Editor. The Power Query Editor lets you transform data by shaping and combining data.

You should not use Power BI service workspace. This is a collaboration area in the Power BI service. You can use this area to share reports and desktop and let end users interact.

You should not use Power BI Desktop Publish. This is used to share a report created in Power BI Desktop through the Power BI service.

You should not use Power BI Desktop Analysis services. This is used to perform analysis on a selected data point.

125

You should publish the report to the Power BI service. You cannot share a report directly to users from Power BI Desktop, but in the Power BI service you can identify the users, security groups, and distribution groups with which the report is shared by email address. Users are automatically sent an email invitation to the report.

You should not create a cloud-based shared directory. This is not required for sharing a report. You do have the option of sharing a report by copying the report's .pbix to a shared folder or distributing the file through any normal file distribution means, such as through email. However, this does not minimize the management overhead in terms of informing users who should have access, or in terms of managing the share.

You should not create a custom security role. The process of sharing a report through the Power BI service does not require custom role-based security.

You should not add the users to a dynamic distribution group. Dynamic distribution groups are not supported as a destination for sharing from the Power BI service.

126

You should use Power BI Desktop for using calculated columns in the reports. Sometimes users want to see the calculated value in the reports to quickly analyze the complete data and make the decision accordingly. Power BI Desktop uses Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) formulas to define the calculated values. For example, see total revenue generated by all the employees working in a particular store. Power BI Service does not currently support creating measures and calculated columns.

You should use the Power BI Service for sharing a report. Power BI Service enables the sharing of reports with colleagues internally and externally. Power BI Desktop does not allow the sharing of reports with other users.

You should not choose both tools to meet the requirements. Each Power BI tool has its own features and limitations. Power BI Service (online) does not support calculated columns, whereas Power BI Desktop does not support sharing reports. Nevertheless, both tools have some common features related to visualizations, filter, security, bookmarks, and so on.

127

Entity relationships are basically used in Microsoft Dataverse to define how records are related to each other. 1:N (One to Many) means that a record of one entity is associated with multiple records of another entity. N:1 (Many to One) means that multiple records of an entity are associated with a single record of another entity, and N:N (Many to Many) refers to multiple records of an entity being associated with multiple records of another entity.

You should use the 1:N (One to Many) relationship for the Event and Pass table, because one event can have multiple types of passes to distribute. Some passes could be for VIPs and some could be for partner organizations etc.

You should also use the 1:N (One to Many) relationship for the Organizer and Pass table, because an organizer can generate multiple passes for a particular event.

You should use the N:N (Many to Many) relationship between Pass and Participant table, because one pass can be distributed to multiple participants. For example, VIP passes can be distributed to all VIP guests, and Partner passes can be distributed to all partners of the company. Also, one participant can have passes to different events. Therefore, Pass and Participant should have the N:N (Many to Many) relationship.

128

To give each sales team in the organization access to their own data only, you should use security roles. Security roles allow you to configure different levels of access to data records. This can be used to restrict users to seeing just the records that they create and own, records that their team creates and owns, or records that the entire organization creates and owns. Security roles govern access to the specific record, and users are then able to see all columns within the record. Power BI requires the use of security roles for row-level security. When this is configured, users will only be able to view the data that they have access to.

You should not use Power BI settings. This is not where you configure user access to records. This section relates to the general functions of Power BI reports, rather than security.

You should not use the report itself. This does not distinguish between the different security roles. Power BI reports use a query language to return the results for the query. Filtering access to records based on security requirements is not a capability of the query itself.

You should not use the dashboard. This displays the Power BI report, but it does not limit the visibility of data. Dashboards are areas that are used to show multiple data objects, such as charts, tables, and Power BI reports in a single interface. They do not include the ability to restrict the results being returned to users.

129

You can configure the dashboard as a system or user dashboard to provide access to all users. A user can create a user dashboard only in the app areas that they have privileges for.

You should create the dashboard as a single-stream or multi-stream dashboard. A single-stream dashboard is an interactive dashboard over one data stream and is based on a table view or queue. A multi-stream dashboard is an interactive dashboard that displays real-time data over multiple data streams rather than a single table or view.

A standard dashboard is not an interactive dashboard so it does not meet the scenario requirements.

130

You should use Power Query. Power Query provides the ability to transform and merge data and is supported by a variety of Microsoft applications and services. You can use Power Query to perform the extract, transform, and load (ETL) processing of data. You would use Power Query Desktop to work with Excel for Windows.

You should not use the Power Platform admin center. The admin center provides a central point for managing environments and settings for Power Apps, Power Automate, and customer engagement apps.

You should not use the Power BI service. The Power BI service is a set of tools that help you create, share, and consume business insights. Power BI service is a Software as a Service (SaaS) implementation of Power BI and does not meet the scenario's requirements.

You should not use Power Automate. Power Automate lets you create and manage flows and automate business processes, but does not meet the scenario's requirements.

131

You should ask an administrator to enable Power BI visualization embedding. This is an organization-wide setting that must be enabled before users can embed Power BI visualizations. This setting is disabled by default. An administrator can use the Power Platform admin center to enable this setting.

You should not try to embed the visualization in the system dashboard. You can embed Power BI visualizations to the system dashboard, but this does not get you any closer to embedding the visualization on a personal dashboard.

You should not use the Power Apps portal to embed the visualization. A visualization is embedded to a personal dashboard through the app's Dashboards pane.

You should not ask the visualization author to recreate the visualization in the Power BI service. Until enabled, visualizations are not supported from either Power BI Desktop or the Power BI service.

132

You should perform the following actions in order:

Open the Advanced Find window, and select the contacts that you want to use.Select Mail Merge.Choose the template you want to use.Click the Download button.
In order to perform a mail merge, you should use the Advanced Find interface. You should begin by selecting the Contacts table in the Advanced Find window and then filter as required to display the results that you need.

Once the results are displayed, you should then use the Mail Merge button on the toolbar to start the merge. You need to select the mail merge template that you want to use. Then, you can download the data to start the merge.
You should not export the contact records to Microsoft Excel. In this scenario, the mail merge functionality stated is for Microsoft Word.

You should not select Word templates. This is used to create a template. These are used to set up the initial templates that are used for functions such as mail merges.

You should not open the Contacts table in the model-driven app. You need to use the Advanced Find window.

133

You should use an environmental variable to ensure that when you move the app between different environments, the Power BI report reflects the correct data. Every environment requires you to specify a workspace and either a dashboard or report to use. Environment variables allow configuration without unmanaged customizations.You should not use Power BI Premium. Power BI Premium includes features such as greater scale and performance, self service, ability to share content. It will not automatically change the data source to reflect data correctly.

You should not use a custom connector. Custom connectors are used in Power Automate to connect to systems with APIs that do not have prebuilt connectors available.

You should not use Power Query. Power Query is used to prepare data and transform it for the purposes the data will be used for. It includes a user graphical interface for pulling data in from multiple sources and an editor to perform the transformations.

134

You need to perform the following actions in order:

Create an object detection model in AI Builder.Train the model.Publish the model.
First, you should create an object detection model in AI Builder. You can use different AI model types in AI Builder depending on your business needs. You can use this model to detect objects from a picture. For example, you can find the assembly manual by taking a picture of the product in Power Apps.

Then, you should train the model. The training step prepares a model that identifies the product. You should provide at least fifteen pictures of each product to train your model and return the desired manual with better accuracy.

Finally, you should then publish the model. After you train the model, you have to publish it to make it available for Power Apps or Power Automate.

You should not create a form processing model in AI Builder. You build a form processing AI model to extract information from scanned documents, like invoices.

You should not distribute the model. You can distribute a model as a solution component, exporting a zip package containing the model. After that, you can import this package into another environment. This is not required in this scenario.

135

The following prebuilt model components are available for use with canvas apps:

Business card readerReceipt processorText recognizer
These components are ready for use and do not require you to train the component. The Business card reader is also supported for use with model-driven apps.

The Object detector is supported for canvas apps, but this is a custom model instead of a prebuilt model. This means you must train the model with your data and publish the model before it can be used.

The Text translation prebuilt model is supported for Power Apps. It is supported for Power Automate only to add intelligence to flows.

The Language detection prebuilt model cannot be added to a canvas app screen but can be accessed using the formula bar.

136

The custom model must be trained and published before use. The prebuilt model is ready to use without training. You must provide the data for training a custom model.

The custom model cannot be put into use more quickly than the prebuilt model because of the time required to train and publish the model. You can put a prebuilt model into use more quickly.

Neither the custom nor the prebuilt model lets you modify its output parameters.

Both the custom model and prebuilt model work with Power Automate only. A limited subset of AI Builder models are available for use with Power Apps.

137

In AI Builder, you can choose from several model types that are suited to different business scenarios. AI Builder has several prebuilt models available to use immediately without the need to train custom models. This means that you can immediately feed data through them for results, rather than needing to build a custom model to work out exactly what you are trying to achieve.

The prebuilt models include:
The text recognition model - used to detect and extract text from documents and imagesThe business card reader model - used to recognize and extract relevant information from business card imagesThe language detection model - used to determine the main language of a text documentAI Builder also supports custom models, which enable you to extend the capabilities and train a custom model to match your precise needs. These are not available to use without first selecting and training the model that you want to use.

Custom models include:
The prediction model - used to predict the likelihood of an event occurringThe form processing model - used to recognize text in complex form layoutsThe object detection model - used to detect a specific object within an imageReferences

AI models and business scenarios

PRP Assessment Questions.md

abstract classes


Visible


Configure()

The Configure method is a place where you can configure application request pipeline for your application using IApplicationBuilder instance that is provided by the built-in IoC container. ASP.NET Core introduced the middleware components to define a request pipeline, which will be executed on every request.


DataAdapter


public static void MethodA()


Core Runtime

The . NET Runtime contains just the components needed to run a console app. Typically, you'd also install either the ASP.NET Core Runtime or . NET Desktop Runtime.

is it 28 bytes and no matter how many chars it consists of? In any case, sizeof(string) number of bytes are allocated, which may or may not be 28 bytes, depending on the string 's particular implementation. so string not have predefine size

XML is the format for storing and transmitting data of all kinds. As such, datasets have a close affinited.


Temp

Temporary tables are stored in tempdb. They work like a regular table in that you can perform the operations select, insert and delete as for a regular table.

Reminder.md

Return last digit of the given number - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/454f012b

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int lastDigitof(int input1)
		{
		// converting a -ve number to +ve
	     if(input1<0)
		  {
			   input1*=-1;
		  }
		  int n=input1%10;
		  return n;
	}
}
```# Return second last digit of given number - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/9f87004e

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531075337.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int second LastDigitof(int input1)
	{
	// handling a single digit number
	if(input1>=-9 && input1<=9)
	return -1;
	
	// converting a -ve number into +ve number
	if(input1<0)
	input1*=-1;
	
	input1/=10;
	int n=input1%10;
	return n;
	}
}

Return second word in Uppercase - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/4a72723f

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public string secondwordUpperCase(string input1) {
    String[] strArray = input1.Split(' ');

    String stt = "LESS";
    if (strArray.Length == 1) {
      return stt;
    }

    return strArray[1].ToUpper();
  }
}

Simple Encoded Array - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/1557c062


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  //Assume following return types while writing the code for this question.
  public class Result {
    public int output1;
    public int output2;
  }

  public Result findOriginalFirstAndSum(int[] input1, int input2) {
    int[] arr = new int[input2];
    arr[input2 - 1] = input1[input2 - 1];
    int sum = arr[input2 - 1];
    for (int i = input2 - 2; i >= 0; i--) {
      arr[i] = input1[i] - arr[i + 1];
      sum += arr[i];
    }

    Result r1 = new Result();
    r1.output1 = arr[0];
    r1.output2 = sum;

    return r1;
  }
}

Sum of last digits of two given numbers - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/783a1fcf

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode
{
	public int addLastDigits (int input1, int input2)
	{
	// converting -ve number to +ve number
    if(input1<0)
	input1*=-1;
    if(input2<0)
    input2*=-1;

    int x=input1%10;
    int y=input2%10;
    int sum = x+y;
    return sum;
	}
}
```# Sum of Powers of Digits - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/92437794

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531110043.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int sumofPowerOfDigits(int input1) {
    double sum = 0.0;
    string str = input1.ToString();
    for (int i = 0; i < str.Length - 1; i++) {

      int a = Character.getNumericValue(str[i]);
      int b = Character.getNumericValue(str[i+1]);
      sum = sum + Math.Pow(a, b);
    }
    return (int) sum + 1;
  }
}

Sum of Sums of Digits in Cyclic order - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/1ddbe65e

using System;
using
System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int sumOf SumsOfDigits(int input1) {
    string str = input1.ToString();

    int sum = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < str.Length; i++) {
      for (int j = i; j < str.Length; j++) {

        int num = (int) Char.GetNumericValue(str[j]);

        sum += num;
      }
    }

    return sum;
  }
}

    • Send connection request# Taking Input - Dotnet.md

Conversion from string to integer

int.Parse

int num = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());
  • If the user passes the null value, it will throw NullReferenceException.

Convert.ToInt32

int num = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
  • If the user passes the null value, it will return 0 and does not throw any exception.

Programs

Sample

1. Find the sum of 2 numbers.

using System;

namespace MyApp // Note: actual namespace depends on the project name.
{
    internal class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Welcome to Dotnet Training ");
            Console.Write("Enter Num1 : ");
            int num1 = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());
            Console.Write("Enter Num2 : ");
            int num2 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

            int result = num1 + num2;
            Console.Write("Result of {0} and {1} is {2}", num1, num2, result);
            Console.Read();
        }
    }
}

# Uncommon Alphabets - Uppercase - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/1u20ql00lc

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int findTheSum(char[] input1, char[] input2) {
    int size_1, size_2;

    size_1 = input1.Length;
    size_2 = input2.Length;

    int sum1 = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < size_1; i++) {
      int flag = 0;
      for (int j = 0; j < size_2; j++) {
        if (input1[i] == input2[j]) {
          flag = 1;
        }
      }

      if (flag == 0) {
        sum1 = sum1 + input1[i];
      }
    }

    for (int i = 0; i < size_2; i++) {
      int flag = 0;
      for (int j = 0; j < size_1; j++) {
        if (input2[i] == input1[j]) {
          flag = 1;
        }
      }

      if (flag == 0) {
        sum1 = sum1 + input2[i];
      }
    }

    int sum = 0;
    int temp = sum, digit = 0;

    while (sum1 > 9) {

      temp = sum1;

      while (temp != 0) {
        digit = temp % 10;
        temp = temp / 10;
        sum = sum + digit;
      }

      sum1 = sum;
      sum = 0;
    }

    return sum1;

  }
}

Unique Digits Count - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/b7aac4a5

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int uniqueDigitsCount(int input1) {
    String str = input1.ToString();
    int len = str.Length;

    int count = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < len - 1; i++) {

      for (int j = i + 1; j < len; j++) {

        if (str[i] == str[j]) {
          count++;
          break;
        }
      }
    }
    return len - count;
  }
}

VowelStrings - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/1u213yyfb4

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public string findStringVowelFirstAnd Last(int input1, string[] input2) {
    string str_compare = "AEIOUaeiou";
    string output = "";
    int count = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < input1; i++) {

      for (int j = 0; j < 10; j++) {
        if (input2[i][0] == str_compare[j]) {
          count++;
        }
        if (input2[i][input2[i].Length - 1] == str_compare[j]) {
          count++;
        }

        if (count == 2) {
          output = output + input2[i].ToLower();
          j = 10;
        }
      }
      count = 0;
    }

    if (output == "") {
      output = "no matches found";
    }

    return output;
  }
}
```# weight of string - Mettl.md

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/387952fc

>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531105009.png)
>![](raw-lecture/Pasted%20image%2020220531105029.png)

```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

public class UserMainCode {
  public int weightOfString(string input1, int input2) {
    String str = input1.ToUpper();
    int sum = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < input1.Length; i++) {
      if (input2 == 0) {
        if (str[i] == 'A' || str[i] == 'E' || str[i] == 'I' || str[i] == 'O' || str[i] == 'U' || !Char.IsLetter(str[i])) {
          continue;
        } else {
          int a = str[i] - 64;
          sum += a;
        }
      } else {
        if (!Char.IsLetter(str[i]))
          continue;
        else {
          int a = str[i] - 64;
          sum += a;
        }
      }
    }
    return sum;

  }
}

# Workflow.md
